I'll definitely try to do when I'm back in Tokyo!つばざさん, ありがとうございましたSandra

Highlight of my week in Tokyo!. This was my second visit to Tsukiji Fish Market, and it was so worth the return trip!Big thanks to Tsubasa-san and his colleagues for showing us around the Inner Market, explaining how the market works, showing us so many fish and seafoods I'd never seen before. Great fun to learn about buying fish, what to look for when buying to make sushi vs cooking fish. Lots of details on how to fillet the various fish/shellfish, how to prepare it for sushi. Lots of laughs and just a lovely way to spend a morning!Highly recommend it. I had hemmed and hawed about the price, but it was worth every penny.

Great chance to make your own sushi. The first half of the workshop is the market tour. I had heard that all the tourism has ruined the market, but frankly, that's just wrong. Even though we go at the end of the market hours and there are lots of tourists with cameras, it's an incredible experience. So many fishes you never knew existed, huge slabs of tuna, beautiful uni, it goes on for row after row into the dimly lit distance. Tsubasa was knowledgeable and friendly, showed us lots of great stands, and then took us to buy fish. We learned about feeling the gills (deep red and slimy is good!) the color of the skin, how good squid reacts when you touch it. And then we were off to watch the filleting. After learning the differences in preparing sea bream, sea bass, flounder, blood clam, squid, and scallops (and tuna, but we had just bought a piece of a tuna, not the whole fish!), it was time to make the sushi. Some people had the discipline to make a whole plate of sushi before starting; I couldn't wait. Make a piece, eat it. Pleasant staff, a fun group of people on the tour - it was a lot of fun.

Incredible sushi making class and Tsukiji tour. This was by far the highlight of our trip to Tokyo . The class was fun, our classmates interesting and most important our teachers excellent.. Cant wait to do it again

Super sushi class!. I had a wonderful sushi class today with Hirobumi (the chef) and Tsubasa, our super friendly and helpful guide. Very good English too. The morning session was full so Hiro accomodated us by opening a class just for us at 2:30 in the afternoon. The class was hands on and more than I expected. I really learned a lot and am excited to go home and practice. Thanks Hiro and Tsubasa for the great, funfilled day we had today! Made our trip to Tokyo so memorable.

Really fun tour!. We had a really eventful and fun morning, experiencing the tuna auction followed by the Tsukiji market guided tour.Thanks to our guide who reminded us to get to the market earlier than scheduled, if not, we wouldn't have been able to get in. In fact, we were already on the late tour when we got in at 3am!Watching the tuna auction on TV documentary was already pretty incredible, so having to see it live right in front of your own eyes was truly out-of-this-world!After the tuna auction, we met up with one of the sushi masters, Morita-san (who's a true Tsukiji insider and knows everyone and everything about the market!), and toured the inner and outer market. The inner market is open to general public after 9am but we managed to get in 2 hours earlier thanks to Morita-san.It will be a very meaningful tour for all food lovers, and for people who'd rather be spending their money on experiences.

Great for tourist or local expats. This is a great tour for tourists, local expats and/or sushi lovers. The tour leaders were very knowledgeable about the market and fish. We really enjoyed helping them choose fish for our lunch and then helping to prepare it. A wonderful experience I have already recommended to friends.

Excellent!. We had a really informative and fun tour of the inner and outer fish markets, followed by an excellent sushi workshop, using the ultra-fresh fish from the market. Our guides were very knowledgable and able to explain many fascinating aspects about the fish market (how to select best fish quality etc), and also how to correctly make sushi. Great organization and really useful and friendly too - Highly recommend!

Fish Market Tour and Sushi Class. Fun morning! We first toured the amazing inner market and learned from Morita-san how to pick the best seafood for sushi. We also shopped in the outer market then watched chef Noji-san clean and prepare the fish. We practiced how to cut the fish and made the sushi, then ate!
Master Breakfast. Wonderful experience, learn much and had lots of fun! Looking forward to join next time! And the Lovely Master breakfast!

Tsukiji Sushi Workshop. Great workshop with knowledgeable English speaking guides and Japanese speaking chef. Before the workshop, visiting the fish market to select the fish was great fun and an experience. The guides joined us to the fish market and workshop.The chef was patiently. First showing how to clean the fish and how to prepare the sushi in 7 steps.During the workshop we made 10 different sushi with the prepared fish. The end of the workshop is eating the sushi together.Good fun and a super experience you can take home to your own kitchen and share with family and friends. Good experience with teens, business or couples too.

Great introduction to Japan. The cooking class is very enjoyable and informative. I learned a lot , not just about food, but the Japanese approach to cooking and other aspects of the culture. Yuka is knowledgeable and professional in her teaching. I highly recommend her classes.

Interesting class and lovely teacher. Yuka is a very good and entertaining teacher and a very chatty lady. We really enjoyed her sushi class. She uses high quality fish and patiently explains everything, from how to cook rice to how to eat sushi. We would highly recommend it!

Fun afternoon making Sushi, Yuka is fantastic!. I have made sushi before, but while in Japan, I wanted to join a cooking class. So glad, we found Yuka! From the moment she picked us all up at the station, she won us over with her unique charm, incredible friendliness and very japanese comedy talent After a quick stroll to her house, we spent the afternoon preparing our rice, cutting our (excellent) tuna, made a dashi, a dessert, rolled the sushi and all throughout laughed a lot and learned a lot about sushi, fish, wasabi, knives and japanese culture. I can't say I was bored a single minute! And at the end we ended up with a fantastic meal, as well! On our way back to the station, she even took us to a nearby supermarket and showed us all those hidden gems there, which you often have trouble finding not speaking/reading japanese. If you have a little more time than other short 2h classes, I definitely recommend Yuka. You won't be disappointed!

The true art of Sushi cooking..... My daughters had organised a cooking class for my wife and I as a gift for our recent holiday to Japan. Their research had led them to Yuka. We were certainly not disappointed and had a great 4 or 5 hours learning about the finer points of making good sushi and having fun with other like minded holiday makers. Yuka's enthusiasm, knowledge and passion comes through to give you a new appreciation of Japanese cooking. A highly recommended thing to do when in Tokyo

Sushi Making Class on My Last Day in Japan. "Technology has made it easier for students to learn through devices (like youtube), but nothing can come close to the experience of being taught by an inspirational teacher like you, Yuka-san. ありがとうございました"

Amazing sushi making class. It was amazing meeting Yuki and being so welcomed into her home. She taught us so many amazing things about Japanese food and culture. It made us true sushi experts. It was fun and informative and gave plenty of hands on experience. I would recommend this class to any foodie who wants to learn about Japanese food and culture and again some hands on experience. Yuki is a big book of knowledge and is more than willing to share it with you to make sure you get what you want out of your trip to Japan.

Don't miss this opportunity!. What an excellent experience we had. Not only did we learn how to cook sushi and the history surrounding the culture and technique, but we also learned so much about the interworking of Japanese culture from Yuka! She is so knowledgable, friendly, and passionate about cooking - a must do experience for tourists! Language barrier was nonexistant and her home was comfortable and welcoming. Only regret - we should have done BOTH classes!

Fun & educational sushi class!. This is a really cool way to kick off a trip to Tokyo - learning about how to make sushi and the proper way to eat it. Yuka is a great host (very chatty) and hospitable and it makes for a fun afternoon! We did the 10am sushi class and didn't leave until 3pm -- so factor that into your plans. Would definitely recommend!

Superb sushi class.... We had a lovely afternoon learning not only about Sushi but Japanese food, culture and society in general. Yuka has a very engaging teaching style, is extremely knowledgeable and takes her time to answer any left field questions. The small class size really helps and Yuka's use of high quality ingredients results in a fantastic overall experience. She also gave me a knife sharpening lesson at the end of the class. Would highly recommend and will be going back next time we're in Tokyo.
What an awesome experience!. We had so much fun and learned so much! Thanks for the great experience! We would highly recommend to anyone visiting Tokyo!

GREAT COOKING CLASS WITH YUKA. Yuka's cooling class was the first and one of my favorites activities in Tokyo on my first visit in Japan. She is very acknowledgeable, fun and loving person. I would definitely attend the other classes Yuka offers. THANK YOU Yuka for being such a great teacher and such a loving person.

Two excellent classes Japanese cooking classes. I went to two of the classes here, one for sushi and one for onigiri and teriyaki. Yuka was really great picking us all up from the nearby Metro stop, and is an amazing teacher, being very friendly, really inspiring and incredibly entertaining at the same time. The classes are just the right size (6-8 people), she picks some great ingredients, and it was excellent fun getting hands-on. It's a really friendly atmosphere, and you get all kinds of extra tips on things like which Japanese knives to buy, where to get the best macha tea etc. This was very good value for money, a good way into Japanese food culture, and excellent way to meet new people with similar interests. I'll be going back to her classes when I return to Tokyo in April.

Great sushi experience!. We booked this session as one of our last activities for our honeymoon in Japan.Yuka picked us up from the station; group size was great and we learnt a lot about sushi and Japanese food in general. She was a great teacher. Food was delicious and we had a really fun and memorable morning!Thank you! :)

Great Sushi Intro. This class is great for sushi making first-timers. Yuka is extremely hospitable and went out of her way to pick us up at the station and return us there at the end of the class. I agree with other reviewers that quantities were a little stingy, but in my mind, the bigger issue was waiting around 5 hours to be allowed to even eat anything. I'm sure that Yuka will offer snacks in the future once she becomes aware of this, as that is the kind of host that she is! The techniques learnt were perfect for sushi newbies but too basic for food service professionals seeking continuing education.

Professional, funny and genuinely amazing course. Yuka's sushi course that we took was really phenomenal, if we had more time in Japan, we would've gone back for more! She was really professional and knowledgeable while being easygoing, funny and most importantly genuine at the same time, covering so much information (including a lot of extra bits and tips) in the 4/5 hours spent with her.Definitely give it a go whether you want to learn more of the Japanese cuisine or you're into cooking(any level)!
Fun cooking class. Yuka is an amazing person. She helps having an excellent overall Japanese culinary experience. She also is familiar with the best restaurants and tourist attractions.

Take this class :). I am a bit late in writing this review but my husband and I took this class in August while we went to Japan for our honeymoon! It was an amazing experience, and I would highly recommend it for anyone interested in making japanise food and learn about the culture. Yuka was so friendly and helpful and we learn a lot not only about food but culture too.

Maybe our expectations were too high. I went to Yuka's sushi class with a couple of friends and was slighly disapointed after having read all the many great reviews. Yuka is wonderful and gave lots of insight on Japanese sushi making culture but there were a couple of downsides to her class. The class started at 9am and until around 2.30pm when we started to eat what we made no drinks or snacks were served for the students. I have been to multiple cooking classes around the world and they usually consist of tasting ingredients/ elements along the way and at least water is availible. We also found that the quantities of ingredients were very stingy, for example not everyone got cucumber/other ingredients as there were not enough. The sushi making was only the last hour of the class, with not a lot of explainations. The students did not get to stir the rice to cool it down, we had to use clear wrap between our hands and the rice instead of learning the real way etc. It was a nice day and don't regret going, just hoped that more sushi making would be happening.

Highlight of my trip. I was a bit on the fence about booking this class (Sushi making) as I was traveling alone and didn't want to feel out of place in a group. I'm glad I went ahead and booked. Yuka was great about answering all my questions and was very quick in her response times. Payment was a breeze with paypal. The meeting point was easy to find and Yuka is very personable, putting everyone at ease and made us feel welcome in her home. Yuka entertained us the entire time with funny stories while still teaching us so much. The class was entertaining and I felt like I learned quite a bit. After class she took the time to show us how to properly sharpen knives on a stone and even walked with us to a local grocery store for an impromptu tour. I couldn't recommend this class more!

Insightful, Informative, Hands-on workshop. My family and I enjoyed Yuka's Sushi workshop yesterday.Yuka was extremely friendly, explained clearly about the various ingredients, techniques, processes, do's and don'ts and ensured that every participant in our (small) group of six will practice hands on what they learnt.Eventually, before escorting us back to the Metro station Yuka was kind enough to offer to join us to a Supermarket tour, where she explained about various ingredients and answered many questions.A great experience, both for trained cooks as well as armatures.

Sushi and Gyoza cooking classes with Yuka. I was lucky enough to attend two cooking classes with Yuka. The first experience I went along with a friend and together we made Sushi. The sushi making was tricky but Yuka soon made you feel like a pro and you left with recipes that you can make at home. The friend and I soon after made sushi for our other halves and they thoroughly enjoyed learning how to roll! Both my friend and I live in Japan(short term) and the learning about the ingredients and the shopping experience afterwards enabled us to have a much better understanding of Japanese cooking and how to navigate around a supermarket. The Gyoza cooking class I went alone but soon made friends. It was a just as fun and yummy experience. Yuka herself is great fun and makes you feel at ease. The groups are small and all the dishes that you make are to die for.

Very knowledgeable and interesting!. If you really what to know how to make authentic sushi from the beginning, this class id for you!Makes you want to go to the supermarket and buy all the ingredients and take it home! Had lots of fun!

tailor-made cooking class was perfect. tailor-made cooking class was perfect. A knowledgeable instructor with perfect English and humor gave us a great grounding of the country, and it's culinary world.

Great experience. We had a fantastic experience today , learned about several key points on making and eating Sushi ! The "chef Yuka Mazda" really were prepared and ready to make us very confortable through the all experience . Highly recommended!

Cooking Japanese - a breeze with Yuka!. Yuka is an excellent teacher. She made everything seem easy, and you know what - it really was! We made gyozas and the wagyu beef gyudon - all or which turned out excellent even though we were amateurs in the kitchen. Tried out the recipes back home and it was all good too! Yuka, we'll be back for more!
Cooking with Yuka - a haiku. Gyoza, wagyuTasty funny learn a lot Best miso in town**no joke. Beat our Michelin star miso!!!!!!!!!

If you like Japanese Food and Cooking, then you should go to Yuka!. This was already my second cooking class with Yuka. Last year I was in her sushi class and I really liked it. This time I booked the Gyoza and Wagyu Beef Gyodon class and again I liked it very much. Yuka is really a "chef" and she can explain to everybody what are the important steps to prepare a good Japanese meal. Thanks Yuka and see you next time when I'm in Japan.

Extremely fun honeymoon experience. Very knowledge instructor. We came here for the sushi making course for our honeymoon. Our class had 7 people in total and it was at Yuka Mazda's house. Yuka was very thorough with her teaching and her english was superb. Instead of the normal places where they demonstrate most of the time, Yuka demonstrated and let us follow each step to make the sushi. It started from cooking the rice to fanning it and then shaping it to a sushi. The experience is expensive however it is well worth it. You actually spend about 4 hours with her and she also provides recipes to you after the class. Unfortunately we lost the recipes while we were travelling but we still have a very clear idea what was taught which is amazing. She was even nice enough to show us ingredients at a nearby supermarket after the class and dropped us off at the nearest subway station. What a blast we had. We would recommend this class to anyone who enjoys eating and cooking. Not to miss, we ate all the sushi we made and had miso soup and the appetizer Yuka made ahead of time. Thanks Yuka.

Great hands on experience!!!. I had this experience given to me as a birthday gift and was so thankful for the experience. The class was nice and small and Yuka is quite humorous also! Would highly recommend for a real local experience!

Fantastic. Yuka was fantastic, we had a few issues with the trains meaning we were running slightly later than we wanted but as promised Yuka and the rest of the class were waiting for us still at just after 10. Yuka was very patient and clearly explained everything we were doing. She is clearly very passionate about food and it was a great experience for myself, my girlfriend and her mother to all do together. Eating what we had prepared was fantastic and Yuka had clearly bought the very best of ingredients as it was the best we had ever had. I highly recommend this course to anyone who is coming to Tokyo and wants to experience really high quality food and be taught about proper Japanese style sushi to make again at home.
Great experience!. I had a great experience doing Yuka's sushi workshop. Yuka is a great host and speaks English very well. Definitely my highlight in Tokyo!

Great experience. Yuka's sushi class was a great experience. She taught us a lot of details you need to do when preparing sushi so you get the best rice. She's very entertaining and loves to talk about Japan and ofcourse food. Must try when you are in Tokyo!

Can I give more than five stars?. Yuka's course was incredible. We did the gyoza and beef session. She was an engaging and inspiring tutor. She not only taught us how to cook some great food, but had so much to tell us about Japanese food in general, as well as local recommendations for restaurants and shopping. To top it off, she took us to the supermarket after the morning was over, and showed us all sorts of exciting things. We got a real insight into Japanese food, which was especially good at the start of our trip to Japan. Much more than a straight-forward cooking lesson - thanks so much!
Excellent!. Yuka is very patient, I loved the course, super recommended, and high quality Japanese cuisine.thankyou very much!!!

Yuka is the best! Great english and awesome lesson. we went with an open mind and came out feeling like we can actually prepare Sushi! Yuka was entertaining and we learnt a lot about the right way to cook rice. The quality of Tuna and how tuna and salmon are rates in Japanese Cuisine.The environment was comfortable. Yuka was really good and we look forward to going back and doing the Wagyu class also.

Yuka-Sensei is the best Teacher in Tokyo!. Yuka is an amazing and funny teacher. Multiple times in the lesson she was able to make a few jokes that all had us on the floor laughing. She speaks great English, so don't be afraid that you won't understand. I took both the Gyu and Gyoza lesson as well as the Sushi lesson. Both were great, but if you can only do one I would say do the Sushi Lesson because she will teach you a lot about the culture and history around sushi. Hope you have fun!PS. She taught Taylor Swift and her guitar tab is sitting under the table cover ;)
Great food, great fun. We learned to make gyoza, gyu-don and miso soup and it was all fantastic. I'm a sucker for the gyoza and Yuka is such a fun teacher. You won't regret!

Great, not only for the food but also for the insight in japanese life.. Me & my girlfriend went to the sushi-course. Not only was it a greate class but Yuka made it even better. She's very good in english, very kind and it was not only real fun to learn all the small details in sushi but also to get a glimpse into the japanese way of living today.

Fun and informative. Yuka taught a group of 9 of us in her kitchen at home. She covered a lot of ground and I have been successfully making some of her recipes back home in London. There is a lot more to know about making sushi than I expected, and some of her tips are invaluable.
So much fun!. Amazing time making gyozas! All the food was delicious and Yuka was an amazing host and teacher! So much fun with our group of friends!

Sushi class. I loved the experience, Yuka Mazda really knows what she is teaching , that class is of 8 people is not extremely big, it is nice, neat and she listens and pay attention to every person in the class , answering all the questions.
I plan to do it again for another course when I can come back to Tokyo.

Great experience . I have been Tokyo a few times，so I decided to take a Japanese cooking class. I like Yuka's way of teaching, quite interesting and entertaining. Her English is very good among Japanese cooks. Just a few points, she didn't make herself very clear but most of the time, we know what she was trying to teach. I am a little bit slow learner but Yuka was very patient with me. Besides teaching sushi class, she also gave us some tourist information at the end of the class, which is quite helpful. I would recommend her class.

Very nice. The cooking took place in the kitchen of her house, so it was very nice and cozy. I was very happy with the whole experience and can absolutely recommend it. Of course, it was very delicious as well! Thanks very much!!!

So much fun. The reviews were great so expectations were high and Yuka still exceeded them. So many cooking classes work in 'stations' where you hear all of the lessons but only get to try the pieces assigned to you. Not in this class. In this class, you make your own sushi from start to finish under Yuka's careful guidance. Even if you never made sushi again, you still learn everything you need to know about eating sushi -- what to watch for and how to eat it authentically. And after the class, Yuka even took us to the grocery so we could learn what ingredients to use in a number of dishes. Worth every penny and more!

Amazing.. She waited for us in the station. She welcomed us with an amazing smile. We went to her house and she started explaining about the food, the culture and we prepared sushi and other three side dishes. She showed us everything from cooking the rice to rolling and everything. She is a humble person. an important note: the materials that she uses to cook sushi, are the best materials. Expect to find the best tuna, best wasabi plants and everything.

Excellent!!!!!. Yuka is really a top teacher and cook. Her classes are very well organized and explained and really hands-on. We were very happy to attend her class and we also had a very abundant lunch with all the different courses that, following her guidance, we had previously cooked. We are looking forward to book another class with her next time we come to Tokyo.

Great experience!. If you are visiting Japan and you are interested in Japanese cuisine, you must attend to this course! Yuka is very nice, welcoming and speaks great English as well, during the class we not only learned how to make delicious sushi, also miso soup and other traditional Japanese dishes. She also gives you advice about where to eat, what to do and solves any doubt you may have about Japanese food or culture! It was great and very useful for understanding better this amazing country! When I go back to Japan I will repeat!

An awesome, enriching experience. This is an excellent cooking sesion, and also much more than that.Yuka fills her delivery of the content with eye opening inisghts and cultural facts about the wonderful, sophisticated world of Japanese cuisine.Yes, you will learn to roll some maki but you will also feel deeply enriched by the experience.

Informative and delicious. Yuka is a very passionate teacher when it comes to cooking and making sushi. She is very knowledgeable and eager to share her knowledge with her students. Through the course, I learned how to make sushi rice the right way, how to roll a sushi, how to make a sashimi, and best part of all, how to eat them in the most proper and delicious way :P

Great way to learn a little about Japanese Cuisine. Japanese Cuisine is really broad, going from OKONOMIYAKI to SHABU-SHABU, including YAKITORI, YAKISOBA, COLD SOBA, UDON, Ramen, Curry...etc...etc...(no enough lines to describe them). But SUSHI is the best known all over the world.We had an excellent time with YUKA and her Kitchen. Great time, good advices...Thanks a lot...

Very informative . We had a lovely time at the sushi class. Yuka was friendly, informative and knowledgeable. Would definitely recommend. I would have loved to also understand how to prepare the tofu that we ate at the end with our sushi - it would have been a great addition to understand how to make the accompaniments. Well-priced, easy to reach from wherever you're staying and highly recommended.

Sushi class with Yuka. We had a nice time with Yuka for sushi class. Learning begins with cooking rice and how to mix it with rice vinegar (the most important step), and then how to roll sushi. Throughout the time spent with Yuka, the atmosphere was very friendly. She is funny, and knows how to make person confortable. After the class, we visited a supermarket and she showed us each kind of ingredients. We do not regret at all.Didier & Pierre.

Highlight of our trip to Japan. We had a wonderful time with Yuka and everyone else. Yuka is animated, knowledgeable and fun! We made beautiful sushi, learned a lot about Japanese history and culture and ate a glorious amount of sushi!!! A must-do!

Sushi class with Yuka. My husband and I and my two young adult kids thoroughly enjoyed our sushi making class. Yuka met us at the subway station and escorted us back to her home where she spent the next 5 hours teaching us about Japanese cooking and making sushi. She was very entertaining and informative and we had a wonderful time making several different kinds of sushi. There were two other couples in the class with us, for a total of 8, which seemed the maximum that her space would allow. Yuka explained how to prepare sushi rice and dashi broth and miso soup. We also learned the proper way to slice tuna and scallops, how to roll two different types of sushi, and how to make nigiri sushi. Yuka was an excellent and animated teacher and we really appreciated knowing how much care and preparation goes into making proper sushi. This activity was a highlight of our trip to Japan and well worth the time and expense. I highly recommend Yuka and her class!

Cooking a storm. Had the chance to do these classes on my last trip to Japan and found it an absolute amazing time. Thanks to the lads for making this such a great learning curve and inspiring me to get creative in the kitchen. Fabulous

Excellent experience with a brilliant host - sushi course. Yuka came to the station to pick us up and walk us to her class. It was boiling hot so I really appreciated the gesture. We were a group of 7, myself and a lovely family of 6. Yuka got everyone involved in the cooking which was good as I was concerned from other reviews we would have no input. There are moments when Yuka is doing the cooking and talking you through the process but a lot of the time she will am a volunteer to do part of it. She also did a great job of letting us do the cutting for the sushi nd teaching us Japanese cutting technique. Great course, I'll recommend to anyone travelling to Tokyo. Thanks Yuka!

Best souvenir ever!. Being able to bring something back home from a trip, is nice. Bringing back something, that is not only a thing, but a memory, an adventure, is something completely different and - in this case - really awesome.4 hours of food, history, japanese traditions, all told by - and learned from mrs. Mazda, is something that I will think of and take in to my life, for ever. Have just made my first serving of gyoza, back home .. Big success. All thank to mrs. Mazda.When going back to Japan (and I will) I'll make sure to stop by for more courses.

Not enough cooking.... Ill start by saying Yuka is a really lovely person, so feel guilty writing this review, however I think its important to be honest and in the interest of trip advisor!Yuka met us at the train station, it was a good 15/20 minutes walk to her apartment. Would have been easier just getting a taxi there (not that im lazy!)? Or using GPS to get there ourselves?We did the sushi class and have been on other cooking classes in different countries and always enjoyed them.The biggest downside is that like many Tokyo apartments Yuka only has 1 cooker, which means most of the class is her talking about what shes doing and you watching. Maybe portable cookers so everyone can cook?We were eventually able to roll some sushi, about 2 hours into the class but i dont really know what was in it as i didnt make it... Just figured id read the recipe when we get home.We got about 20 minutes of rolling sushi in 3 hours and the rest was watching or talking? It felt like she was 'padding it out' to make it longer.As I said, yuka is lovely, but we did sign up for a cooking class and it isnt really what we got...

Excellent sushi class!!. After this class, we have a new appreciation for sushi. Not only will you be making sushi with fresh ingredients, but you will also experience that sushi making is an art.. Yuka sensei was delightful. It was truly a remarkable enriching experience. ありがとうございました。

Cooking School Yuka Mazda. My family went for a sushi cooking class. Very clumsy to prepare some pieces of sushi. The teacher was very cute and spoke good English also. We learn many complicated rules about making sushi and even eating sushi in different places too. Both the chef and customers are artists to promote sushi as a culture.

Great cooking class with Yuka!. Spent an entertaining and challenging morning with Yuka creating amazing sushi, each bit 9, 10 or 11 grams of rice with fresh fish. We learned a lot of additional details since Yuka was a wealth of knowledge! Arigato Yuka.

Amazing Sushi Class!. My partner and I came across Yuka's Cooking Class on tripadivsor and so we decided to contact Yuka's and to participate in her Sushi Making Class. It was 1 of the best decision we made for our 6 days trip in Tokyo.Yuka was clear with her instructions and preparation for our class. Lesson was conducted in English so we have no problem understanding Yuka.We had fun and were impressed by how our sushi looks like after the class and also being able to understand more about Sushi.Both my partner and I would recommend Yuka's Cooking class to anyone who is interested in learning Japanese culinary! :)

Amazing Cultural and Culinary Experience - MUST DO. Yuka was extremely knowledgable, professional, clear, humorous, helpful, and the positive affirmations list could go on. Great cultural and culinary experience, well worth the time, money, and effort.

Yuka is very knowledgeable and entertaining. We had a great experience. Learned a lot about the art of sushi making and Yuka goes above and beyond for her students - even making sure we got on the train home safely!

Cool experience in Tokyo - sushi class with the great Yuka!!!. During our second trip in Japan, me and my wife want to try a sushi class. We find a lot of courses but at the end we choose this of Yuka. We really recommend Yuka's class if you are in Tokyo and you have the opportunity do it! Yuka is an amazing chef and her lesson is clear and funny! We really like it and we learn a lot of useful things to do sushi and miso soup. At the end of the course, Yuka took us in a super market and show us which things to buy... GREAT!!

A must must in Tokyo :). We booked Yuka's class for cooking Gyoza, rice and Gyudon. It was soooo amazing. We had a great time and also with the other participants. Yuka is a great teacher, and we have alreafy made the recipes back home. At our next time in Tokyo we will definitely book Yuka's other classes. After class she took us to a supermarket and helped us shop the right ingredients , to take them home. :) Thank you once again and see you soon. ;)

Sushi class. I really recommend Yuka's class if you are in Tokyo and you have the opportunity do it! You will learn how to make sushi I know it sounds easy but she explain you every detail so you can appreciate real sushiTotally worth it

AMAZING EXPERIENCE! A MUST WHEN IN TOKYO. I had the most incredible time at Yuka's cooking class. She taught us everything from what ingredients to use to how combine them to make the most amazing sushi. Her experience working within food is incredible and her knowledge is insightful. After the cooking class, Yuka was kind enough to guide us to the supermarket where she gave us a guided tour of what ingredients are best to get to ensure our dishes can be just as good as what Yuka discussed and showed us. I can't emphasis how incredible her class was and if you're planning a visit, please make sure to book with Yuka. You will not regret t.

A Great Way to Learn About and Enjoy Sushi!. My daughter and I had an excellent time learning how to make and enjoy sushi. Yuka is extremely personable and makes the class enjoyable and educational. The class is well-organized and the quality of the instruction and the ingredients are impeccable. Thanks for a memorable experience! It's definitely one of the highlights of our trip.

A wonderful class of Japanese food and culture. First we have to thank Yuka Sensei for giving us a wonderful time. With top quality ingredients and maker-friendly recipes provided by Sensei, we can't believe that we can make tasty Beef Don, Miso soup and dumplings with a touch of Japanese style and flair. Food is truly a vista to a country's culture. From Yuka Sensei we learn not only the great way to prepare food but background knowledge of Japanese food, etiquette and culture. It's a class that helps us fall in love with Japan and her wonderful culture.Sensei was also kind enough to offer us loads of recommendation about having great food in Tokyo. We are lucky to have tried them all - never underestimate the taste buds of a great chef; our trip was enriched with rounds and rounds of gourmet.Sensei's lively presentation and very personal style made us feel very welcome. It's such a pleasure to meet her!

Fantastic Cooking Class. Yuka is passionate about cooking and teaching, that's it what makes this class a unique experience. We did not only prepare sushi, we also got to know a lot about how Japanese enjoy their sushi and particularly what they do not do. On top, Yuka made it a fun time.

Excellent sushi course!. We loved our day learning to make sushi here! Yuka was an excellent teacher, oodles of interesting and useful info about making and eating sushi - like not to put wasabi paste in the soy sauce, which we have always done, oopsy! We learnt so much that we can take home and use making sushi! Thank you 😊

Best Sushi Education You'll Get!. Yuka's class is so great. Not only is she an expert in her craft, but she is a very nice and kind woman! She made the class both extremely informative, but also fun and full of laughs. My fiance and I went to the class hoping to take home some tips for bringing our love for sushi into our own kitchen, and we left feeling well prepared to do so. I'd highly recommend this to sushi lovers, and really anyone looking for a fun, unique, educational experience - especially to get Yuka's first hand advice on some great local things to see in Tokyo.
Amazing!!!. Excellent, I loved the treatment and clarity of explanation. Very informative and great tips. Easy location. The friendliness of Yuka Mazda is unrivaled. Unforgettable moments.

Sushi-Making Class in Tokyo. This was a fantastic half-day experience! Yuka speaks good English, was very clear in her instructions and overall the experience was a lot of fun. We had a 4-5 hour session (group of 7 people), which included making sushi, tofu, miso soup and a supermarket tour. Ingredients were amazingly fresh and all of the food tasted great. I strongly recommend it to anyone who is interested in making sushi!

New Appreciation. My family and I, including two teenagers took the Sushi cooking class. We were very Jettlagged but Yuka made it very interesting. I have a new appreciation for professional sushi chefs now that I have experienced how difficult and long it took my family to prepare 15 pieces of Sushi. However, it was well worth it as my own creation tasted awesome

This was everything I wanted from a sushi lesson and more!. I went to the sushi lesson with my girlfriend and we learned so much and cooked some absolutely amazing sushi, of course due entirely to our amazing host Yuka. Yuka not only helped teach us how to cook sushi and the correct order to eat it but also she told us about places around the areas we were interested in going to. On top of this we were heading to Shibuya which she was heading to too and she came with us on the journey and told us even more information. If anyone is in any doubt my advice is that there is no doubt, do not hesitate and book as soon as you can :) Thanks for everything Yuka!

Great Sushi making Class!. We are visiting Tokyo and wanted to take a sushi making class. We read a bunch of reviews and then decided on Yuka Mazda. I emailed her when we were available and she got back to me later the same day with times available. Easy reservation process. We are two adults and our 18 and 22 year old sons. We were surprised that there was only one other person in the class!Yuka is extremely knowledgeable and if you want to know everything about making sushi she will teach you. She is also very funny and entertaining! The 5 hours went by so quickly.The quality of the fish was superb and everything we made was amazing!I can't imagine a better class. I highly recommend this class!

Learn to make Sushi... the right way!. Although a little cliche, my boyfriend and I wanted to do a 'Sushi Class in Japan', so we headed to our friend Google. And we're glad we did! Yuka's 5 hour class was an absolute highlight of our trip. As we look back on our photos from our trip, we're still amazed at what we produced - we were professional Sushi masters for a few hours in the heart of Tokyo! Yuka has the energy, the passion and the experience to put on an absolute show that will ensure you're engaged and enthralled for the entire class. Highly recommended, you'll love it!

Amazing cooking experience. We went on the Sushi course, Yuka is incredibly knowledgable (and very sweet), we learnt a lot making our sushi and had a great time. The best part was the quality of the ingredients, you could tell Yuka had gone all out, which resulted in some pretty spectacular food. I'd really recommend for anyone wanting to really learn a lot about Japanese food.

A new found appreciation for Gyoza. My Daughter and I did Yuka's Gyoza and Wagu Beef Class and had a great time. Yuka is super friendly and very knowledgeable. After taking her class we have a new found appreciation for Gyoza, Miso paste and how to properly cook rice! It was fun and enjoyable. It was also fun meting other travelers from all over the world. When we return to Tokyo we will take the Sushi class! Thanks Yuka!

Exceptional experience attending Yuka Mazda's Sushi making class. It is always clear when someone has a passion for what they do and Yuka exudes this from the moment you meet her. She is an endless font of practical knowledge but with a slightly irreverent sense of humour which makes it all the more accessible.There is a lot of attention paid to making the sushi rice which is absolutely critical to flavour.Among other things she demonstrated was making Miso soup. It was the best I have had. And I have tried really good miso soup.Whether you choose to make sushi or not, your experience of the cuisine will definitely be enhanced.

Wow!. We have just been on this Gyoza-course at Yuka's place. And it was unbeliveable!We learnt so much! About Japan. About Tokyo. About knifes, food, tea, ingridients- well everything! And Yuka was such a lovely lady, who really took care of us. We really recomment this course, and make sure you do it in the beginning of your trip, because of the very many tips that Yuka gives you.Thank you so much!Arrigato And please enjoy this day.LoveEmilie and Jonas

A lovely experience and a fantastic person to spend time with . Both myself and my brother booked this as part of our two week visit of Japan from England as we both enjoy sushi but haven't a clue how to make it correctly. Yuka is a lovely person and you instantly warm to her. The course was fantastic, she insists on using the best ingredients and through her teaching you create lunch for yourself (with a little assistance from her). It is a testament to her that over two weeks all over Japan she was one of the best experiences we have had out here. Yuka keep it up, this is amazing - love from England!

Awesome 'local' experience. My mom and I did the goyza cooking class and it was so much fun! It's in her house and it's a really Intimate experience. She's so knowledgeable and has tons of experience. The food is great, even if you're not a big time chef and likely won't cook it again, it's fun to be a part of the process and learn more about Japanese culture and cuisine. Highly recommended and fun thing to do in Tokyo.

Learn something new. I was staying in Tokyo for few days so I had some time to spare and decided to do sushi cooking class. I choose this one because the review was good and the price seemed alright. I have to say I was really satisfied with my choice and had a great time. Ms. Yuka was really friendly and made really confortable atmosphere for everyone. I learned a lot, not just about sushi but some other things about Japanese culture and I had a lot of fun. This is something I would definitely recommend to everybody.

A great introduction to sushi preparation with a large serving of charisma. Yuka met us from the nearby metro station and we walked to her apartment. We began with cooking the rice moving onto constructing the sushi once the rise was prepared. Once everything was prepared we ate as a group. The optional supermarket trip was very informative and the whole experience was enjoyable and educational!

Great experience in Tokyo with Yuka. I attended a one-day cooking class with Yuka, and I genuinely had fabulous time. She has great sense of humour and an easy teaching technique. It felt like attending a big family meal with a laid back atmosphere. I fully recommend Yuka's class, as it can be an important element to improve your immersion in Japanese gastronomic culture.

Proper japanese cooking class!. I am really amateur at making sushi and Japanese cooking in general, the class was really helpful and gave me a wider understanding not only in creating but to know how to eat and to recognise good quality. Definitly worth it! Look at the pictures!

Cooking class with Yuka. Thank you so much for being part of such a great experience for us while we were in Tokyo. Not only did we learn so much about the food but about the styles and techniques that Japanese cooks use.

Highly recommended ! Excellent class & knowledgable host!. I booked my class at 11pm on the Friday night, for the morning class on Saturday - luckily there was a cancellation so Yuka was able to fit me in! I was in Tokyo for work on my own and trying to work out what to do with my weekend - as I had already exhausted many tourist activities. I really enjoyed Yuka's class - Yuka is a great host with lots of knowledge of Tokyo and cooking. She is a very good teacher. I hope to return again soon and look forward to using my new found skills at home.

A brilliant teacher and host. Yuka was a very good teacher and it was lovely to be taught the secrets of sushi in her own kitchen. She gave us the finest ingredients and with her help we produced the best sushi I have ever had. The course took about 5 hours and ended with a fantastic lunch.Afterwards Yuka took the time to show us around the local supermarket and explain some of the ingredients. I had a wonderful and can highly recommend it. Petra

A great day all round!. Booking a cooking class with Yuka was very easy - that is what made me sign up in the first place. My partner and I enjoyed the small group - it meant everyone got a chance to engage and try out the skills we were learning. Before I took Yuka's cooking class I thought I knew about making sushi but soon found that there were many things I didn't know. I am now back in Australia and enjoying practicing my new skill!

Everything you would want a sushi class to be. A 5 hour experience with everything hands on from perfect rice cooking, seasoning and all the inside information on sushi making and eating etiquette. Yuga's english is fantastic, she is easy to learn from and the food is magnificent.We learnt how to make sushi rice, how to season and prepare for sushi (its complicated!), how to make Miso and all the different types and how to make the broth for tofu and Miso.All the food was the best Japanese I have ever had (and i have lived here for three years!).She says she will teach you 4 michelin star standard and it was just that (to us).I will definitely go again for the other courses, and can't wait to make for my friends and family.

Really fun and good. Yuka was very patient and nice to us, she carefully teach us every step and we had a nice conversation exchange about the local culture. Very nice experience for those who want to see/ experience more than the touristic attractions.

One of the highlights of our trip!. I think one of the best qualities of a good teacher is the ability to recreate what you are taught without their help. When we arrived back in Hawaii we were eager to practice our new found knowledge. I am proud to write this review because We were able to prepare the same dishes we were taught at Yuka's cooking class! We had an amazing time. Yuka is a great teacher! Her English was awesome and we had no trouble understanding. We were taught how to prepare the Sushi dishes and Miso soup. Preparation of each dish was accompanied by the many stories Yuka had to share.

A thoroughly enjoyable day... . Yuka met the 8 of us at the subway station on the dot of 10 and we walked to her home, 10 minutes away. She is a bright and bubbly lady with a great sense of humour. She showed us how to cook rice to perfection and then helped us assemble a great variety of sushi using top-quality fresh ingredients. While we were preparing our sushi Yuka made the accompanying dishes - chilled tofu, miso soup, Dashi and green tea. The best part was eating the best sushi I've ever tasted, and I made it myself. At the end of the day she was happy to take a couple of us to a supermarket and explained some of the uniquely Japanese products. Finally she walked me to my bus stop. Highly recommend.

Sushi Making. This is the 2nd year have have been to see Yuka.... And as you can imagine I returned because it was fantastic.The quality of all the ingredients and food was amazing... The best part though is Yuka who takes you into her home and provides a fun filled entertaining day.

Excellent!. I highly recommend you experience "Cooking School Yuka Mazda". Perhaps one of the best days we had during our visit to the great city Tokyo. Yuka's Sushi Making Class was amazing. The quality food, fun atmoshpere and a great host, Yuka made the day.

Gyoza, miso and beef guydon class. I am very impressed with Yuka's class. Practical, entertaining, informative among others. I would recommend without reservation having attended four other cooking classes in Japan. Great experience.

Tokyo Highlight. We pre booked Yuka's cooking class because it looked like the best option for what we wanted. The experience exceeded our expectations! This was all credit to Yuka's welcome, planning, instruction, hospitality and overall enthusiasm. We had a truly memorable time. We felt we had mastered folding and cooking Crispy Gyoza's …..with many laughs along the way and her enthusiasm made up for our lack of expertise!

Great course and excellent host. My wife and I partook in the sushi course. We had a lot of fun and Yuka was a great host. She talked us through the different stages of creating the sushi and how to make good sushi rice. Yuka's english is very good and so she is very clear and went through everything so well.As I saw with one of the other reviews we didn't eat till the end but that made it all the more satisfying to eat all the sushi we had made.At the end Yuka sat down and talked us through shops and restaurants in Tokyo that she would recommend. It was a bit of a cultural experience as well.I would really recommend this to anyone who wants to give Japanese cooking a go. Well worth the visit

Great class. Making sushi, sashimi and miso soup is not at all simple!. Yuka was amazingly punctual. She said she would meet us at the station at 10 a.m. and she arrived on time, almost to the second! It is a 10 min. walk to her house from the station during which you can get to know your fellow students. As other reviewers have mentioned, her English is excellent so that's a big relief. Coming to the class - you get to learn and practice a lot of techniques. How to slice the fish, make the sticky rice, make the soup, roll the sushi roll, etc. Everyone gets to practice the techniques. And it is not at all easy towards the end - especially when it comes to rolling the sushi rolls perfectly...I found it quite tricky. Japanese cuisine really is a lot about getting the technique and presentation right. But at the end of the class, when you finally get to see (and eat) all the delicious food you have prepared, it is definitely a great feeling. Would definitely recommend this class.Some things to keep in mind - this will take around 5 hours, so do keep that in mind while planning your trip. Also, make sure you keep up with the rest of the class, else you might find it difficult to follow the remaining steps (happened to me).

Top Notch Cooking Class. Ii took the sushi class. This class was the perfect combination of learning, practice, and eating. Yuca did a great job teaching us about Japanese food and food culture. I really liked the combination of teaching and hands-on practice. The insight / lesson into Japanese food was almost as much fun as the sushi preparation. Seemed like a good value for the amount of time and quality of the class. Highly recommended.

Yuka was great, but the class felt a little disorganized. My mother and I took Yuka's gyoza and beef class. Yuka met us outside the train station right on time, and we walked to her apartment. Yuka speaks great English. She is very knowledgeable about cooking, and we learned a lot of secrets about Japanese cooking! She gave us recipes to take home as well. She used high quality ingredients and the food was excellent! We learned how to fold and cook gyoza. We really enjoyed this part, but from then on it seemed that we tried to make too much food at one time with 7 people in a small kitchen. A lot of time was spent on Gyoza (which we loved!), but we didn't feel like we had a chance to appreciate or learn how to make the beef dish or miso soup. With that being said, the wagyu beef tasted excellent.

Great class and would recommend . We stumbled upon this last minute using TripAdvisor. It was a great class. Yuka's English is excellent. She's funny and engaging and knows her stuff when in comes to Japanese cooking. She also gave us some great tips for kitchen knives and even gave us a tour of the supermarket. Recommended for foodies or anyone looking for something a bit different.

Lots of fun. My husband and I had a day to fill in before or late flight home to Australia. I contacted Yuka with only 24 hours notice and she fitted us into the gyoza and beef class. She met us at rail station and we walked to her apartment. We had a lovely time cooking and talking to the other 5 students.We all had a turn at the various tasks and enjoys our meal very much. We learnt a lot about Japanese soy sauces and miso pastes and also about Japanese knives. A great way to spend 4 hours. Thank you Yuka for being such a great teacher and lots of fun too.

Fantastic Experience. There are only good things to say about Yuka Mazda. Not only is she hospitable almost to a fault, her passion for Japanese cuisine is unparalleled. She constantly adapts the course to the tastes of the people visiting and is even excited to learn new English terms/phrases to improve her future interactions. The ingredients used for the class are of the highest quality (such that I'm not even sure if she runs it at a profit), and it goes without saying that the final product is delicious. Meeting Yuka was an absolute pleasure, and I cannot recommend this experience enough.

The BEST day. We booked for the cooking class before leaving Australia. Yuka speaks perfect english and we learnt so much about japanese food, and how not to eat sashimi and sushi... Our group was fun and we shared lots of laughs during our sushi making. Yuka meet us all at the train station and then we walked to her house to begin our education in sushi making.I have no hesitation in recommending you take one of Yuka's classes - in fact in hindsight I wish we had taken more while we were in Tokyo - Thank you Yuka for making our visit one of the most memorable.

Good experience. Yuka's cooking class is a great way to learn more about Japanese food and how to prepare it. She met the 2 of us and 3 others at the train station before we walked to her apartment. We were lucky our class was small as we had previously read the sizes can vary significantly. We made gyoza and a Japanese beef dish. She used high quality ingredients and made sure all the students had turns in helping to prepare. The food was delicious and explanations were clear. She gave us the instructions to take home and even suggested alternatives to use back home if we couldn't find the correct ingredients. We were given miso, green tea and a Japanese dessert to accompany our prepared meal. After the class ended I asked where I could purchase some ingredients locally and she walked us to her local supermarket and gave us a tour of the place and showed us all the ingredients and explained the different types. It was a lovely experience and I would recommend it to friends who want a different way to experience Japan. The class lasts approx 4 hours.

Wonderful cooking classes. I took two consecutive classes with Yuka during my trip to Japan. She was easy to communicate with by email prior to the classes and was an excellent and engaging teacher. She has lots to share about life, food and cooking in Japan, and speaks very good English. She has a great sense of humor, and we had plenty of hands-on experience during the classes. I highly recommend her class to anyone looking to enrich their knowledge of Japanese culture.
Excellent Teacher. Well spoken English. Very informative lessons. Amazing quality products. I'm very excited to get to work on my own homemade sushi! Had a great time!

Learned a lot!. We had a great time at the Sushi making class. Yuka gave very detailed descriptions on how to cook rice and how to treat the fish, we really liked that as it can make a massive difference. Her ingredients were fresh and of really high quality, she provided nice Tuna and even scallops. We also got to eat everything at the end, it almost looked to pretty to eat but it was so so good. Recommended!

Great experience making sushi :). My partner and I took part in Yuka's sushi making class today and it was a great experience! We read reviews here about it and decided to give it a go and delighted we did as it was such a different experience and so fun! Yuka is really friendly and welcomes you into her home, she has great English and a great personality! We prepared a really nice lunch and ate it at the end of the day which was a lovely way to finish a great day! Thanks a million Yuka we would definitely recommend this to others to do!
Highly recommended. Without a doubt one of the highlights of our trip to Japan. Yuka was incredibly helpful, informative, and funny. Oh, and the sushi was delicious - best we had while in Japan!

The most fun day in Tokyo!. Yuka was absolutely amazing, so friendly and informative with many tips on making sushi, ingredients, utensils and knives to use and buy whilst in Japan. Yuka had many stories and the time flew by, instructions were clear and easy to follow, my seven year old son joined in and had the best time. Yuka has inspired us to continue making sushi at home, it was the best we've tasted, the dashi and miso were also amazing. Thankyou Yuka for a great day and all the tips during the supermarket tour.

Best sushi and class ever!. Our first visit to Japan and of course we want to experience everything we can. We signed up to take Yuka's sushi class and it was the best decision ever. I emailed her to ask about availability and she replied right away, in perfect english. We signed up and she sent an email with instructions and her contact info. She met us at the ticket gate of the subway exit and we walked to her home. The class was amazing. She explained the difference between different ingredients, what to expect at different levels of restaurants, and answered every question we could fire at her. We laughed and learned and felt so welcome in her home. The final product was something you'd expect at the finest sushi restaurants. And the taste!!! You eat everything you prepare so come hungry as it is a lot of food. We took so many pictures and videos so that we can take Yuka home with us when we leave. She even sends you home with printed recipes too.And when it was all said and done, she took us to the grocery store and walked us through all of the important ingredients, and even beyond what we prepared. She spent almost 6 hours with us and we could have spent an entire day with her! Don't bother looking anywhere else. I promise you this is worth every dollar, and I would easily pay double for all that you get.

Highlight of our trip to Tokyo!!. My boyfriend and I took Yuka's sushi making course during our stay in Tokyo, and we both agreed it was the highlight of the trip! The sushi was fantastic, and after one class with Yuka we're excited to make it many more times back home! Yuka is an amazing host, and gave us great tips on places to go during the remainder of our stay in Toyko. I would highly recommend the class- we loved every minute of it!

Fun way to learn how to make sushi. What a great experience! Yuka met us at the subway stop and walked us to her very comfortable apartment where she patiently taught us the art of making sushi. While I doubt that we will ever become experts at making sushi, Yuka made the class a lot of fun and very interactive. We learned how to make the rice properly, how to cut the fish, how to make nigiri and cut rolls and how to use and look for top ingredients. The class had a total of 8 participants including my wife and I. After we finished making sushi, we sat down at the table and ate, chatted and had an all around great time. Don't miss this
Fun, informative and good food . Great class with good food. Yuka was a good teacher. Also great information about Tokyo and the Japanese kitchen.

Fabulous,Fun, Delicious, Game On!. We had so much fun at Yuka's sushi class. I can't wait to practice what we've learned at home. The sushi is beautiful and more importantly delicious. Thank you Yuka for a wonderful day.
Fun and useful. Yuka is sweet, funny and a really good teacher. Had a great time while learning how to make sushi. Can definitely recommend!
Great class, learnt enough to make maki sushi back at home. I really enjoyed this class. The teacher was fantastic. The ingredients were high quality and there was a good variety of fish.

Great time, great teacher. Although I had prepared sushi before participating Yuka's cooking class, it was a very great experience and entertaining course we had with her, I've learnt lots of new, interesting things.She is a very experienced, funny teacher, very kind, speaks perfectly English, and offers high quality of ingredients for the courses.There are some things I do regret however:- taking only the sushi course,- not getting her offer on coming for shopping with us. This is something you should definitely chose, if you are interested in Japanese cuisine, else you just get lost in the supermarket.It is also very kind of her that she comes and picks you up at the subway station, it helps you a lot, even if you are experienced finding your way around - which can be quite challenging in Tokyo.

Best cooking school in Tokyo. I attended both the Sushi and the Gyoza + Wagyu beef classes. Yuka is a very experienced, professional and classy teacher (+ very entertaining!), that will guide you through every step of meal preparation. It is also a great culinary experience, since she uses only high quality ingredients that you won't normally find in normal restaurants. I do suggest, as a plus, the complimentary supermarket visit that she offers, useful both to satisfy your curiosities on specific ingredients and to be guided in the shopping of otherwise difficult to find Japanese ingredients and delicacies.

Sushi Course. We had an amazing experience !! Yuka was so full of energy, knowledge and love for the food. We did the sushi course and it was excellent. Yuka shared her passion and enthusiasm for Japanese dishes and high quality ingredients. She is a real profesional. We learned so many new things in just few hours with her. The only thing we regret is that we don't have a time for an additional course. We highly reccomand!

Thoroughly enjoyable sushi making class. My family and I had a great time with Yuka learning how to prepare sushi with delicious, high quality ingredients. My husband and I had taken a class elsewhere during a previous trip to Tokyo, but I was keen that this time our sushi-loving kids could try and learn to prepare some too. Yuka gave clear instructions and demonstrations in excellent English, and kept all 8 of us in the class fully involved with hands on preparation of the rolls and nigiri. She introduced us to ingredients I hadn't encountered before, and helped us with techniques - and the end results were delicious. Yuka is great company, clearly passionate about food and full of recommendations for places to eat and buy ingredients around Tokyo. After the class was over, she took us around a supermarket and helped us select some foods I would never have been able to identify left to my own devices! She was very generous with her time, which we really appreciated.I would definitely recommend this class as both very informative and enjoyable to families, couples and friends alike.

High respect for the ingredients. It was a pleasure to have learned the art of making sushi with Yuka. She has such a high respect for the ingredients we used, she wanted to keep the quality at the highest. Everything was very high standards, from instructions to ingredients and the result was a high quality sushi making - eating experience. Fully recommended.

I learned (and ate) so much!. I thought I knew how to make sushi... Now I realise I have been making it wrong for so long!I can't wait to try out the delicate techniques we learned in our sushi class. I was surprised by how much food we made also, with one guest being able to take away what they couldn't eat. Yuka was very friendly and spoke wonderful English so it made the class very easy to understand and enjoy.

Fun Gyoza and Beef Wagyu cooking experience. We had such a great time in the gyoza and beef wagyu class. Yuka gave such great explanations and details on what we were doing. It was hands on for everyone - even our 2 children. The class size was small - a total of 7 people and everyone got a chance to do preparation and cooking. Then, we all got to eat all of the fabulous food we had prepared. I would definitely recommend this to anyone wanting to learn to make japanese food.

Amazing Sushi Class with an Expert. I had the honor of taking a sushi class with Yuka, who was very patient with me, friendly, and very knowledgeable about sushi. No other person had reserved the class for that day, but after I plead to Yuka that it was my only chance to take a class in Tokyo, she graciously agreed to conduct the class one-on-one. Yuka does not let you skip steps or allow you to passively go on to the next step even if your prior attempt was poor. She strives to be sure you understand what you are doing and if the last attempt didn't go well, she asked me to do it again like a wonderful teacher should. This was the best cooking class I've taken abroad, and Yuka's class is a real gold mine if you're interested in truly learning how to make sushi. It was fantastic.

Very fun, lighthearted, but intimate experience. Really fun time making four different recipes with a small group of people. Yuka was great at showing us very detailed instructions that were fun and memorable, and the small group setting in her home kitchen made it a very fun and friendly place to learn delicious food. The food was all very, very delicious. Especially liked the wagyu beef in the dish, as well as the very crispy gyoza. We were able to keep the recipes and make them again and again at home - definitely 100% worth the experience! We were pretty intense/quick about making the food, so we had some time left over, which Yuka very hospitably offered to use as time to give us recommendations. She had a bunch of great recommendations of sights and restaurants to try out in Tokyo, which we very much appreciated. We went to all of them and they were all great!

The Art of Sushi. Just a couple of words on the morning we spent in Yuka's company making sushi. Firstly, Yuka is a wonderful teacher and sushi-mentor! As someone mentioned, Yuka really puts her soul into making the class interesting and fun, and she shares her knowledge on cooking in general and her experiences from far and near in particular, which meant we never had a dull moment. Secondly, Yuka is equally inclusive of teenagers and adults, therefore the whole family was engaged in measuring amounts of rice, 9, 10 or 11 gr - those small amounts actually made every difference. We had a lovely time and I would love to go back and try the art of Gyoza next!

Memorable - totally worth it. Went as a group of three friends and had the class to ourselves. Several hours. Yuka is meticulous and really knows her stuff. I have since made sushi at home with friends and it turned out great. Her approach to teaching makes the lessons memorable and totally worth it.

More Than a Cooking Class. My grandmother and I took the Gyoza and Gyodon class. Yuka San is a wealth of knowledge. Beyond simply showing us how to make the gyoza and gyudon, she shared insights such as distinguishing the variety of misos, the "cheap" vs. "expensive" way to fold gyoza, how to verify if a beef is wagyu, and much much more. We had a great time, and hope to be able to reserve a class on our next visit to Tokyo.

Fun and yummy sushi making class. Yuka was so nice and a great instructor. We had a really fun time taking this class while we were in Tokyo, and plan to use our new sushi-skills many times in the future!

Great Sushi Class. Thanks so much to Yuka san for a great day and sushi-making class!Great for learning about Japanese ingredients and how they compliment each other, Yuka san provides what you'll need to learn everything from preparing rice for sushi to cutting the fish and rolling your own makizushi with fresh ingredients.A lot of fun with family and friends!Thanks so much for the great communication; expectations were exceeded and we'd definitely like to come back for another class!

Nice thing to do. I really had a fantastic time with Yuka San, wonderful sushi class with best ingredients and I learned a lot from her >>how to cook rice for sushi (REAL ONE)California roll, Hiyayyako, Dashi (Japanses broth) ,secret of making great miso soup.It was great experience in Tokyo ..5 hours is just not enough hehe.Thank you so much ❤️

Sushi Cooking class . We had an amazing time, learned a lot more than rolling sushi, it was an amazing intimate learning environment ... such an educational 4 hours of cultural learning, laughing, eating.... Highly recommend this class.

Good times. Better sushi.. My wife and I took the class and not only did we enjoy making the sushi, we learned a lot about Japanese culture in the process thanks to Yuka's stories and instruction. It was definitely one of the high points of our trip, and while we're not master sushi chefs just yet, we've enjoyed making maki rolls and miso soup multiple times since our return to the states. In short, Yuka's great, the people we ended up sharing the class with were fun, and the sushi was amazing. She also did her best to accommodate for food allergies.

Sushi wa Oishikatta :). I attended Yuka Sensei sushi class two weeks ago with a group of friends. I have been living in Japan for few years now and have never had the opportunity to join a Japanese cooking class. Not only I have learnt about sushi making, maki rolls, I have learnt also about basic ingredients (miso, dashi, tofu) that I never had the chance to cook/prepare for myself. An additional cooking adventures that I will explore for sure. The class was fun, instructive and under the expert eyes and savoir faire of Yuka Sensei. She is a lovely, fun person and extremely helpful in providing all information requested to her. Looking for joining another of her classes in a near future.
Wonderful Class Perfectly Choreographed. I urge anyone with an interest in Japanese cooking to try this class. It was informative, delicious, and fun!

Fun and fab - Learning,. Notwithstanding the terrific quality of food used and the yummy lunch post the class, the instruction and commentary were entertaining. Yuka gives a genuine and often funny insight into Japanese culture which goes beyond a cooking class. For example, there was a discussion on toilet etiquette with views on those automatic toilets and how Japanese men cope with activating the flush. You must ask her when you see her. Otherwise, the instruction was clear and showed a real passion for the nation's cuisine and the sometimes niche ingredients used. Just sit back and take it all in - and enjoy the amazing sushi and other concoctions that you yourself bring together.

So much fun!. Yuka is a fantastic teacher. She made it a fun and entertaining class for us (of 3 different nationalities) to learn to make sushi, miso and knife skills (not that we mastered that!) I would absolutely recommend her class to anyone that goes to tokyo.

Superb Sushi Class!. Today we joined Yuka Mazda's sushi making class and it was excellent. We were six students, learning how to make sushi, maki and California rolls using fine ingredients, taught by a very friendly Yuka sensei. It was a great day and we learned a lot. Yuka Mazda knows a lot about cuisine and she taught us well, in a very easy style. Finally, we had lunch together, eating what we prepared, plus miso soup and tofu, finished off by bean curd cake and matcha. Excellent. I can't wait until we return for another course.

Amazing cooking class . Yuka was very entertaining and funny and get cooking class is a must do in Tokyo!! She had fresh and beautiful ingredients and explained all about them. Would for sure go again.

Excellent sushi class, lots of fun! . My husband and I attended the sushi class (just over 4hrs) and it was lots of fun! Yuka speaks great English and explains the cooking techniques well, with lots of interesting and funny stories. We got to slice the sashimi and other ingredients, roll sushi, make sushi rice and miso broth. Excellent class!

Yuka is a star! Excellent class!. My 13y.o. son and I (both sushi lovers) took the sushi making class with Yuka and had an amazing time. Yuka had very high quality ingredients, and a wealth of expertise and stories to share throughout the class. We learned enough to continue trying on our own at home. Yuka also had excellent recommendations on where to buy top quality kitchenware in and around Tokyo. On top of it all, Yuka is a lovely person to meet!

Amazing !!!! Learned so much 😍😍😍. So much fun and very informative. She has a breadth of knowledge on each ingredient. Where its from, what makes it top quality and how to get the best out of it. I took her sushi class and am now ruined for life, as we got to use the best and freshest fish. I also went with her to the supermarket after, DO THIS! She takes you through the whole place and it is worth it! Could not recommend more highly.

Must add to your "to do" list in Japan. Probably the best thing I've done in Japan so far! Highly recommend doing this. Must book in advance as classes have limited spots.This was my 2nd time visiting Japan and was really stuck on what to do. I was bound to Roppongi and couldn't venture out further. I did some research on nearby activities and found out about Yuka's class on TripAdvisor. After reading some positive reviews, I was adamant I should try it out. I decided to pick the Sushi class, because it's such a popular food here in Australia and I wanted to know how to make them...properly and from a local too.Yuka picked our group up from the station and it was an easy walk to her home. It was also amazing hearing about her about background and comforting to know that we'd be in good hands (she knows a lot about how to eat/eating really good food!!).As soon as we arrived at her house, we got straight into it. She uses the freshest ingredients and her classes are very easy to follow. A very hands on and interactive class - we made some pretty tasty sushi, miso and learnt about dashi broth. Dessert and delicious drinks were served after. Little Japanese everyday basics which was great to learn about. And you can tell Yuka was very passionate about sharing this with us!If you don't know anything about Japan, Yuka is very happy to share her culture with you! She added her own personal touch to our group's experience, by sharing her travel experiences with us, favourite restaurants and places to visit in Japan. One of the guests requested a visit to the local supermarket after the class. It was such an invaluable experience, learning about different ingredients, dishes and beverages that you'd find in a Japanese supermarket.Yuka was so lovely and such a knowledgeable teacher. She goes above and beyond in making each of her guests/students feel welcomed and cared for...from initial emails/communications, to the very end when we say our goodbyes. Thank you for making my experience in Japan very memorable and worthwhile, Yuka! I will be back for more classes :-)

Great class and delicious food!. This was my second time attending Yuka's class - both times have been with friends who were visiting Japan. Both groups, myself included, have loved the class and felt it was well worth the money. She's very friendly, knowledgeable, and fun and the directions are very easy to follow and replicate at home. Would definitely recommend!

Great Cooking class. Yuma is an amazing teacher when coming to food she picked us up from the station took us to her home
And when it came to cooking she explained all the different types of ingredients. Very tasty. Thanks Yuka!
A great Japanese cuisine experience. Yuka is a great cook and a great storyteller. We really enjoyed the class as well as her recommendation on how to cook and chose the right ingredients.

Super fun cultural experience!. I would recommend this to everyone who goes to Japan! Yuka is very knowledgeable and has shared with us some authentic Japanese cooking skills. Yuka is also very friendly and nice, and is very open in sharing with us her interesting stories about cooking, food and cuisine, and even has shared with us tips in experiencing the true Japanese culture while travelling in Japan.The class mix is also good - there were 6 of us in on class, and we got to share with the other group our travelling experiences.Must go if you are looking for an authentic Japanese experience!

Unique Japanese cooking experience. Yuka taught us her own way of cooking in a modern style. Although it's not the most traditional way, it's faster and easier especially for serving meals to small groups, which made the class more valuable. Unfortunately Yuka mis-understood my booking before class as we communicated in English, which made me a bit upset.

Fun Beef & Gyoza Cooking Class with 8. This is the 2nd Japanese cooking class I've done, and the food was AMAZING. The price is higher, but the quality reflects that. We were a group of 8 people (my family) and we were super full afterwards. We made: miso soup, Wagyu Beef Gyudon, Pork & Veggie Gyoza, and Japanese rice. One of our favorite memories of my family's trip to Japan!

Great tasting gyu-don. Yuka goes above and beyond avg cooking classes, buying the top quality meat and giving students a taste of different variations on common Japanese ingredients like Miso to illustrate the differences.
