I really appreciated her attention to detail, and it should be noted that the pace of the class is too fast for kids but perfect for an adult who wants to add a few new dishes to his/her repertoire in a short amount of time. Highly recommended!

Sushi Making Class 10-1-15. Myself and my Girlfriend attended Yuka's Sushi making class, it was a fantastic experience to learn the proper Japanese way of making sushi & traditional miso soup. Ingredients used were of the highest quality and teaching methods were great. Would highly recommend. Would recommend that you set aside at least 5 hours of your day to complete this lesson. It does take a bit of time.

Sushi cooking class. I attended Yuka's cooking with a friend who was in Japan for the first time. It was a lot of fun with high quality ingredients that tasted great and easy to make. We also to properly prepare the rice. Recommended if you are serious about Japanese food.

Fun teriyaki chicken class. My girlfriend and I had a great time taking the Teriyaki chicken class with Yuka. We made Teriyaki chicken, yakisoba, and strawberry daifuku. Yuka also showed us how to make miso soup and white rice on a stove. She was very energetic and friendly, and we had a lot of fun learning Japanese cooking. We also appreciated that she gave us restaurant recommendations within Tokyo.

Family Cooking Class. My family of two adults and two teenagers had a great evening cooking gyoza and wagyu beef with Yuka. She was funny, entertaining and a very good teacher. We loved the hands on nature of the class and we were all able to participate in every stage of the cooking. Yuka was patient even with our very strange gyoza folding techniques. Communication regarding the details of the course were clear and easy to follow. Yuka met us at the local station and took as back there at the end of the class. I would really recommend this class as a worthwhile part of every Tokyo itinerary.

So good, so fun!. 10/10 must go, she is full of energy and... A celebrity has been here also ;) come find out! She chooses out the best cut of fish for us travellers, and is sure to be a goooood lunch!

Gyoza & Wagyu Beef Gyudon Course. My husband and I recently took a cooking class with Yuka and it was a great experience. She meets you at the Hiro-o train station and escorts you on a short ten minute walk to her home. There were eight people in the group which is a nice size. We were provided written instructions with lots of opportunity for hands-on engagement. Yuka shares lots of information about Japan during the course of the class which is nice. The group cooked, laughed, exchanged stories and ate the results of our efforts. This was a wonderful way to meet new friends and experience cooking Japanese food with a knowledgeable and entertaining local. We highly recommend and will definitely return for another class.David and Chrystie Hill

Excellent class from a professional. Yuka Mazda is an exceptional teacher who is truly passionate about cooking. Not only did we learn how to make sushi but she provided far more by teaching us the background and insider information to top quality sushi. I really enjoyed her class and her technique. I will take another class from her when I return to Tokyo.

Great food and lots of fun. Yuka showed us how to make delicious gyozas that you´ll have no trouble doing back home. She´s a great cook and we had lots of fun whilst cooking.I´ll recommend anybody to spend half a day at Yukas cooking class if You want to learn more about Japan, Tokyo and Japanese food.

The difference between expensive and cheap gyoza. My son loves cooking especially Japanese cuisine. In the recent Japan trip, we attended this cooking class and learnt how to make gyoza. Yuka san showed us how to make both expensive and cheap gyoza. We made both and cooked our own dish successfully. The class was full of joy and excitement, and very suitable for people who are interested in Japanese cuisines and cultures. It is really a highlight of our trip and a memorable experience for us.

Highly Recommended CooKing Class in TokYo. An experience that every tourist must do when they visit Tokyo. Easy to follow recipes that you can actually do at home. Also, Yuka is very accomodating and freindly. Keep it up! :)

Gyoza, miso, gyu-don deliciousness. If you are lucky enough to get a class with Yuka then you are in for a great day. We wanted to make sushi but could only do these foods as she was fully booked. She takes you into her lovely home with about 6 others students. We made Gyoza with pork, real miso soup and used Kobe beef (the best) for the gyu-don. All amazing flavours and not too difficult to learn, until you get home and Yuka isn't there of course ;). Great day and experience thanks so much Yuka. From Luke sans

Great experience. There were 8 family members, all cook and love to eat. Yuka's class was fun, informative and the food was delicious! We chose the Gyoza and wagyu beef dish. We wanted to do something none of us had made before and it was the perfect choice for us. We had fun over a delicious experience, I highly recommend.

Highlight of my trip. My husband loves cooking so I booked Yuka's cooking class. Yuka is funny and energetic, she explains the background of the dishes and taught us how to eat sushi like a Japanese. I appreciate the preparations she did, and we enjoy her class so much.

Great expérience. I went with a friend during our stay in Tokyo and it was great course. Yuka is full of energy and funny, she teach us different japanese dishes easy to do at home. Highly recomanded for a good cooking expérience.

Great experience!. Whether you've never made sushi before or you're trying to fine tune your skills, Yuka's class is a great way to do it. I've been making sushi for over 10 years and definitely came away with some great information and techniques that I'll use moving forward. Highly recommended as a fun change of pace while you're in Tokyo.

Sushi class . Great class. I just finished today and it was a blast. I highly suggest you choose Yuka. From the first stage of scheduling she sent me all the info needed and broke down in detail what the class was about. She picks you up at a meeting place and takes you to hear nice apartment. The class is a smaller setting so your able to actually prep and cook everything. She explains every ingredient and why it's used as well as the tradition behind it. The food is amazing and when your done you will be surprised by what you made. Yuka has a great personality and is free flowing throughout the class. The class is taught at a good pace and in a great environment. You can't beat it. I would recommend you take this class.

What Yuka doesn't know about Sushi isn't worth knowing! Great value too. We had a private Sushi class (by chance!) of two with Yuka on a Wednesday in December.She's great fun, speaks really good English, explains the background behind all of the ingredients, and provides you with a printed recipe for each of the dishes that you make. We only had one full day in Tokyo, and are really glad we spent our lunch with Yuka at her home. When you consider the cost of the ingredients that Yuka provides, it really is great value too!
Cooking class. Yuka is very friendly,her english is really good,ingredients are extremly fresh and the class is well worth it...i would take it again for sure.

The difficult made easy!. We did Yuka-san's sushi making course which included making miso soup and a stunning cold tofu dish. Sushi made properly is hard work, but Yuka can do it with her hands tied behind her back and helps to give you the confidence to try it yourself. The ingredients she selected were absolutely top notch (real wasabi!) and everything we made tasted fantastic if not perhaps aesthetically perfect! Yuka's English is perfect and she will chat about anything so you can get some great cultural insights. Her aparment is lovely and she is nice enough to meet you at the station. A wonderful Tokyo experience. Now....to try making it at home....alone.... and not let Yuka down!

fantastic and enriching experience!. As a solo traveller from China and together with 2 couples from Austria and Canada, I had a wonderful sushi class from Yuka.The class was carried out exactly as what is on her website. We made sushi rolls, niguri zushi, miso soup and tofu.Yuka bought the top-quality ingredients and explained and demonstrated step by step. Everyone has the chance to slice the fish chunk and made their own sushi.Yuka spoke fluent and idiomatic English and was quite humorous. I was deeply impressed by her meticulous attentions to details and timing. A camera crew was there shooting some documentaries that day, which added a surprise to this unique experience. Yuka lead us through noisy game studios and quiet residential quarters to experience brielfly the diverse Tokyo life before seeing everyone of us off.For dipping into real Japanese cuisinal culture and serving Japanese food yourselves, this is the top choice in Tokyo.
Good Way to learn to make sushi with a good Cook at her home.. The ingredients were of the best quality. Finally, I understand how to make sushi. Also, how to make miso soup!

Great experience in a relaxed environment! . My husband and I, along with my parents when to Yuka's house to take part in her cooking course. We couldn't get to the train station on time to meet her, but we just popped the address she gave us into google maps and we found it fine! The first great thing about the course is that it was at her home making it personal. There was only the 4 of us and 1 other so we had plenty of time to chat to Yuka and ask questions about the food. We chose the Gyoza and wagyu beef course which was delicious! Another bonus about it being in Yuka's house was that she could talk us through everything as if we were at home and the ingredients were in the fridge. She was very generous with the amount of food we ate which was great! You pay a good price but it is totally worth it! We'd definitely recommend this course as Yuka is a great host, very bubbly and chatty making you feel very welcome.

Comforting and Educational. I enjoyed this class so much. Not only is Yuka very welcoming, but I felt like I learn so much more than just making sushi. She is very sweet, and knowledgeable about ingredients and quality. Thank you so much for this class and I will cherish this.

Hope to have a second class when I come back to Tokyo!. That was my first time making Sushi, it turned out to be much easier than I expected when Yuka taught us how to do. Yuka's instruction was pretty clear and she was patient too. Materials we were using such as salmon, scallop, tuna, tasted fresh and luxurious. I believe she picked the most expensive one for us from the market. We also got to grind wasabi, cooked rice and made miso soup by dried bonito. Yuka was talkable as well. Foreigners could learn a lot about not only Japanese food but culture in the class. It was a very impressive experience. I would like to take a second class if I go to Tokyo again!

Chicken Teriyaki Class. This was our first trip to Japan. I researched TripAdvisor on things to do and Yuka's Cooking School came up as a top choice and for good reason. We were in Japan for 3 weeks and did many wonderful things and this school was among the best of all we did. Yuka is very accommodating, friendly, and the class itself was not intimidating. It is a must for anyone visiting Tokyo.

Sushi class (english). Yuka was an excellent, endearing teacher. My wife and I enjoyed taking her Sushi class and found it to be a wonderful social time, as well as a tasty one. She explained the techniques, the reasoning behind them, and in some cases differences between Japanese and western perspectives. Definitely recommend it if you're looking for a relaxed, but fun few hours in Tokyo.

Much more than just a cooking class!. That was my second class at Yuka's Cooking school. I took gyoza class this time and it was amazing. Yuka bought high quality ingredients as always, so food was very tasty. It was 7 of us in one group and we all had opportunity to prepare and cook gyoza. We prepared also miso soup, sticky rice and wagyu gyudon. We were preparing only one dish at time so we could follow the procedure. At the end we had some tea and Japanese sweets. If you want to take cooking class, I highly recommend taking this one as Yuka is full of energy, gives lots of extra explanation and even recommends substitutes if you can't buy some of the ingredients back home! We got all the recipes and also plenty of useful information about Tokyo and Japan - everything from shopping and restaurants to sightseeing. She even recommends some nice places outside Tokyo if you plan to travel around.

Outstanding cooking class. For our last day in Tokyo we decided to take a cooking class at Yukas place.Yuka is not only a great cooking teacher she is also a really friendly and awesome person. After 3 hours of cooking and eating exceptional Wagyu beef with Gioza she took us to the next supermarket as well as Shibuya, showed us what we could possibly take home as souvenirs and what we could do for the rest of the day. I highly recommend booking and the only thing I regret is taking the class on the last day.
A fun lesson in traditional cooking . Great fun with an English speaking Japanese chef. Yuka has a lovely helpful personality and makes the class very enjoyable. We all had fun at the class.
Fabulous Tokyo Cooking Course. Fun Tokyo experience cooking Gyoza & Wagyu Beef with Yuka Mazda. Yuka is very friendly, speaks excellent English and the food is sensational. Highly recommend.

Cooking with Yuka. Our family had so much fun learning to cook gyoza and wagu beef with Yuka. She was very engaging and gave us lots of information. The food was so delicious and the class was very hands on

She's the best, perfect English-incredible technique. Incredible place, warm, friendly, easy to understand. I still use her rice making technique whenever I make rice! This is a highlight for Tokyo. Interesting to see a Japanese apartment too. Very good value. Book it!!

Fun in Tokyo with Yuka !. We really enjoyed this experience, it was fun and somehow we felt like celebrities since we had an exclusive session with Yuka. We recommend others to go for the session, its something that you will keep talking about it for the rest of your life.

Highly recommend Yuka's Sushi Class.. My husband & I just returned from our trip to Japan. Yuka's sushi class was one of our favorite experiences. An accomplished chef, she taught us many techniques while sharing great tips on sushi-making. She showed us how to make sushi rice, sushi rolls, nigiri sushi and miso soup. The ingredients were excellent and we got to enjoy our "creations" at the end of the sesion. Most memorable & delicious experience!

A fun but comprehensive insight to Japanese cuisine. My husband and I were honeymooning in Japan and Tokyo was our last stop. I had booked the Teriyaki class just before we left for Japan. And i was so glad I did! My husband doesn't show much interest in cooking usually, which I put down to a lack of confidence. Not only did he absolutely love it, but he got to sit in the seat Taylor Swift sat doing Yuka's class and now has a few more recipes in his resume he can confidently execute.. I thought Yuka was charming and very welcoming and I thoroughly enjoyed her class!
Absolutely amazing experience!. Yuka is a great cook and teacher and an absolutely lovely person. We've prepared teriyaki chicken, yakisoba and strawberry daifuku- all of it was delicious

A tasty sushi course. My husband and I did Yuka´s Sushi class and enjoyed it a lot.Yuka explained us a lot about the technic how to make Sushi, about how to eat Sushi, and a lot more about japanies food. She is a high knowledgeable cook and very kindly and diverting. We learned how to make sushi-rice, miso soup, broth, sushi rolls and nigiri rolls. The products we used were in a very high qualitiy. And at the end we could eat all Sushi that we have prepared by our own. It was a great experience.Would definitely recommend the class to others.

Sushi cooking class with Yuka. My husband and I signed up for a sushi cooking class with Yuka in Tokyo. It was a blast. We learned how to make miso soup, various sushi rolls and nigiri rolls. There were two others in our class and it was more than enough food for us to enjoy at the end as well. Our instructor, Yuka, was terrific; She had great energy, was really knowledgeable and made us feel comfortable cooking foods we had never tried cooking ourselves before. Would absolutely recommend her class to others.

Very knowledgeable and accomplished chef!. We did Yuka's class and prepared the beef gyudon and gyoza. Her directions were easy to follow and she was very friendly and extremely knowledgeable in the art of cooking. We found out later that she's a bit of a cooking celebrity in Japan on cooking shows and shopping network! We were in a group of 6 in total but still got one on one attention. Her facilities were clean and modern and we now have full confidence in making perfect, YUMMY gyozas!

High quality, authenticity and fun. My girlfriend and I did Yuka's sushi class on Sunday and had a great time. The class is very hands on and we performed all the steps of the recipes. We received a comprehensive sushi lesson with printed instructions to keep (sushi rolls, nigiri, sashimi plus miso soup, broths, dipping sauce, more). The ingredients are high quality (real wasabi, top cuts of tuna etc). Yuka is clearly knowledgeable, energetic and personable and genuinely went out of her way to make this a great experience (met us at train station, walked us to bus stop to catch trains). Best of all we made so much of a feast we couldn't eat it all. Expectations were exceeded at this cooking class in Tokyo.
Awesome experience!. I took the sushi making course with Yuka and had a great time! She's very friendly, fun and knowledgable about Japanese food and culture! I really recommend this class.

Great time! . Yuka is very likely the most friendly person you will ever meet. I did the sushi class and it was fantastic. If you are reading this review then book the class. Food was plentiful, I learned a lot, and it was very fun.

Amazing and fun sushi class. I attended the sushi making class and had a fantastic time with Yuka and the other students. Yuka is extremely knowledgeable and a great teacher. Yuka's English is really good and she explained all of the different steps very clearly.I really enjoyed the class and especially the fresh sushi we were able to make (and eat!).If you want a fun cooking class and learn about Japanese cuisine from a great teacher, I highly recommend Yuka's classes.After the class, Yuka was happy to have a chat over tea and pass on useful travel tips about Japan. Yuka also took us on a visit to the local supermarket to help us pick out some green tea to bring back home.

Very enjoyable cooking class. My partner and I attended the sushi making class with 2 other people ( 1 couple cancelled). Yuka met us at the train station and walked us to her house.The class was very good, Yuka provided excellent insight into Japanese cooking and provided the highest quality ingredients for us. Yuka is so lovely and speaks English well. She has excellent recommendations for activities to do in Tokyo and beyond. We attended the class on our last day in Japan so couldn't follow all her recommendations, would have been very helpful earlier on in the trip!I would definitely recommend this activity to anyone visiting Tokyo!

Great time. My wife and I took the class since we both love to cook and wanted to learn more about Japanese food. Yuka was energetic, very knowledgeable and fun as an instructor. She was great in demonstrating and explaining how to do things and then letting us have a try...and the food was great!

Fun!. My husband and I took the gyoza and the beef wagyu guydon course. We had 4 people in the course. It was an interactive session where we were all able to contribute to making of the dishes. We were also able to ask her about local recommendations. It was a lot of fun!

Excellent experience - absolute must when in Tokyo. Did a sushi making class with Yuka in November. Class size was good with 7 of us. Yuka is an excellent cook and definitely knows a lot about Japanese cooking. She explained a lot about Japanese cuisine and ingredients which was very interesting. This was an amazing experience with an authentic Japanese cook in her home. Definitely recommend when you're in Tokyo. Yuka was also very good with email communication and speaks fluent English.

Great sushi cooking class with Yuka! . We had the best time ever! Yuka is a great host and patient chef! It was a wonderful experience to spend time at her japanese home and to learn the basics about sushi (roll) preparation in such a felaxed atmosphere!

Making sushi with Yuka. Yuka is an extremely kind and patient person, and her sushi making class was a lot of fun too! We took her class on 11/9 with several other people and she did a fantastic job in making us feel welcome and getting us involved in the sushi making process. Not only did she do great in explaining "how", she also explained why things are done a certain way. You can tell she's a great chef who truly loves cooking and teaching others.

Fantastic cooking class. We had a fantastic time with Yuka! She's incredibly sociable and friendly and it was very nice to visit a Japanese home. The ingredients were of very high quality and we had a lot of fun making sushi! We would recommend it to anyone who visits Tokyo!Mia & Mats

Teriyaki Class. Yuka is super social and holy crap she knows so much about food, all aspects of how to prepare anything to the economics of it. The class itself was enjoyable, there was a good energy in the class and there was no point of anxiety during the class either. She made everyone feel comfortable. If you enjoy food and having a laid back time learning from someone who knows their stuff, this is probably something you should do in Japan.

FANTASTIC!. Yuka was very friendly. I booked a cooking class from spain for my boyfriend that was in Tokyo and she helped with everything. It was easy to contact with her and she gave me all the information I needed even without asking.He enjoyed the course so much, even prepared me the teriaki which was easy to prepare and amazingly good!thanks a lot Yuka!

Sushi cooking class in private hoem. Wonderful class with best ingredients and step-by-step do-it-yourself instructions. With Sushi, Miso soup and Tofu maybe the most known Japanese are taught. Nice that all tis is happening in the warmth of Yuko Mazda's private home

delicious food, top tips and an entertaining teacher. Perfect!. Yuka was fantastic! She met us at the station and we walked to her apartment. We learnt to cook gyoza, my absolute favourite! Yuka gave us the top tips to make perfect dumplings. We also made beef gyudon and miso soup. Yuka told hilarious stories, she is such a character and chatting with her is so much fun. She has traveled to many places and really sets people at ease. I have cooked the dishes since returning home to the UK and found I replicated it well, so she must have taught me very well. I had a wonderful time and couldn't have asked for more. Thank you Yuka, I would recommend this to all my friends that visit Japan! x

This was nice, but not outstanding.. Yuka is very personable and engaging. We started by meeting her at the train station. Meeting directions were very clear. The group then traveled by foot to her apartment. Yuka walked us through all of the elements of making sushi. She really knows her stuff. I only gave this 3 stars for 2 important reasons: There were 9 students in this class (10 at the table when you add Yuka). It was just too crowded for her small apartment. My other piece of feedback is that we made several courses (all very tasty), but we waited until the very end to eat everything. It would have been really nice to eat as dishes as they were finished--as the class went from 10am to 2pm (right over the lunch hour). I was famished by the time we ate.

Had great time . It was my first time learning to make sushi. It was fun. I could make delicious sushi :P . Yuka was patiently showed me all the steps of making and shared the information about interesting places in Japan. I am thinking to learn another cooking course from her.
Fantastic :). Great Japaneses cooking course for people who don't eat fish. Yuki is very knowledgeable, personable and cute :) Great thing to do on a rainy Japanese day.

Highlight of my Tokyo trip!. I have taken cooking classes in Thailand, Indonesia, & Japan and Yuka's class is by FAR the best experience of them all. I felt so welcomed in her home as if family. Since the class I have had sushi making classes of my own for fun with friends and family. So thankful to Yuka for sharing her cooking skills with us. She's such a great teacher and person overall. Don't miss the opportunity to take her class in Tokyo!

Excellent Cooking Clas. This class was a great chance to make foods that I'd otherwise not had a chance to try or learn to make. Working with Tofu, Kobe Beef, and learning how to make broth the right way was very educational!Yuka was very friendly & helpful and made sure we were on track and not doing anything incorrectly. She answered all of our questions and took time out to go to the supermarket and explain which ingredients were the best to buy for different dishes or just for eating.The course was a great value and the food came out delicious!

Great cooking course. I was with my family, 6 people, in total we were 8. The course is very nice. Yuka is very friendly, she speaks good English & she explains very good. The food is very good. I enjoy the time there & the food. Recommended.

Sushi making class. My husband and I enjoyed attending Yuka's sushi class on the last day of our honeymoon in Japan. It was a real highlight of our trip and we would thoroughly recommend it. Yuka is not only a very good teacher but is kind, entertaining and very knowledgeable. We also thought the course was good value, especially as Yuka uses very high quality ingredients. Jo

Awesome experience. The whole class was super fun, everyone got to do something and Yuka was so nice and an awesome teacher. We made nigiri, making, and inside out sushi that was awesome, and had a great feast with foods we helped prepare. Finishing off the meal was a lovely cup of matcha like in a tea ceremony. Finally, on the way back to station, Yuka took us to a supermarket and explained about the specific things important to Japanese cooking. It was a really great experience for me and my fiancé.

Delicious Sushi!. After a brief walk from the train station to Yuka's house, we quickly got into preparing our feast! All the ingredients were fresh and delicious, and my family and I had a lot of fun! Yuka is a great host and made us all feel very welcome in her home
A fun sushi session. We had a great experience learning to prepare sushi with Yuka, even better she has some great stories and makes the experience very memorable. Highly recommended!

This was a real treat.. Yuka met us at the train station and after a short walk we were at her apartment starting the class. We decided on the Teriyaki Chicken course, and it did not disappoint.
We had a very nice time cooking, chatting and learning a lot of the Japanese cooking culture.

Sushi making (and eating!) in Yuka's home. Yuka is super well-organised (from meeting point directions, to preparing for the sushi) and friendly. It was lovely to be welcomed into her home. The class was a great balance of teaching and just having a go. The pace was very relaxed and we enjoyed chatting with Yuka and the other participants. The highlight was obviously getting to eat all of the yummy food at the end! Thank you Yuka!

Excellent Teriyaki Chicken Could Be Yours. They say "teach a man to fish and he will eat forever" well... teach a family the best teriyaki chicken meal ever any they will feast forever! This class was truly awesome. Yuki was funny and was able to work with the various strengths and weaknesses of my husband, my niece and myself with ease. Although very busy with her sushi making classes she was able to squeeze us in for her teriyaki chicken class. Take teriyaki chicken! It is worth it!!
Sushi Class. Our sushi class with Yuka was definitely one of the highlights of our trip to Japan. She is a great teacher and such a kind person!

Friendly, yummy, reasonably priced learning/eating experience. Yuka was very warm and welcoming to her home, which she was outfitted as a cooking studio. She clearly knows her stuff and took the time to teach each of us students individually on everything from rolling the sushi to the (difficult!) art of cutting sashimi perfectly. The class dragged on a bit, but part of this was because there were a full 8 of us. The final product was beautiful and delicious...

Excellent class!. When I booked this class Yuka emailed back almost immediately, and luckily enough we got to choose the menu for the morning - gyoza and wagyu beef. We were met promptly at 10am at Hiro-o station (very easy to reach from Shinjuku). There were only 3 of us in the class that morning; we walked to Yuka's apartment (about a 10 minute walk) where we started to prepare the food. Throughout the class, Yuka chatted to us and discussed Japanese cuisine, showed us typical ingredients and even gave us recommendations as to where to eat nearby our hotel! The food we made was delicious and we were even provided with some "matcha" green tea and a dessert at the end of the class, along with a recipe sheet to take home. The whole class lasted about 3 hours - all in all, an excellent cooking class and enjoyable morning. Thank you! Jason & Shane

New found respect for Sushi!. I had no idea, until I had the most amazing sushi lesson with Yuka, how much skill is involved with sushi making, and how vital the ingredients are to the process. Yuka is brimming with experience and knowledge, and patiently explained the background of the art of sushi making, with fun and enthusiasm. We all tried our hand at rolling- some more successfully than others! Then were able to enjoy our hard work- even having extra to take home! I would not hesitate to recommend Yuka to anyone travelling to to Tokyo and I really look forward to trying out my homemade sushi on friends and family in England! Thanks so much for a fun and informative day Yuka x

Sushi Expirience with Yuka. We were thrilled. The whole organisation of Miss Yuka,the host role. Everything was just perfect. Thank you for teaching us how to make the perfect sushi (^-~). We would surely choose heragain on our next trip to tokyo

Great sushi making class with Yuka. We enjoyed very much our class with Yuka. We are quite passionate about food (I own a cooking school) and we can say that Yuka knows how to share her passion and knowledge really well.I finally understood how to make delicious sushi rice in a simple way. Thank you Yuka.

A great experience!. I have a really great time learning how to make sushi! Yuka was so lovely and was a great teacher. The class was so much fun and the quality of ingredients was excellent, so our sushi turned out amazing. I would definitely recommend to a friend, and If I'm ever back in Tokyo I will go again for another class. Thank you!

Sushi class - Memorable experience and well worth the time and money spent!. Yuka was very customer oriented right from the start. She gave very clear and concise directions on how to book her class and how to get there. The class was very hands on and messy with lots of instructions and recipes going on at the same time and it all came together at the end. The quality of the ingredients seemed very fresh and there was way too much food! She was very enthusiastic and spent a lot of time explaining different ingredients/methods/do's and don'ts. Highlights - actually saw the Wasabi root for the first time, learnt how to make inside-out sushi roll, went with Yuka to the local supermarket and bought some seaweed and other ingredients to bring home!

Yuka's Cooking School A+++. My girlfriend and I had an awesome time learning to make sushi. The course was very good value for money and Yuka is a great host. Thank you so much. See you next time we are in Japan.

Hands on - and delicious - cultural experience. Yuka is full of information and energy. She provided lots of background information to Japanese cuisine but still made the class hands on and fun! This class is good if you want to learn a skill but even if you have no plans on cooking yourself it will provide insights into Japanese culture and cuisine.

Wonderful authentic cooking experience. Our family had a wonderful experience learning to make tempura in a small group with Yuka. Even our 16 year old son really got into it - and he insisted on making tempura (very successfully) the day we got home from Japan. Booking in was very easy - Yuka returned my e mail almost immediately sent very clear instructions to get to the class. Yuka is a great host, speaks perfect English and provides written recipes to take home. We learnt much more than just the tempura recipe - even how to sharpen Japanese knives. Yuka was very generous with her time and took us on a supermarket tour on the way back to the subway station. We will definitely be back next year to do a different class!

Fantastic experience with sushi making!. Totally enjoyed the cooking class and sushi making experience! Lesson is held in a cosy place and Yuka is attentive to the needs of all students. She's fun loving, patient and is very helpful with providing us useful information about Japanese food and culture. Highly recommended for foreigners. Yuka speaks good English (:

Warm and welcoming experience in Tokyo. I attended the cooking class with my mum as we wanted to learn more about Japanese cuisine and culture and boy were we lucky to have found Yuka! She was extremely welcoming, friendly and patient and her skills in the kitchen are world class. After the class she even helped us plan the remainder of our time in Tokyo and showed us around her local neighbourhood.

Japanese food masterclass . I chose this masterclass while scrolling tripadvisor. Workshop held in Yuka's home, near the subway station. I came on foot, but Yuka met other members in the subway, so it is impossible to get lost. Yuka is very welcoming and cheerful person. Masterclass program is excellent. We were cooking chicken teriyaki, yakisoba, plain rice, miso soup and daifuku. Food was delicious! I cooked these dishes many times at home since then and every time my guests were delighted. Yuka provides detailed recipies in printed form so you don't need to waste your time and write it down. After masterclass you can go on a short tour to the nearest supermarket and buy some local products on Yuka's advices. I will definitely repeat this experience in my next visit to Tokyo!

Her assistant couldn't help so it became a private lesson!. and it was a blast! She's very fun and energetic.She does a really good job keeping you entertained and allowing you do do things yourself (with guidance). The quality of food that she had was incredible, too.

The best thing we did in Tokyo!. We loved spending time with Yuka and learning how to make sushi! She was very detailed and walked us through each step in the process - we recently returned home and made sushi on our own using her detailed instructions and teaching. She was very informative about life in Tokyo and what we should see/do while we were in town - we took a lot of her advice and had a great time. The amount of food was substantial - it was like a Japanese Thanksgiving! We left totally stuffed! We would highly recommend this to anyone interested in sushi or learning how to make it.

Learning to cook in Tokyo. Yuka offers a hands-on cooking class based on her extensive experience with a variety of cuisines. Beginning with the best ingredients, I was able to prepare the featured dishes, cook them on her stove, and of course, eat! The classes in her apartment provide a friendly, homey atmosphere. Yuka is quite particular about ingredients and method, and this should appeal to both hobbyists and even experienced cooks. Fun class!

Great fun and new knowledge. Yuka´s cooking class took place in here lovely home which was very interesting for us and we felt great thanks to it. I thought I knew a bit about sushi making since I prepare it quite often at home but that was a big mistake. Yuka was patient and showed us how to cut meat na omelette and other ingredients and then we prepared everything and of course ate it.Our group was only 5 people and that was also what I liked a lot compare to bigger cooking classes.I definitely reccommend you to choose Yuka as your japanese food cooking teacher.

Great quick cooking class - even for experienced travellers. Solid cooking class with only a few other people. Centrally located in Tokyo in Yuka's home. She has the whole class well laid out so most of the time is spent cooking and preparing. You will leave full so consider this your lunch. Completely appropriate for kids who cook (8 years+) and teens. Very good English and a very good instructor.

Sushi Course. My husband and I completed the Sushi course and our afternoon with Yuka was a highlight of our trip to Japan. Yuka met us at the metro station and we walked to her lovely house. She is funny, knowledgable, and full of energy. We spent the afternoon learning how to make sushi rice, cut the fish, create rolls, and make miso soup. We were impressed with her English and ability to help us create a meal for royalty. We highly recommend this class for anyone who wants to learn how to make sushi. Plus, we feel confident in our abilities to make sushi again at home.

A pleasant time with a real cooking expert. I attended Yuka's cooking class with my two customers, in the role of japanese-italian translator.But Yuka's perfect English made my life way easier. She explained in detail all the process, making sure that we had really got it. And she gave plenty of advice, spacing from her cooking methods (developed through many years of practice), to how to store the food and where to find it.My customers were really satisfied with the pleasant atmosphere of the class, while we got to eat way more than we had foreseen. Needless to say, the Tempura we prepared thanks to her was really delicious, and I was impressed by the completeness of the course, being only a couple of hours long.All included, a very enjoyable time. Highly recommended.

Where else to make sushi than in Tokyo. I spent a lot of hours cooking sushi and other delicious Japanese dishes. Yuka is the sweetest teacher, and her small apartment and the little course (5 people) created a perfect atmosphere. I would definitely recommend this course to everyone going to Tokyo, everything is well communicated, and the result was absolutely amazing.

Gyudon And Gyoza. Today we took a cooking class from Yuka Mazda. We learned how to make Gyudon, Gyoyza, Miso Soup, and Nippon style rice. Yuka spoke excellent English, was knowledgeable, engaging and fun. We cooked fabulous food and chatted about things to do in Kyoto and Tokyo. Yuka ended the class with a tour of a local grocery store and a nearby neighborhood. This has been one of the highlights of my time in Tokyo so far. I highly recommend taking this class. I would take the class towards the beginning of your trip as Yuka can guide you to do other fun things.

Fun and delicious sushi class. I signed up for this class on my own and was with 3 other couples in Yuka's home. She showed us how to make sushi rice, cut the fish and veggies, make the dipping sauce, and finally wrap the sushi rolls and make the sushi pieces (fish on rice). We ended up with a beautiful meal that was very delicious. Yuka is a very enthusiastic and funny teacher. I'd definitely recommend the class.

Yuka's amazing tempura temptation cooking class. We went on a tempura cooking class in June 2015, and Yuka was very accommodating and welcoming. She made the class entertaining, enjoyable, and most importantly fun, with her very chatty and informal approach. The tempura we made was delicious, along with other different varieties of food. I strongly recommend this class even if you are not a master chef, as it is a great experience.

A perfect moment with Yuka. First, Yuka is probably the best English-speaker we have met during our 2-weeks stay in Japan (even for French-speaker like us).Then, we have had the chance to be the only couple during our class. Probably because we have booked early enough and chosen something different from sushi ;)Indeed, we wanted to taste once in our life Kobe beef... and have no regret about this! What a shot!Yuka is really passionate by what she does, and we have learnt a lot during our class, in a very friendly atmosphere. The feeling to be "at home" is so pleasant!Thanks Yuka, all the best for the future!

The best Sushi..... It was just a great and delicious experience... Those familiar with Japanese cuisine know that eating is half the fun of traveling in Japan... and I have to say that with Yuka we made the best Sushi I ever had.... in a comfortable home setting... and Yuka, is a passionate and gentle woman who loves her work.... THANK YOU YUKA...

Just great fun!. Yuka is truly the highlight of the experience. Warm, engaging, helpful and hilarious!! It was the perfect group activity (there were 5 of us) with some delicious food!! Highly recommend!!

Come learn cooking at comfortable home setting. Yuka has a good command of english and is very friendly and chatty. The cooking class is not just about following recipe but also to understand the ingredients and tools used in sushi making.I'm glad I sign up for this enjoyable class! Love the comfortable setting in Yuka's house. No worries if you are first timer in cooking, its really easy to follow through. :)Love, Katie
Japanese cooking instruction. We enjoyed the professional cooking class with Yuka and had a close look at the nearby supermarket afterward. It was a glimpse of Japanese culture.

Authentic Cooking lesson with great tips!. Learnt heaps from Yuka. She is a fantastic teacher and very knowledgeable. Ingredients were top quality and she even took us to the market afterwards to show us what they looked like. Really good experience and I definitely want to go back to learn how to cook other things from her.

Taste of Japan - Yuka Style. The minute you meet Yuka ,it's like meeting an old friend . Casual , friendly and accommodating . The cooking class was easy to follow and she made mastering it so effortless as the recipes and instructions would make any non cooking person feel comfortable in the kitchen.A favourite -Teriyaki Chicken now can be part of our menu at home and Yakisoba Noodles an easy simple meal. Who would've thought cooking Japanese rice needed such precise timing . Her instruction will prove to never fail again !All in all a memorable time had especially savouring our dishes we cooked ourselves and enjoying Yuka's easy manner and company .

Great fun and an amazing teacher!. Yuka met us at the nearby train station and welcomed us into her lovely home for an insightful and enjoyable lesson in REAL japanese cooking. She shared a wealth of knowledge and spoke excellent English. After the class she even kindly took us for a short tour in her own time to the local supermarket and surrounding shops to give us a locals knowledge of daily life in Japan.Highly recommended, thanks Yuka!

Delicious sushi making class - definitely worth it!. Yuka met us at the subway station and walked us to her apartment where she had everything ready. She had top quality ingredients and made the class educational as well as fun. I came with 6 young men who just graduated from high school and they thoroughly enjoyed making the different types of sushi from scratch and more importantly, eating it all.Yuka was friendly, patient and spent a lot of time with us. Afterward, she walked us around the neighborhood to give us a feel for the old town and gave us great recommendations on what to do while in Tokyo.I make sushi at home and finally learned the right way to cut fish for sushi vs sashimi - I highly recommend her class.
Cooking class. Great for families! Yuka was very welcoming and knowledgable, and her English is excellent. We learned a lot and really enjoyed lunch.

Lovely evening making sushi with Yuka!. I knew I wanted to do a sushi making class in addition to my business trip to Japan, and I was so happy that I was able to get a spot in Yuka's class on relatively short notice. It was a small intimate setting, which was very nice after the bustle of the city. I am so glad I didn't end up in a class with 20 people -- the 6 of us got to try all different techniques. I learned a lot! I also really appreciated that Yuka used really high quality ingredients and she shared a lot of information about how to buy the ingredients-- both in Japan and in the US (where she has spent some time). Her english is also great, which made understanding the directions fairly easy. I also really appreciated that she met us at the train station and walked us back - it would have been hard to find her place on my own. I highly recommend this class - it was a lot of fun!

Wonderfull evening, glad I booked. Me and my daughter travelled through Japan and on the 2nd evening we joined Yuka's cooking class and made Teriyaki. Our group was fun and we really enjoyed the evening.Yuka speaks English very well, so she could explain clearly what we had to do. She picked us up at the metro and took us to her home. Thanks for this experience Yuka.

Favorite memory in Tokyo!. My friend and I took the Teriyaki Course after we tried to sign up for the Sushi course, but it was full. Having heard great things about Yuka and her classes, we decided to "settle" for the Teriyaki Course. Let me tell you, it wasn't "settling" at all! It was such an amazing course! Delicious foods that were pleasing to everyone, I'm sure I'll make these dishes more often than Sushi, so I'm actually really happy we took the Teriyaki Course!Yuka is an amazing instructor. She has great humor and is very dedicated to answering all of your questions. Our group of 5 ended up going over the usual class time with all of our questions, stories and talking! After, Yuka walked us back to the subway so we wouldn't lose our way.Like the title of my review says, it was the highlight of my trip to Tokyo. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND taking a class with Yuka!

Fun sushi making class with Yuka Mazda. This was a great class to do if travelling on your own or with a friend. Yuka is very friendly and entertaining and taught us in a way that will allow us to replicate at home. Great price for the length of the class and the quality is the ingredients you get go enjoy at the end.

great sushi making experience!. First of all, yuka picked us up from the station and took us to her apartment. 6 people total in our group. I walked out of this class with confidence that I can make aushi on my own. would totally recommend! great overall experience!

greatsushi class. 6 people class with yuka! Great sushi making experience. I walked out confident that I can make sushi on my own! Yuka was very detailed oriented and spoke a cute japanese/british accent! She picked us up from the hiroo train station and took us back when the class was done! great overall experience.

Fun way to experience Japanese culture and come away a better cook!. I was visiting Tokyo by myself, but I was able to book a seat for a teriyaki chicken course with Yuka. There ended up being five of us, myself and two couples, also visiting from America. We had a great time learning how to cook these dishes with Yuka. She was very informative and did a great job explaining the process and making it interesting. By the time all the food was finished, we were all very hungry and very impressed with our new-found cooking skills. I think the cost is quite fair considering you get an entertaining session, a lesson from a skilled cook and you get to eat the food you've paid for at the end. I will be booking another session next time I visit Tokyo!

Lot of fun. The sushi course was really funny and made easy by Yuka. She's a wonderful teacher and we had a great time. On top of that, a real surprise was the mini-tour of the neighborhood, with a supermarket visit and a walk into a very nice area.Highly recommendet to get a full immersion into japanese life.

Highlight of trip to Japan. Everything about this experience was great. Yuka is very experienced and extremely knowledgeable. We chose the kobe beef option which ended up being a great choice. After the class on the way back, she took us through the market area so we can see the local scene too. A must do.
Great experience!. We had a great time and enjoyed the cooking class really much!Thanks for taking such good care and even showing us around in the neighborhood!!
Great Cooking Class. Great cooking school, had a great time and learned a lot!!!best way to enjoy and learn at same timegreat time in japan, thanks Yuka.

Insightful learning about Japanese cuisine and culture. I loved Yuka's class! Yuka has greatly explained to us the essential things about sushi. She has presented us with high quality products such as tuna and wasabi. We learned to make various types of sushi as well as miso soup. The outcome was highly delicious. The class was in her own house, which made it even more special, seeing local Japan. I recommend this to anyone who truly wants to experience the local Japanese cuisine.

Extremely fun and a great way to experience Japanese cuisine!. Yuka's class was not only very informative and interesting but was also incredibly fun. A group of friends and I took her sushi course last week and all agreed that it was one of the highlights of our short trip to Tokyo. Apart from having little to no experience in the kitchen, the class was easy to follow and was definitely something we will try again in the future. We really appreciate Yuka's careful guidance not only in the class but also recommending places around Tokyo that we could go to. Her enthusiasm and openness only contributed immensely to the fun and light atmosphere that made our experience memorable. Thanks again!

Wonderful time in Tokyo. Totally recommend this cooking class for anyone who want to try real japanese experience and those who simply love cooking. We spent half a day at Yuka's cooking class and enjoyed every moment of it. Even my husband who never cooked much before did really great under Yuka's professional supervision. Many thanks to Yuka for the great fun and yammy dishes! We learned a lot and totally recommend it to others.

Delicious, fun and useful. I joined the class on short notice (total of 6 participants). We learned to make Gyudon and Gyoza, as well as Daishi stock and Miso soup.The class was fun and relaxed, Yuka does a great job of explaining the basics to make recreating the dishes at home easy.She took us to the nearby supermarket afterwards for some shopping.I've already cooked the Gyudon and Gyoza at home and it was just as delicious as it was in her class.At first I was a bit disappointed because I would have liked to learn about making Sushi, but I actually think this class was more useful because these are dishes I can easily make at home.

Good quality sushi making class. I have visited Japan for many times and it is my first experience in visiting a local family for sushi making class. The training contents have been very useful while the ingredients that Yuka offered are of good quality. Yuka even spent time in introducing the neighborhood to us which is very local. love the experience!

Such great fun!. As a surprise to my girlfriend, I booked the sushi making course with Yuka and it was such a great time! We both really enjoyed ourselves and Yuka was a great teacher! We made sushi rolls, nigiri and miso soup and all of it was very delicious! Yuka is very nice and made us feel very welcome in her home. Our class was small so we all got to do each step of the process. I recommend this course to anybody looking for an authentic sushi making course in Tokyo!

Great time!. We had so much fun today doing the waygu beef and gyoza class! I was a little nervous when we arrived, because there were 8 people in the class, so I didn't see how we would all be able to participate. But Yuka put us right to work having us all cut up vegetables and then showing us how to fold our own gyoza. I was expecting to be hungry the whole time while waiting for the meal, but we cooked gyoza while we let the waygu beef cook, so we were pretty much eating the whole time! We all got to make at least 10 gyoza, and all got a chance to cook them. Yuka was hilarious and was excitedly talking to us the whole time about what was happening and other tidbits of information. I was never bored, which I have been in many other cooking classes, and at the end she even showed us how to make mochi, which was just something that she wanted to show us and not part of the normal class, and let us all try the fresh mochi. I would definitely recommend this class!

Fun and educational!. I took Yuka's Sushi class and it was great. It was 6 of us in the class. Yuka taught us how to prepare rice properly and we made several different kinds of sushi. She told us everything about Japanese ingredients, especially how important the quality of the fish is. Besides cooking you can ask her anything about Japanese culture or tips for visiting Tokyo (or other places in Japan). I'm sure I'll take some more classes next time!

Fun day with a local!. We loved our cooking school with Yuka, we did the teryaki course and the food was delicious. We had a nice small group, the vibe was very relaxed and we did all the preparation and cooking ourselves for our own meals once Yuka had shown us each part, so this made it easier to learn and remember.We have cooked chicken teryaki with sticky rice twice since we've been back home already, it is very easy once you know how!Yuka is very friendly, her apartment was lovely and it was great to get to see a different neighbourhood (definitely take her up on the quick tour around the supermarket and area after the class!).Thanks for a great day Yuka!

Making great sushi with Yuka. We took Yuka´s sushi class and it was great to get knowledge about how to boil the rice the right way. Then we learnt how to treat the fishmeat without spoiling the taste. It ended up with many delicious pieces of sushi that we enjoyed together.Yuka is really teaching you the correct way to make sushi, she has energy and are very engaged in teaching her students.Thank you Yuka for a great afternoon :-) / Anders and Maria from Sweden.

Cooking with Yuka Mazda. Cooking with Yuka was a real treat. A highlight of my trip to Tokyo. She is warm and friendly, and our conversation (in English) flowed easily. She met me at the subway station and we walked to her lovely apartment where she had everything ready in her small kitchen. Fortunately for me, I was the only one in her class that morning. I enjoyed cutting, grating, folding, simmering, frying, all with her expert guidance. We made Wagyu Gyu-Don, Gyoza, Miso soup (I never would have considered combining a # of different misos), sticky rice, dessert and tea. Mmmmmmmm. Can’t wait to make Gyoza at home using her detailed recipe. On the way back to the subway, she took me to the grocery store and pointed out all kinds of foods and ingredients for cooking. It was a delightful time and one of my favorite memories from my trip. Thank you, Yuka!

Lots of fun and learning. We took Yuka's sushi class and had such a great time learning how to make many different types of sushi. It was very hands on and Yuka made us welcome in her home and gave us the recipes to take home. It was a great day and Yuka even took us on a supermarket tour at the end and we learned about other Japanese ingredients and how they are used in cooking. She was a lovely teacher. Highly recommended!

Great experience!. We did Yuka's sushi class and it was fun and delicious! We learned the proper way to cook (and cool) rice, how to slice fish, and make nigiri, sushi rolls and inside out rolls. Yuka has a great personality and makes the whole class fun (and isn't afraid to let you know if you're doing a poor job!). Would go back again for another class.

Great Course!! . We had so much fun and the meal was so delicious and easy to make. We had the Teriyaki course with a great dessert. Yuka is a really great teacher and it's easy to follow her instructions. Such a nice and polite person. It's really recommended! Thanks so much for a great experience!

SUSHI SUSHI SUSHI and lot more. Thank you very much Yuka for the great time, advise and mouthwatering sushi!What is better at Yuka's cooking class compared to others:> price or value for money!> small groups - we were five - in the kitchen is space for a maximum of 8 Persons so it is garantueed that you are not more than 8 (most of the time less people!) > you do EVERYTHING > starting with WASHING the rice! You learn to prepare the sushi from the first step, so you will be able to do exactly the same thing later at home> you get the recipes printed out with all information (so during the course you can pay attention without the need to write everything down)> Yuka is a very clean person - she will make sure EVERYONE's hands are washed and desinfected before starting!> a lot of extra information - during cooking there is a lot of time to chat with Yuka about Japan, Japanese people, japanese food ...> after the course Yuka accompanied us to a supermarket and showed us where to get all ingredients and what to consider during the shopping! Moreover she showed us around the area > contacting, booking, getting there > all very easy!!> and and and The class was totally worth the money (8000Y). (I know that sushi classes in Germany cost even more - but they do not take part in Tokyo - the Sushi-mekka, they don't come with a lot of extra information, the fish is less fresh,...)Thank you again Yuka - I will definetely recommend the Sushi class and your other cooking classes to my friends!

very good atmosphere, very serious learning. my young daughter and me, we never made sushis before learning with Yuka. She was very helpful and rigourous to give us good basis for japanese cooking.The nest time, I'll return to Japan, I'll ask Yuka for another lesson. It was a good and nice experience

One of the highlights of Japan. This cooking class was one of the highlights of the trip. I will have to stay there were mostly great things about this class, and only a few "need to improve" things. Let's start off with the great:Yuka was such a wonderful host! She was polite, punctual and extremely informative.Yuka picked us up from the Hiro-o station and we walked to her home, it was nice to chat with her about the surrounding area, and learn a bit more about Japan along the way.The sushi we made was way better than our hotel sushi (but I'm sure most places would have been better than our hotel) Her home was very nice, and relaxing. She made us feel welcome and part of the family. Her instructions (while a bit rushed), were clear and she helped everyone cut the sushi properly, and went over every little step of the process.She went out of her way to make sure we had the best ingredients! The money paid for the class went a long way, and I was glad to see this!Now, for the "needs improving":While her class doesn't really have many negatives about it, there were just a few things that I would recommend improvements upon.Don't leave tasks unsupervised! The poor gentleman from Milan, Italy was left to monitor the miso broth, and ended up throwing away the broth due to a misunderstanding of instructions. Try to be a bit patient with everyone. I do understand there is a lot of information to be covered in a short amount of time, but I felt as if we were rushed to do things on our own after just a couple of steps. This left most everyone around the table confused, and asking each other for help. Overall, I will take her cooking class again for different options. I was highly impressed with her professionalism and courtesy to everyone. The company was wonderful, and I left feeling full, happy, and satisfied.A+

Great cooking lessons with a great teacher :). I've had sushi and gyoza courses and had a blast both times.Yuka meets and picks you up at the metro station close to her home where the lessons take place. Yuka is very nice and the dishes she teaches to cook are just as great. a lesson would last a 3 to 4 hours but trust me, you won't see time pass at all.if you're eager to learn how to make some japanese dishes, you want to consider her as a teacher :)

Great experience and great time. We had the Kobe beef cooking class and thanks to the large Yuka's knowledge, we learn a lot about japanese cuisine as well. Yuka is a great teacher and a real pro. We had very pleasant time learning, getting tips, asking questions and having a delicious lunch! The tour in the local supermarket was very nice and was a real bonus to the class. Thanks a lot for great experience, Yuka.
Had a great time!. Yuka's Cooking Class was a great choice - nice group, good explanations, delicious food - very very nice experience!!

What an experience! Something everyone should go for in Japan!. Yuka Mazda is not only an excellent cook but also an excellent teacher! We enjoyed from the get-go, in fact, the details of making sushi are so mind-boggling that it made us appreciate it even more. The best part about this was making it, eating it and learning about many other aspects of Japanese culture including how to use wasabi. You will never learn these anywhere else so candidly. We were also taken on a tour through the neighborhood and supermarket later to see what goes into buying the right ingredients. If you have 3-4 hours to spare, this is a must-do activity and with Mazda-san, you will never regret it! Thank you Mazda-san!

Great introduction in Japanese homestyle cooking. Yuka is a very enthusiastic teacher and very knowledgable about Japanese cuisine. Besides teaching us how to prepare a 4 course meal she also gave us lot of tips how to prepare other Japanese dishes. She found an easy way how to make a strawberry daifuku, which was amazing. We had a lot of fun during the class and learned lots of new skills. Highly recommended!

Great Teacher and Great Class!. I took a class here with my husband in March 2015 and we had a wonderful time! Yuka was very enthusiastic and had great energy. She takes great care in putting the class together and using only high quality ingredients. We took the sushi making class which also included miso soup, chilled tofu, and a strawberry daifuku dessert course. Everything was delicious and we walked out very full. The class was 3 hours long and we had a fun/informative supermarket tour afterwards. Highly recommend!

Excellent experience. We thoroughly enjoyed the class. Yuka is very friendly and a good teacher. She met us at the subway station and walked us back there after a tour of the local deli/food hall and the old town in her area. Please note the timings of the class and the optional "tours" were relaxed - we had no other plans that day so were happy to take our time, but others may want to be aware that from start to finish its about a half-day.

Friendly, patient and tasty experience. Yuka met us outside her local underground and we walked the short distance to her apartment. She had lived and worked in the UK and her English was fautless. We made Miso soup, Japanese rice cake stuffed with strawberries (possibly the most delicious strawberries we have ever tasted! ) and Teriyaki-chicken. We had a lovely evening and would highly reccomend Yuka Mazda and her wonderful cooking classes!

Excellent Experience with Yuka!. I joined the Sushi making class on a Thursday morning. What a fun time! I learned the different types of miso and Yuka allowed our small class of 3 to customize our miso soup to our liking. We mixed them with the Yellow miso being the most dominant and our favorite. I don't care for the miso paste served in most restaurants in the US. I must say this was amazing. Susie making was fun - but not as fun as eating our delights. Yuka purchased top quality ingredients and was by far some of the best I have ever tasted. She allowed us to cut the fish and use the ingredients that we preferred. Thanks Yuka for a wonderful experience during our visit to Japan. This was one of the highlights!

The best Cooking class in Japan. Sushi class is highly recommended.. Yuka is Ammmmmazing. Group of 5 of us and we all loved her class. She is very lively and animated and fun to be around. Great stories, very intelligent and knowledgeable about cooking. Best English speaker we came across during our week in Japan. The sushi was oooso tasty. Took us to local grocery stores to show us tasty Japanese foods to buy/try after the class. Taught us history about Japanese food as well. Cannot say enough good things about Yuka. No trip to Tokyo is complete without taking her course. Would totally do it again.

Simply Amazing. Yuka's class is nothing short of amazing. I've always wanted to take a Japanese cooking class, but I was always stuck with two options: 1. take a class that was overly-westernized, or 2. take a very traditional Japanese class in Japanese (a language I don't speak well.) Yuka's class is the best of both worlds: it's very accessible without sacrificing quality. I went by myself, and had a great time with the other visitors! I highly recommend this, you'll learn a lot, eat well, and just have a great time!

Wonderful night with Yuka!!. My family and I had a wonderful time with Yuka! We took the sushi class, but also learned to make miso soup. She is very informative about Japanese food, culture, and, of course, cooking! She was delightful!! She also gave us so many restaurant recommendations for Tokyo and Kyoto. You will not be disappointed!

Highly recommend the Kobe Beef class. Yuka's cooking class was the best. She's very informative, funny, and a great cook. Plus, she speaks perfect English. Signing up for a class was easy and Yuka gave us clear instructions on where to meet before class. Her Kobe beef class was amazing! Kobe beef is really expensive to get in Japan, especially at a restaurant, but Yuka's class is a really good value. She uses real Kobe beef, and wow, does it taste delicious. Yuka was such a great teacher and very funny too. I really enjoyed her class.

Terrific sushi class!. Yuka's sushi class is very enjoyable, informative and easy to follow. She explains things well and as long as the ingredients are available, her recipes should not be difficult to recreate back at home.Yuka is also generous in sharing her knowledge about where to shop if you have questions about specific kitchenware. She even took time to give our group a quick tour of the neighborhood and the local supermarket.This class was definitely a memorable experience. I highly recommend it!

Gyudon class. i highly recommend this cooking class. It is by far the best I have tried already in Japan. Yuka is very friendly and speaks a perfect English. I chosed the gyudon class and it was delicious. I learned to cook the gyudon beef, the gyoza, the rice and the miso soup. I could cook again these recipies at home because it was very well explained. I will definately take a new lesson :)

Awesome Sushi Lesson from a wonderful teacher. Yuka was brilliant, friendly and funny. We spent over 3 hours with Yuka learning the intricate delicacies of Sushi making from scratch. The end result was incredible and delicious! Yuka is really engaging and loved spending time with us in the class and then showing us around the local supermarket! We would love to go back for future lessons!

Fun class. One of the best cooking classes I have ever attended. It was a lot of fun. It was a small group of people, so we could try our hand at making different types of sushi. Also Yuka talked about Japanese food, culture and also took us along to a local grocery shop. All in all an interesting and fun afternoon activity.

A must do in Tokyo! . I did a private sushi class with Yuka and had the most amazing time learning about Japanese cooking. Yuka was incredibly patient and knowledgable and also a lot of fun! It was the best thing I did in Tokyo. The fish was extremely good quality and we used real wasabi with other high quality ingredients. Definitely also recommend doing the supermarket tour after as it was great to learn about the different ingredients in Japanese cooking. It's more than just an ordinary cooking lesson and Yuka gave great advice on where to eat out in Tokyo. I can't wait to visit Tokyo again and try another of her classes!

Sushi classes. Fun great food, hostess and company. . We had great fun and learned many new things about making sushi and desert matcha. Yuka was friendly and patient, especially with foodie novices. Highly recommended.

Excellent class and so much fun!. I truly enjoyed my experience with Yuka, while visiting Tokyo! Not only was the class fun, I also learned some very valuable information about Japanese cooking that I can now use on my own cooking. I would highly recommend this experience. Doesn't get much better than cooking on an actual Japanese home.

Beyond expectation. I visited Yaka's cozy house for Sushi cooking class last February when I visited Tokyo to celebrate our 36th wedding aniversary. That was just perfect and beyond expectation whatever imagination you have. Very precise explanation and exercise. Perfect recipe. High quality raw fishes. Not just a Sushi class, but also Miso soup making, Tofu decoration and especially terrific strawberry desert class included. Thanks Yuka!

Sushi cooking lesson with Yuka!. I enjoyed a lot my first sushi cooking lesson with Yuka. She is very kind and she explains everything about japanese cooking. And don't miss the supermarket tour! Very interesting! Thanks Yuka

amazing... A hidden Tokyo gem.. We originally chose Yuka's cooking class over others (Buddah Bellies) as it seemed more authentic and less commercial.Yuka's class ended up exceeding even our most optimistic expectations. While I would describe my cooking skills as "can barely boil water" normally, under Yuka's tutelage, I was able to create sushi creations that rivaled some of the best sushi restaurants I have dined at. Extremely down to earth and personable, Yuka was able to break down, explain and demonstrate the little tricks and techniques that differentiate true chefs from simple cooks. I can't wait to try Yuka's other courses the next time I'm in Tokyo. Cons: Yuka's cooking class may turn you into a "sushi snob" as after learning authentic Japanese technique, you realize many restaurants that serve sushi really have no idea what they are doing.

Best cooking class experience so far. I did Yuka's sushi class in Feb 2015, and from beginning to the very end it was an amazing experience. Yuka was very friendly and helpful about whatever I was curious about, plus she speaks perfect english. She was extremely well-prepared, provided the best quality fish (and all other ingredients) and also taught us the fish cutting part which other sushi courses either skip or charge you extra. She gave detailed and very interesting information about every little thing we used, and provided a grocery store tour where she further explained japanese cuisine. Overall, it was extremely fun and informative, and you get to eat A LOT of sushi :)

Best Sushi Course and Delicious Recipes!. This is the second time I took Yuka's class. She is very passionate with cooking and an expert in not just japanese cooking, but also western cooking. She delivers the course systematically and always be ready to respond any questions about the steps. I highly recommend anyone who is the beginner or some expert who wish to learn more about japanese cooking. Cheers Yuka!

Sushi class was a blast. My wife and I did Yuka's sushi class in February 2015. Yuka was extremely knowledgeable and the whole experience was a ton of fun. We learned how to prepare sushi rice, nigiri sushi, regular and inside-out rolls, miso soup, and a side dish of tofu in dipping sauce. Very high quality ingredients. Yuka also gave us a bunch of other recommendations of things to see in Tokyo and Kyoto, including drawing maps for us and writing out the names of places in Japanese. Great class and great host!

Very interesting!. I love cooking and this class was the perfect opportunity to discover Japanese food!! I had the chance to have a one to one class and talked a lot to Yuka-san (she speaks a perfect English) and exchanged cooking tips. I would do it again for sure!

Delicious and informative!. Three friends and I had a geat time doing the teriyaki course with Yuka. While booking, she was very quick to respond and very accomodating of the special requests we made (for a vegetarian in the group). Yuka is a gracious and friendly host who provided so much information about everything from the food and cooking to Japanese culture. She even took us back to the grocery store after the class to teach us more, provided us with numerous stores and restaurants in Tokyo to try, and even provided a written Japanese translation to help our vegetarian communicate with chefs on the rest of the trip. All of that, plus the food was delicious! We highly recommend her course for anyone visiting Tokyo and wanting something beyond the standard tourist experience.

Above and beyond!. Yuka was a sensational host, and immediately made us feel at ease. Her recipes were beautifully authentic but simple and easy enough to take back home and use in the kitchen. The onsen egg with our Kobe Beef was to die for!! And the desert.... YUM! She had an interesting story about all the ingredients, and they were all the very best quality. We got a copy of all our recipes, and after our class which finished at 8pm, she took us to a great local bar we never would have found on our own. She also directed us to the best sushi restaurant I have ever enjoyed right in the centre of shibuya. I recommend doing a class at the start of your trip so you can take fully take advantage of her local knowledge!

Worthwhile, delicious and fun. My husband and I did Yuka's yakatori class and enjoyed it very much. All the organisational arrangements were very clear and we appreciated being picked up and escorted from the station. Yuka is everything you could wish for in a teacher: skilled, professional, encouraging and at the same time great fun. And her English is flawless. The balance of demonstration versus hands-on cooking was perfect and we left feeling very capable of producing the food at home. It was all delicious and made a great lunch, presented beautifully with Yuka's assistance and complemented with Japanese matcha tea. We also made strawberry daifuku as an extra, which was a highlight and made us feel very clever! Yuka was generous with her time and on our way back to the station even took us on a little tour of the local neighbourhood, including the supermarket, which was informative and fascinating. We had a great day. Thanks Yuka :)

Wonderful tempura class!. The tempura class I took with Yuka was fun, educational & overall a very memorable experience. The registration and meeting point directions were easy & detailed, the class was hands on, organized, explained & instructed with enthusiasm & passion. I left feeling confidant & excited about making tempura & other dishes Yuka taught. She even showed me how to make strawberry daifuku as a gift even though it was not part of my class. After the class Yuka gave me a walking tour of the neighborhood and the local market to show me ingredients we used for the class and answered any questions I had. I highly recommend Yuka's cooking classes if you are looking to try something special.

A great, fun experience. Yuka picked us up from the station even though it was pouring rain and freezing cold outside and walked us to her home where we then indulged in hours of sushi making and learned how to make Japanese stock and sauces as well!Yuka was very informative, friendly and overall, just really lovely! We got to enjoy a 3 course lunch before heading home - where Yuka walked us back to the station to see us off.Thank you Yuka for a fantastic afternoon! I will definitely be trying out my new sushi skills soon :)

A Wonderful Experience. The Japanese cooking class with Yuka is a flawless, highly enjoyable and of course very tasty experience!To begin with, I was amazed by the professionalism with which Yuka took care of every detail. It starts with a very intuitive web-site which allows for the smoothest of the bookings followed by very clear emails describing the logistic details.Once the day arrives, Yuka will be waiting for you at the meeting point with her contagious smile. You will soon realize that it is impossible not to get along with her. She speaks fluent English and she is an interesting and kind person, in addition to being a very good cook and teacher. Once at her place, the class begins. Mine, started with the preparation of Daifuku. For me, that alone was already worth the class! But that was just the beginning as Yuka brought us along the interesting paths of Japanese culture and its delicate and tasty cuisine.During the class the atmosphere was relaxed and funny so that the only hint of the passing of time was given by my stomach asking to try the wonderful food that we were preparing.In fact, thanks to Yuka`s suggestions, regardless of your level of experience, at the end of the day you will enjoy a juicy, tasty meal prepared by yourself!And that is just the beginning as I can now start to try the generous amount of recipes that Yuka taught me in my own house at any time.To resume, if you are in Tokyo and feel like spending a day in a warm atmosphere, with great, funny and competent company, cooking and eating wonderful traditional Japanese food and with every detail gently taken care for you, then Yuka is really what you are looking for: Absolutely suggested.

Well worth it. The class was fantastic and Yuka was a very enthusiastic teacher! She also went out of her way to show is round the local district and made sure we caught the right transport to our next location. A lovely experience while in Tokyo!

Overall great experience. I saw this cooking class on trip advisor and thought it was a good idea and learning experience for me and my girlfriend. after leaving Yukas cooking school i can say i learnt a lot and the chicken teriyaki was delicious, it was overall a pleasure as you learn to cook everything from scratch to finish. Yuka herself is a lovely person and even showed me where to find all the ingredients in supermarket after class out of her own time! highly recommend!!!

One of our best experiences. First of all: This was one of our best experiences of our Japan trip!!!Yuka is a really nice host and one of the friendliest persons I met. She was on time at our Meeting Point and walked to her home with us. Beside me and my friend only one other couple joined us. So we were a really small group.
