At home, Yuka's kitchen was already prepared. She has bought only the best ingredients and everything what you need for really good Sushi. And be warned, don't eat, before you visit the cooking school. You will really make a lot of Sushi!During our preparations, Yuka explained and showed us every step. With her explanations Sushi making was really easy. But that is no wonder, because, Yuka herself is a very popular cookery book author in Japan. Yuka also explained a lot about general Japanese cooking and Japanese living. And if you need some more sightseeing tips, she will be happy to assist you. She recommended a lot of restaurants to us, which we should visit when we are in Kyoto (our next place during our Japan trip). And the restaurants she recommended have been worth a visit!After everything was prepared, we started to eat. Additionally to the Sushi, we prepared a really tasty Miso soup. As a surprise Yuka had already made a dessert for us the day before. So that our Sushi cooking class was in fact a full 3 course meal with one cup of traditional matcha tea at the end.And to top it all, everyone even got a present at the end. Yuka, I can only say: thank you! It was a great experience, which I can only recommend to everyone!

Great sushi-class!. Last Monday I joined the sushi cooking class from Yuka and it was lovely! Yuka is a great cook and she gave us a lot of advise: not only how to make the best sushi, but she also told us a lot about Tokyo. The ingredients were all fresh, we could do all the cooking by ourselves and we made a lot of different sushi's. And the result was great, the sushi tasted perfect!

A great fun experience learning how to make sushi. I found Yuka's website on a Google search and emailed her to ask for available spaces, Yuka replied promptly and was had very clear instructions on how to pay and where to meet for classes. She picked us up from the metro station and took us back which is wonderful as Tokyo can be quite difficult to walk around. We had a brilliant time, Yuka speaks fluent English and we we felt very welcomed in her kitchen, she takes time to explain everything to you and a bit of Japanese history comes with it. I look toward to using my new sushi skills and show off to all of my friend back home! Thank you Yuka, you're awesome!

Sushi Class. We met Yuka in the metro station, She is really kind and helpful. Really organised and willing to help and share knowledge about many different aspects of Japanese cuisine and culture in general. We made a variety of sushi, miso soup, tofu and japanese green tea. Since we had a bit of extra time she even showed us how to sharpen japanese knife and where we can buy knives and japanese potery. Our trip in Tokyo would be completely different without her, really eye opener experience.Her is english is also much better than most of the Japanese. Highly recommended course.

Highlight ! . We had a wonderful day with Yuka who met us at the train station and took us to her lovely home ... Where we were taught how to handle seafood and knife usage ... Then made a feast of sushi, nilgiri sushi, miso and a super yummy tofu starter. It was a fascinating experience and divine lunch . Beautiful finish to the day with Yuka taking us through a supermarket and pointing out many things to us and then a tour of some interesting side streets . We had two teenage boys with us who loved it. Could not recommend highly enough and would do again in a heartbeat !

A great Japanese experience. Our class with Yuka was fantastic. She took us through how to make sushi hand rolls, miso and daifuku (a Japanese dessert) and she provided us with written copies of all of the recipes, which we have since used to make all of the dishes again since returning home. Yuka also told us about many other attraction in the places that we planned to visit while we were staying in Tokyo, including some great restaurants. We would highly recommend her class to anyone.

Family Cooking with Yuka - New Year's Eve 2014. We were fortunate to be able to book an evening class with Yuka on New Year's Eve, a special time in Japan and the last night of a memorable family trip. We went on the strength of her reviews here and it was absolutely better than we had even expected. Yuka is the real deal - she has written numerous cookbooks, has a vibrant online presence, teaches cooking extensively to the Japanese and thanks to her training in Europe, she has the communication skills, humor and ability to bring Japanese cooking alive to people who want to learn. We were humbled by the things that we did not know and the craft of Japanese cooking, but also by its simplicity. Yuka-san demystifies the techniques needed, but also give hints to the deeper understanding and skills associated with everything from making sushi rolls to preparing rice, to handling Kobe beef. We could not have asked for a better way to wrap up our trip, particularly as we followed her advice and went right after our class to the Meji shrine at midnight. Thank you, Yuka, for lasting lessons in cooking, and for special memories of Japan.

Unique and memorable experience. My boyfriend booked Yuca's sushi making class, and I didn't really know what to expect as I am not such a fan of cooking in general. However, Yuca's sushi making class was awesome and so much fun! To begin with,Yuca met us at the train station nearby her house, for that reason it was very easy to meet her as the train lines in Tokyo are very easy to understand. She is a very sweet and funny lady, and her teaching skills and techniques were pretty impressive. Her English is also very good and clear, so you won't have a problem understanding the steps. She is very detailed and make sure everyone understands the steps without getting bored. I was amazed by what I learned and already practiced some of the recipes at home, back in the U.S., and it came out exactly like the one we made at the class because she also sends you with the recipes you learned during class. I will definitely come back for another class next time I'm in Tokyo! Maybe the Tempura class next :). Also, make sure you don't eat too much prior to the class as we had so much food that we couldn't even finish it. I would recommend this class to anyone, even if you are not a fan of cooking, Yuca was so welcoming and wonderful that she will make anything interesting.

Perfect present for a special occasion. I purchased this cooking class for my brother and his wife as a wedding present for them to enjoy whilst on their honey moon. Yuka was very easy to make arrangements with and went out of her way to make the occasion special for them - printing a special menu and including an additional celebration desert. Yuka also provided more than just a cooking lesson - giving advise on places to go and things to see during their stay. I received the following two messages within 24 hours of their class which i think sums up their experiences:'Thanks for organising our cooking class yesterday! Yuka was amazing and we made so much food i am still full. We are off to check out her recomendations today'.'Thank you Jane it was such a fun day and i am so excited about cooking everything again when we are back'.

The highlight of our Japan Trip. Through the cuisine of one country you get to know its people and Culture... This is what I thought when I signed up for the class and I was not disappointed. Yuka is not only an excellent chef but also gave us some Interesting insights into Japanese culture. We prepared the most delicious sushis and miso soup ever and she made it look so easy. But the secret of it all is to use only the freshest products. Yuka took her time To explain us all the different ingredients, where she got them from And which one have the highest quality. She used only the best of tuna, salmon and scallops . In addition to this she had a big variety of different veggies and herbs. Her English was excellent which made it quite easy to follow her instructions which made us create the most beautiful and delicious sushis. She also was so patient with our two children aged 8 and 10 who just loved to prepare and eat the sushi. the tour to the supermarket was also fun! This cookingClass should be on every Japan Trip!

Best Japanese cooking class in Tokyo. I booked a tempura cooking class with Yuka for myself and my 3 teenage children whilst in Tokyo over the new year. Yuka's set up makes it all so easy starting with a central meeting point at a metro station, recipes in English and all ingredients out and ready to go. Needless to say our self made lunch was delicious and there was so much food we did not need dinner. Highly recommend this if you are interested in food.

Great experience!. Yuka is a masterful chef and a wonderful person. 3 of us did the sushi class and we had a private session. Great experience for visitors or long time residents if you want to learn some new skills and a lot about Japanese cuisine.

Excellent Cooking Class. I really enjoy the cooking class with Yuka - much more than I expected. I seldom cook at home and Yuka taught me every steps in cooking Japanese food. I think I can repeat when I cook at home afterward. And thanks for Yuka to show me around in the Japanese supermarket and taught me some information about the Japanese ingredients. It is really an excellent cooking class - fun and great!

Enjoy a lot !! Yuka'so class was so much fun !!. It's such a fun, enjoyable and informative cooking class.We had a really good time with Yuka. We learned a lot from her, she is very knowledgeable, we asked a lot about Japanese food and other stuff about Japan. She was able to answer us almost everything.The class is very organized, we get to try every steps on our own, and we were so happy with our miso soup and sushi. Yuka also prepared a recipe for us to bring home, so that we can make great sushi to our family and friends when we return to Australia. Yuka only use the best, freshest ingredients she could get from the market, maybe that's why the food we made in the class taste so good. Besides, Yuka gave us lots of recommendation for what to eat and do while we were in Tokyo. Based on her suggestions, we had the best Ramen in our life !!If you want something different, something great fun, this is a must do while you are in Tokyo !!

Great cooking class in Tokyo!. Since it was my second trip to Japan, I looked for something more special to do than the regular touristic sites and decided a japanese cooking class would be a nice experience.Yuka turned out to be much more than expected- The cooking class itself was very detailed and enjoyable, with very high quality products, and we got the recipes printed so I can repeat it at home (planning to make miso soup this weekend!). In addition Yuka was kind enough to take us to the supemarket after the class to help up shop for the relevant ingredients (which was very helpful since I can't read the Japanese labels in the store...). I really recommend Yuka's class to anyone who's looking to do something special in Tokyo :)

Fun cooking experience.. so much food!. I really enjoyed the experience, and it was good value because the sushi itself had a big variety of ingredients! for the seafood there was salmon, tuna, roe, scallops.. and there was tamago, avocado, cucumber and other herbs used for the sushi.. On top of that she also showed us the preparation for miso soup.. and she gave us a small taste of sake, some matcha tea, and a small dessert after!!On top of that she gave us a sushi set for us to take home after!Make sure before you go that you're hungry so you can enjoy all the food prepared after!Yuka is also very kind and gave us advise on where else to go to Tokyo after..

Very great time cooking with Yuka.. i really enjoyed attend yuka's cooking class. I chose sushi class. I can not cook anything before, and yuka taught me every step, and very patient to me. She gave very detail information and explanation about the food and ingredients. I really had so much fun cooking with Yuka. I definitely recommend anyone visiting Tokyo to take a class with Yuka.

Great cultural experience. Yuka has a way of making everyone feel welcome and at ease. Her cooking instructions are very clear and hands-on, and she provides interesting information about ingredients and customs. I brought home many essential cooking tools and dishes to further my Japanese cooking experience :-)! Yuka went above and beyond the cooking class by taking us on a supermarket and neighborhood tour, and emailed me with suggestions on places to visit for my trip to Kyoto. I would recommend an afternoon with Yuka to anyone who would like to spend time with great people and enjoy a fun and meaningful Tokyo experience!

Great meeting and experience!. Yuka really coloured our visit to Tokyo!From second one till the last Yuka was telling, showing, learning us all how it is to live in Tokyo these days (and how to cook great meals :)). She showed hidden allies of her neighbourhood, told funny stories and she is really good at making people at easy,The cooking was great. Well prepared, instruction was clear and not 'too packed', so there was still plenty time to talk. At some point I almost forgot that it was a cooking lesson ;) Felt like a Japanese friend already, she has good people skills. But actually on the cooking front I learned a lot, both from the cooking and the conversation. The recipes she provided where useful indeed.Will never forget the experience. Wish Yuka all the best!

A very rare opportunity to learn from a professional.. Yuka taught everything I need to know about making the best Tempura and delicious Kamameshi. During the course she gave abundant tips about making the best Japanese cooking, from the very basic to the advance level. She is very detail and focus in guiding the lesson. You will get the essence of the Japanese cooking, the perfection, creativity and the arts behind it. I highly recommend anyone who is seriously want to learn about Japanese cooking, even those who has some experiences in japanese cooking will surely found a great benefit!Domo arrigato gosaimasta Yuka's sensei ! :)

Great Activity!. My husband and I attended Yuka's cooking class and really enjoyed our experience. Yuka met us at the metro and took us to her house. We made Kobe beef and potatoes that turned out delicious. We saw Yuka on our last day in Tokyo and she gave us recommendations for places to visit in the city. I wish I had booked this class earlier in our trip. Thank you Yuka!

Great Sushi Making experience!. This was a great afternoon of sushi preparation in Tokyo. From the easy and efficient booking to the actual day of sushi making Yuka makes this a fun and educational day. She has everything ready to go when you arrive and you get right into preparing and cutting up all the seafood etc. and making the rice and Miso soup. We were a class of 2 and did most of the preparation ourselves under the guidance of Yuka who is very patient and her english is exceptional. She is also really pleasant and fun to work with. In the end we had so much fresh sushi to enjoy and we left with a small gift and a summary of how to prepare sushi at home. She also gave us a tour of a local high-end supermarket and neighbourhood. She does offer other courses that I plan to attend on my next visits to Tokyo. Overall an amazing way to spend over 3 hours learning about the culture of sushi.

Hostess with the mostess. Wow what a fun day, we weren't sure what to do on our last day in Tokyo so decided at the very last minute to contact Yuka and see if she was doing a class the next day. Turns out she had no bookings and said we could pick the class and she'd do it just for the 2 of us. It turned out to be our favourite day in Tokyo!Yuka was such a great teacher, we had so much fun and at the end had some beautifully presented sushi to devour! The quality of fish and products was amazing. We ended up with so much sushi we couldn't even finish it all.Yuka is such a lovely person she even gave us a tour around her area. Highly recommend a day with Yuka, you won't be disappointed, highlight of our trip so far!

Such a nice activity to do while in Tokyo. We are traveling with a 9 months baby. We asked Yuka if we could attend the class with him, and the answer was - Of course!. She reserved a class only for us, was very welcoming and profesional. We loved the time spent with her! We took time to ask her questions about japanese culture and ate such good sushis! She buy only first quality stuff.She even took time to give us some infos about places to visit.Perfect activity to do in Tokyo with a baby. Thanks Yuka!

Much More Than Expected!. Cooking with Yuka was the highlight of my Tokyo experience. She is warm and put me at ease immediately. She provides the freshest (and good quality) ingredients. We prepared super yummy yakitori. It was a good hands-on time cutting the meat, frying the chicken etc. Yuka's experience showed. (She has taught local Japanese cooking in the past 20 years and was featured on local TV. In the past few years she has even taught chefs from around the world). She was quick to add expert tips on the brands to buy (that would create the difference in taste), what to look out for in the cooking process before the next step etc. These were the added special touches that one won't get from recipe books. I had great fun chatting with her and it ended up like a cultural experience, understanding Japanese way of life and nuances. I highly recommend cooking with Yuka Mazda (please don't be confused with another Yuka in Tripadvisor as well!!)

Fun and informative...and did I mention delicious?. Yuka met us at the subway station and escorted us to her spotlessly clean home kitchen. She was gracious and patient with us in giving her lesson. She made it fun as all recipes were already printed for us, all we had to do was follow her direction. She made cutting and cooking very easy. We prepared tempura, miso soup, and various and sundry other entrees. She served powdered green tea at the end of a delicious meal. I think we can now prepare everything pretty close to how she showed us. Yuka walked us back to the subway and gave us good directions to get to our hotel. She even gave us a little tour of the area on the way which was nice. It was a lovely experience and a nice way to spend half- day in Tokyo.

A local experience not to be missed!. I attended Yuka's cooking class at her place in early October. It was my first time experiencing cooking lessons while travelling. My love for Japanese foods brought me to Yuka. The menu includes learning to make miso soup and different types of sushi. She even served us homemade sweets + supermarket tour + helping me shops all the necessary ingredients to bring back home and patiently answered tons of questions from me about the food, ingredients, Japanese and everything Japan. I had a great time. Yuka's house like everywhere else in Japan, was squeaky clean. Extremely good command of English. Highly recommended for those who have been imagining making sushi at home! I did just last night (see pic). I think I did great since my husband finishes off many rolls of sushi. Yuka will be proud of me :)

Unique experience!. I've never written a review before but I just had to for Yuka. My sister and I had the honour of having a private class. We are absolute beginners but she explained everything clearly and answered my million questions. The fish was fresh, and used high quality ingredients. The class was good value (I paid 80,000 JPY for each person and took at least 3 hours but it would have been longer if I didn't have to leave early). She also even offered to take us to the grocery store after class! She was very knowledgeable (having studied and traveled all over the world), adorable, but most of all kind. I was ill during the class and unfortunately had to cut the class short. I was so disappointed but Yuka wrapped all the food up in individual wraps, gave me soy sauce, chop sticks, added freezer packs and put it in a portable cooler just to make sure the fish would be the perfect temperature when I got back to my place to enjoy later! She offered me her help in case I needed to see a doctor or pick up medicine at the store (since I would be lost in a pharmacy in Japan). She truly felt like a friend or family member. It's so rare you find someone like that, especially in a time of need when you're away from home. Thank you Yuka. Hope to see you sometime again.

This was one of our most enjoyable moments in Japan. I don't usually write reviews but what Yuka had provided during our cooking class had definitely gone over our expectations. I enjoyed every minute before, during and after the class with Yuka and other participants. She was very knowledgeable when explaining each ingredient and sushi making prep steps which made the whole process so much easy to understand, fun and interactive. The whole experience was very homely and relaxing - which was the best part of a holiday. It was raining on that day but Yuka was waiting for us at the train station and walked us back to her lovely home so I already knew something good was on its way. Yuka had a decent command of English and was very friendly too. After the cooking class, she was even kind enough to bring us to the local supermarket to show us Japan's special produce! I really admire her passion for what she does as a living and will definitely recommend this to anyone who is interested in Japanese cooking classes in Tokyo. Thanks Yuka! (and the lovely group photos you've emailed us)Cheers,Christine

pleasent way to meet the japanese kitchen. I had a wonderful day, learning Japanese “special” dishes (I chose the special course) and after it shopping the necessary ingredients with Yuka. Yuka did very well to explain everything we should know and convince me to try the dishes at my place – what I definitely will do ;-) To make it short: it was a great, relaxed and especially informative cooking class!

Highlight of a fabulous trip to Japan. Having simply booked into this course with the aim of expanding my Japanese culinary knowledge, and hopefully picking up some skills I could use in the kitchen back home, the day's course not only achieved this but left me passionately wanting to delay my flight and spend a few more days in Tokyo to learn more from this excellent chef. As promised, Yuka was patiently waiting for me outside the station and on the short walk to her house put me at ease with her very friendly and sweet manner, as we discussed my travels so far around Japan and the culinary delights I had already come across. With a broad culinary knowledge base covering a variety of different continents Yuka is clearly very into her food and judging by her TV shows on Youtube and numerous published recipes, also extremely talented. The class I took was the 8000 Yen Sushi course, covering nigiri, sushi rolls, sashimi, making of the miso soup from broth, dipping sauce for chilled Tofu as well as sake and a Tea ceremony at the end to finish the day off. Given the quality of the ingredients alone the course is extremely good value (some of the best quality fresh fish I had while in Japan), while Yuka very generously at the end of the class provided me with the required sushi equipment that would be difficult to source back home. Throughout the class Yuka shared useful and insightful knowledge on both the food we were preparing, and wider Japanese culture, while instructions were clear and concise (also printed recipes given for the day), ensuring I was able to keep up with everything that was being said, as well as lots of encouragement given as I navigated the slightly tricky part of rolling the sushi in line with her restaurant quality standards! A lot of preparation had clearly gone in from her side (all ingredients had been pre measured for instance), making sure the day's learning was maximised, while she was also extremely generous in allowing the lesson to overrun by a few hours as I tried to get as much as possible out of the experience. I couldn't recommend the day more highly, and have come away with this being the highlight of a fabulous trip to Japan.

Amazing, one of best experiences I've made during all my times travelling!. Yuka, a Tokyo chef, invited us into her home to teach us about Japanese cooking as well as about the inside look into life as a local. She is a chef with her own cookbook and makes tv appearances, given that we were taught how to cook from a true chef was an amazing experience. She also explained to us the importance of fish selection, the customs of Japanese eating and about how people in japan live. We made all different types ofsushi and miso soup based on clams. Being a chef she bought only highest grade fish and products , and we got to use her high quality cooking utensils which I must admit, was fun. After we completed our cooking, we sat down to enjoy our final product together.This was when the evening went from great to amazing. She treated us like we were family , started opening her cupboards and bringing out sake for us to taste, then after that was done, we shared some asahi beer.We spent the evening talking like old friends. Afterwards, she walked us to the local supermarket, showed us the different Japanese products and explained a few to us, and showed me which matcha tea she made me in her home so I could buy it to bring back to canada.She walked us to our subway station , hugged us and waited (like my parents and family always do) until we boarded our train and waved and waved to us. She asked us to reach out to her and come back to japan. Such a GENUINE and kind person, I was very impressed with her not only the cooking class but moreso, with her as a person. Thank you , Yuka,For one of the best experiences I've made during travelling. Hugs,From Toronto:)

Highly recommended for tourists and expats alike. Yuka's sushi class was so much fun! She is not only an excellent cook, she is a superb teacher. She started the class off by giving us each detailed copies of the recipes, and then going over the ingredients we were to use, which were all top quality. This was followed by a hands-on lesson -- Yuka would give a demo of key steps, pointing out best practices as well as bad habits to avoid, and then let us students loose in her kitchen. The class size was small (only 3 people) which meant that we each received focused attention from Yuka. Following the class, she took us around Hiroo, including a tour of the supermarket. Whether you're an expat living in Tokyo or a tourist just passing by, I highly recommend setting aside some of your time for Yuka's sushi course.

Yuka is amazing. I purchased, Yuka's sushi class to our really good friends as a wedding present. It was looking too good to skip so me and my husband also joined the class. Yuka was kind enough to accept only 4 of us as I requested. When we entered her apartment there was a small but gorgeous looking chocolate cake waiting for our friends to congratulate their wedding. It was a really really sweat gesture. Although all of us have been living in Japan quite a while neither of us knew anything about japanese kitchen or how to make sushi. Yuka started from very basic (but most important) like how to make a good rice..etc. Few things I really like about the class was;1) Yuka absolutely bought the top quality ingredients. I can say that because I live in here. there was only best tuna, best salmon, best avacado..etc on the table2) We actually did everything. Yuka just showed us one sample and the rest was ours. It was not a just listen and watch class.3) All the ingredients on the table has been used. It was way too much food. In the end of the class, we were quite tipsy, proud with our amazing looking sushis and so full from eating them. Cant wait to host sushi parties at home now! It is highly recomended

Highly recommended. My husband and I and two of our children signed up to learn how to make sushi and we found the experience memorable and meaningful. Ms Yuka gave us practical tips, and even customized the lesson to the sushi that we wanted to learn. She provided detailed recipe notes and shared with us some Japanese desserts that were not part of the course! She also brought us along on a supermarket trip after the lesson. The lesson venue is also conveniently located near Hibiya and Roppongi.

Briliant way to experience Japan through taste, mannors and vast knowledge of Yuka Mazda. Yuka cooking course is a briliant way to experience Japan through taste, mannors and vast knowledge of Yuka Mazda. We had a Sushi course in her kitchen and enjoyed it very much. When we get back home we definatly are going to have home made Sushi nights!

Unique taste of Japan!!. Fantastic cooking class experience with Yuka during our stay in Tokyo. From inquiry to booking, Yuka was informative, immediately responsive and very accommodating to our needs.Yuka met us at the subway station with another couple who were also taking the class, then making our way to her apartment to start the class.Yuka was very warm and attentive, making us feel very welcome and relaxed in her home.We made several recipes, sushi, sashimi, tofu and japanese soup, Yuka providing us with print out recipes to take home, whilst also kindly giving us our own sushi roller and broth mix. There was plenty of ingredients, various range and of which appeared great quality. Yuka making us green tea and desserts also.On return to the subway station, Yuka took us on short tour of the area including supermarket tour; very interesting.Overall, we had a lovely time and would definitely recommend the class for those wanting to have a unique Japanese experience.Thanks YukaRachel & Kyle

Amazing, fantastic, wonderful, a must-do in tokyo. Yuka's cooking class is an absolute must-do activity for anybody who likes food, whilst in tokyo. Yuka herself is one of the loveliest people i have ever met, but she is also a fantastic teacher and explains everything very clearly in fluent english. I did the sushi rolls course, and yuka was very careful to check which ingredients i could eat (i have a shellfish allergy) and happy to make substitutions. She also picks you up from and returns you to the station, so you won't get lost. The class lasted 3 hours, and you can learn lots of different techniques in that time. Yuka also gave me the tools and some ingredients so that i could try the dishes again by myself. I highly recommend this class!u
Sushi course. A very memorable class that left us feeling confident about out sushi making abilities. A must-do for anyone visiting Tokyo!

Tokyo on a personal scale. In a megalopolis like Tokyo, you can be overwhelmed and awestruck by the sensory overload! A personal experience by Yuka is the " breath of fresh air". Right from the immediate response to my email enquiry, and the personal meeting at the subway station, I felt this was going to be a great experience. After meeting we walked to Yuka' s house through her local neighbourhood! So different looking at the sights through a "locals" eyes. We took the sushi class. It's all about the " little things". The attention to detail, the smallest mistake, can determine the wrong outcome. Yuka highlighted the importance of such details to make the perfect sushi. I was so amazed that once we had completed the sushi class, that the platter in front of us, had been made by us. The class included the delicate art of making dashi, the beautiful refined dish of silken tofu, lots of questions answered about ettiquette, and fantastic restaurant recommendations for the duration of our stay. Thankfully we visited Yuka on our second day, so had a long list of restaurants to try.After the class we went to the local market to swoon over Japanese product, and amazed by the diverse array on offer! ( it makes shopping in Australia seem somewhat dull) . I now know the obsession the Japanese have with food. In Yuka's words, "the Japanese are crazy for food". Of course most travellers to Tokyo take in the famous sights of the palace, the temples, and the beautiful Edo culture. If you want a personal experience into " real" tokyo, this is it! Not to mention how amazed you will be at how well you can cook!( with Yuka's help) did I mention you get to eat all you make!! Do not eat before you go!!!!! I can't thank Yuka enough! I'm writing this review the following day because I'm so excited about the restaurant recommendations I will try for the next 5 days. Arigato!!!! A small insight by a foreigner into a fascinating foreign land.It's more than a cooking class, but Yuka sharing her Tokyo with us!!!!LUCKY US!!!!!

Cooking in Japan!!!. It was a pleasure cooking with Yuka. She is a very good teacher, very kind and speaks English fluently. It was a nice experience to be in a Tokyo home kitchen and learn first-hand how to make yakitori. Also, she gave me a copy of the recipes we cooked.I wish i had more time to make all the cooking classes. Maybe during my next visit in Japan

Palm. I'm from Thailand and I had a chance to joy sushi cooking class with Yuka Mazda. I really enjoyed her class. It was great experience with this amazing woman. If you would like to experience Japanese cooking, this class will be the best for you.

Fantastic, authentic and personal Japanese experience. My boyfriend and I were travelling through Japan and were desperate to find an authentic and personal cooking course. We emailed Yuka and she organised it straight away. She met us at the metro station and we went back to her house where we cooked up some FANTASTIC food. She was very informative, friendly and fun. She even walked us back to the metro station and helped us search for Japanese souvenirs. This was a fantastic cooking course and Yuka was an excellent person! Thanks for such a memorable experience!

Get to know the fundamental Japanese cooking with Yuka San. When you out there backpack by yourself, one of things on my checking list--ensure I can really get to know food and culture. Taking Yuka San's cooking class is one of random things I had done over Japan a month ago. First, Yuka San is very conscious of what cooking materials she offered, such as: producer brand, producer location, and how the cooking material produce. To her, everything she teaches her students to cook has to right. Second, the health and nutrient aspects of material has to be calculated properly. As we cooked, she made sure me drained out all the grease, and we really did not see that everywhere I took the cooking CLASSES. Third, the presentation of how to serving the food is one of most essential part that she shared. I was blessed enough to be the only student for the entire day. she shared with me everything she can in that short period of time from food, local life to social life in Japan. It was definitely worth visit and great investment on the day. I miss the time spending with her. thanks Yuka San.

Amazing and personal experience!. Picked us up from the metro station, took us to her own home for the cooking course. Speaks great English. Made us feel very welcome and tailored the course to our wishes. Lots of thoughtful extras to make it a truly memorable experience. Great knowledge of sushi and Japanese cooking. Definitely feel we will be able to make sushi ourselves when we get home. Fantastic!

Great Japanese hospitality and cooking experience. A lovely experience for our family of four. Yuka responded very promptly to our enquiry and was very accommodating and entertaining throughout the three hours we spent with her. We were picked up from the tube station and welcomed into her home. We took the yakitori class and were all thoroughly engaged throughout, and, with Yuka's guidance, produced a delicious lunch made from high quality ingredients. She also provided gifts and comprehensive handouts to take away, as well as lots of information about other places to visit and restaurant recommendations (though we were all too full for the evening!) Highly recommended - thank you Yuka!

Great experience. My daughter and I took Yuka's sushi class together and had a really wonderful time. Yuka was kind, thoughtful, fun, accommodating yet very professional and organized. She used fresh, high quality ingredients, gave clear instructions, and we felt like we will be able to take what we learned and make delicious sushi at home! The food was fabulous, but more than we could possibly eat. We took our leftovers with us and had sushi for dinner that night as well! Yuka even took us shopping in a local supermarket on the way back to the train. Very helpful. Then she emailed us pictures from our class, and gave us extra information about local restaurants and markets. We are so glad we did this - highly recommend!!

Highly recommend sushi class. We cannot recommend Yuka's cooking class highly enough. Our experience was similar to the review below, Yuka is a lovely person, a great teacher, and we felt we came away with better knowledge of how to make delicious sushi at home. We were lucky enough to have a private class just the 2 of us, by chance. We only booked the day before, I think we got lucky not being peak tourist season. The food quality was very high - don't eat before you go as we made far more than we could eat! Yuka has a great sense of humour and is very thoughtful, she has since sent us further information of things to do whilst in Tokyo and Kyoto. We think this class is very good value for money also. Would definitely recommend to friends.

Highly recommend. Friendly, professional instruction.. What a great family experience! My husband and I took the class with our two children, ages 15 and 14. Yuka meets you at the train station near her house, which is just a few blocks walk. She is immediately welcoming and engaging. We elected to take the sushi class. After making us feel comfortable in her home, we got right to work. Yuka had prepared a very nice handout for each of us to follow which we could take home with us. She was well organized and got us going on our respective tasks. It was so much fun! Our daughter does not care to eat seafood, so she prepared some vegetable rolls for herself. We also learned to make a wonderful tofu dish as well as a delicious soup. All the ingredients for the class were of high quality. We finished with tea and a sweet, then were presented with some thoughtful gifts. Yuka then walked us back toward the train station, stopping for a tour of a very nice grocery store. We thanked Yuka for a wonderful afternoon and decided to explore the area before getting on the train. After visiting a couple shops to our surprise we heard Yuka calling after us. With our enthusiasm with the class, we had forgotten to get information from Yuka on an unrelated matter. She actually waited there to find us to give us the information then offered to show us around for the rest of the afternoon. She could not have been nicer or more accommodating. We graciously explained that we had other plans, but we were so touched by how friendly she is. Yuka also e-mailed us the names and locations for a few of her favorite restaurants. We highly recommend taking a cooking class with Yuka Mazda.

Great way to "see" Japan. Highly recommend seeing Japan through the art of its food. Yuka is a great teacher and offered very high quality ingredients. She explained things thoroughly and answered questions very well. She is patient and understanding. We had a great time.

Learning Japanese cooking from a well-travelled Japanese lady! A wonderful experience!!!. Our kids love sushi, so my husband (French) and I (Chinese) decided to sign up a cooking class during our visit to Tokyo. Yuka responded to our queries promptly and was very flexible in addressing our requests. She made great efforts to show us authentic ways of Japanese cooking and shared some helpful tips of alternative ways (short-cuts). The class was conducted in a relaxed and pleasant environment. True Japanese hospitality! We enjoyed both the lesson and the copious DIY meal!!Yuka is a food lover and is familiar with French and Italian cooking so she is able to relate how Japanese cooking is similar to or different from the cooking we are used to. Be ready to hear Yuka's comments on Japanese believes (or superstitions) and fun facts!

Japanese Hospitality and Sushi Making All in One Class. Yuka was so polite, kind and informative while teaching us how to make sushi. To start she met us at the metro station and walked us to her home where we were greeted with the beauty and simplicity that the Japanese are famous for. As we sipped green tea, she gave us a brief intro and then put us to work cleaning the shrimp, slicing the fish, preparing the rice and slicing veggies. I was amazed at how simple the sushi was to make with her guidance. I started the class with the attitude that I could never make sushi at home and now I can't wait to show off my new skills. Yuka used quality ingredients and shared the types of sushi people eat at home. I would highly recommend taking this class. It's an experience that will remain forever in my memories of Tokyo.

I enjoyed the sushi class and can recommend it!. The sushi class with Yuka was a very nice experience. We were a small group of three and enjoyed it very much. She even made a tour with me through the supermarket to explain the food before bringing me back to the metro station.

"Great and fun". What an amazing cooking class !!Yuka is a lovely lady and very friendly and welcoming.I had an experience that I shall never forget and I have a new skill that I can show off to my friends in Indonesia, I know how to make sushi now :) .I really recommend this cooking class !!

Amazing Japanese Cooking Class. I spent a wonderful afternoon learning to make Sushi and the Japanese culture with Yuka. She used the freshest ingredients and makes a lot of effort to ensure that you are familiarized with authentic Japanese cuisine. Our fish was fresh from Tsukiji market that morning. Not only did we have a good class but also a wonderful meal. Highly recommended experience in Toyko!

The perfect way to learn to make sushi!. Yuka provides a sushi education experience that is affordable, informative and fun. She is a very generous and welcoming person and makes you feel comfortable immediately in her home. This was the perfect introduction to sushi making, the skills I have learnt will now get me off the ground I make sushi. I recommend this class to everyone. Origato goizamus Yuka!

Fantastic experience and just what I needed to stop the jetlag kicking in. I had an amazing, relaxed time with Yuka. I knew I would have a few hours to while away before I could check in to my hotel, so I decided to book the cooking class at the last minute. Not only did Yuka teach me some amazing ways to make yakitori and sushi, but she was also so friendly, making feel feel very at home, and giving some invaluable insider tips Tokyo. If that wasn't enough, she gave me lots of little goodies (a toilet seat warmer being one of them!!). The experience was fabulous and on top of learning some great cooking, she spoke really good English which is a rarity in Japan.. you'll find out when you visit. I treasure the experience and look forward to welcoming Yuka to London so I can repay the favour. A must do for all!

Great authentic Japanese cookin class in Tokyo. We called Yuka almost at the last moment and she was kind enough to help us out and arranged a 'private class' for us (my wife and I) for the next day.She picked us up from the metro station and guided us to her nice apartment. She prepared in advance fresh, high quality ingredients, showed us how to use them and explained what else would they be good for.The class was very friendly and in a relaxed atmosphere. We cooked for ~2 hours and all dishes came out delicious and the overall meal (+ the hot sake) was excellent.Highly recommend!

Wonderful Cooking Experience. I took Yuka's cooking class today for Yakitori. What an amazing class, great recipes, and fabulous teacher! Yuka made it easy to meet her by the subway station (which is important when you are a foreigner in Tokyo). She is also such a warm, wonderful person and really give you so much knowledge while explaining the ingredients and cooking techniques. I consider myself to be a fairly decent cook and have NEVER been able to get rice right! Now I know I can with Yuka's advice even those I was tempted to lift the lid. I highly recommend this from beginner to expert. You will learn a lot and have a great time and great meal!

Bon appétit !. Great cooking class! Yuka is a really nice person, she answers to all yours questions about japanese cuisine, and i spent a good moment with her. You have to do it !She explained very well each step for the recipe, in a way that you will be able to cook it once you have come back to your country!

Great experience - must do in Tokyo!!. We visited Yukas class just this week and it was a great experience. She met us from the train station to make it easy for us, and invited us into her house. Her English is excellent, having lived in the UK for a number of years. On top of this, during the lesson, she was very helpful in adapting the recipes so that we can make the dishes when we return to the UK (as she knows what ingredients we can and cannot get). The sushi class was very fun, and we made all the different types of sushi, along with Miso soup, and had a Japanese tea ceremony too! Only problem was that we made so much!!!ni wish Yuka had helped us eat some of it! I will definitely be making sushi back home in Scotland. She also walked us back to a place of interest (a bar 15m walk away which is where a scene from kill bill was filmed) which was very kind of her. Great experience and totally recommend to do while visiting Tokyo.

A wonderful instructor and gracious host! Definitely 5 stars and A+ rating!. Yuka was marvelous!! I had an excellent experience learning to cook with Yuka. I really enjoyed my experience. I would really like to recommend this class to everyone. We were able to get really fresh raw fish which was amazingly delicious, we all especially loved the raw prawns. I also found out that the freshly grated wasabi wasn’t as hot as I expected. It was very flavorsome and fantastic. I am sure that you won’t find another cooking class with such high quality ingredients. We didn’t only learn about making sushi, but also about daily life in Japan. It was really cool that we were able to make sushi that looks exactly like the picture on the website. I was also able to taste a lot of Japanese ingredients and vegetables. I’m sure you will love Yuka’s class.

Great cooking class with friendly and helpful teacher. Yuka was a terrific host and instructor who speaks very good and clear English. She printed a custom menu for me and showed me how to cook everything. She had also kindly prepared the table already with drinks including plum wine and 2 types of green tea. Yuka is a friendly person that knows when to help students and when to let them work for themselves so they learn the most. I definitely recommend this cooking class and Yuka's friendly demeanor!

Definitely worth it!!. Did a cooking class with my boyfriend at Mari back in March. We absolutely loved it and Mari was an amazing teacher. Mari made us feel so welcome in her home and the whole experience felt so personal compared to doing this with a big group. It was so lovely being taught how to make traditional Japanese food and now that I have the recipe I will definitely be making it again. All of the food we made was delicious. Mari even taught us how to serve Japanese food and plate it correctly. I enjoyed learning about Japanese cuisines and traditional cooking methods. Mari ended the cooking class with a beautiful dessert she had made and even gave us all a little gift to take home. So glad we did this cooking class. It was a lovely experience and very rewarding.

Excellent class with Mari. The group of 5 (2 Brits, 2 Aussies and 1 Belgian lady) met Mari at the subway station and were taken to her apartment. She offered us tea and explained about the ingredients that go into a typical Japanese meal. Each person was given one or more tasks to help prepare the meal. My task was cutting onions which I did badly, as in Japanese cooking onions have to cut really thinly.After some hard work mixed with general conversation we sat down to taste the food. I can honestly say, it was one of the best meals I have ever tasted. We even had a desert made from coconut and banana which Mari prepared plus some Chocolates from Papua New Guinea which I provided. These proved to be quite popular with the group.This was my first day in Japan and a really enjoyable experience. Mari is a great cook, a kind host with a lively personality.

wonderful class with a fabulous host. did a class with Mari on my last day in Japan. Fantastic end to the trip - the experience of cooking and eating in a local's kitchen, hearing about the different foods and how they are used and in the end, eating delicious food. Mari is extremely knowledgeable about Japanese food and provides detailed guidance and explanations on what she is using and how. this is a must do if you are interested in learning more about the local cuisine.

Cooking with Mari. Visited Japan with my wife and wanted to try a Japanese cooking class. Mari's class was very well reviewed and her website was easy to access and use for English speakers. I emailed her ahead of time and luckily she had an opening for us. The class itself was very informative and fun. There were 6 of us in the class from all over the world: Hawaii, California, Germany, Australia, a good mix of students. We did a lot of the food preparation and Mari helped us while cooking the dishes. We made several different dishes: a salad with homemade dressing, soup stock, a marinated pan-fried fish main dish. Mari also made a fancy dessert for us at the end.Mari is knowledgeable and she includes many key details as to why the Japanese cook the way they do. She has a lot of info on what types of ingredients and where to get them. She even assisted one of the students locating a knife shop to pick up a Japanese-made chef's knife. Her English is very good, did not have any trouble communicating at all. All in all, it was a very good experience and well worth it. Highly recommend the experience.

Amazing experience to take back home. Marry's cooking class was one of the best experiences we had in Japan, and allowed us to bring a small piece of Japan home. Mari is incredibly friendly and outgoing with grade A English and a great sense of humor. She is also a top notch chef, with years of experience, formal training in cooking around the world, and a recently published popular cookbook (yet you'll never hear about it from her). The food we cooked under her direction was one of the best meals we had in our month long stay. Don’t let that scare you - her class is incredibly and approachable for beginners and advanced amateurs a like. Her explanations are very clear and thorough, with plenty of room for questions. She gives ample background information about the dish’s history and role in Japanese cuisine. She spends time discussing the technique and the different cooking utensils we will use. At least two talks (before and after the cooking) were spent going over the various ingredients: where do they come from, what is their function in the dish, how to choose them, and of course - how to substitute those hard to find outside of Japan. The class format was a group of 6 people. We started with a short introduction. Mari went over the dishes we will cook, when (and how) are the dishes served, and then gave out tasks for different prep work and cooking. We had two main dishes and several side dishes, so each person had several things to do, and participated in nearly all dishes (which is something that does not happen in some cooking classes we read about on TripAdvisor). We had a great group with plenty of stuff to chat about, and made sure to swap tasks between us, so everyone could take part in all the dishes. Mari went from person to person, giving pointers and correcting technique, making sure to call other group members to pay attention for important tips. Obviously, Mari printed the full recipes for us, with plenty of space to scribble additional remarks. We set up the table and talked some more over the incredible meal we cooked. We had a blast talking to the other participants and Mari herself. We talked about cooking, about travel and about Japan. In many ways, this class was a cultural experience as well as a foodie one. After another round of questions and answers about what we had just made, Mari served a surprise French dessert, which was amazing, and gave out packages with more stuff to take home. This was a great way to end our trip, and we are eager to invite our friends for a Japanese meal, to flaunt our newly acquired skills and ingredients.

Lovely class and a delicious meal. I heard about this class online at TripAdvisor, and I'm really glad I did this class. Mari's apartment is located to Tsukiji Fish Market (which is also a must-do), so I visited the market in the morning, and had a sushi breakfast there. Afterwards, I walked to the station where we're supposed to meet (about 1 mile/1.6km away). There, I met with Mari and the rest of the class. In my class of 6, 2 had taken the class before, and are taking it again on their next visit to Tokyo. From this, I was sure that the class was going to be a memorable experience. Mari was the sweetest lady ever, and the class was absolutely fantastic. She invited us into her home, and had all the ingredients laid out and ready to be prepared. I've never really had experience cooking before, but I was still able to contribute and help make the course. After cooking all the food, we sat down and all ate together. It was delicious! I'll have to try to replicate this meal in the future. If you're looking for great conversation, a lesson with real, traditional Japanese home style cooking, Mari's class is the place to go. I loved it!

Fantastic cooking experience with Mari. My husband and I had a wonderful experience cooking with Mari in Tokyo. She is an absolutely delightful personality, her English is excellent, and she definitely knows her cooking - both Japanese and Western. Taking this class gave us insights not only into how to cook Japanese food but Japanese culture and daily life in Tokyo. First, we learned how to make the essential basis of much of Japanese soups and sauces, dash broth, and then moved out to a whole Japanese meal. We loved this class, and Mari made every minute count! This is a must do when in Tokyo for the first or tenth time!!

Amazing cooking japanese experience. It was a very interesting experience and delightfull meal. We learned some basics we did not known before, not only about japanese cooking but also about japanaese culture. Mari is a very good communicator as she makes the class enjoyable for everyone. Located close to the fish market gave us the opportunity to visit it before the class.

Great food and fun for the entire family. Our family had a great time cooking with Mari. It was one of the highlights on our first trip to Tokyo. Besides being a great cook Mari is really good at describing Japanese food culture as well as the basics of cooking. We had a great time and bought some of Mari's cooking books as gifts for our family and friends at home - a great present.

Cooking class with an amazing instructor!. Instructor, Mari-san has a very wide knowledge about Japanese cooking.She taught us various way of cooking even for one recipe.It is very helpful when we cook the recipe again at home.I really respect her kindness & passion about cooking!

Tasty, fun, educational look at Japanese good.. It was a small group and done in the instructors home. Leaned a lot about the base of Japanese cooking as well as some of the ingredients and themes common to a lot of the foods. Mari was an excellent host, instructor, and cook! The dishes we cooked as a group were delicious and we all got to share in them around a table after the cooking was finished. It was also a great way to meet fellow travelers.

A part of our trip we wouldn't want to miss. The cooking class with Mari was in one word: Amazing! We had loads of fun making Gyoza, Miso soup and a side salad. Mari is extremely knowledgable when it comes to food and provides tips on how to recreate recipes at home even if you can't get some of the ingredients. I would recommend anyone visiting Tokyo to book a course with Mari!

Awesome Cooking Class. I attended a custom class where we made two main dishes. We learned the basics of Japanese cooking and prepared one chicken main dish, one vegetarian main dish, Miso soup, salad and a side dish. Mari was wonderful. She responded to my inquiries promptly and provided detailed instructions on where and when to meet her (an absolute necessity for a newcomer to Tokyo). Her English is excellent.She teaches the class in her home which is set up perfectly for a cooking class. Mari knows her ingredients and freely shares her knowledge. We were an international group--American, Austrian, Israeli, Irish, Canadian—and Mari had suggestions on how and where to find ingredients. We learned and practiced the basic techniques for creating all the Japanese dishes listed above. I am confident that I can remake anything we learned… a theory I will be testing soon!Thank you Mari for an excellent class!

A MUST DO. If your looking to get away from the hustle and bustle of Tokyo for a couple hours, a cooking class with Mari is definitely a great idea. Without a doubt, one of the nicest people you will ever meet, Mari was such a great person to learn from. Nothing was rushed, she explained all the ingredients, why she used them, where she got them and how to use them best. She also asked us lots of questions and made the environment very comfortable. When it came to the cooking, we all took turns on different jobs and then she ran through how to bring it all together. And the food was AMAZING!!! I don't know if I'll remember how to make it again even with the recipe, but it was very delicious. She even gave us a little bonus dessert afterwards and we sat around chatting for 30-40 minutes after we finished eating. All in all, a great day!

Excellent cooking class in Tokyo. We had the pleasure of taking a cooking class with Mari and it was the highlight of our trip to Tokyo! Mari is a professional chef who teaches out of her own kitchen. She was very good about teaching us why we were using certain ingredients and gave us "jobs" in the actual preparation of the food. It was awesome! Highly recommend Mari if you are interested in learning how to cook Japanese.

Great experience. Mari was prompt to reply to emails when I first found out about her cooking classes in Tokyo and I'm glad I did not hesitate to register. It was a really enjoyable experience and she made me feel so welcomed in her lovely home. It was great that the class was small to encourage group interaction and we could all participate in the cooking process with some guidance from Mari who clearly has a huge passion for food and teaching. Loved that we could all sit down together at the end of the class and enjoy the fruits of our labour not before Mari taught us how to place our cutleries and dishes the Japanese way! We ended the meal with a lovely dessert which Mari had prepared earlier and I left with a full stomach, a lovely memory, a nice souvenir and her newly published cookbook. And since I was also travelling to Hokkaido after Tokyo, Mari kindly emailed me a list of foodie places to try in Hokkaido after the class and I'm glad she did as they were amazing finds!

A Tokyo Must. Based on the reviews I'd read, I knew that Mari's class was something not to miss - and I'm so glad I didn't! From her gracious welcome, to her warm home, to the quality of the teaching and food, to the fun of meeting people from around the world, it was one of the highlights of our stay in Tokyo. I learned so much about ingredients and the simplicity of making delicious Japanese food, and have recreated them in our tiny apartment here in Japan - a testament to the success of a cooking class in my opinion. And, to keep me inspired, I brought home a copy of her gorgeous cookbook to share with friends and family! Make time for this - you'll love it.

STOP LOOKING ELSEWHERE. You need to book a class with Mari right now.. This was my favorite thing I did in my recent trip to Tokyo. I had never been to Asia before and so I took to Trip Advisor for “Things to do in Tokyo.” Obviously there are a lot of things, but this captured my interest because I love to cook. I was a bit apprehensive at first because my husband and I are vegetarians, but after a quick peek at Mari’s website I realized she held vegetarian cooking classes! I was immediately sold.I emailed Mari right away to inquire. She got back to me very quickly and I signed up. The payment process was easy and secure and before I knew it we were on our way to Japan. The class took place in Mari’s own home - something that I thought was very kind of her to do AND it offered a peek into a Japanese kitchen. The class was small, with just 6 people, so it was an intimate setting and everyone was able to help out with the cooking process. The class itself was about 3-4 hours long and we were able to eat a full meal that we prepared ourselves! Mari then provided dessert that she had previously made. It was delicious!We learned so much about Japanese cooking styles, techniques and history. We used new ingredients, new cooking tools and culinary traditions. Mari even let us try her very own miso that she makes every year. I had no idea how to make miso, but now I do!Mari also recently published a cookbook. We purchased one on our way out and can’t wait to cook from it.It was truly a remarkable experience and I couldn’t recommend it more.
Cooking Class. The charming Mari, cooking Instructor, is teaching a lot interesting knowledge about traditional Japanese dishes. The easy and healthy food is waiting, after lesson, to be eaten.

The Perfect Travel Experience!. Mari was hospitable, knowledgable, and made me fall in love with Japanese food. Her class began with an overview of unique Japanese ingredients. It was not only a cooking class but truly a cultural experience that helped me to better understand what is popular in Japanese cuisine. Mari's english is fabulous and her recipes are easy to follow. I was very impressed with our meal and I can't wait to cook it for friends and family back home. This was the highlight of my trip!

English-language Japanese cooking class in Tokyo - a must-have experience for any home cook who likes Japanese food. Mari's class was not only fun but immensely practical. It turns out Japanese cooking is perfect for the home cook: once you know foundations (dashi, rice, rice vinegar, a little sugar, mirin, soy sauce, miso, seasonal vegetables), how they are used and what techniques are applied, you can easily make soup, day pickles, and everything else. Mari demonstrated this both in her menu and in her execution. The class was well organized and fun. Nothing was technically too difficult and everyone seemed to be learning from what everyone was doing (we read the recipes together, then split into teams to make everything). Mari is thoughtful and welcoming of questions on any subject at all (especially related to food and Japanese and international cuisine), clearly well informed and with a perspective of her own to bring to the conversation. And I didn't leave hungry (I bet no one did).My spouse and I sometimes attempt to cook "Japanese" at home, although with mixed results until now. We'll be applying what we learned in Mari's class to bento (lunch boxes), weeknight suppers, and parties. The recipes are a bonus.Note: the class covers the basics. If you are already accomplished in Japanese cuisine, you may learn a little less. You should still have fun though.More free advice: the Tokyo subway is very reliable and the trains are very frequent. Do not plan extra time for travel to the meeting place, unless you have already scoped out a cafe or somewhere to cool your heels.Final note: In Japan, the custom is *do not tip*, but you can expect to witness a free exchange of omiyage (little presents) between guests and hostess. You will be happiest if you know this ahead of time and prepare yourself accordingly.

A terrific teacher. Mari gives great courses right in her kitchen and best of all you can enjoy a home cooked meal at the end of the class. Highly recommended to anyone looking to learn more about Japanese cuisine and couture - Mari can teach you about different cooking styles and in readiness used across the country.

Good veggie cooking class!!!. We went to Mary's on our trip to Japan, we didn't know anything of her classes, but we saw it on Tripadvisor and decided going there because of her good reviews. I only have to say that It was very interesting and funny, cause she explained us how to prepare 5 dishes of classical Japanese cooking, but vegetarian. When we finished we were absolutely satisfied. I recomend going and try to learn with her!!!

Fantastic Cooking Class - Highly, Completely Recommend!. Wow! Where should I begin? Mari's cooking class is a delight and a must-do if you are in Tokyo. The class was held in her home, and in a great, easy-to-find location right by the subway exit. Mari was very warm, welcoming, and thorough in her explanations of Japanese cooking techniques and of different Japanese foods. The class didn't feel awkward, it was very comfortable and relaxed with the other class members. Mari made us feel very at home, helped us prepare and eat a DELICIOUS Japanese meal, and gave us a wonderful parting gift. I would sign up for the class again, without hesitation. I can't imagine a better cooking class in Tokyo.

If you want to learn about Japanese cooking then this is essential. My wife attended this but asked me to post this review. We met Mari at the station meeting point near her apartment along with 4 others. The cookery lesson lasts about 3 hours and is held in Mari's apartment. Mari speaks excellent English and the whole session is very hands-on with course participants doing the food preparation under Mari's watchful eye. My wife came away with a great understanding as to how to make and prepare popular Japanese dishes and she also bought Mari's book "Cooking with Mari" which is available on line. She also got an understanding of the tools you need to prepare the dishes so a visit to the Kappabashi kitchen precinct in Tokyo received a visit to get tools difficult to find in the UK. Highly recommended if you are a foodie. Book via the internet.

A fun experience for foodies. Overall:Mari is great and highly recommend for anyone who love Japanese cuisine. Great experience.The class: Mari was able to use 3 hours of time to give a good fundamentals of Japanese home cooking, there's printed recipes for us to take home too. I feel I walked away learning the principals and I can apply different varieties on top of it (ex: we learned a sauce and can apply different seasonal vegetables). The class itself is pretty easy, you don't have to be a serious cook to take the class. Mari did a good job letting everyone participate, good conversations along the way and best part, we end up with a really nice lunch! Every one really had a good time. Japanese cooking is actually pretty easy!Finding her place: Mari's place is right next to subway station, very easy to find. She will give instructions before class.Language: Mari can speak very good English, Chinese, and of course Japanese. :)Tips: 1. Email her prior to class if you have any diet restrictions, she will accommodate to each class. For our class, she made a vegan dessert because one of student cannot eat any dairy products. 2. Mari just published a cooking book. We all grabbed one for future home entertaining ideas.3. In hindsight, I wish I took her class prior exploring Tokyo. She has really good tips where to buy things (knifes, seasonings, etcs). I got a nice Japanese tea pot for gifts.Fun, informative, and cultural experience. Go for it!

Excellent cooking class. I wanted to learn how to cook Japanese cuisine at home and this class exceeded my expectations - I've got useful tips for cooking various Japanese dishes, learned a lot about the ingredients and more importantly, it was fun! Mari is a great teacher, excellent cook and her English is perfect.

A true immersion into Japanese cuisine. We are really glad we had the opportunity of having a class with Mari! She's very welcoming and a great cook as well. The food was absolutely delicious. A must for anyone interested in discovering Japanese cuisine from an insider's point of view. She shares a lot of stories and information about traditional cooking.

We loved cooking woth Mari. Mari made us feel very welcome to her home and together with an Australian and a nice woman from Singapore we had four nice hours. We were a family of four. Mari taught us a lot about japanese cooking and flavours and it was all a hands-on experience. Mari's enthusiasm for teaching us about every aspect of the food was very clear. It was a really nice experience.

Must do activity in Tokyo. My 23 and 27 year old "children" , husband and I took Mari's vegetarian cooking class and LOVED every minute! We had been in Tokyo several days and because we were eating at restaurants we were "starved for a home cooked meal "! The food was delicious, the class incredibly informative from the actual cooking instructions to the info about the different vegetables some of which we were seeing for first time! Mari is absolutely delightful... Being invited into her own home is also so special. It was so interesting to see her apartment and to hear her explain about Japanese culture. She invited us to ask any questions not only related to cooking and was a very gracious hostess. Book it now because they're only six slots per class, and if you're the first one to book the class you get to pick the menu like I did! Thank you Mari for a wonderful experience for our entire family!
Cooking with Mari. Great teacher and we learned alot about the food we was cooking and the history behind it! Something everyone can do and bring home to your own kitchen :)

Amazing Cooking Class!!. I was looking for a cooking class to surprise my girlfriend for her birthday. I found Mari and was excited about the day. She met us near her apartment and took us into her home where we cooked the most delicious food. Mari was caring, knowledgeable and friendly and has even sent us recipes since the day. I'd recommend this to anyone!

Warm, personal experience. The experience was small and intimate, it truly is what you make of it. Mari was cheerful and welcoming. She is very knowledgable of the history and effects of ingredients on food, so ask many questions! The course was very well organised with printed recipes to take home. Mari's home is warm, cosy and comfortable. It was fun to see a more personal side of Japan. Would definitely recommend anyone to take this class!
Great Experience. Wonderful class and a unique experience during our trip. Mari is incredibly kind and made for a fun, laid-back learning experience. Highly recommended.

It was great cooking with Mari@Tokyo. Looking foward to more when I'm back in Tokyo!. I had enjoyed a wonderful brithday afternoon cooking with Mari in Tokyo. Always travelling for work in Tokyo/Japan, and for this visit, I have decided to return to Tokyo for leisure and to explore my passion - food and paragliding in Japan. I found Mari on FaceBook and web blog. Great comments about her skills and hospitality. Mari-san gave a good inside about Japanese ingredients, great step by step details on Japanese cooking and "hands-on" experience cooking. I had a great time cooking and food were delicious. Thank you Mari-san. Hope to see you soon again when I return to Tokyo.

Cooking Class in Private Japanese Home. I really enjoyed this class. Mari picked up our small group of 6 and took us a short walk to her home. She gave us tea and a recipe packet, went over the prep stations, and had us get to work. There was a lot of hands on and not just us watching her cook. We made sushi, miso soup, and an eggplant and peppers side dish. She went over traditional Japanese cuisine, the different types of kelp/miso, and the food culture in Japan. There was a newspaper crew taking lots and lots of photos, but it was only a minimal distraction. Next time I'm in Tokyo I will definitely book another class with Mari. Definitely schedule in advance as I was lucky to get the last spot in the class.

Delicious sweets class with a great teacher. My partner and I were lucky enough to book ourselves in for a traditional Japanese sweets class with Mari at quite late notice - but I would recommend booking in advance to make sure you don't miss out! We were welcomed into her kitchen along with four other travelers who seemed to enjoy the experience just as much as we did. Mari has a wonderful, clear way of communicating her vast knowledge about Japanese ingredients and cooking. She took us carefully through the ingredients we would use (and the best places to purchase some raw materials to take home), then walked us through the process, encouraging each of us to participate in the cooking. Then, we got to eat it all - delicious! The written recipes she provided were great (and complete), but I also took lots of notes to try to take home as much of her knowledge as possible. She suggested some really helpful variations and tips to get the most out of the recipes. We will definitely be contacting Mari again next time we are in Tokyo.

Lovely & knowledgeable cooking teacher.. Cooking with Mari was one of my best experiences in Tokyo, and this was my 3rd visit to Tokyo. She is knowledgable about many aspects of Japanese cooking, makes a spectacular attempt to connect with people from all cultures, and is a beautifully warm personality. I will definitely look to her for cooking advice again when I go to Tokyo next time as it feels just like visiting a talented friend.

Great "slice" of Tokyo. After visiting some of Tokyo's great public spaces, crowded museums and amazing shrines, it was a welcome change of pace to take a cooking class in a private home. Mari is a delightful woman, accomplished chef, and soon to be published cookbook author. She welcomed us into her compact apartment, where our party of four joined two Japanese ladies for a lesson on the Japanese cooking and ingredients. Then she set us to the task of making lunch and setting a Japanese table. While we dined on our delicious meal, she answered all variety of questions about everyday life in Tokyo. It was a wonderful experience and a unique opportunity to interact personnally in a huge impersonal city.

Meet a talented traditional Japanese Chef. We had high expectations on Mari and her cooking lesson;she has welcomed us and coached with kindness and care in detail into cooking a genuine lunch based on Gyoza (Japanese dumplings), a miso soup with fresh vegetables and boiled eggplants side dish. Mari has not only satisfied us, but she has surprised proving she is a talented and professional chef, giving many insights on Japanese cuisine and precious suggestions on typical ingredients.We recommend this experience to anyone passionated of Japanese food like us.

More than just a cooking class!. My finance and I were looking forward to this class our whole trip as it was towards the end of our journey - and it did not disappoint! What we got was more than just follow this recipe and cook this meal. Mari sat down with the whole group (there were 6) and went over the different kinds of kelp, bonito flakes, and miso paste available and how to go about buying it. Mari had a lot of these different products in her house and we were able to see the different kinds of kelp as well as see and smell the different miso pastes. These products were the basis of our meal so it was nice to see the variations. The rest of the class went well as we divided up the cooking responsibilities among the group and eventually sat down to a delicious dinner. Mari showed us the proper way to set a Japanese table and we all took turns asking etiquette questions as well as general questions about Japan and the culture. We made Sakana no Nanban-duke (marinated seafood dish), Nasuno Hukumeni (boiled eggplant), with miso soup and rice. I would recommend cooking with Mari to those skilled and unskilled in the kitchen. A fabulous experience!

Unique & Amazing Cooking Experience. Mari-san gave us detailed explanation of the Japanese ingredients and the Japanese cooking method. She was very kind and attentive to all of us during the lesson, so that everyone was getting involved.We cooked gyoza, miso soup and eggplant. The recipes were easy to follow and the food was simply excellent! Highly recommended to those who want to understand more about the Japanese culture :)

A true Japanese cooking experience - home cooking, local knowledge and good food!. The class was held in Mari's home and is limited to 6 people which makes for a very personal and interactive session.I would highly recommend this class to anyone looking for a good introduction into Japanese cooking who values local knowledge and a great host! Thanks Mari - we had a awesome time!

AMAZING!. I am always keen to learn to cook new recipes. My husband was initially not wanting to participate in a cooking class. However, he admitted that he was grateful I dragged him into it. Mari is incredible; her english is fluent, knowledgeable about the culinary arts and recipes are user friendly. I could easily recreate these recipes back in Canada. She also prints out the recipes in detail!

Great New Experience. My husband and I really enjoyed Mari's cooking class. We meet people from different parts of the world and we all shared a great cooking & eating session. Mari is an excellent instructor and made sure we understood many different aspects to the Japanese cooking experience. Would highly recommend signing up for this class, you will defiantly enjoy it. We've never done something like this before and we are glad we did. Thank you so much Mari for a great and informative time!

Japanese comfort food with good people.. It was terrific cooking class experience with Mari&all around the world students. She explain very well about japanese ingredient and base of cuisine. It was interesting explain about kelp&miso&katsuobush(bonito flakes). And we cook together eat together Japanese comfort food in comfort mood. Thanks to Mari!

Home cooking in Tokyo. Mari's cooking class was perfect, the dishes we prepared were delicious and Mari took the time to explain about the ingredients in detail, so I really learnt a lot. I particularly appreciated her warm approach which made it easy to ask questions and left feeling that I would be able to make the dishes back home in France. I would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for an insight into Japanese cuisine and I think it would appeal to people of all cooking abilities. Thank you for a fantastic evening Mari san! Oishii kata desu!!
