The best way to learn Japanese cooking. The cooking class with Mari San was a wonderful experience. Mari San welcomed us in her home and made us feel at ease immediately. We all enjoyed being guests in her home and being able to see how Japanese people live. I have wanted to learn Japanese cooking for some time now and Mari taught us the basics about flavours and the ingredients. She made it very easy for us to follow the procedures and do our share in the preparation, and the food turned out to be delicious. we made Gyoza (which my husband will love), Miso soup and eggplants. I can only recommend this class and I will book one again the next time I am in Tokyo.Arigato gozaimas Mari San

An excellent opportunity to discover the japanese cooking. I was this sommer in Tokio and as a food blogger and lover, I really wanted to learn more about the Japanese cooking secrets. I took class with Mari and it was a wonderful experience. Mari is a nice, clever woman who know a lot about the Japanese food and culture. She speaks English very well so it was very easy to communicate, and I really learnd a lot!It was very fun and interesting to cook at her home, to see the way of Japanese living, cooking and eating.I know next time I'll go to Japan, I'll take another class with her.More about the class hier in French in my blog: http://www.fitandpeach.com/archives/2014/09/10/30372986.html

Japanese cultural experience/cooking class. My husband, 32 year old son, and I just returned from an exciting and action packed trip to Japan. Without a doubt our cooking class with Mari was a high point. As a teacher, she was excellent, explaining the basics of Japanese cooking, flavors, and textures. Her grace,ease and open nature with our group made it easy for us to ask questions of all sorts about everyday life in Tokyo, as well as cooking questions. The home environment gave us an insight in to everyday Japanese life. We are still talking about the wonderful spinach salad with sesame dressing. The Suribachi bowl set and Shark Skin grater are on my Christmas Wish list.

Authentic Japanese Cooking Class. Cooking with Mari was a lovely experience. We booked a couple of months in advance after reading reviews about this class. Mari picked us up from an easily accessible station in Tokyo - gave very good instructions on how to get there and her home is just steps away. Mari was a great host and explained everything really well. Her english is also very good and easily understandable. We made chicken teriyaki, miso soup, and a salad. It was delicious. All together the experience lasted approximately 3 hours. She also has a very cute dog named pooh-chan who just loves guests.

Japanese Home Cooking Demonstration a Highlight. I have no fear of being contradicted by either my wife or 15-year-old son when I say that the "Japanese Cooking Class Tokyo with Mari" was one of the highlights of our recent Japanese holiday. Mari's warm, friendly and open nature was matched only by her skill as a cook. All three of us learned some new cooking techniques and picked up handy hints which we intend to use very soon. I can't recommend this evening highly enough, and I think my Australian friends will soon get very sick of me talking about it all the time.

Great Japanese cooking class. Mari gave a great Japanese cooking class and willingly shared her love of Japanese cooking by explaining and making all courses from scratch. She has a great knowledge of the food and was very informative about the different ingredients and techniques to use.Best miso soup I have ever tasted!!! Thanks for your warmth and hospitality Mari.

Very good time cooking with Mari. Mari was very nice from the beginning to the end. She picked us up in one easily accessible station in Tokyo and her house was just a few steps away.We are glad we could choose the main dish that night because we booked more than a month before.Mari has very good English, and everybody could easily understand her. She was very clear and informative about the recipes and about the ingredients. We were admired to know that many Japanese food are really easy to prepare.I think the cooking class is just half the experience. The other half is joining a japanese house and meeting people from other part of the world and have a pleasant talking with them. Mari has very interesting point of view of Japanese culture and it is worth asking her many things you are curious but don't have anyone to ask.Really recommend this class to anyone visiting Tokyo.

Authentic homely Japanese food cooking experience. I took the class during my vacation there and had a wonderful time. Got to learn about the basics of traditional Japanese foods consumed at home. Had fun cooking and a great time eating the food we cooked.Thanks Mari for the warm welcome :)

Amazing cooking class experience with Mari. Cooking class with Mari was a very enriching and good experience. She gives very good explanation and details about the food, and the food taste amazing! You can also learn a great deal about Japanese culture and much more! I strongly recommend her class to anyone who loves food & eating!I went with my spouse and me being a dietitian and him an excellent cook, we both learned a lot from her class. We learned how to make Miso soup, oyako-don & Gyoza (Japanese dumplings).
Mari is very friendly , japanese food is very delicious. Mari is a great cook and a great teacher.and she is very friendly with sweet smile, i like her very much

Bad quality for the price. I cook often but I don’t cook Japanese food. My wife who Japanese she cooks me Japanese food often. I wanted to surprise her birthday for my Japanese cooking so here I am. Start from instructions about ingredients, then cutting. She told just cut the ingredients but I wasn’t sure what other people were cutting and what for. Of course other people were same. She doesn’t explain or teach anything during the cooking. Then we all finished cut them about in same time, then her cooking show begun.She just started to cook with our finished ingredients without a word and kept cook and cook.During cooking, she grabs some ingredients form her fridge as though she remembered, again without a word and she just put in to a pot without washed. We couldn' t know what was that till the last.First, I was existed all about this cooking but all her acting, attitude, and unkind teaching, I lost interest during the class. It wasn’t fun at all and I couldn’t learn any instruction in cooking.I didn’t like her attitude that what she asked for what to bring. A woman in the class with me, Mari asked her for bring the things what Mari needs. That surprised me a lot and I didn't feel good to see that. Mari didn’t let us cooking, she kind a used us for how she is going to cook comfortably.Food that she cooked the finishing blow with bad taste that my wife is not good cooker but she was much better! I can’t believe it!I do not understand how the …Miso soup would be bad taste?All joined people ware nice, we didn’t have any conversation during eating and was very odd atmosphere.

Very Informative and Casual. I visited Tokyo for a week in August and one of the first things I researched was a cooking class. I found Mari's cooking class and saw the many good reviews and I knew I had to sign up. She was very warm and inviting from the second I met her at the subway station near her home. The class was very casual and all the other participants were friendly and curious like I was. The food we cooked (fish & vegetables marinated in a vinegar/sake sauce, potato cakes & miso soup) was simple but required skill to make. It was delicious and I learned quite a lot from Mari. I highly suggest anyone traveling in Tokyo take this class.

Fantastic Experience. Mari is a great cook and a great teacher. Her English is perfect and very easy to aunderstand. If you want to learn any specific dish she try to make real your wishes. After cooking with Mari you can enjoy with her of the dishes cooked and get a good conversation with her and other diners. Fully recommended.

Great class on the fundamentals of Japanese cooking. My husband and I took this cooking class with Mari on our short trip and it was one of the more valuable activities we did. Mari is not only a very nice person but she is extremely knowledgeable on Japanese cooking techniques and other cultures as well. What I liked most about this class is that you don't just learn how to cook the recipes, you understand the fundamentals of each recipe and why flavors are combined so you can use this knowledge for so many other things beyond the recipes given. Overall, i highly recommended this fun class!

Excellent and cute Japanese cooking class :). Me and my mom had a lovely afternoon/evening cooking delicious and nutritious Japanese Miso soup and meat Gyoza in Mari's place. She is a very calm and patient teacher who shares her stories and experiences with the amazing food of her country, she also has a super cute adorable dog! It was a very nice alternative way of having diner in Tokyo which we warmly recommend.

Highlight of our trip. Mari's class was one of the highlights of our trip. You will meet other travelers, cook with them, and get to know them over a fantastic meal. You will learn how to shop for and prepare a Japanese meal. You will eat food that will eclipse anything you could get in a restaurant. You will also learn a lot about Japan from Mari, who is a fantastic teacher and host.

Great time with good food. Mari is a great teacher and we had a very nice time learning japanese cooking. She gives a lot of tips and can teach a lot of different plates while making just one. For example, for the sushi we could also learn how to make a japanese omelette! Classes are at her home, what makes it really cozy. She's very nice, and if you're going to Sapporo after, don't forget to ask for restaurants suggestions there :-) She knows a lot about it.

Superb Tokyo cooking class. Mari's homemade cooking class was a useful way for me learn the basics of Japanese cooking. Mari first provided a short history of essential Japanese ingredients, like konbu (kelp), dashi (soup stock), katsuobushi (dried bonito flakes), and miso paste. Armed with this information, I developed a better grasp of Japanese cooking methods, utensils, and traditional recipes. Next, she skillfully demonstrated how to prepare four easy and healthy Japanese dishes. Finally, before indulging in our meal, our delightful sensei explained the importance of table setting in Japan.

One of the best things you can do in Tokyo. As a solo traveller in Japan (with no Japanese language skills at all), going to Mari's place to learn the basics of Japanese cooking was great. She provides a really thorough explanation of basic Japanese ingredients, as well as tips on where to buy things that you might want to take home, and then you cook and eat lunch. The food was amazing - some of the best I've had so far in Japan, and it'll be pretty easy to replicate those dishes at home. I highly recommend doing this.

Great chance to know about Japanese food and cooking. Good - Mari speaks very good English, easy to understand, and she knows about the ingredients and the knowledge about Japanese cooking/dining.Bad - There is only one kitchen, one set of stove so not everyone can practice the whole way of cooking. You will need to share the tasks; some people will cut and some will cook and some will prepare the table. It depends on how many people there are int he class.Overall, if you are interesting in cooking and want to know a bit more about Japanese cuisine, here is a good chance to start your first step.

cooking meeting - it was great. The train station is just near Mari's house. very easy to get.we had few wonderful hours - learning about Japanese food, about ingredients of the Japanese kitchen, we ate nice and tasty food that we prepared together. the meeting with Mari wa very interesting and pleasant. warmly recommended.

Home setting. Date: Friday 15 August 2014Booking process: by e-mail.We made chicken teriyaki, (the basis for) miso soup and a spinach salad. The first was our request, basically because we were the first to book. Our party was 6 people (us from the Netherlands, two people from Denmark and 1 person from Indonesia). After a through informational chat about the ingredients, we set about chopping, cutting and stirring. Mari provided plenty of advice and insights into authentic Japanse cuisine. This was our second cooking course in Asia, and the first one in a homely environment. Highly recommended!

Japanese home cooking course. If you would like an introduction to Japanese cooking and culture, this is the class for you. What we loved about this class that not only we get to know Japanese ingredients and the way of cooking them, but also the Japanese culture and the way of treating them. Mari is a great cook, and a lovely host, who makes you feel at home. Even if you are in Tokyo just for few days, it is well worth the time.

Cooking with Mari is a Lesson in Japanese Culture.. Mari taught us quite a bit about what is important to the Japanese cook and her/hiskitchen. We learned excellent recipes, yes, and techniques like gyoza making, and how to properly grind sesame seeds. But what we valued most was Mari's ability to convey the cultural performance that is at the center of Japanese cooking, including a respect for ingredients, the harmony of flavors, and the aesthetics of presentation. Mari is a great teacher, and clearly loves what she does. Highly recommended for the thinking cook.

Good introduction to Japanese home cooking. Mari met us right outside the subway exit and was a very short walk away from the venue. She gave good explanations of the ingredients, style of cooking, and we chatted as if we knew other for a long time! We never felt rushed so that we could fully learn what she had to teach.

Friendly & Inviting Japanese Cooking With Mari!. The really awsome thing about this class is that not only do you learn how to make delicious Japanese food but you also get a quick history lesson on Japanese ingredients and culture. I arrived at the station to meet 3 other enthusiastic students. Mari picked us up from the top of the station stairs and off we went to cook in her cute home. Great homely environment and Mari is so so so so so so nice! I'd defiantly reccommend giving her a visit as the class was a good price and well worth it!!! Go cook with Mari now!! Ps. She has the cutest little dog!!!

An amazing cooking class with Mary. Very very good and tasty food prepared by us with Mary of course. We were only 2 people during the class : almost a personnal class. We have learnt so much about Japanese cuisine. A little bit expensive but definitively worth it !

Perfect start to a good day in Tokyo. Went to Tokyo for my birthday back in Feb 2014 and wanted to try something a little different. We had planned to go to Ginza and Tsukiji in the next days. All I can say is wow.Mari met us at the met station and was amazingly hospitable from the start. Amazing spoken english also. We met up with another couple from New Zealand who were really pleasant also and went to her apartment.While a simple menu ( Because none of us knew where to start ) She was extremely attentive to detail and helped us create wonderful food. Would recommend for anyone travelling the main part of Tokyo.Kanpai!

Fresh and Delicious!. I actually attended two classes with Mari on the same day- one in the morning to learn to make tonkatsu, goma-ae and miso soup, and one in the afternoon to learn to bake. The class sizes were great and allowed for a lot of interaction with Mari for us to ask questions. While we were there she taught us about the different ingredients and how they came together to make the final product. In the break between classes she gave me directions to get down to the Tsukiji area so I could walk around and grab some ingredients. Overall, great class, great instructor and great atmosphere. I highly recommend it!

Great real-home Tokyo experience. Mari's cooking course was excellent. And even better that it was held in Mari's own home. Would recommend to anyone! Well worth it, and delicious!!Naomi and Claire, Sydney, Australia

Great class. Myself and my boyfriend visited this class during our 3 week trip to Japan from the UK.It was very well organised, with the recipes written clearly and ready as we arrived, along with all the ingredients we would use and the necessary equipment.It was a very intimate lesson of only four of us in Mari's small flat. We were made to feel very welcome by Mari who is brimming with knowledge about Japanese food and able to answer any question. She also gave us an interesting insight into cultural and social norms in Japan as we chatted over lunch.We just wished we could have had more say in the menu, as the beef stew we created was lovely but very similar to what we would make at home. Unfortunately this was selected by other guests who didn't turn up! Perhaps some sort of voting system could be introduced? Or after booking each guest / couple could chose from a two or three options? Thank you Mari!

well-organized cooking workshop. as a foreigner living in japan, I learned a lot from this cooking class. we prepared basic but very delicious foods. I strongly recommend Mari's cooking classes to everyone who wants to know japanese cousine.

Mari is the Queen of Fermented Foods. What a lovely evening we had with Mari. We discovered many of the secrets of miso which we will definitely be trying out at home. Her English is perfect and we felt very much at home with the other participants. We all pitched in to learn the dishes.Do think of taking the class when you still have time to shop for ingredients /implements you use at the class. We did this on our last day in Tokyo so misjudged the timing a little. Highly recommended

great night of home cooking. I took the class with my husband and 15 year old son and it was a treat for all of us. Mari spoke excellent English and offered a hands on lesson making delicious food andexplaining about things we didn't know at all like types of kelp and how choosing one over another affects flavored. We had an international group with us from the US, and others from Japan, Turkey and Canada. It was a very nice way to spend an evening and I can't wait to try Mari's recipes at home.

very heart warming class!. I am japanese who took one of my friend from turkey to the class. Even from japanese point of view, her explanation about food was very clear and understandable.And other guests was also nice and warm, so i am sure you gonna enjoy it!!!

A Great Night. We had a wonderful night with Mari in her home. She gave us a look into the world of delicious Japanese food. Mari showed and talked to us about cooking methods, ingredients, possible substitutes and alternatives. We learnt a lot about ingredients such as seaweeds, miso and konbu. Mari provided an informal atmosphere for our class and was a methodical teacher who gave good explanations and background information. We felt at home with Mari and her gentle and obliging manner made a pleasure of the whole experience. We left with the skills that enabled us to cook the recipes at home. She gave us copies of the recipes. Mari also gave us an incite into many aspects of Japanese life, including current issues faced by the Japanese. When we booked this cooking class from Australia, we wondered just how it would go! Mari was very communicative via email and was able to answer my questions and guide us in the choice of menu that would suit us. Mari's cooking classes are highly regarded and at present are being featured in Tokyo newspaper articles. We would highly recommend Mari's classes. Thank you Mari for a most fantastic evening and cooking class. Kaye, Ken, Oliver, Blair

Mari Magic. Cooking with Mari was an absolute delight; she is polite, helpful, knowledgeable and fun! Our class included 2 Australians, 1 Belgian, 1 Czech and the 2 of us from the UK (hope you all got home OK), considering we had never met previously we all got on well and enjoyed the class.We all shared the preparation of the miso, tofu and okonomiyaki and Mari explained everything along the way. It was a real surprise to us how important the quality of the ingredients are, and for me the miso soup was completely different to any I have eaten in a restaurant – normally I wouldn’t finish it. All the food we prepared and cooked was eaten, so a testament to Mari and the class – an enjoyable few hours.Access is via the simple and clear instructions Mari provides when booking the class - essentially meet at the subway station exit at the agreed time.Many thanks Mari.

Delicious evening with Mari!. Mari is a delightful, knowledgeable cook who taught us much about Japanese home cooking. It was interesting, as a tourist, to be in a real Japanese home and Mari made us feel very welcome. She has a wealth of knowledge and shared it with a gentle, thoughtful and detailed approach. Mari met us at the subway station, as she had emailed us, and it was just a few minutes walk to her home. There were 6 of us at the cooking class and Mari had everyone working on various parts of the prep. Prior to beginning she went over the entire menu, answering questions, which I really appreciated. It was nice to get a sense of the whole and how each dish fit together.Would highly recommend taking a cooking class from Mari!

Perfect!. Mari has well-organized this informal class. She gave informative and interesting details about history of the chosen dish and the ingredients. She is clearly passionate about cooking, and it was contagious! Over dinner, we also talked about Japanese culture and politics. Fantastic experience overall.p

A fantastic cooking class. Learning to cook with Mari was lots of fun and turned out to be one if the highlights of our trip. I would recommend this to anyone who is visiting Japan and wants to learn how to cook some traditional home cooked meals.

Great time at Mari´s place. Mari is an excellent host and cooking teacher. She waited for us at the agreed place. We felt immediately at ease with her and the other pariticipants (6 people in total, including us). Mari explained the recipes for all meals in detail and in a very interesting way and gave us a lot of insight into the Japanese way of life, traditions etc. We all participated in the preparation of all the meals, under Mari´s very kind instructions and guidance. What we cooked was very oichi (delicious) and I think that all of us had great time. I would definitely do a course with Mari again. Arigato daimas, Mari!

Cooking Japanesa!. What a fabulous introduction to traditional cuisine.Mari is passionate and knowledgeable and conveys her skills with gentle grace.We attended this course on the first day of our trip and thereafter were able to appreciate thesubtleties of a well made miso.A fun and rewarding activity.

Enjoyable and Friendly Japanese Cooking Class. This Japanese cooking class with Mari was one of the highlights of our nine day visit to Tokyo.We booked and paid for the class online in Australia before we left and it was easy to organise. Mari met us at the train station exit just a short distance from her unit. The class was small with only six of us - three from USA, one from France and two from Australia. Mari was very enthusiastic and friendly as she explained to us very comprehensively the background to the cooking ingredients and method for cooking. We all joined in preparing the meal as Mari showed how to deal with the ingredients. No real cooking knowledge is required and it was fun to use ingredients that were mostly unfamiliar to us.This background to Japanese cooking helped us throughout our stay in Tokyo because we could understand how some of the dishes were prepared and their ingredients. This is a great way to understand part of the Japanese culture with a lovely person like Mari in her unit.

Fun and great learning experience!. Had a very enjoyable evening at Mari's Cooking Class, learning how to make Sukiyaki, Okonomiyaki (Japanese Pancake), Spinach Salad, Dashi and Miso. Mari explained all kinds of things about the main ingredients used in Japanese cooking and the differences between them (various seaweeds and miso pastes for example). Had a lot of fun and the food tasted great! So much better than my own previous feeble attempt at Okonomiyaki ;-) For those interested, this is the website were you can make reservations. http://www.japanese-cooking-class-tokyo-mari.com/

Home cooking with Mari. Mari's class is really interesting. She gave us a really good insight into the food Japanese people eat at home, and how to make it yourself. Best of all, you get to eat a delicious meal!

Excellent cooking class!. Mari's cooking class was a lot of fun for my husband and I, and very informative. Mari explains how to make the dishes in your own home, how to find the ingredients, and where you can make substitutions if you can't find certain ingredients. She gives a great background on the dishes (history, how they are typically made) and the cooking explanation is thorough with lots of time to ask questions. You get hands on experience for how to make the dish yourself, and then you get to eat the delicious meal you've created. We loved this class! I can't wait to make the recipes in my own kitchen and I would love to take another one the next time we are in Japan.

Japanese home cooking at its best. Mari was a great teacher and host. She is personable and very attentive in her classes. Classes are small so you get the most out of it. Her English is A1, so I highly recommend this to all foreigners.

Interesting Cooking Class!!. I've learned a lot from her cooking class.... Mari is very nice and knowledgeable about food ...It's worth what you are paying for ! Wanted to learn more from Mari-san ... so I will join on her classes again :)

Great cooking class!. Delicious food taught in a fun and easy way! Mari is great and gives you some great advice and insights to japanese food culture. She even helped us with finding the right shops in Tsukiji for ingredients to bring back home. I strongly recommend this course for anyone with an interest in food and culture (which you should be visiting Tokyo)!

Great cooking class. This Japanese cooking class was awesome!!! We had a great menu planed with lots of different dishes. They are easy recipes and very different to the Western food. It was very interesting to talk about cultural environment and the life of everyday Japanese families. Mari is very kind and happy to help with further questions... We stayed 2 and an half weeks in Japan and this class was one of the big highlights for us!! And we did love Japan. I wished I had more time to do more classes with Mari.In a short sentence: We loved it!!! If you are in Tokyo go for it you won't regret it!! Joelle & Vic

Fantastic Class. My partner and I really enjoyed the cooking class. Mari had prepared a really good menu that allowed us to make and taste a good selection of things. She is very knowledgeable about food and was able to tell us a bit about how cooking differs from region to region. I've been inspired and I will make some of recipes at home.

Cook, learn and enjoy!. Very informative, genuine and also fun! Mari is sweet and very knowledgeable about Japanese cuisine - she answered all our questions and recommended restaurants/cooking books. Honestly, it was really relaxing as well. If you're into cooking, I recommend a cooking class with Mari.

Mari's cooking class. Mari's cooking class was one of my trips highlights. Mari did an excellent job explaining the recipe, its history, and the detail about how to execute it. More importantly she was able to answer any and all questions I had. I would recommend everyone to take a japanese cooking class, because unlike other cultures it's simpler than it looks. Mari is also a good source of information about things going on in the city. She directed me to temporary art exhibit entitled "The Art of Rice" which I found fascinating. So my second recommendation would be to take the course earlier in your travels, so you can get tips about great places to visit. Also book early as classes fill up fast.

Fabulous cooking class. My husband and I both loved this class. Marie was very friendly and knowledgeable - we made bento boxes with terriyaki chicken and miso soup - all delicious and we have successfully replicated them all back at home. It was lovely to have the class in her apartment, which is very centrally located - very close to the fish market - her friendliness and knowledge was also very helpful for other aspects of our stay in Tokyo. We highly recommend this class.

Wonderful Cooking Class. Mari did a great job showing us how to prepare a few Japanese dishes. Her knowledge in and beyond the kitchen was very helpful in for our stay in Japan and when we return home. We highly recommend you take her cooking class.

Cooking with Mari!. Such a wonderful experience! Mari is so kind and patient. Her home is very welcoming and she does a great job explaining the origin or the dish, interesting facts about the ingredients, and step-by-step directions for recreating at home. Her instructions are easy to learn and the food is delicious!!! I would suggest this to anyone who wants an authentic experience in the heart of Tokyo!

Wonderful. My wife and I cooked with Mari; Gyoza and Miso Soup (among other things) - I can honestly say I have had a lot of Miso Soup (a lot) and this was the best I have ever tasted - and I dont think I will ever taste Miso that good again. The Gyoza was great - never had it before, but making if and seeing how Mari cooked it was fantastic - from then on we used it as a standard to test all the other Gyoza we tried in Japan; we never had another Gyoza that good again.I dont see there is much point in repeating what everyone else had said - ie. her English is probably better than a lot of English speaking people. Needless to say, you will have a good time, go with the flow, have fun....

A great homely experience. Mari is an extremely friendly and welcoming instructor who was very informative. She shared a lot of good background knowledge regarding the ingredients, history and culture of Japan. She teaches easy to learn home-style japanese food which anybody can replicate at home.Being a few mins walk from the Tsukiji market means you can walk around and find some of the ingredients yourself after class. An enjoyable time and great way to get insider information from a real tokyoite!

Great experience!. Mari was a fantastic teacher telling us all about the ingredients and the complexities of miso. I higly recommend this class. My husband and I had a great time cooking, chatting and eating. Mari has introduced us to new food and we can't wait to get home and try them out on out friends in the UK. X Laura

Great experience!!. I had a great time with Mari's cooking class! She is a very friendly host and cooking teacher. She discussed the various ingredients with us and Japanese cooking techniques. Her recipes were also delicious and easy to cook, something that we can definitely try again at home. She was always attentive to everyone of us, and also very helpful in answering our questions on Japanese cooking. Was very amazed to discover that she makes miso at home herself! Mari has a wealth of knowledge on Japanese cooking and is very keen to share it with all visitors, would highly recommend going for her class!

Fun Experience!. I had a great time at Mari's class. Her class is a great way to meet other travelers and learn authentic Japanese home cooking. Mari is very helpful, a great teacher, and has a wealth of knowledge on food and cooking. At the beginning of the class, she went over the basic recipes and then went over the some variations we could do to change up the taste and style of the dishes. She showed us the different ingredients we'd be using and how each one affects the dish. We made katsudon, gyoza, sunomumo (picked vegetables), dashi soup, and miso soup. The recipes are very easy to follow and you can email her if you have any questions. Her food blog has a lot of Japanese recipes to follow. I would strongly recommend this class to anyone who wants to learn about Japanese cooking and culture.

Great Intro to Japanese Cooking. As a resident of Japan, I was looking for a class that could teach me about things I could actually make in my own kitchen. Mari Nameshida was not only able to tailor a class to my request (a miso-based menu), she provided an entire tutorial on miso to myself and my cooking partners so we better understood this classic Japanese ingredient. Mari's house is spacious enough for a group of people to cook in and her recipes are easy to follow. Mari's varied culinary knowledge and excellent English mean that she can answer nearly any question on Japanese food that you pose. This was a great experience and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a delicious experience in Tokyo.

Fantastic opportunity to learn about Japanese cooking (and culture). We attended Maris' cooking class in March and absolutely loved it.The location was great, as we met at a central subway station. Once at Maris' place, she gave us a brief introduction to the meals we had selected, and discussed the ingredients (and was particularly helpful in suggesting alternatives if certain things were not available in our home country)Following that, she led us through the preparation, whilst we chatted about life in Japan and she gave great advice about attractions we should attend whilst in Tokyo.Before too long, it was time to eat, and it was amazing. It's hard to believe how quick and easy it appeared to be to prepare restaurant quality food like this.This was one of our highlights in Japan, and if possible, I'd highly recommend attending this class at the start of your visit, as the advice and assistance mari is willing to offer is invaluable!

Wonderful time with Mari. My husband and I visited Tokyo last November and wanted to do something a bit different. We booked a night of cooking with Mari and couldn't have been more pleased. She has a beautiful, warm home, and we learned so much about Japanese cooking. We were even videotaped to be on a local, Japanese show. There was one other couple cooking with us, and it was very fun connecting with like-minded individuals. I also thought her pricing was very reasonable.
Interesting and fun. Great introduction to japanese cooking, made easy by Mari... went straight out and laid my hands on some good kelp and bonito flakes to try again at home...

Excellent and fun cooking class. We had a wonderful time with Mari understanding and cooking Japanese cuisine. She was patient and took the time to explain and answer all our questions. We had so much fun! It definately added to our experience in Tokyo. An absolute must when visiting Japan!
Friendly Mari. Helpful tips are provided during the whole class, extremely for for foreigners. And of course her English is really good, we learnt a lot for that single day. it is lovely :)

Get a taste of local life and food with Mari.. My husband and I spent a whole day with Mari, touring and shopping Kappabashi street for kitchen supplies and cooking at her home. Mari is really friendly, her English is great, and her mastery of Japanese cooking is obvious. Great experience for cooks and lovers of Japanese culture and food.

Fantastic cooking class plus great cultural experience. Mari is a truly wonderful and honest host and cook. We learned to cook some amazing Japanese dishes, helped along by Mari providing practical and helpful tips. The location is easy to get to by public transport. It was a highlight of our trip to Japan. Thanks Mari :)

dessert in Japan. Cooking with Mari was one of the highlights of my trip to Japan!I enjoy Japanese desserts and Mari helped demystify the process by explaining the ingredients (and acceptable substitutes ). I bake a lot, but she thought me a few new tricks and inspired me to get a cooking scale. Since our group was small, we were sent home with leftovers to share with our friends. There are a few english speaking Japanese cooking classes in Tokyo, but this was the only one I found where you could learn in someone's home. I enjoyed talking to Mari and the rest of our class about Japanese culture. Mari also talked me out of going to Jiro's sushi restaurant - apparently it is the only 3 Michelin star restaurant without a bathroom and the meal lasts 15 minutes???

A great experience that includes a glimmse in Japanese culture too. We booked a cooking session with Mari for seven of us. It was easy to organise per email before we went to Japan. She explained were to meet and all went very smooth. Mari does the cooking class at their home and we apprechiated to have the class in a private home. She explained the dishes and ingredient with much detail, then we cooked together the meal that tasted great. We learnt a little bit more about the Japanese culture and I would recommend Mari's cooking class. It is not cheap, but she uses quality ingredients and shared her passion for them with us.
learned in Japan- do it at home again. what a great experienc! We learned so much and now back at home we can do it again and again. Thats real great. Thanks so much Mari!

Mari is AMAZING!!!. What an incredible experience! Mari offers a cooking class in her home, much like Mom would show her older children so you can pass the traditions on. She not only shows us how to cook AUTHENTIC Japanese food, she explains the different types of foods/vegetables/seasonings for the different regions of Japan. She also helps explain WHY things are done a certain way AND how to avoid common mistakes that affect the flavor and texture of the dish. She was VERY patient and even tolerated our hijacking of the conversation from time to time. (Sorry) We were in Japan for 11 days and SERIOUSLY considered seeing if we could squeeze in a second class. Now I'm very eager to get back home to see if I can find some equivalants or options so I can make something similar back home. I also intend to see if I can schedule a LUNCH class with her on a future visit!! We did our class with 5 from our party. 3 adults and 2 teenagers. ALL enjoyed the experience! I felt like when we were done, not only had a learned a lot, I had made a friend in Japan! Thank you Mari (and husband) for sharing your home with us!
A Good Way to Learn Japanese Cooking. went to some of the Japanese cooking classes held by Mari. I love how she smiles while teaching how to cook sumptuous Japanese food. thumbs up!

Cooking class in tokyo. An excellent moment in tokyo at the cooking class.
I finally know how to cooking Gyoza, thanks to Mari who has been patient and Very helpful.
Classes were easy and well explained !
I will recommend it to friends.

Great cooking experience on our first trip into Tokyo!. My wife and I booked the cooking class about a week early. The first people to book the date get to make the menu you will be cooking, so I recommend you book early to insure you can plan something you want to learn how to cook. We did an evening class and cooked miso soup, potato cakes and dumplings. Although it wasn't our menu, it was very good and we enjoyed making and eating it. Mari took the time to explain different options for changing ingredients in the dishes to suit various tastes. We also got to meet some interesting tourists like ourselves.It was a fun time and one of the highlights of our snow filled visit to Tokyo!

Useful, enjoyable cooking class for food lover!. I always make different kinds of cuisine at home taking ref with recipes, tasted in restaurants. But, here with Mari, I got the authentic Japanese way of doing it and tasted the difference from skipping some ingredient I did! This is a very useful practical learning and great fun during the time with Mari and other participants. I have tried making all the dishes back at home and same delicious I would say. Can't miss it if you like cooking!

100% recommended!. Mari's class was just great. We got to choose the dishes we cooked and Mari was very accommodating. She was extremely knowledgable and welcomed us into her apartment. We had a great group with lots of good questions and amazing food! We had had tempura for dinner the night before but agreed that Mari's was better. If you love cooking and want recipes and techniques that you can use in your own home I would 100% recommend Mari's cooking classes, a really fantastic experience!

The Requisite Experience. This is the ideal experience for both short/long term residents and people on holiday. Mari hosts a Japanese cooking session that is, if one were to judge by the booking rate, highly popular. You will spend about three hours in her apartment with a few other eager students of Japanese cooking learning how to prepare for and cook one type of Japanese dish with some side dishes. The location is very easy to get to, as she lives directly next to a subway station (and will happily meet you there to guide you to her apartment for the class). She offers a listing of things she has covered in the past on her website (http://www.japanese-cooking-class-tokyo-mari.com/). The price point is exactly spot on, considering that it includes the meal that is prepared, and the amount of time that you receive instruction. You are able to walk away with a recipe in English for all the items that were prepared, along with any notes you chose to make during the session. She also welcomes photography at any point during the class. Mari is native Japanese, but owing to time spent in the US, is able to flawlessly offer all instruction in English. Another enjoyable aspect was the interaction with fellow students throughout and after the class. As my schedule allows, I will continue to utilize her services to explore the Japanese culture on a deeper level, as well as squeezing in some practice in speaking some Japanese. The environment caters well to the solo adventurer, the couple looking for something interesting to do, or the family looking to bond together. Two thumbs up!

Excellent class!. My partner and I loved our cooking class with Mari. One of the real highlights of our three week holiday to Japan! Mari pointed us in the right direction where to buy some ingredients to take back and we have already cooked with Mari's simple to use recipes now we have arrived home. We enjoyed the setting in Mari's home which just furthered the emphasis on Japanese home style cooking. Would recommend Mari's class to anyone no matter what level of cooking experience!

Great morning. I really enjoyed the morning with Mari. The class was at her flat near Tsukiji market and there were 6 of us attending.We made sushi rolls, miso soup and spinach shiroi. Mari spent lots of time explaining the different ingredients, e.g. the different types of miso, and gave us tips where to get them at the market. She was very knowledgeable and good at explaining everything.We were cooking at her home so it is also a chance for people to see a typical Japanese flat. But that also means that there isn't lots of space and we shared out the tasks. So for the Spinach shiroi, for example, one person ground the sesame, one person mashed the tofu, etc. and then we had one shared disk rather than everyone making their own version.I love cooking and learned a lot, I can really recommend it for anyone wanting to understand the subtlety of Japanese cooking a little more! It's probably not something for small kids or people who aren't very interested in cooking.

Great!. Mari´s class was phenomenal! We were so excited when we found the class on TripAdvisor and it was a definite highlight during our time in Tokyo. My cousin and I had been interested in Japanese cooking for some time and this was a perfect setting to experience it in. (So many cooking classes are commercialized and only offer a rudimentary foundation on sushi, which real sushi chefs study for years to master.) Mari´s class was much more informative and you come away with enough know-how to throw a little dinner party featuring delicious Japanese food! She was also incredibly responsive in helping us schedule our class and we were even able to cook what we had been interested in making. Couldn´t ask for a better cooking class experience! It´s a perfect way to get an inside glimpse at authentic Japanese cuisine. Highly, highly recommend! Five full stars!

Had a great day With Mari. Had a great day with Mari who was able to easily remove the mysteries of japanese cooking. Mari's relaxed and calm manner within a warm and welcoming environment helped to create an experience well worthwhile. She provided clear instructions while guiding us through each recipe, showing us techniques and explaining the background of the recipes. It was great to enjoy the spoils at the end of the session !!

Home cooking away at home with Mari. Do you love to experience different cultures? Do you love food? Double the delights in Tokyo and learn the secrets of Japanese home-cooking with Mari. A passionate cook, Mari speaks fluent English and loves to give tourists and visiting foreigners a hands-on opportunity to cook, check out ingredients, taste their handiwork and share tips on what’s good to eat and do in Tokyo and Japan.I found Mari’s class after I googled English-language classes in Japanese cooking. And Mari readily answered my email. After exchanges about my dates and her classes she found a vacancy and I booked and paid online. She meets her guests/students at her local train station before we walk together the 30 or so meters to her apartment. Mari is a warm and relaxed host and teacher. My fellow students were a young Australian couple visiting Japan for the first time and a young French woman recently moved to Tokyo. All four companions for the day were interesting, enjoyed sharing travel stories and loved food. My kind of people!Our host turned out to be a gifted teacher and engaging young woman. Taught to cook originally by her mother and grandmothers she kept the flame alive doing cooking courses throughout her training and subsequent professional career. After spending a year overseas to learn English Mari returned to Tokyo and established her niche cookery school based in her home concentrating on home-style cooking and regional specialities in Japanese cuisine for tourists and overseas visitors.We prepared a home-cooked meal of Okonomiyaki (Japanese pancakes), Imo-mochi (potato cake) and a dashi stock that we then used to prepare the most delicious Miso soup. All the easy-to-follow recipes were provided. Under Mari’s supervision and using her detailed notes we prepared the meal from scratch. Then we ate the delicious results together and Mari peppered the chatter with loads of information about Japanese ingredients and cooking methods and answered all our questions about the how and the why of food, cooking and dining in Japanese life.It was great fun, the best three and a half hours I spent in Tokyo and very reasonably priced.

Fun and friendly. My daughter and I took the cooking class with Mari. It was a great, fun activity to do together,and we met other people from other countries. It only took a few hours and Mari made it veryeasy. She will meet you at the station and walk with you to her home. She is completely bilingual, has lived abroad extensively and has a great open minded world view. The warm atmosphere of cooking in a home made the food and new friends we met even better. I will definitely recommend this class to my friends when they visit Tokyo.

Great cooking class!. The class started with Mari explaining us the difference between different ingredients and history of dished we will cook. Appart of great cooking experience, Mari really shared with us many real japanese culture, history and curiosities that would not be possible to learn in such a nice way.Really recommend cooking classes with Mari!

Very Good Course. Mari went out of her way to make the course extra special - I would really reccommend this to anyone visiting or living in tokyo who wants to experience REAL japanese cooking technique and excellent food.

Fantastic cooking experience. I took Mari's class last week. It was really nice to find a class in english which offered dishes you can actually make at home. Mari also teaches about where to find ingredients, and what is best to buy, which is so helpful when you live in Japan and can't actually make the difference between two miso pastes. Also as only few people can participate and it's at Mari's place, it doesn't feel like you are taking a class. I had a very good time, thank you Mari! Also you can choose which dish you want to make so you can go several times...

Homely and delicious Japanese cooking. Mari met us at the station and brought us to the kitchen. She showed us each ingredient so that we became familiar with them and explained their preparation. Being able to identify them at a local market is just as important. She had lots of useful tips and knowledge which won't be found in anywhere else. The recipes were simple but delicious and I was able to recreate them easily at home! She was a really patient teacher and I thoroughly enjoyed my class with her. A fantastic Japanese culinary experience!

Authentic Japanese cooking with a fantastic teacher. My partner and I took Mari's course earlier in January after finding out about it on Tripadvisor. We had limited time in Tokyo and took the class on two separate occasions, learning how to cook Sushi, Miso and Sukiyaki. Mari has an incredible wealth of knowledge and recipes of which she was more than happy to share with us. What I was really impressed with was the fact that we could choose our own dishes to make. We were also made to feel welcome in her home and had a lot of fun. I would strongly recommend this class if you have a little time in Tokyo and are travelling alone or in a small group.

MARI NAMESHIDA MAGIC!. I am a Hong Kong Chinese, your proverbial 'Wannabe Home Cook' with a mission to achieve 10 cooking experience around the world since retirement 5 years ago, starting with Le Cordon Bleu back in 2009. Japanese culinary discipline is high on my list and I was privileged to experience Mari Nameshida's Magic first hand, in November last year. Googling for cooking instructions in English landed me with Sensei's web site, as well as TripAdvisor's pages and the rest is history. I convinced her to take me on a 2-week Intensive Course ie 6 hours a day x 12 days to learn the rudiments of Japanese cuisine. I was elated when Sensei said 'yes' after reading my blog - http://tangcancook.blogspot.com - which reaffirms my interests and commitment. The course was a roaring success, exceeding my expectations across all fronts. From basic cooking methods, to Washoku, to regional cuisines, to Yoshoku, to Kaiseki ... Sensei was able to give me a grand tour of not just the 'how' in preparing Japanese food, but the 'why' from both the cultural and sub-cultural angles. Best yet was the 1-on-1 platform, just Sensei and myself, teaching and learning the best of Japanese comfort foods, in a well equipped kitchen at her home. One cannot get more homely and more genuine than that, and it was sheer magic. This unique experience, so different from the cooking schools I attended, has put me on a different plane as I continue my quest. How would I describe my sojourn : steep learning curve, accelerated appreciation of Japan as a nation and the Japanese as a people, helicopter view of Japanese cuisine, professionalism that matches any proper school, bestowed confidence to cook when I am back home in Hong Kong, with depth and breadth since. How would I describe Sensei : a true professional, a charming personality, a genuine people person, a global player with a strong sense of identity, an untiring teacher who engages her students but above all, a fun individual who one can spend hours and hours with. Whether you are single, or a couple, or a family, or like me a Wannabe I bet Sensie can, and will, custom-tailor a program to meet your specific needs. That much I can guarantee, why? It is because I was there, I have done that, and I have nothing but the best to say about the NAMESHIDA MAGIC!

Great Home cooking class with an enthusiastic chef. My kids and I had a really great time learning some basic and some more complicated Japanese recipes with Mari. Her great English made the instructions easy to follow and she was really passionate about what she was teaching. We enjoyed the background stories that accompanied the cooking and the dining tips while we shared the meal that we'd created. Can't wait to go back and try some more dishes.

Great food, worth to try it. Excellent cooking classes, love the food, love the experience of cooking with Japanese ingredients. Mari's knowledge make me understand more about the food Japanese culture. Totally worth it! And Mari is great!

Best cooking class in Tokyo. We had a very great time with Mari. Everything was well explained and we had all the information we needed to start cooking the dishes back at home. Mari is nice, friendly and very professional. We all shared the food we made. It was delicious. I would recommend this experience at any time and to anybody.

Lovely. What a wonderful way to try your hand at Japanese cooking. Mari's knowledge really helped us understand Japanese cooking and ingredients. We cooked Sakana no Nanban duke ( marinated fish), Imo mochi ( potato cake), and Miso soup from Dashi stock. All the dishes were very tasty.

Great home cooking class in Tokyo. Mari's cooking class was a great experience for us - an authentic insight into Japanese culture. We learned to prepare a delicious meal with clear explanations, tipps and tricks and background information on Japanese cuisine and eating habits. We had great fun! Highly recommended!

A valuable eye opening cooking experience with Mari. Signing up for cooking lessons with Mari was the highlight of my trip to Tokyo. Having taken other cooking lessons in Japan, Mari's cooking lessons were by far the best. Her recipes are very detailed and she explains everything clearly. Mari is an enthusiastic cook with a friendly personality. She makes you feel right at home. She loves food and knows a lot about cooking. Not only does she teach you how to cook, but she is also very organized, insightful and knowledgeable about the background behind each dish She also takes cooking lessons in her free time and has created some of her own recipes. You won't regret it if you sign up for a cooking lesson with Mari. Definitely a valuable eye opening cooking experience. Highly recommended! (^_^)!June

Accessible, friendly and user friendly cooking class in Tokyo. I had a wonderful experience in the home of Mari who speaks great English, is very good with groups of people and is a great teacher. We cooked an excellent meal of sukiyaki, potato mochi, Gyoza and dipping sauces. The food was delicious, the lesson very well presented and the venue comfortable and easy to get to. It was very affordable and excellent value. highly recomended.

If you enjoy about cooking you should just visit her. Mari is nice shared so many tips about baking for me . Also she can speak eng and Chinese as well .I hope I can have another classes in someday . Really enjoyed spending time in her class .I will be back

The best!!!!. If you visit Tokyo and like to cook, and are intrigued by Japanese cooking styles, a class with Mari should be on your "must do" list. The class in in Mari's kitchen. She is a wonderful cook and a great teacher. Our evening was like visiting a friend for dinner and then cooking in the friend's kitchen while enjoying the company and the food, and all while learning the techniques. Thanks Mari!

Japanese cooking class...super exciting!. It has been a great pleasure to experience this course because Mari showed me not only the recipes and how to prepare them in detail but also the history and tradition behind each ingredient and flavor....I could not choose a better way to get closer to the Japanese culture!

Great experience, you should do this!. Mari hosted an awesome cooking class at her apartment in Tokyo. Not only did we learn a ton about the specifics of how to cook the dishes on the menu, she also taught us a lot about the background of all the ingredients involved and general insight into Japanese culture.Highly recommended!

Fun, interesting, and delicious!. Mari graciously accommodated 7 of us for a class as we traveled through Tokyo and it was such a great experience! We all got to participate in the preparation and cooking of our meal, and she explained information about the ingredients and traditional Japanese cooking methods and techniques in a very easy to understand way. The whole experience was very personal and intimate, it felt like we had all known each other for a long time, and previous to the class she asked about any diet restrictions or allergies in our group so that she could prepare a menu that suited our group.Mari offers a unique class that gives non-Japanese cooks a great chance to get to see and understand the simple, yet precise methods used. The personalized lesson and meal were beyond what we expected and Mari herself is so kind, warm and fun! I highly recommend booking a class if you are in Tokyo for any amount of time!

Do not tell your friends you went to Mari's!. I really appreciated Mari's lesson. I spent 2 weeeks stay in Tokyo in November 2013 and decided to start my week end on staruday lunch by taking japanese cooking lesson. The Miso soup and Dashi soup are really the Basics for the japanese cuisine. We learnt how to use them with several recelies. We cooked and cut a fresh fish. Mari's is a great professor and share her passion for japanese cooking. Really a great time that ends by sharing the food with the other students. And if you have time, the fish market is far away from Mari's home. You can buy the key ingredients for cooking at home. I recommend to plan this activity if you wish to discover the Japanese culture.

A highlight of our trip. Mari's class was both really informative and fun. After enjoying so many Japanese dishes in restaurants, it was really good to learn a little about what goes into the preparation. Mari explained the basics of making dashi (basic stock) and how to choose the ingredients, which should be helpful in making many dishes besides the few we learned. My boyfriend and I had fun cooking and also having dinner with Mari and the other three people in the class. Mari was very nice and was wonderful in answering our questions about Japanese food and culture. Definitely recommended!

Great thing to do while in tokyo. This was great thing to do while I was staying in Tokyo. It was just me and one other girl and we made sukiyaki, miso soup and also japanese spring rolls. The food was delicious and I finally tried eating sukiyaki with a raw egg and it wasn't too bad actually!! Over all it was a fun thing to do and Mari is very nice and welcoming.

Learning Japanese Culture Through Food. Although I have been living in Japan for many years, I don't really know how to cook Japanese dishes, so I decided to sign up for a class with Mari. We cooked a mackerel dish, miso soup and egg custard pudding. Mari explained us about the ingredients, different types of miso and kelp, seasonal veggies etc.I used to think that cooking Japanese dishes would be difficult, but all the recipes are hassle-free and easy to recreate with different ingredients. Mari is a great teacher. She is very patient, attentive, polite and always made sure we understood the cooking process and answered all our questions. We also met her husband and he was also very nice and welcoming. They are a great couple. Mari's class was a wonderful experience and I will definitely go back to learn more dishes.

HIghly Recommended. My husband and I spent an evening with Mari learning the subtle intricacies of sushi making and other dishes. It sounds so simple but in fact we learned, for example, that there are many types of rice and that the tools for making the rice are as crucial to the quality as the ingredients. As we ( there was also a family of 4 that joined us) worked together in her comfortable apartment close to the Tsikiji Fish Market, we were also exposed to the nuances of the culture reflected in its food. We very much enjoyed Mari's hospitality and her excellent instruction. Next time we visit we would love to have Mari take us on a tour of the Tsikiji Market to point out the varieties of rice, soy sauce, tools, and quality of fish we talked about it during the class.

Tokyo. So beautiful country , We lucky to be there for the sakura season. No stress in country even life go at 100km/h.. Poeple was good and smiling , but just not too much poeple speack english...We eat very good sushi and different food :) Buetifull temple and many place to visit. Tokyo was one of my favorite capital in the world.I will go again soon

Authentic experience in Tokyo. We were in Tokyo for a mere 3 evenings and chose to have our last meal as a cooking class with Mari prior to our late night flight from Haneda back to the US. What a treat! Booking rather last minute, we were subject to prior choices from other guests in terms of meal choice, but for this evening we made: Chirashi Sushi, Miso Soup (including the stock) and Imo-Mochi (potato cakes). Food was delicious and the education was outstanding! Having grown up in Hawaii, I was well exposed to Japanese foods and such, but learning true technique was priceless. I realized after all these years of making miso soup that I had been doing in incorrectly. Mari showed us how to make the dashi broth from scratch and how to incorporate the miso properly as well as the numerous inclusions you can add to your soup to make it tailored to your flavor preferences and ingredient availability. Mari met us at the subway stop, which was quite literally 19 seconds to the door of her building. We were staying somewhat nearby at the Conrad and opted to walk to her place as we had time after our checkout at 4pm in advance of our 4:30pm meeting time. The class took a good 3-3 1/2 hours during which we conversed with Mari and our co-cookers and sipped on tea. Mari's home gives a glimpse into the authentic living quarters of day-to-day Tokyo citizens and seeing this is priceless. We did a similar experience in Shanghai and loved all aspects! The meal preparation was well-organized and Mari had all the ingredients for us to prep and cook. I was amazed at the Imo-mochi... super simple in context and very delicious! The chirashi was top-notch as was the tuna she provisioned for us... it was so silky yet firm and delicate in flavor. Amazing! Having been to the fish auctions earlier in the day, it brought about a sense of completion seeing the product at market and prepping it in a home. Mari was very graceful and welcoming and we learned about the culture of Japan, living in Tokyo and the nuances of the cuisine. I have it on my list to make homemade dashi and a proper, simple miso soup as winter nears in Southern California. Thank you for a great evening and forever memorable experience!

Delicious and a cultural experience you can keep!. Cooking with Mari was fun and I learned a lot. Being new to Japan, I wasn't familiar with how to cook traditional Japanese home foods. Now that I know a bit more, my long-term stay here will be healthier and cheaper! Mari customized the meals so they were suitable for vegetarians. She was very inviting and I felt welcomed in her home. I'll definitely be going back, and honestly recommend her classes.

Excellent Japanese Cooking Experience!. Cooking with Mari was a highlight on our trip through Japan. Selecting our own meals, having the chance to learn how to cook them by ourselfs of a very skillfull cook and enjoy a nice lunch afterwards truly lighten up our day.Everyone who wants to learn to cook something japanese while they're in Tokyo, should not hesitate to visit this Cooking Class! :)

Great cultural activity in Tokyo. My sisters and I really enjoyed Mari's cooking class. We found her information on Tripadvisor and e-mailed her to make a reservation. She got back to me quickly and answered a few questions about payment (yen paid at the end of the class) and ingredients. She was very accommodating and selected dishes that didn't include shellfish since we had one person in our party that was allergic. The class size is small, six people max I think, so it was intimate and everyone could participate. We enjoyed the explanation about ingredients typically used in Japanese cooking. The class is in her apartment, which is nice like cooking with a friend. Her husband came home from work so we got to meet him too and share our meal together. They were both very friendly and spoke English very well. We learned about different miso pastes and seasonal ingredients for garnishes with your soup. Making the dashi (soup base made with seaweed and dried bonito flakes) is simple and I've used her recipe already to make miso soup at home. I've used the powder dashi in the past and the flavor difference is noticeable. Making your own dashi gives you a mild, yet smoky flavor. We had a potato cake side dish (a regional dish from her hometown and not normally served/seen in Tokyo...what a treat!) and simmered Japanese eggplant and chicken main dish. All the dishes were so delicious! Before leaving Japan, I picked up some of the soy sauce and seaweed she used from the basement food floor at Takashimaya and packed them in my suitcase.
So fun and delicious!. Mari was super sweet and a good teacher! The food we made was delicious. I'd definitely come back next time I'm in Tokyo! Arigatou gozaimasu! Oishii deshita!

We recommend Mari's class. We participated in Mari's Japanese Cooking Class. The class was both fun and very informative. We not only learned how to make Imo-mocha (potato cakes), miso soup and gyoza (dumplings), but there was good conversation with Mari and our other classmates about Japanese culture and food; along with other's experiences of Japan. There are a number of things that stand out about the class. First it's in Mari's home, so it has the atmosphere where you learning from a friend in her home. Second, Mari's focus is to teach meals that everyday Japanese cook in their home, something any student (who knows there way around a kitchen) would feel confidant in creating back home. Third, the small class size gives you plenty of opportunities to ask questions about what you are creating or general advice about Japanese cooking. Last, its a value, the class fee is very reasonable, especially for the whole experience. We highly recommend Mari's class. Next time we are in Japan, we plan to take her class again to learn something new.

Learn all about sushi and miso soup. If you're interested in cooking and food, do participate to one of Mari's cooking classes! Not only will she give you the best recipes, she also explains how to cut the ingredients, she'll tell you all about typical japanse ingredients or cookingware, and you can even have a glass of her homemade plum juice. For me it was a wonderful experience, and if you have to choose between this or a karaoke night: you won't get any closer to japanese lifestyle than during this cooking class. A final advice: take a cooking class before you plan to go to the Tsukiji market, so you'll know what to buy at the market :-)

Great cooking class. We attended one of Mari's cooking classes in September 2013 during our honeymoon in Japan and had a wonderful evening. We didn't have a special wish so Mari chose something for us, a local dish from the Hokkaido region. Cooking with her was great and we learned a lot about Japanese food and culture. The dish itself was delicious. At the end Mari provided us with some excellent recommendations for (hidden) restaurants in Tokyo which we could not have found without her! We would highly recommend her cooking class for couples or single travellers.

If you do one non-sightseeing thing in Tokyo choose this. Whether you are a talented or novice cook this is a great class and experience, plus a chance to meet other people visiting/living in Tokyo. Mari is incredibly hospitable and able to pass on lots of advice both about Japanese cuisine and life in Japan. Would highly recommend it for anyone!

100% good. Mary class was good and interesting at the same time , she is knowledgable about Japanese food and culture , so your learning is wider than a normal cooking class . Hope you enjoy the class as much as I did .

Fantastic evening!. Our family really appreciated this evening. It was nice to meet Mari and visit her home. The cookingclass was well organized and the whole family got things to do. Mari is such a nice person and she gave is a lot of information about Japaneese cooking bit also tips of things to do in Tokyo! I would really recommend this to everyone visiting Tokyo!

A Wonderful Cooking Class and Unique Cultural Experience. Okay, foodies, you've sampled the best sushi Tokyo has to offer, done a traditional Japanese Kaiseki dinner, eaten Udon and Soba noodles, as well as Okonomiyaki, and sampled the modern fare this bustling metropolis has on offer, but what do Japanese eat at home and how do you cook it when you return? Look no further than Mari's course. Mari is an expert cook, has flawless English and a warm and inviting personality. From the basics of Japanese cooking to hands on practice and introduction to Japanese culinary traditions, Mari has it covered and more. You'll return home with solid knowledge and a collection of recipes to boot. Her home and the course are centrally located in Tokyo and convenient to the subway. Our evening with Mari was literally the highlight of our trip, and I cannot give her course enough praise.

Very authentic and delicious. Mari's home is easy to reach, as she lives literally right next to the subway exit, where she picked us up. She's very fluent in English, as she's been living in the US before, so all communication was no problem. During the class we were 5 + Mari, which was just the best size of the group. She evenly distributed the little tasks of preparations among the group members. We were preparing Miso Soup, eggplant with miso sauce, and various kinds of tempura. The set up was very thorough, and we all got a hand out with detailed descriptions of the dishes. We first introduced ourselves and got to know each other a bit before we started cooking. The actual cooking was fun and very interesting, with a lot of insider tips, as Mari used to cook together with her mom a lot and later took various classes by herself. I'm looking forward a lot now to putting into practice at home, what I've learnt during the class. I can strongly recommend Mari's classes, and will definitely join again next time I come to Tokyo.

Japanese home cooked dishes with Mari. I had two sessions with Mari and it was great, even one was 121 on Buri Daikon, Nasuno Hukumeni and lots of extra that she pampered me!Useful tips and all her experiences are shared with us openly.She is very friendly too.I was previously wondering what ingredients are used and how it is done.....:-)

Excellent introduction to Japanese cooking. Our class with Mari was a thorough introduction to the essentials of Japanese cooking. Our entree that day was gyoza, a fried (then, steamed, as I found out!) dumpling. They were delicious and we've been able to make them at home with her recipe. Her knowledge of cooking in general is very impressive and the class setup allowed for a bit of time to chat with the other guests; it's not all rush-rush-rush! If I'm back in Tokyo I think I'll take another class.

Easy and delicious!. My parents and I took a lunch time class with Mari in mid October. We had so much fun learning the dishes she taught and they were super delicious! Mari is very knowledgable and easy to talk to. We had a glimpse of the Japanese home life, seeing her in her apartment. A definite must do for tourist interested in the Japanese culture or foodies who wanna take home a slice of Japanese home cooking. I will definitely be back for more lessons with Mari in future.

One of the best things we did in Tokyo!. My adult son and I planned a lunch-time class with Mari in mid-October and had a wonderful experience! Her apartment is easy to access. She is a delightful young woman, who made us feel very comfortable throughout the session. (And she accomodated us arriving late due to typhoon-related train outages!) We both learned a lot and had a delicious meal. Our class had a total of 6 participants, a number easily accomodated in Mari's kitchen. I totally agree with another reviewer's comments about feeling far less intimidated by some Japanese indgredients (such as kombu, bonito and miso) after the class. I am planning to pick up "supplies" at an Asian grocery in the states this week, so that I will be able to prepare some of the dishes that we made in our class at home. I hoping that my husband will be on the next Japan trip so that I can take him to one of Mari's classes. Thanks Mari!

Personal, fun experience. My husband and I had so much fun meeting Mari, getting to ask her anything we wanted about Japanese culture, seeing her Tokyo apartment and cooking up a feast. We learned about new ingredients and techniques and ate our way through the evening. It was wonderful, and I highly recommend this class!

Delicious vegetarian Japanese cooking class. We took 2 classes: vegetarian dishes and japanese sweets. Mari has delicious and easy to make recipes and accommodated to our dietary preferences. On our next visit to Tokyo we definitely would like to take cooking class with Mari again!

Delicious and Awesome!. We joined Mari on Friday for some delicious Japanese eggplant and chicken dish. (among many other side dishes!) In total we were a group of six people, all very friendly and open-minded. Mari, the host, is lovely and very patient in explaining all the details of Japanese cuisine! She is also very interested in European cooking and so we could also contribute a little with our knowledge of this. The class is suitable for people of all cooking skill levels! For me as an sort of "intermediate" it was great. It was one of the best night out here in Tokyo.

Japan ese cooking class with mari. mari was very effective an d accomodating. it is a big plus that she can converse fluently in english which makes it easier for us to understand and appreciate the course. the whole course was very interesting and indeed i got the basics i needed to develop one of the recipes here commercially. mari can still be very helpful even beyond the class schedule. i love japanese food and would want to learn more so i can do some at home. please keep the course going. whether for personal or business the course will do very well for any participant. whenever i go nto japan a cooking course will always be part of my schedule. thank you for this opportunity

Recommended. 1) Mari is accommodating. I had our daughter with us and we went through the lesson hassle free even though we had to change poo poo and pee pee twice.2) The recipes are simple with great results. I am genuinely surprised how good the food taste.3) Overall explanation of food profile is excellent.4) Subjective - I was with a wonderful group of 3 other strangers who made the night of learning even more interesting. It turned a cooking lesson into a delightful social gathering.All in all, if you have no clue on cooking, this is the place to be in. If you are a avid chef looking to be inspired with Japanese cooking, Mari does the job with ease with her in-depth knowledge.Thumbs up for a return lesson in future :)

Fantastic introduction to Japanese cooking. My cooking class with Mari was really a great introduction to Japanese cooking. We prepared Gyoza (dumplings), a sort of custard and Miso soup (I had never thought it was prepared with dry fish !). Mari is very nice and explains everything very well. Great !

A great insight. I love Japanese food but it always somehow felt inaccessible (tofu, seaweed, miso etc.). Admittedly I had no idea what miso is until this class. Mari's style is not inhibiting. She's gentle, softly spoken and somehow that inaccessible world , along with its ingredients, come to life thanks to her approach. I'd recommend her class to anyone who wants an insight into what ultimately is the best cuisine in the world. Thanks for a soft landing Mari !

Fabulous fun and absolutely delicious food!. I first took a cooking class with Mari in March 2013 when my mom was visiting me in Tokyo. We had such a wonderful time that I took my mother-in-law and great-aunt during their visit in September. Again, Mari outdid herself! She is incredibly kind and warm, welcoming you into her home as if you are an old friend, while also telling interesting stories about traditional Japanese cooking as well as her own life. The food we made was absolutely delicious and Mari is such a good teacher that I was able to make all the dishes from both classes on my own at home. Mari has definitely helped me expand my repertoire of Japanese dishes. She also provides a copy of all the recipes, making it easy to make the dishes again once back in your own kitchen. We had a wonderful time and I'd highly recommend Mari's cooking class to anyone and everyone!

Fun and cultivating cooking class. My trip to Tokyo started beautifully with a cooking class with Mari Sensei.In a group of 4 people, we had the chance to talk about food and also culture, as she explains a lot of little techniques that normally you wouldn't learn in books.I have learned a few basic fundamentals on Japanese cooking and she made it look so easy and fun at the same time. I recommend this cooking class for those who indulge in Japanese culture and food at the same time. A must.

Fun cooking class. I had such a nice time with Mari and also my fellow travellers in August. The food we cooked was simple, traditional home style japanese, and delicious :) It was so nice to be invited into her home and to exchange cultures with each other, and also the others taking the class who were from France.Definitely worth it, such a nice way to end my trip, thanks Mari!

Lovely authentic japanese cooking class. During our recent time in Tokyo, we attended a 3 hour cooking class at Mari's home in Tokyo. The small class size and cooking in someones home made the experience very unique and Mari cared a lot about teaching us the basic fundamentals of Japanese cooking that can then be adapted and used in a variety of dishes - I genuinely felt that we learnt something! Mari speaks fantastic english and shared with us a lot of family history and what its like to live in Tokyo. We have a lovely evening and would highly recommend this experience to others. Thanks Mari.

Delicious and healthy Japanese cooking. My mother-in-law visited me in Tokyo, where I live, and Mari's class gave us some great and authentic recipes and a warm, memorable experience. Mari's warm and pleasant personality make the cooking class fun, and she sets a friendly tone that helps the students quickly establish a nice rapport. Mari's English is superb and she gives interesting background and anecdotes along with her recipes and techniques.
