tokyo tales. on my recent trip to Japan (my third) I had a great night cooking with Mari and felt privileged to be able to experience this in her home. this visit I only had time to do one night class but, on the strength of that experience, next time I will book in for a week of intensive cooking with her. we all had a lot of fun and learned a lot also. I would have no hesitation in recommending her service to anyone. thank you Mari! g

I loved learning how to make sukiyaki!. My Husband and I went to Japan for our honeymoon. One of our highlights was the cooking class we took with Mari. We learned how to make yummy sukiyaki (one of my husbands favorite Japanese foods). We also learned a couple of appetizers. Everything was so tasty- I was impressed with my cooking skills after the class. Since we returned home a couple of weeks ago, we have made sukiyaki 3 times already. Thank you Mari for such an amazing experience!

Loved the Cooking Class!. Having been to Tokyo before I was looking for something "off the beaten path." Since I love cooking and trying new things, I was in search of a cooking class and Mari was a great choice. From the time I first emailed Mari, she was pleasant, responsive and helpful. Location, food choice, and other attendees were all great. There were 2 women from Barcelona and a young man from Seoul - but living in San Francisco that attended the class. I think Mari gave the person who contacted her first the menu option - which was definitely ok with me. We made miso soup, grilled eggplant with sweet miso sauce and deep fried mushroom with mackerel. She even bought 5 mackerel to give each of us a chance to filet it. The class was completely hands-on, everything made from scratch, and a great learning experience.The menu is something I will definitely try at home. I just wish I had more recipes!It was a very pleasant evening in Mari's home meeting other people with different backgrounds.If I get the chance to go to Tokyo again, I will definitely take another class. Thank you Mari for making my last stop in Tokyo a great one! I even made it back to Narita without any problems...

"Learning japanese gastronomy with Mary". I did an intensive cooking class with Mary. She approached me to japanese culinary culture and general culture with a deep knowledge of both occidental and oriental ways of living, knowing before hand what were my preferences on food and tastes that would work for my palate and anyone from Europe i would cook japanese food after my lessons with her. It didn't stop her at teaching me traditional japanese food not world wide known, which involved loads of surprises and fun. She is a lovely, very cultivated young lady who keeps attending cooking classes herself to keep renewing her knowledge. A passion for cooking is carried in the family, I had the great opportunity of meeting them and shown how to make real soba from scratch by her father. If you are planning on attending an intensive course, it would be an appreciated effort that you could guide her on what you would like to learn, so she would have an idea of your preferences. Overall, she taught me a lot and we had much fun, and she became not just a teacher, but a friend. I travelled to Japan on my own and she offered me help on any trouble I had, Showing that special kindness that her and japanese people carries within them.

Holiday highlight. Highly recommend this as something to do in Tokyo. A 5-10 minute walk from Ginza. Mari invites you into here apartment with a group of 6 in total.Mari takes you through some of the basics of japanese cooking and talks you through some of the principles. Everyone gets involved in the course and the preparation of the food then you huddle round Mari's stove and watch here work her magic. My wife and I were with two other couples we did not know and still had a great time. As we were first to book we were asked if we had a preference of what we wanted to cook but we asked Mari to chose and she did not disappoint.Can recommend highly enough.

The ultimate host. An amazing experience and great food. Mari was the ultimate host, welcoming us into her home teaching us about food, her culture and life in Japan. Her English was so impressive it wasn't funny! The good we cooked were family recipes which made the experience all the more impressive and she took the time to explain how different prefectures cook with subtle differences. If you are a chef, the class probably won't amaze you but as someone who juts loves food I really enjoyed it. Her husband came home early and ate with us and together they really provided a great, warm and social experience. Se also shared tips on places to shop and things to do which as a tourists I would have otherwise missed.

Fantastic experience. I took the cooking class with Mari and it was a very good experience. In her cozy house, we learnt traditional japanese dumpling and proper way of making miso soup. Her introduction was so clear and informative. The cooking class was not just only on food but also a detailed explanation on japanese culture. Mari's english is perfect. The food finally came very delicious. And I can even cook japanese food in my home country. I would strongly recommend this cooking class and a must-do experience if you visit tokyo.

A very good experience !. We took a cooking class with Mari and it was very great! The cooking class take place in mari's house, so it was very friendly and convivial ! the cooking was delicious !!! we loved very very much ! So I definitely recommend this cooking class !

Wonderful Japanese cooking experience. My husband and I were welcomed into Mari's home where we learnt how to make sushi and delicious miso soup from scratch. We learnt a little about the Japanese culture as well as lots of tips when cooking Japanese dishes. We highly recommend this class to anyone visiting Tokyo. Mari thank you so much for your warm hospitality. It is such a wonderful holiday memory!

Very interesting and rewarding culinary experience. A friend and I visited Mari recently whilst we were backpacking round Tokyo. This class was an excellent introduction to Japanese home cooking (and home life to some extent). The class was casual and friendly in style, and we managed to learn much about Japanese cooking culture.After cooking Oyako-don, vegetable tenpura and of course Miso soup we all sat down to eat our hard work. Mari was a wonderful host, made us feel very much at home and gave us much incite many different kinds of Japanese food whilst we were preparing our dishes. I would highly recommend this class for anyone visiting Tokyo with even just a slight interest in food. It really was a rewarding experience!

Mochi class. Mari is the best, she was very informative! She gave us tips and advices for the food that we were preparing. She even gave us other variations of mochi and also the best ingredients to get and where to get it. It was very comfortable at her house and she made us feel welcomed and relaxed. It's the best of home cooking! We will definitely come back and would also recommend Mari to everyone!

Homemade Japanese cuisine made easy. For starters, Mari left us spoilt for choice with a wide menu variety to choose from. Our group of 4 had a great time learning about the Japanese cuisine from Mari. Her steps were simple and clear, making it easy even for the non-cooks in our group. We made the best tasting Katsu don and goma tofu ever! It dispels the notion that Japanese food is hard to prepare. Mari is nice to talk to and also generous in sharing cooking tips, additional recipes and knowledge on Japanese cuisine beyond the dishes we chose. The whole session was a pleasant and cosy affair. I definitely recommend this class if you are a fan of Japanese food and want to learn more about Japanese cooking style and kitchen essentials!

Highlight of my vacation. This cooking class is not to be missed. I've never been an especially good cook, and was nervous about having to show my lack of skills to strangers, but Mari created such a comfortable, friendly environment. She is very patient, helpful, and happy to give all kinds of information on cooking, recipes, and life in Japan. In my class, she taught us how to go from fish straight from the market to eating it minced with chopsticks. Cleaning, filleting, deboning, everything. And it was easy! I can't wait to replicate the recipe for my friends. Did I mention that everything was incredibly delicious? I will 100% be taking another class when I return to Tokyo.

Making Japanese Homemade food!!!. One of the best experience we had during our family vacation!!! Mari is a wonderful person who makes you feel welcomed in her nice home environment! Her cooking classes are very simple and fun to take not only for adults but also for kids!!! Making amazing homemade food that whole family is able to participate as well as taking the best memories and recipes back home, I guarantee will stay with you forever!!!!!!

Excellent cooking class. Both my wife and I had a great time at Mari's! The cooking class was comprehensive, informative and easy to follow. It definitely felt like we were learning the authentic Japanese cuisine. I highly recommend this class to anyone interested in Japanese food and expanding their horizons as a home chef.

Very pleasant and interesting cooking lesson. We had a great time learning Japanese cooking with Mari. She taught us the dashi soup which is at the basis of many recipes like miso soup and katsudon which we cooked after. We also prepared goma-tofu which is hard to find in restaurants. We had very interesting discussions with Mari and with the other participants.We would have taken more lessons if we have had the opportunity (but we had our lesson just before leaving Japan).

Wonderful Mari. My 16 year old daughter and I traveled throughout Japan seeing incredible sights and meeting wonderful people. However, none made us feel as welcome as Mari. Her cooking class was informative and fun. We would recommend anyone taking the time to meet her while eating some wonderful food in the process.

A look inside the japanese kitchen.. Attended a cooking class by Mari last year. I realy enjoyed it. She made everything easy, no fuzz, just home made cooking that felt like this is how she makes it for herself. She explained everything good, and gave tips of what to do, and what not to.The recipies followed me home, and have given me good memories of japan.

This is a must stop if u r interested in cooking.. Berni, our two kids at 11 n 12 and I went to Tokyo in June. We decided to take a Japanese cooking lesson n berni found miss mari thru the web. We met miss mari one rainy morning at a subway station n went to her apartment for the lesson. We learnt to make potato cake, miso soup n Japanese Gyoza. Miss mari's receipes r simple, thorough n easy to learn. It was a lot of fun. Our kids love it n we ate all the food afterwards. We Hv been home for two months already n we Hv at least practiced 3 times food we learnt fm miss mari. Our friends enjoyed it n we r so proud of it. I wd recommend miss mari to anyone who is interested in Japanese cooking n take her lesson when they visit Tokyo next time.

Cooking Tempura with Mari in Tokyo. My boyfriend and I took this cooking class and we really enjoyed it! It was the first cooking class we ever took, but it wasn't too difficult, because Mari explained everything very good. Also her recipes are easy to understand, so that we can now cook Tempura by following the recipe. We learned how to cook the soup stock, Misu Soup, Tempura and boiled eggplants. It was not only typical Japanese but also very tasty!We were lucky because it was just the two of us in the class and we really had a good time talking to Mari, she is a very kind and funny person. She was very interested in what we were doing and what we are cooking in our home country Austria.All in all we really enjoyed this experience and would recommend it to everybody who is interested in learning how to cook a Japanese dish!

Real Japanese Cooking. I work in Tokyo and took part in a class taught by Mari with my coworkers last week. I can already cook a few simple Japanese dishes (oyako-don, maguro-tsuke-don, okonomiyaki) and so wondered what to expect. But her depth of knowledge of produce, passion for cooking and skill in the kitchen meant I learned so much. And her encouragement and general friendliness made the whole experience a really great evening. Thank you Mari!

A fun night cooking something special. Mari was very welcoming in opening up her home to my wife and I. Mari was very accommodating in what we cooked and allowed us to learn some great skills and cook some very tasty Japanese food that was different to the Japanese food we had eaten before. We found Mari very friendly and enjoyed the experience. I would recommend the class to anyone while in Tokyo.

Vegetarian Japanese Cooking Lesson in Tokyo. On honeymoon in Japan this June and what a time. Tokyo is amazing, its like being in the future! We spent one evening with Mari who showed us how modern Japan is. The cooking lesson is taught in a real Japanese home - Mari's. She is a lovely,friendly host and takes you through the cooking of a Japanese meal. It is very laid back and enjoyable. You get to see and learn how to cook authentic Japanese cuisine and at the end of all your hard work sit down and eat the fruits of your labour. We are both vegetarian and Mari accommodated this in the lesson. We have cooked a few of the dishes since we returned home and are delighted with the tips Mari taught us! My wife and I had a great time and thank Mari for her hospitality. We would recommend Mari's cooking lesson to anyone who has the time in Tokyo.

A Taste of Home (Ofukuro no Aji). I took this class with Mari because I was interested in making traditional Japanese food that I could cook for my fiancé (he is Japanese) later. I like oyakodon, so I requested to make that, and I know that my fiancé like nasu (Japanese eggplant), so I asked her to suggest an eggplant dish.I chose to do the lunchtime lesson, so I met up with her at 9:30am. She lives really close to the station where you meet up with her. It's nice that Mari knows English because it is much easier to learn how to cook in a language that you understand. As she was teaching me, she explained about why we did things the way we did; it helps you understand more about why you are making it a certain way.We finished cooking faster than I expected, but the food tasted great! I don't cook too often, so I was surprised that I could make something that tasted like this. I would definitely recommend taking a lesson with Mari. This makes my trip to Japan this time a bit more unique, because how many people from overseas can say they learned how to cook a traditional Japanese dish while in Japan? =)

A fabulous evening with Mari!. I went to Mari's cooking class on the recommendation of a friend, who was attending her second class with Mari on her vacation in Japan! This in itself speaks about how wonderful the class with Mari is. The class is held at Mari's home and she kindly meets you at Shintomicho station so you won't get lost!Mari is such a kind, knowledgeable lady. I felt immediately comfortable in her home. The best thing about this class is that it is home food - things that you can and will be able to recreate at home by yourself! We made a delicious cooked salmon dish with vegetables, miso soup from scratch, and Japanese pickled cucumbers. It was a fabulous meal and I know I will recreate it again for family and friends to enjoy!My friend and I had a wonderful time and we felt like friends of Mari's, not just students. I absolutely recommend the class and I am already thinking about going to another class with my husband during our time living in Tokyo!
Home style cooking in Tokyo. This cooking class was good fun, with the option to choose your own food to cook. Mari was very nice and made the morning a great experience.

A lovely, interesting and great tastin way to experience japanese home-cooking!!. Going to Japan can sometimes be a hard task. As a "gaijin" (foreigner) you may not know to much of the language and as japanese people usually don't speak english... You got a bit of a problem in the communicatons department.Going to resturants in Japan isn't necessarly a problem, but you'd rather wan't to bring something home with you, right?That is why japanese homecooking with Mari is such a great thing to experience.Mari is a very sweet japanese woman who for a small price can teach you how to make japanese dishes in your own kitchen.She is fluent in english and explains well how and why to do things.When I joined her cooking course, we made Okonomiyaki (a wonderful non-sweet kind of japanese dinner-pancake like no other). While making this we learned how to make the cornerstone of japanese food; the "dashi" stock. Also used for the miso-soup.Learning all of this makes it easier to make all other kinds of dishes!I really had a great time learning from Mari. It's hard not to consider her more of a friend than just a teacher after experiencing her homecooking class.I'll be back next year Mari-san!

Perfect and professional instruction from Mari.. I enjoyed the interaction with instructor Mari and other participants. She was very personable and knowledgeable about Japanese dishes and many aspects of Japanese culture.

Cooking with Mari. When looking online to attend a cooking class in Japan, I was so pleased to find Mari's webpage. It was easy to see she is organized and enjoys teaching others how to cook Japanese food. Her recipes were in English and she explained how to convert the metric measurements. Mari is personable and took an interest in me and my friend. It was like cooking with family! If in Japan again, I would see what else we could cook up! I would recommend this to everyone, especially Americans who want take a cooking class with an instructor who can speak English. Huge thanks to Mari, for creating a wonderful memory for me!

Professional and true Japanese Cooking Class. our company specialises in the design and delivery of investment forums and training modules for Boards and executives of Australian and overseas superannuation/pension funds and earlier this year we hosted our international investing forum in Tokyo. As part of our program we also host a Partner Program for the partners/spouses of our delegation. Mari's cooking class, along with a tour of the famous wet market, was the first activity of the week introducing us to Japanese food and some of the staple foods cooked in homes all over Japan. Mari provided me with menu choices or I was able to design my own menu - but I went with her recommendation of miso soup and fresh Tuna served with sushi-rice (delicious)!! I discovered Mari's Cooking Classes through tripadvisor and from my initial communication Mari was professional, warm and friendly in her approach. She provided me with information and took a genuine interest in what our objectives were to ensure we delivered a high quality authentic cooking experience (we have been delivering this program for many years with regular attendees and expectations are high - Mari's class did not disappoint - however, for our larger group the only thing I might of changed was the time, reduced slightly). As our numbers increased we outgrew Mari's home kitchen and she therefore sourced a professional cook kitchen for us to use - nothing seemed to be too much trouble for Mari - she clearly wanted to make our cooking class work!If you are looking for an introduction to Japanese cooking Mari is delightful and I'm confident you would not be disappointed.If I return to Tokyo on a non-work related trip i will be taking my partner to Mari's place for my second cooking class, with gyoza Japanese dumplings on the menu!

Oishii!. My family had the most wonderful afternoon with Mari! I don't know what was better - the cooking instruction, the meal or Mari's company! Mari was so welcoming and happy to answer all our questions about Japan and to teach us so much about Japanese cuisine.Thank you Mari for a wonderful day in Tokyo!

Amazing cooking class. In June this year my father and I attended Mari's cooking class; we had the pleasure of cooking in her home with a group of about 6 people from around the world. We were able to see how to run a traditional Japanese home kitchen and learn how to make sushi from the experts (along with other amazing Japanese dishes) It was an amazing experience, well worth the small cost and I would recommend this for everyone - even if you don't like to cook.

Exotic, fresh, and delicious. I decided to book Mari's class because I love food and cooking, and have taken many classes in various places around the world, but never Japan. I am so glad I took this one! Mari was amazing! She communicated well before the class, was flexible when we got lost, and welcomed us into her lovely home. She taught us a great deal about Japanese culture and cooking, especially about essential ingredients for Japanese dishes. I had never made sushi before, and now can do it at home!Mari lives near the Tsukiji fish market, so her fish is some of the best and freshest I have ever tasted. We learned sushi, pickle, and miso soup in a relaxed and friendly environment, and are very well. If you are thinking of this class, do it! You will have a fabulous time and learn so much! Thanks, Mari!
Great !. Thank you MariWe had a wonderful experience and made delicious cakes ! Next time in Tokyo we call you !

Very tasty and informative cooking class. We very much enjoyed Mari's class. She provided many useful adaptations for those of us working in Western-equipped kitchens. The perilla added to the sliced cucumber pickle salad was a delight!

Home-style cooking with a lovely host. Mari gave us a lovely introduction to Japanese cooking, using fresh ingredients. She was able to answer all of our questions about Japanese food and it was obvious that she is passionate about cooking. Cooking with Mari was really nice because we spent time in her own kitchen so we knew it was quite authentic. We will definitely do this class again when we visit Tokyo next time.

An excellent opportunity to learn to cook real Japanese food. I attended one of Mari's classes in July 2013, it was a great experience. Mari kept in regular email contact before and after the class, giving me tips on restaurants to visit in Tokyo, and even mailing me some extra recipes after the class. Mari is very helpful and a great teacher, I had a great time learning to cook some authentic Japanese dishes. The group size was nice and small and everyone got along really well. I highly recommend that anyone who enjoys Japanese food in the slightest should attend her one of her classes. I look forward to returning and visiting again! Thanks so much.

Mari is fantastic!. If you would love to learn more about Japanese cooking from a friendly, kind person in her own home you HAVE to visit Mari! She is so helpful and such a joy to have as a teacher and a friend too. Mari even gave me lots of advise about things to buy in Japan and even shared some hospitality with me. A class with Mari will make your Tokyo trip something to remember!

Real Japanese home cooking!. Thanks for 2 great cooking classes and all your helpful advice about the recipes. Mari gave practical tips about Japanese cooking techniques that I will be apply to my cooking at home. She also provided valuable insights about food in Tokyo overall. I look forward to taking another class in the future, hopefully soon!

Great Time - Excellent Class. We live in Japan and visit Tokyo often. We highly recommend the class. We learned a great deal and it will really enhance our dining experiences in Japan. Mari is a wonderful host and the class is well organized and entertaining. Very nice to do the class in Mari's kitchen instead of a classroom or professional kitchen. Mari was very accommodating with setting up the class. We will definitely be coming back when we have visitors from the states. Looking forward to making the dishes ourselves! Craig & Kathy

Nice home cooking!. The experience was great! Real home cooking from dashi to gyozas, sushi roll and cucumber salad! All very good and tasty! Great company, Mari is very helpfull in giving you tips and advice while in Tokyo.

thanks for a wonderful experience. Fantastic cooking class, great company, lovely host. We much enjoyed our cooking class with Mari and can just agree with all the great comments! Thanks so much and best regards. Sarah & Sebastian

Intimate encounter with genuine Japanese home food. This opportunity to cook with Mari was a highlight of my trip to Tokyo!I wasn't sure what I wanted to cook so I left the decision up to Mari after telling her what I liked (seafood!). Thanks to this, our menu (more delicious and satisfying than I could've ever imagined) consisted of some miso soup, spinach side dish, and a wonderful Hokkaido-style entree called Ikameshi which is squid stuffed with rice, mushrooms, and other veggies. This next part may gross some people out, but I loved having a chance to "gut" the squid. Mari made it look so easy, but I can attest that it is insanely difficult to do it cleanly and quickly. With some other tips and tricks she shared, this wonderful dish was soon prepared and I realized quickly how much more I prefer Japanese homestyle meals to ones you may find on the menu pages of a restaurant (michelin-starred or not). I adored Mari and appreciated how easy-going and direct she was with her instructions. I had tremendous fun making and eating my dinner and look forward to another trip to Tokyo so that I can take another class with Mari.

wonderful cooking experience for my whole family. Mari's cooking class was wonderful! She was very flexible in finding a date & time for a cooking class for me and my children (ages 12, 10 and 7). We had so much fun learning how to make miso soup and gyoza. It was one of the highlights of our 3 months in Tokyo. Mari has a wonderful touch in working with children, and we all enjoyed sitting down to a meal together when we were finishing cooking. I highly recommend this class!

Perfect introduction to Japanese food and life. I was amazed to learn all the basics of Japanese cooking in just a few hours. Mari does an excellent job in explaining all the basics. No matter what dishes you choose to cook with her, you will walk out of her apartment with a very good idea of Japanese cooking in general. I used to quit right away when trying to follow some recipes from my Japanese cook book, now it seems very familiar and easy and I actually understand all the ingredients and how to use them. All thanks to Mari! What I also enjoyed is the insight in the Japanese culture - Mari very openly explained many aspects of it.

A touch of home - cooking with Mari. My husband and I had a wonderful morning with Mari! We met her in May for a a lesson in making udon and grilled tofu. She truly enjoys what she does, making you feel at ease in her home quickly. Her recipe was easy to follow and fun as well! We were having some problems making train reservations and she was eager to help us. She also steered us in the direction of some great kitchen supply shopping! Since coming home just a week ago, we have already made dinner for our family of 12 using her recipes and lessons! Such a wonderful memory!

Gave the bottom line on everyday Japanese food. I was so glad that I went to Mari instead of a cookery class. Mari is an excellent traditional cook (her husband is very lucky) and broke all of the myths created by staying at Ryokans. The only Miso soup I liked while in Japan was Mari's - she will explain why!You will learn all about the little tricks required for the baseline recipes and be made to feel very welcome in her home. A very experienced cook who has a genuine interest in her craft and will teach you in an enjoyable way. Thoroughly recommended and beats classrom stuff anyday.

In all average. Sum up the whole lesson, food, service....I would say, average...Not super, but not poor. Price was average, home style cooking was casual and good enough.Visiting her home was nice, but it was a bit more like home visit program, which I have done it before with the other organization in Tokyo. So again, for me it was an average experience.

Real Japanese Home Cooking!. If you want to experience the REAL JAPANESE HOME COOKING,you should take this class!WHY? Because I'm japanese.I'd made MISO-SOUP,OYAKO-DON,OHITASHI and SUNOMONO in this class,these are the same menu as what japanese people are eating usually at home. There is no difference between my mom's cooking and MARI's. I recommend this class for all foreign tourists!

Perfect for foodies!. If you have an interest in Japanese cooking, this is for you!! Mari will customize the class according to your interests - we did pickling, dashi/miso, sushi rolls, and desserts. In the process you will learn as much as you'd like about the basic ingredients and techniques in Japanese cuisine . Mari is a wonderful teacher, and you will have a blast no matter what you skill level (both my husband and brother were fully engaged and had tons of fun despite not being skilled in the kitchen).

Great experience!. We had the pleasure of meeting Mari earlier this month for a lesson on udon making. She met us at a nearby station, and we took a short walk to her studio apartment. It is modern and clean, but like all Japanese residences, small. There were 4 of us at this lesson, and the other couple was also from the US and very nice. We reviewed the instructions with Mari, and then came the making process! We had a great time using our feet to make the udon and making a lovely cucumber side salad. Mari's English skills are quite good, and it was a great experience to remember Japan by. She is lovely, and emailed us a photo of us as well!

WHAT A TASTY FOOD AND HOSPITALITY!. Since i like Japanese foods and never had cooking experience, i found Mari's Cooking Class and joined the class it was a good chance for me to join her class. She taught me how to cook Okonomiyaki, Misoshiru, Ichigo Daifuku, Kabocha Daifuku, Kabocha no nimono . they were all so delicious and didn't take much time. also she was very good at the teaching! I love Mari's Cooking and if i have chance, i will definitely join again to her class and learn another delicious Japanese dishes.

Great cooking and cultural experience. We loved the cooking class with Mari. From the very first moment when Mari picked us up at the metro station we were amazed by her kindness and hospitality. The cooking was hands-on and a lot of fun. We loved the Bento dishes we prepared and will soon cook them again at home.However, for us it was so much more than a cooking experience. We had a lively discussion and could ask Mari all kinds of questions about Japanese culture and practical issues in Tokyo. This was of great value for us since we didn't know any locals before meeting Mari. Moreover, it's admirable to see how she is living her dreams by doing what she loves to do. We absolutely recommend Mari's cooking class!

It is so nice to see people who live their passion!. It was so much more than learning Japanese cooking. It was like meeting a friend who likes to share her passion about food and cooking, her knowledge about how to cook easily japanese dishes and the different ingredients (with hints where to buy them). As the cooking class takes part at Mari's home, it feels like a "table d'hôte" with a learning experience. It was so nice to see how Mari enjoys to be a host and how she brings the world together at her place. And moreover, thanks to Mari's open minded character you get to know a lot more insight about daily Japanese life in general. I am looking forward to looking for all the ingredients back home and to use the recipes to convince my friends that Japanese food is so oishii :-)! And I even dare to cut a whole fish into filets now.

We learned to make a meal for our friends -. We enjoy cooking classes in the countries we visit as a way to meet local people, enhance our learning of the culture and to learn more about the food. This day we visited the fish market, then took the class, then went to Asakusa. Mari chose a menu that I could adapt, and upon return, we used it for our sons while telling them about our trip. Our class included a young woman from Australia whom we enjoyed meeting and shared our travel stories. Mari assisted us with some touring directions which led us to Tokyo's cookware alley in Asakusa where we bought gifts. We enjoyed getting off the street, seeing her new apartment, learning about her life and family, and eating a good home-cooked lunch. Compared to similar classes in other countries, the price is extremely reasonable.

My Favorite Souvenir from Japan. The recipes for kitsune udon and Japanese pickles are among my favorite souvenirs from Japan. I'm so excited to make this meal again at home. Mari is a wonderful host who promptly responds to emails and is very flexible about menu options. The meal was delicious and I felt like I learned a lot about Japanese culture that I wouldn't have otherwise. I would recommend this course without hesitation to anyone interested in learning about Japanese home cooking and hope to personally cook with Mari again on my next visit to Tokyo.

Yummy and Great Company!. Mari's class was so great. She catered to us so well and goes out of her way to make it special. I asked her if she had candles to surprise my wife with them on top of the Okonomiyaki and instead she baked a whole cake and surprised us all at the end!!! My wife and our 4 friends with us loved it!! We took my 1.5 year old daughter with us as well and it only added to the fun. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a fun way to hang out with friends in Tokyo.

Fun und delicious. I had a lot of fun while learning how to cook Udon at Maris'. Mari is a very patient and knowledgeable teacher. So makes sure everyone can take part and has allot of knowledge about cooking in general and japanese cuisine. The dishes turned out delicious and I will surely cook them again at home. That the class takes place in Mari's apartment in an added bonus. It has a bit of a homestay feel. I also had a good time talking to the other participants and Mari. We all learned a bit about each others culture.
Perfect!. Mari's class was the highlight of my stay in Tokyo. She welcomed us into her home; made us feel comfortable with new-to-us cooking ingredients and techniques. A+!!!!

A most delicious way to experience Japan. Mari is the most wonderful host. She makes you feel welcome in her lovely home from the moment you walk in the door and by the end you have made a new friend. She patiently walks you through each step of food preparation and cooking and is happy to provide details and background for the dishes and ingredients. It was also exciting for me to learn about other aspects of Japanese culture through Mari. Mari's English is great, the location is convenient, and the recipes are very do-able. I highly recommend this class as a great, authentic, Japanese experience.

Excellent morning cooking. We visited Mari with our 2 friends whilst on holiday. She was very friendly and ok'd the menu with us before via email. The cooking steps were broken down, so seemed very straight forward and we've recreated the dishes at home too. We enjoyed visiting her home and seeing how real Japanese live.

Fantastic Experience!. My husband and I with our two adult daughters recently experienced one of Mari's cooking classes and it was fantastic! Organising the class with Mari was a pleasure. She responded to emails promptly and was very flexible with menu options. One of our daughters is allergic to nuts and shellfish and Mari was very happy to accommodate this.Mari met us at the station at the pre-arranged time. It was a very short walk (about 1 min) from the station to her apartment. We made sushi and gyoza, both from scratch and they were both excellent and left us all feeling that we would be able to do these successfully when we got home. We arrived home a couple of days ago and one of our daughters has already made sushi for a dinner party and it was a huge success! We are going to cook both the gyozas and sushi for a dinner party next weekend.One of the great things about the class was the opportunity to talk to Mari and her husband about Japanese food and culture. We really appreciated their openness and honesty.During our emails prior to our trip to Japan, I had told Mari that our family was travelling to celebrate both my husband's and daughter's birthdays, so she prepared a birthday cake for them. They were really surprised and both very touched that she had gone to this much effort.Overall it was a very pleasureable experience which we would highly recommend. If we are ever lucky enough to go back to Tokyo, a cooking class with Mari will be one of the things that it is right up there on our must do list.

Glad that I sign up!. Mari was a nice and lovely person. Picked me and others up at the nearby subway exit @ 9:30am and her place was only few steps away. We learned how to make dashi, donkatsu, agadeshi tofu and miso soup, which are all home food. I was surprised they were easier to make at home then I thought. Mari showed us the tips and trucks, and answered all our questions.I got to try my own cooking for lunch, and this is a GREAT intro to Japanese home cooking. I ended up buying a cookbook that she recommended at the bookstore, and will self-learn more dishes back home.Recommend anyone into Japanese cooking to sign up! You won't regret it :-)

Unforgettable Experience w/ Mari. Plain and simple, a MUST-DO for anyone visiting Tokyo and wanting to learn Japanese cuisine, not to mention also meeting one of the sweetest people on the planet. Highly recommend!My wife and I took Mari's class on our first full day after arriving in Tokyo. Having planned a meal with her including okonomiyaki, sushi preparation and some side dishes she recommended, we couldn't wait to meet her and get started.Meeting us right at the subway stop near her home, we were like friends after the first five minutes. The environment is charming, setup is clean and offers a real glimpse into a real-life Tokyo home. She threw some aprons on us and after a short time, it felt like family just cooking up an evening meal together. We asked tons of questions (sorry again for so many Mari!), and she was so accommodating in every way to answer them. She asked many herself, and we even were able to give her a recipe from the States. :)Much like Japanese cooking itself, Mari's approach is simple -- she LOVES food and you can see / feel / taste it throughout your entire time with her. Getting to know her own personal story while learning these dishes she grew up with, it's a privilege that we were able to meet her. Inspiring to say the least!It's now been a week or so back home, and we have already conjured up our first attempts at dishes post-Mari, to which (I think) we've done her proud.We realize she'll always now be part of our cooking... truly unforgettable. Thank you Mari for such a wonderful experience!!

Japanese cooking. This is a great thing to do in Tokyo, both for learning how to cook and getting an insight into Japanese culture. Mari is open to teaching you whatever dishes you've come across in your travels or making suggestions. Her house is easy to get to. Definitely recommend it to other visitors to Japan!

Great cooking class with Mari. We loved our cooking class with Mari. We learned how to make dashi, miso soup, some yummy pickles, and tempura veggies, seaweed and fish. Mari is so lovely, and knowledgeable about Japanese food. She created a great atmosphere - and we all created a great meal :-)If we visit Tokyo again, we'll be back for another cooking class with Mari.

Left with smiles on our faces and happy tummies!. If you want a REAL Japanese experience try a cooking class with Mari. Not only is Mari a fantastic, warm and humble hostess she is an amazing cook and she caters for your wishes. I asked for a 'typical' Japanese lunch - not sushi or okinminyaki as I make both of those at home - and Mari created a simple, delicious menu of homemade udon noodles (with soup stock made from scratch), chicken, mushrooms and leek to accompany the udon soup and a picked cucumber and seaweed salad.If I can recommend you do one thing in Tokyo - actually in all of Japan - it would be Mari's cooking class. I can't wait to host my Japanese themed dinner party for my friends back home and teach them how to make udon noodles - by kneading the dough by standing on it!

Personal and authentic. My girlfriend and I really enjoyed the cooking class with Mari. We made Udon noodles and Dashi from scratch, for a really nice Udon Soup. We both thought the best part was getting to hang out with Mari and talk about life in Tokyo and the every day food Japanese people eat.

Wonderful opportunity I'm so glad I experienced. I have to give credit to my traveling companion for discovering Mari's Japanese Cooking class. Wow, what a fun, USEFUL, and unique way to spend an afternoon in Tokyo. If you are at all into home cooking and enjoy japanese cuisine, this is an invaluable opportunity you shouldn't pass up!With multiple sessions a day, Mari hosts cooking sessions right in her apartment to teach basic traditional japanese courses - lunch and dinner sessions and sushi making! we were sad the sushi class didn't fit into our schedule, but our lunch time visit to learn a few of the basics was not only enjoyable for the afternoon, but something I have taken back home to San Diego and continued to utilize. for 5,000 JPY a person, you get a intimate cooking lesson of multiple courses that includes all the needed ingredients and a full sit-down meal after preparation and cooking. For our meal we learned to cook steamed clams, a beef stew, dashi stock and miso soup. I have continued to prepare completely homemade dashi and miso soup on more than one occasion at home now with confidence. i never imagined preparing real japanese meals in my home for myself and others and i cannot thank Mari enough for her wonderful class!In additional to easily learning the basics of japanese cooking, its a great international experience with people from all over the world taking her class. During ours, we were participating with guests from Honk Kong and Sweden. It was lovely sitting and talking about our experiences in Japan and how all our countries differ. Mari speaks fluent english (she even lived in the bay area in the US for a some time), and her home is right next to a subway station that she with meet everyone at. She even gave me the heads up on the cooking supply district not too far away where I was about to get a lovely handmade japanese cooking knife with free engraving of my name in kanji and english. quite possibly the coolest item I took back home to the US and I owe it all to her.i even 'liked' her page on facebook and get to enjoy the daily photos of her classes - and it was exciting to post my first homemade miso soup success and get kudos from her :)If you are staying in Tokyo and have a free afternoon, this is a great and rewarding activity to consider.Thanks again Mari!

Best way to spend your last day in Tokyo!. It was a wonderful morning with Mari and the other guests! We talked a lot, about Japanese and foreign cuisine, Mari knew a lot about the history of some of Japans most popular dishes which was a popular subject, our reasons for coming to Japan, what we have seen - there is lots of time to engage in conversation throughout the class!!We shared the prep and cooking tasks throughout the morning so everyone had a turn at experiencing the process of cooking the dishes!It was my last day in Japan and I couldn't think of a better way to end my trip!The food was delicious, the company was great and Mari is a friendly, interesting and fun teacher/host! Thanks again Mari for an amazing day!

Fantastic opportunity not o be missed!. Mari's cooking class in her own home was an incredible opportunity for learning about Japanese food and cooking. Mari's gentle 'hands-on' approach will have you cooking things you never thought you could do in no time. You'll have plenty of time to ask all those questions you want to ask while making yummy food! You can go by yourself or with orhers - Mari is very flexible. Email Mari to talk about what you want to learn, or just leave it to her if you don't know - you won't be dissappointed. I'm certainly going back for more classes.

take Japan to your home country!. I really enjoyed this experience so much. Mari is such a great person and she knows a lot about the Japanese cuisine, not only the recipe by itself but some of its history and tradition. The conversation during the class is so relaxing and interesting and it's an opportunity to meet new people from all around the world. She helps you step by step during the process of cooking, she explains what is each ingredient and where you can buy it, I think that is easy to remember what you did in class so you can cook when you go back to your country. Her apartment is very neat and clean, the teriyaki chicken we made and ate was great. Thank you Mari and see you soon!

A MUST do in Tokyo!. We had an amazing time cooking traditional japanese dishes. Mari is so nice and patient, my husband and I had a wonderful time. I really recommend this experience for travelers heading to Tokyo, that want to have an off the beaten track experience. I cant´s wait to go back and enroll in another lesson.

Unforgettable learning experience. I booked Mari's class as a birthday present for my friend. We both had the most fantastic time cooking a vegetarian Japanese feast and it was easily the best food we had in Japan. Finally, we understood what we had been eating! She explained things very well and was so friendly and kind to us. I cannot recommend the class highly enough.

Fantastic hands on experience. Excellent opportunity to get your hands "dirty". We had a fantastic time learning how to make sashimi and tempura. Then you get to enjoy the fruits of your labour. Yum!Mari's english is excellent and interesting to get a perspective on Tokyo life.

Excellent experience ..... Mari is a extraordinary person, the recepies are easy and delicious .... I enjoyed the food and the company.I learned about Japanese ingredients because I live in Tokyo but before I could not find anything... Muzukashi!!!I recommend the cooking class with Mari, is like to go the tipical Japanese restaurant but you learn how to cook.... Enjoy it.

A Great Introduction to Tokyo. On a recent trip to Japan to visit our daughter and her family who have been living in Tokyo for a little over a year she and I decided to take a Japanese cooking class and found Mari online. We weren't disappointed! Along with the others in our group Mari taught us to prepare Okonomiyaki (Japanese savory pancakes), spinach with a Japanese sesame dressing and miso soup--delicious. I can't wait to impress my US friends. Mari obviously enjoys cooking as much as she enjoys hosting guests as was evidenced by the fact that following our meal we all sat around the table sharing experiences, impressions and laughs. While it was a dismal, cold and rainy day outside, the time inside Mari's lovely home was full of warmth. I would highly recommend this to anyone wanting to experience Tokyo in a novel and interesting way.

Excellent Cooking Class. I had a great time learning some of the more complicated Japanese dishes. Mari was an excellent teach and I highly recommend anyone interested in Japanese cooking to take her class.

Real home cooking class experience. We are 2 French living in Tokyo and we wanted to discover what was behind the excellent food we were eating everyday. We got in touch with Mari-sense very easily by email. Even before meeting with Mari, we could guess how patient and nice she is. We were invited at her parents' home to have the cooking class. We were 3 people total only, so it was a very personal class. We chose before the class what we wanted to cook and the result was great and delicious ! We made gyoza, miso soup and Teriyaki, and we know now what to buy to make the japanese typical sweet & salty sauce and home made miso soup. What makes then a real difference with this class is the "familly atmosphere" at home. After cooking we all had diner together, including Mari's parents. They are all so nice to us, it made this moment a great pleasure ! THANK YOU. We recommend to include 3h with Mari-sense during your trip in Tokyo.

Fantastic class. I learned how to make bento with tamagoyaki, chicken karaage, onigiri and much more. Mari-sensei was a great teacher, very easy to understand and patient. The class size was small, and so the teaching was very personal. And most importantly, the food we made was really delicious! After cooking, we had a feast together with the teacher and the other students. It was a very good experience, and very good value.This was my first class with Mari, but I'm definitely going to take more, and I can highly recommend this class to anyone.

Cooking Class. Mari was a great teacher. My aunt and I learned how to prepare basic stock which is essential for Japanese cooking. She also taught us how to make pork cutlet. I like the way she gave us tips on how to cook Japanese food that you don’t often see them mentioned in cookbooks. We had a good time in the class. Hopefully, we will learn how to prepare other meals in our next trip.

Wonderful cooking class!. We (couple) did 2 cooking classes (Japanese dishes and Japanese sweets) with Mari during a 4 week stay in Tokyo last June. We got in touch with Mari via email. She replied straight away and was really flexible, adjusting the menu to our tastes and to our vegetarian needs. On the day of the cooking classes Mari and her husband Ryo collected us at the station and took us to their home. Mari is really friendly and sociable, easy to get along with and has good English. She is a great cook, her passion for food is obvious. Mari used seasonal ingredients and gave us handy tips on where to get the ingredients in Tokyo, as well as some useful tips on how to prepare Japanese food.We ate the food - which was really yummy - together with Mari and Ryo. It was interesting to talk about Japanese culture with them, for instance about kendo (Ryo’s hobby). We got the recipes to take home and they even gave us some Japanese gifts. It was a great experience, one of the highlights of our stay in Tokyo and we recommend it to anyone who likes Japanese food and cooking.

Amazing hospitality and recipes that wow my friends!!. We found this cooking class quite by chance. After desperately searching tourist information places, we found Mari on a blog online. Emailed her and straight away she responded, trying her best to accommodate my vegetarian needs. We arrived at her specified train station where she met us straight away and took us to a very comfy and clean home.The food was spectacular, (I regularly make the recipes for my friends and they love them) Mari's husband was really kind towards my partner Richard and the night was like spending it with old friends.Thank you, we will be back!!! Xxx

Great experience!. My wife and I loved the evening with Mari. Not only she shown us how to prepare typical Japanese dishes, but with her and her husband we learnt a lot about the Japanese culture. I loved to get some insight into the kendo!We highly recommend to have a class with her.

Fantastic - highly recommended. I can thoroughly recommend Mari's cooking class to anyone wishing to have a unique experience of real Japan (away from the main tourist attractions), whilst learning about Japenese culture and cooking. In their own apartment, Mari showed me how to make a selection of most delicious healthy traditional Japenese dishes, which afterwards we sat down to eat with her husband. Mari goes out of her way to find out what each guest wishes to cook and eat, and it was a priviledge to spend time with her in her own home. Afterwards we went shopping nearby for traditional ingredients. It was all really superb and a highlight of my holiday too!

An excellent afternoon. I had a fantastic experience with Mari. She was friendly and a great cook, teaching me all about Japanese cuisine. We had great fun trying the food we made, and I still have the roll mat she gave me as a gift.

Cooking in Japan!. This is a must for anyone visiting Tokyo interested in Japanese cooking. We had earlier requested her to teach us to make Okonomiyaki, and she had prepared a sheet with ingredients and clear instructions. Not only is Mari friendly and easy to get along with, she is also good teacher and gets you really involved in cooking. The end result was superb and this experience was a highlight of our 2 week trip in Japan. You will be glad you did it. 10/10

Great experience!. Sushi making class with Morris was a really great experience. He took us to his place, welcomed us and teached us how to make tasty and good looking sushi. I can more than recommend this class with great, friendly and experienced chef! Thanks Morris again!

Fun Activity. Fun and informative group activity with wonderful instructors, Kiki and Morris. Found this tour on google. They reply quickly to inquiries and are very accommodating (we had of food and schedule issues and we added participants to the class last minute!).Their proficiency in english is very high so everything was clear and the program they do in the class is fun and inclusive like a quiz show testing your knowledge of japanese culture and sushi while teaching you the proper etiquette of eating sushi. We made 4 types of sushi. And they took pictures for us so we didnt have to bother with our cameras. Getting to the class was easy as the train station is a short stroll away.
Fun, Tasty, Great course!. Morris is very freindly , professional and has a warm hospitality.The sushi course was great and fun!I highly recomend to all who looking to make sushi.Enjoy!

Very energetic and interesting course, we learned a lot. Highly recommendable. The course is only 2.5 hours so I did not expect so much, but we were very pleased with the course. We learned history of sushi as well as terminology. Finally we made 4 different kinds of sushi. At the end we also got a certificate, which we proudly will put at the wall at home, for all our guests to admire.

Exxelent!. I was with my 13 year old. Morris and Nat were fabulous All went very smoothly and very interesting. We spoke alot about Israel and Japan cultures. The course was very good. We made our own sushi and also learned alot of new things on sushi and on Japan. We mentioned it was my sons birthday and Morros surprised us with a cake and cnadle. A must go

Great experience for the family!. I can't thank Nat and Morris enough for making this such an easy, fun and affordable experience. We've used our skills numerous times since we've been back home. Definitely one of the top highlights of our trip, and the kids are still bragging about it to their friends:)

Fun for all the family. This was a great way to spend a few hours in Tokyo and we all loved the whole experience. Morris and his team were very professional and helpful including allowing us to change the time of our sushi experience on the day as we had made a mistake with our dates - so a big thank you.The sushi experience was fun, informative just the right amount of time and we all loved what we had made with some excellent photos sent to us as a bonus.Highly recommended.

Good choice for learning about Japanese culture. We join the tour to learn about Japanese food culture.Because the lesson is held in actual Japanese family's home, we also can learn about Japanese living and dining culture.

Excellent teacher, excellent host!. Morris did an amazing job! Not only did he teach us the basics of sushi making, but he also creates a calm, friendly atmosphere to do it. He gets to know his guests and is attentive to everyone.Would absolutely recommend to anyone who enjoys sushi and wants to make it themselves. Had a blast!
Tokyo sushi making Tourに行ってきました！. I enjoyed sushi making tour!!Teacher was so excellent :DHe told me how to make sushi with happy smile:D:D

Both Japanese and foreigners can fully enjoy!!. Im Japanese but its first time to make Sushi. It was great experience. Lecturer made class fun, easy to make sushi, Neta(fish for sushi)was nice quality. I definitely recommend this to anyone!日本人でもホントに楽しめます！友達や恋人とぜひ！

Oishi Oishi. What a fantastic experience, Nat & Mori took great care of our family and it was a huge highlight of 4 days in Tokyo. Looking forward to using the skills on home turf. Thank you Morris, Nat and team
Sushi making fun. The experience was really good, great fun. Morris, his wife and Kiki (sushi chef) were lovely people, very welcoming and chatty making the experience fun and educational

most memorable experience in Tokyo!. Morris and his wife were amazing sushi making teachers. They made the class fun, easy to learn, and very hands-on. Not only was the class great, but Morris was phenomenal at accommodating us: he found a location literally 30 seconds from our AirBnb that could hold our group of 11 (and picked us up at our front door to take us there), he brought separate food to accommodate a food allergy, and he was in constant communication once we had made the reservation. Our group of 11 had an amazing time and would definitely recommend Tokyo Sushi-making Tour to anyone interested in experiencing the art of sushi making!

Best experience in Tokyo. When planning my trip to Tokyo, I already had in mind that I wanted to take a cooking class, and I am so glad I found Morris and his Tokyo Sushi-making tour. It was a great experience, even in a Typhoon we walked to his apartment where he and his wife hold the tour. It was wonderful, with lots of delicious food, and fun information, not only about sushi but also japan, japanese culture, and some language skills as well! Morris and Mori did a great job teaching the class and had a great presentation to go with it. Honestly some of the friendliest people I met! I would not hesitate to go back, and would highly, highly recommend.

Japanese "omotenashi" exemplified - in this sushi-making tour!. To be open to any learning adventure - that was how international-minded Morris-sensei prepped up the group of eager learners. A fun quiz followed - by which we learned lots of trivia, manners about the proper way of eating sushi properly, some history, and even Nihongo. When we have overseas guests, we will have them enjoy this experience as well.

Shali + Neta = Sushi-licious!. The venue is very accessible and convenient since it is near a very busy train hub (i.e. many train lines intersect in the area). My wife and I were all smiles from beginning to end of the sushi lesson - fun and interactive. Truly a great learning experience - with witty Morris-sensei and his lovely assistant/partner/wife all-in-one.

This was so great!. The sushi lesson was so informative and fun! Morris did a great job at making the people there feel welcome. I learned more than I expected to. I felt a bit like a wizard when the decorative sushi was put together with (teamwork based) success. The food was yummy too! I plan to make more sushi in the future.It was great to learn about the best practices for eating sushi as well. I think that what I learned will help to make sushi taste better for me in the future when I do eat sushi.

Informative and fun!. My 15 year old daughter and I loved this 2 hour sushi making course. There were only 3 of us which made the experience very personal. Nat was a great teacher and we were honoured to visit Morris and his wife's beautiful home. Would definitely recommend as an authentic experience if in Tokyo.
Great experience of sushi making tour. Morris is wonderful teacher, his wife who helped is very nice, and the overall lesson was very interesting.

A lot of fun!!. I had a lot of fun making Sushi with International students! :)We Japanese rarely make Sushi at home, so it was a good chance to learn the knack of making them, especially, Nigiri-Sushi.I was happy to be able to make nice-looking Sushi by myself! Morris-san was a skilled and friendly instructor who has a nice smile:)I highly recommend this class to both Japanese and foreigners.
Tokyo Sushi-making Tour. I could happily sushi making.I was able to talk a lot and participants.It was a good opportunity can study Japanese culture.
Sushi Making with Nat. So much fun! Excellent sushi...made by myself! Nat was a fantastic teacher. We made 4 different types of sushi and learned a lot about history and food.Dont miss it!

Very fun sushiclass!. We had a great time at this sushiclass. Morris was so nice and talented. He also picked us up at the subwaystation and helped us find the way back. Would really recommend a sushiclass with Morris, we had so much fun :)

what an interesating tour!. 3 outstanding points here.1. MAKE REAL SUSHIhave you ever made sushi? i think almost everyone says no. where else can you fine for leaning hoew to make sushi? it is a great chance to make the most popular japanese food here in japan you can not only learn how to make sushi but also bring back the recipe to your country and make for your family and friends. it would be the best souvenir.2. MAKE FRIENDSalthough i didnt bring any friends of mine, i never felt im was alone. there are 3 foreiners and two japanese besides me in the tour. while making sushi, we kept talking about our own counties and sharing funny and crazy experiences together. its a must to cooperate each other to make the best sushi, which makes the atmosphere so gooood!!3. JEEL JAPANESE ATMOSPHEREwe had a lesson at the place where japanese live in a daily life. its a good oppotunity to see the japanese life. and making sushi, taking about japan such as a manner, language, history, etc. dont worry even if you come to japan for the first time and dont know anything. after this tour, you would be addicted to japan:pthis tour is highly recommended if you want to put yourseld into japanese environment.
Good time. Do you want to make your own sushi then go for it. I had a good time and really enjoyed also it will be good experience. Have fun.

Sushi Oshi day 🍣. I wanted to make it last week for my anniversary engagement day but we couldn't, It too late to make the reservation a day before and it was impossible in the same day.However, we have been this week (Today ) it was very cool wonderful and great experience.We love Sushi but we weren't know how to make it, and the chef made it super interesting unforgettable memory for us, he speaks good English, friendly and happy person.He learn us how to make many types of sushi, teach us some words and numbers in Japanes, Also he didn't forget our anniversary day and gave us a gift :D it was really cute .We really appreciate his time he made our day.I strongly recommend.

I concur with the unanimous consensus-The Tokyo-Sushi-making Tour rates a full 5 Stars!. My wife and I did the class this morning and had a great time. Morris and Hide were great hosts and instructors. The sushi we prepared was delicious and the price, 6000 yen per/person, is unbeatable.

Want to experience real Japan? Go for it!. We felt warlmy welcome and had a really good time with our chef Morris and our group of international travellers. Easy to book online, easy to find the place.

Learn how to make sushi!. We had a fun time with Morris on his sushi making tour. We learned knife skills, how to prepare a fish and filet it. How to make nigiri sushi, and maki sushi. Morris is a great teacher and made our lesson really fun. This is a great intro course for the whole family.

Informative, Fun and Friendly. Morris was a great host and very professional. My 16 yr old son and I enjoyed our time and the sushi we made came out great! We learned a few Japanese words, a little sushi etiquette and culture. He answered any question we had about Japan and he was very informative.I highly recommend this tour to anyone!!! Small price to pay for all of the time and information you get from Morris!

Great experience!. I took my friend from Australia and both of us had a great time with Naoya and Nat.They provide us very useful knowledge and skills about sushi making and its culture.Highly recommended! オーストラリアから観光で来日している友人と参加しました。なおやさんとなつさんはとても親しみやすい方で、終始和やかな雰囲気で楽しい時間を過ごすことができました。日本人の私でも握りずしはハードルが高かったのですが、丁寧なご指導のおかげで上手にいいシャリを作ることができました。今夜は早速子どもたちと寿司パーティします！ありがとうございました。
Sushi making class!. Great Course. Thoroughly enjoyed learning about sushi. Morris was a great teacher and taught use in a relaxed atmosphere.Recommended

Informative, simple, easy, fun.. The class was only 4 students and 1 teacher, Morris. He ushered us from the Kita Senju station to his apartment where we had the class. The class was much more than a cooking class; we also did some sushi trivia, Japanese culture/manners, and the history of sushi. I had no idea it was not originally Japanese but actually from SE Asia!The actual process of making the sushi is probably the easiest cooking thing I have ever done, so if you have no cooking experience don't let that stop you from taking this sushi making tour. Of course to be a master of sushi is not easy, but if you want to know enough to go into a grocery store and start making your own, well now I can! The hardest part is probably not making it but ensuring you have high quality ingredients.We made 4 kinds of sushi, including a decorative roll, which I've never seen before, it looks like a stick of dynamite; sushi wrapped in sushi haha. We didn't eat until after we made all the sushi, so we can take pictures, which is worth it, but by that time the rice was pretty dry. Anyway, if you want good sushi and you're in Tokyo don't make it yourself, go to a pro! But if you want a fun unique thing to do while you're in town then I recommend this tour for the experience. I love having such a small class, it was personal and intimate.

気持ちが伝わる内容 We had a great time.. 寿司を作る過程にも色々な工夫がされていました。参加者に楽しんで欲しい、寿司について分かりやすく解説したい、などの気持ちが伝わる内容でした。日本人ですが、初めて知ったマナーも。訪日していたオーストラリアからの友人もとても楽しそうでした。I recommend the Sushi making experience. We could enjoy to learn about history, manner, how to make sushi and various things. You become polite Japanese after you join in the tour.Please enjoy in the tour.

Really fun and informative Sushi Making Class!. We really enjoyed our sushi making class. It taught us not just the technique but the etiquette for eating sushi (which we used throughout our two week trip to Japan). A side bonus to our class was the location. We got to see what a "typical" neighborhood and home were like. I would definitely recommend this course.

Have your Sushi - and Eat It Too! (and with an adorable chef). A quick trip on the metro takes you to a softer, slower, sweeter side of Tokyo. Morris, Mr. Morishita, meets you at the station and walks you the 5 min. to his welcoming home and kitchen. There he tells you with kind patience and humor the DO's and DON'T's of sushi making - and then you start! At the end of your process, you sit down together and eat your (fun) toils!

Fantastic!. We had such a great day on this. Morris and Hide made us feel so welcome and are so friendly! They are obviously very passionate about what they do which makes for an interesting and fun class, we loved it! A must for those visiting Tokyo. We can't wait to go home and show off our sushi skills now! Thank you so much Morris and Hide :)

Relaxed Hands-On Learning and Eating. Morris, our sushi-making instructor, provided a fun, simple, and enjoyable way to make sushi. The atmosphere was casual and relaxed at his own home. Morris first presented us with a brief and interesting history of sushi as well as a fun quiz on the appropriate sushi eating etiquette. The actual sushi-making itself was simple and fun, segmented with interludes of conversation. Overall a great and tasty experience!

Very nice lesson. I'm Italian, me and my girl were happy to have participate at the lesson. Morris is a very good teacher. Trough his experience we learnt many things, to how eat sushi, how to prepare it and some recipes. We recommend Sushi making tour and Morris!!

Sushi Lessons. My teenage daughters and I really enjoyed this tour. Nat was very friendly and spoke very good English which although not the most important, was nice. We learnt many things about Sushi and made our own which was very tasty. A great thing to do if you want to have a very personal, "very Japanese" experience in Tokyo. Thanks Nat!

Memorable action learning. The sushi making class imparted just the right amount of highly applicable practical knowledge for us to take home. We also got to experience visiting a Japanese home, as the class was conducted in the home of Naoya Morishita (Morris), the instructor.Morris was very friendly throughout the whole experience. He waited for us at the train station and walked us back to the station after the class. We had good conversation with him in the few hours we spent together.

Amazing!. I am Japanese. But I have not liked sushi until I took this how to sushi making tour. Naomi and Nobu taught me various things about sushi. The sushi I made was beautiful and dericious!I want to make sushi by myself at home party next time. Thank you!
Wonderful experience . Morris was awesome. Great way to learn about sushi from a local. He made the experience fun and informative. Not to be missed!

Authentic and fun sushi-making class!. This was a lovely gift from my boyfriend and I am so happy I had the opportunity to take Morris' sushi-making class. Morris was so warm and hospitable and the experience was lots of fun. I learned a lot not only about sushi-making, but also about sushi etiquette and Japanese culture. I would highly recommend this class to anyone who is a sushi fan or curious about Japanese culture.

Authentic personal experience while visiting Tokyo. What a great time! It's all the little details that make this personal experience fantastic. The walk to the house, the video with the history and proper sushi eating etiquette, and, of course, the sushi making itself. It was my 13 year-old son's favorite part (and definitely the most memorable) from our trip to Tokyo. Thanks, Morris. I would highly recommend this for other visitors to the area with an interest in sushi.

Fantastic Sushi-Making Class in Tokyo. We had a fabulous time and the class far surpassed our expectations! We learned about the history of sushi, Japanese table manners and language, of course learnt how to make different types of sushi and had a delicious lunch made by ourselves.Our teacher Morris welcomed us at the train station and was very friendly and helpful, offering us tips on where to go in Tokyo and nearby too. His English is fantastic and made us all feel very at ease during the lesson, even my 4 year old who was still recovering from jet-lag. An absolute must-do if you're visiting Tokyo!

Amazing and highly recommended experience!. We have found this activity via tripadvisor and it was a wonderfull experience. Mr. Morris and Nate were amazing and very friendly, they also spoke impeccable english (something what is kind of rare in Tokyo) and were very helpful.We have learned a lot and the workshop was very interesting with also some fun facts and history about sushi. I can only recommend this activity as it was excellent organised and fun to do. The workshop took about 2.5 hours and it is easily reachable via public transport.

Gluten Free Friendly. A relaxed and highly enjoyable experience not to be missed. As well as learning how to make different types of sushi, we learnt a lot about sushi manners that we have since put into practice. Morris had even organised a gluten free soy sauce for my husband which was appreciated immensely! Our 9 year old raves about it and wishes she could do it again. We are all looking forward to making our own sushi when we return home.
Fun. This was fun and we learned a lot. It's a bit of a trek to get there but the explanation of how to get to the meeting place is well done.

Highly recommend this enjoyable experience. I really enjoyed my afternoon with Morris & Nat! They spoke excellent English & were very friendly, so it was easy to chat & laugh away while making sushi. I also liked learning sushi etiquette during the class & will definitely remember them the next time I eat sushi!Co-ordination for the class was very smooth. Morris replies promptly & the meeting place is easy to get to, so no worries about that.

A delightful experience in Tokyo!!. Mr. Moris is a very kind host and skilled sushi teacher. The sushi making was very relaxed and fun setting in his house. As you can see Japanese exotic "today's ordinary" Japanese house!! Although I'm Japanese, I really learned a lot, especially about how to make a artistic decorated sushi roll ( Kazarimaki ) and hand formed sushi ( Nigiri ). I had an excellent day. I would highly recommend this tour for every tourist who would like to know the traditional Japanese food culture!

Excellent class. We met Morris early on a Saturday morning, and had a great morning session with him. A bit of history and etiquette for sushi followed by the actual making of it. And of course at the end we all devoured a handiwork! Morris is a excellent and considerate teacher, definitely recommend.

Sushi making experience. I have made casual rolled sushi or onigiri sometimes before but as for nigiri sushi or hand-formed sushi, gunkan-maki or battleship-shaped sushi and kazari-sushi or decorative rolled sushi, very first time it was for me to try making.The sushi instructor was good at teaching how to make those three types of sushi with attentive care for each person in addition to unique Q & A about very useful knowledge on sushi. I could totally enjoy the process to make sushi from nothing to its finish of the creations. And, how amazing finger-techniques are used to make one nigiri sushi! It must be a kind of miracle feat. Next time, I can enjoy having sushi more with the new view through this experience. From the beginning to the end, it was very fun with a lot of curiosities.The class is must-try if you in a sushi heaven, Tokyo.Written by: a licensed tour guide
Most Amazing Experience ever. Almost person have eaten Sushi, but maybe never made.Teacher is very kind and clever!!!This tour is so fantastic for Foreigner also Japanese.

Fantastic experience!. Most amazing experience ever! Our instructor, Morris, enthusiastically explained the history and etiquette of sushi through various visual and practical demonstrations. The 3 hour class was a very hands on experience, super fun, and educational. Morris spoke very good English and provided us with excellent hospitality. At the end of the class you get to eat your amazing sushi creations, yum!!! If you're staying anywhere in Tokyo you MUST do this tour I highly recommended it - well worth your money. If you love sushi you WILL love this :)

Totally worth it!. I went on my own, and met two travelers (from Australia), and Morris.Morris is knowledgeable, enthusiastic, and friendly!I was worried because of the price, but Morris was completely prepared with his presentation, supplies and ingredients, and spoke english perfectly -- he even accomodated new ingredients for me because I am vegetarian. It was also a great experience to see a Japanese home. I cannot think of any complaints, I had fun!

Fun experience!. We had such a great time on this Sushi making class. Morris was so nice and friendly. We learned about sushi and the history of it. We made 3 different type of sushi rolls. If you are in Tokyo you should do this class. Morris spoke very good English as well. It was a great way to end our trip. Something that we will always remember and the hospitality was very nice. Thank you for everything. Kristi and Danny L.

Fun and fantastic activity. Great experience ever! We gained a real insight into sushi making and thoroughly enjoyed the sushi we made afterwards. Our instructor, Morris, was knowledgeable, informative and communicated his enthusiasm wonderfully. Excellent value and highly recommended!!

Fun and informative. This is well worth doing if you are a beginner at sushi making. It is held at the house of the teacher, Morris, who is really enthusiastic and personable and makes you feel at ease. The class is about 2.5 hours and mixes learning about the history and etiquette of sushi with the practical sushi making. And of course you get to enjoy the results of your work at the end of the class- yum!

Fun (and delicious) way to spend an time in Tokyo!. Fun (and delicious) way to spend time in Tokyo. Naoya (Morris) really knows sushi and his passion is obvious. It was great to be able spend time in a modern Japanese home (the lessons are at Naoya’s house) while learning about making both decorative and traditional rolls. Plus you get to eat them at the end – win-win. His approach is definitely very youthful - so perhaps not the best fit if you are looking for something a little more traditional, but definitely worth checking this out!
Sushi making lesson. I had an great time making sushi with Morris! He had prepared the class really well. It was nice to have a small group because it made the experience a lot more personal.
Excellent. Morris was great and very easy to understand. Would definitely recommend. Be prepared - it's not the Westernized sushi but very traditional Japanese, providing a unique experience.

Awesome sushi making lesson. Morris is very friendly and invited 6 of us to his home in Tokyo to learn sushi making. He put a lot of thought and effort into preparing the lesson to make it informative, entertaining and fun. It was a great fun afternoon travelling to outside CBD Tokyo and see what it's like in the local person's neighborhood. Eating the sushi you made yourself was fulfilling and yummy. Overall a great experience for travellers.

Morris Makes Marvelous Sushi. The Tokyo Sushi-Making Tour - wasn't really a tour per se, but is still highly recommended. Morris invited us, along with four other guests, into his small apartment which is a model of efficiency. As a Californian I thought I knew sushi, but now realize that I really knew nothing about the history, etiquette and making of sushi. This hands-on class was great fun - Morris knows how to keep the group engaged and involved. At the end of the class, we enjoyed a great sushi meal. A great way to spend a few hours when visiting Tokyo.

Funny amazing and educating experience!. I have joined the Tokyo Sushi-making Tour once cause I am a sushi lover. As a good sushi lover, I am supposed to know how to make it! But obviously I did not. I have learned a lot from their "guides" and the whole tour was extremely interesting and funny as well. Go for it!

Oishi sushi!. We had an amazing time with Morris (the chef) and Ayaka (our guide). Morris's English is very good and he has a great sense of humour. The sushi making was extremely interesting and absolutely delicious (oishi!). We would recommend to everyone. Thank you so much Morris!

Great day, great teacher.. If you visit Japan you have to do this class. Very professional, great lesson and a great teacher. We were made so welcome I can't recommend this enough. Everything thing was thought of and made for a great experience. Thank you.
