Precious experience. I joined it by my self as a Japanese.The teacher is very kind, fluent in English and his explanation of Sushi is pretty understandable for everyone.The good point of this event is that we can learn how to make sushi and the manners, the history as well through some easy quizzes.I recommend you to join it with you friends, family members or partners.

Amazing cultural experience. I had a great time with the teacher Naoya. To learn about does and dont's was very usefuly ... kinda abarrassing that I had a lot of wrong ideas ;-) He was very kind and patient when he taught me how to make Sushi. It was definitely an enjoyable and also funny experience. I have to say that it might be a bit expensive (Yen 6.000) but for me it was worth it! Thank you Naoya and all the best for your future :-)

Sushi Pose!!. We had a great time learning about sushi, the country, the language, and background of Japan. A group of my friends (4) attended the class and it had a private feel to it. We made a ton of really awesome sushi and loved the fun our teacher brought to the time we had.It was a bonus we got to wear some pretty awesome Japanese outfits too!!

I want to take this class in college. Taking this class was a great way to throw ourselves into Japanese culture. The instructor is extremely knowledgable while also conversational. The entire family had a great time and a great meal. Fresh ingredients, awesome tour guide, and great vibes- definitely take this class if you want an authentic and realistic introduction into sushi culture in Japan. Highly recommended!!!

Great Cultural Experience. The tour was excellent. In addition to learning how to make sushi, we also were taught Japanese etiquette, language, and culture. The instructor is extremely cordial and adds to an overall pleasant and stimulating experience.

Great to learn the history and etiquette of Sushi. my wife and I love Sushi and wanted to do a course but our time was very limited in Tokyo. Most other course are a whole day but Naoya has afternoon or morning lessons. We learnt how to make some decorative sushi rolls as well as Nigari. Naoya was really friendly, spoke great english and welcomed us into his home to teach us how to make sushi. Really great fun and highly recomended. Check out the facebook page!

Highlight of our trip!. Naoya made this a fun class! As other reviewers said, his mini-games and ability to interact with us made it a very comfortable setting. He was professional, friendly, prepared, and obviously has a passion for all types of cooking.My husband and I learned a lot about sushi - not as easy as I thought! Definitely recommend Naoya's class.

Nice and reasonable sushi-making tour. We had a great fun with Naoya's sushi making tour. Naoya is fluent in English and he does not only show how to make sushi but also teach us sushi cultures. If you are interested in Japanese food culture, this tour is strongly recommended.

Learn how to make Sushi in a fun way!. I had a great fun making my first nigiri sushi! The instructor was very friendly and he speaks English cery well. I made a pretty set of sushi art and it tasted very good!

Great learning experience and very fun!. Naoya's Tokyo sushi-making tour was a great experience, especially since it was my first time visiting Japan. I already had developed a craving and fascination with sushi before i had even visited, but after the tour i had a deeper love and understanding for it. He keeps the experience educational and fun. He is also very patient when teaching you how to make sushi. He throw's in mini-games to keep you entertained and engaged. If you love sushi or if you just want to have a great time, I HIGHLY recommend you to make an effort to take the tour! Cheers!

Sushi Making in Tokyo. This sushi making tour was really fun. I joined with two of my friends and we took a mid morning class and by the time we finished, it was time for lunch, which was perfect since we could eat our sushi creations. Our sushi making instructor Nagoya was really friendly and helpful. He picked us up infront of the metro near his house. From there it was a quick 5 minute walk to his place. Once we got in his house, he showed us around and then we got started on our sushi making class. Before getting started, he also gave us Japanese yukatas to wear, to make the atmosphere more fun. Before making sushi, he also gave a small talk on sushi history and the correct way to make and eat sushi. During the sushi making process, he was very helpful and patient. We made nigiri sushi, battleship sushi, and even artisan sushi. We went through the process step by step and the end result was great. It was especially satisfying being able to eat what we made afterwards. After the lesson, Nagoya walked us back to the metro stop and told us to feel free to email him if we had any questions about places to visit or Tokyo in general during our vacation. He's a really fun and nice person!

Best Sushi-making experience. I've you are in Japan you definitely need to learn how to make Japanese food! This Sushi-making event was really one of the best. It's not a standard sushi event where they teach you not only how to make but also how to eat and believe it or not I was surprised that even my Japanese friend didn't know the answer on that. It was funny, relaxing and inspiring!!

Good for Japanese! Good for Foreigners!. I, a Japanese national, joined this lesson with my Japanese friend and foreign friend. The teacher taught us in English and in Japanese. So all of us could understand well. I think even for Japanese, the opportunity to make Sushi isn't so often, so this was a great experience not only for my friend but also for me. If you Japanese are looking for some place to take your friend from overseas or if you are in charge of inbound tourism on business, I would like to recommend this.

sushi making. I realy liked it! You learn new ways of making sushi, interesting and fun ways :) but I thought that they were gonna teach me how to do everything, from de ris to cuting the fish. So if that is what you are looking for, you should no that they focus mostly on just how to make goodlucking sushi and not how to make best stating sushi. But I hade alot of fun and got very inspired, so this is something I would rekomend :)

Great lecture by a talkative teacher. Wonderful chance to learn how to make sushi at a low price! Morris, the teacher, is very friendly and capable of speaking fluent English. How nice experience is this to make sushi with my hands and eat it! This is absolutely one of must-try experiences in Tokyo.

Definitely worth the visit!. My brother and I were in Japan for two weeks, and having extra time to burn decided to try out the Sushi-Making Tour without expecting too much. We came out pleasantly surprised and realized it was one of the first activities we should've done when we arrived! The guide of this Sushi-Making Tour is Naoya Morishita. He's a really humble, down-to-earth Japanese guy who, frankly, speaks very good English for someone who did not study abroad. The entire lesson was very organized, engaging, and interest. We had a lot of fun learning the history of Sushi, the proper etiquettes, and making sushi. The best part came last: tasting your Japanese creation. I highly recommend the Tokyo Sushi-Making Tour :)

It was amazing day in japan =). I had so much fun in my japanese school.Mr. Naoya is very good at sushi making and teach.Mr.Naoya is and his friends are very nice peoples.I recommend this experience to everyone =)

Great Experience. Made several types of sushi and the class was so fun. Learned a bit about Japanese cuisine traditions in history as well and the food was really good. It's a great experience for anyone who loves sushi.

Amazing Day Learning How to Properly Make Sushi. Where to even begin! Naoya was amazing in teaching my group of 4 how to make sushi.First, when we met him near the train station, he led us back to where we would be learning. Once we arrived, he immediately donned traditional Japanese clothing and gave us some to wear as well. From that point on, I knew it was going to be an unforgettable afternoon. After going thru some background information on sushi, Naoya asked us trivia questions about what we had learned. I thought this was a great way to have us remember the basics of sushi making. Our group was super competitive with making the best sushi and he had the tough job of judging whose was best. During the tour, we made approximately five or six different types of sushi/sashimi. Having never consumed sushi until this class, I was extremely hesitant to even try the tamest of sushi.After the tour completed, Naoya took us out to this amazing restaurant where we ate even more food and talked for hours. Overall, the afternoon flew by and it was a HUGE highlight of my trip to Tokyo.I cannot recommend this experience enough. I now know that I have a new friend in Tokyo.

The sushi making beat all of my expectations and will definitely be the most memorable part of my trip.. I had never made sushi before so i was a bit nervous to how i might do, but it was taught so well and everything turned out so delicious. I can't wait to try out what I learned at home.I would highly recommend this experience to anyone traveling to Japan. The chef was highly professional, talented, and a phenomenal instructor.
Amazing day!. When i was a child i was interested in everything belong to Japan, especially Sushi. So I decided to come here. 1 year ago i had a chance to

It's so good personal experience.. I had interest making a sushi. I was not able to makes sushi. But I went sushi making tour. This opportunity I was changing. I can makes sushi now. I'll recommend for u. You can make sushi. You should makes sushi!haha I was tooooo much enjoy!!!!!!!!!!You have to do that.

Afternoon of Sushi Making. Went to the Sushi-making tour with very few ideas of what to expect, and came away with a set of pretty awesome and fun stories from an afternoon of making sushi and getting to know Naoya, who not only explained sushi-making but really gave us a full Japanese experience. To borrow a sports expression, he left it all on the field.

Used to live in Japan and still learned a bunch. I used to teach in Japan a few years ago, finally took my wife and some friend back for a vacation. Did more touristy stuff this time and tried the Sushi making tour. It was awesome, had some much fun making and learning about sushi. if u even take a vacation to japan please do yourself a favor and try it out.

Amazing Experience. This tour is one not to be missed! Naoya was amazing, not only did he teach us how to make sushi, he taught us basic etiquette of dining in Tokyo, as well as some simple Japanese phrases to use (very handy for a first-timer to Japan). As there was only 2 of us doing the tour, our experience was very personal, something I don't feel can be given from a large tour company. Another point to mention is Naoya is fluent in English, something I have found a little hard to come by during my stay and I don't really know any Japanese. I can't recommend this tour enough, it was definately an experience worth more than the price we paid!
great experience. I have great experience and lots of fun with this sushi-making tour when I was in Tokyo ;)And the best part is that you can eat the delicious sushi you made yourself ;)

Don't leave Japan without having Sushi-making experience at Tokyo Sushi-making Tour in Tokyo. It was amazing!!!! it is worth immerse yourself to true Japanese culture. I got to make a roll of sushi and Nigiri. If you are a sushi lover, don't be just satisfied with eating sushi in Japan. You must try how to make sushi. Tokyo Sushi-making Tour will teach you how to make a roll of sushi and Nigiri and teach you sushi manners.

Best experience in Tokio. We had a great experience in our Sushi workshop at Naoya Morishita's place. Great to learn about sushi making, and to get some background information. But really exciting to be invited at some-ones home. We loved Tokio, but this was our best experience!

Very interesting!. Attended the tour with classmates. The tour is interesting and the teacher is very nice and friendly. We learnt a lot from the tour and ate our hand made sushi after finished. The experience was quite nice and I think it is worthy join if you are interested in Japanese food as well as culture.

a fun and empowering lesson on the most traditional Japanese cuisine. A very welcoming and warm atmosphere. I learned so much and I still use the new skills to make sushi for my family regularly. I highly recommend it for anyone interested in one of the most important Japanese food traditions.

Definitely worthy for visiting. Knowing the Sushi-making Tour and the cute couple is my great pleasure. They gave me a real unforgettable experience during my trip in Tokyo. Not only do they provide a really professional introduce related to Japanese culture but also the detailed process of teaching how to make a sushi. I also have a lot of fun when i was learning the sushi-making, cuz Naoya and his wife are really own a friendly personality and great patient. We both exchange our own cultures and share the story of how Naoya built his dream of "Tokyo Sushi-making." During this tour (course), I learned how to made a beautiful sushi and also learn the story about how a Japanese youth built a tour that proudly share the Japanese culture to foreigners. Thanks for this tour inspired me a lot and really made my trip in Tokyo worthier.

This should be a part of all Tokyo itineraries!. I highly recommend Naoya's sushi making tour to everyone visiting Tokyo. You'll get to experience first hand an essential part of the Japanese culture which is sushi. From learning terms like "shari" and "murasaki" to learning how to write your name in Japanese, Naoya has a lot of fun, well-organized activities in store for you. I love sushi so until now I find myself using the skills I learned from Naoya to make home made sushi. It's definitely a fun, educational, and unique experience that shouldn't be missed.
Fun!!. I was a little nervous because It was my first time to make sushi. But It was so fun since Naoya taught me how to make it very politly!!

An experience everyone should try!!. During my journey to Japan I was able to meet Naoya Sensei and his sushi making tour, it was one of the most rewarding activities I had, now I'm able to prepare sushi back in my country. I encourage everyone to try "Tokyo Sushi-making Tour", you will have an awesome experience and you will get a new friend, just as I did.　先生，本当にありがとうございます！

Excellent!. Naoya's Sushi class was way better than what I was expecting at first. The event was well organized and everything went smoothly. He also created games for the participants to get everyone engaged in his lesson while having fun at the same time. I really learned a lot from him, from sushi-eating manners to making sushi. His sushi making class is one of my most memorable experience in Japan.

Pretty neat experience making sushi!. I was a bit skeptical at first due to having to go to a pretty remote area based on my research, but after I met Naoya everything went smoothly.Naoya was patient and kind as I fumbled my way through making decorative rolls, learning to make Nigiri, and even provided some cool shots of my finished sushi lunch.I would have liked to have learned more about how to make sushi rice (shari!), but thankfully Naoya went over the basics of it and I'm sure the Internet can fill in the rest.It's fired up my desire to learn how to make more decorative rolls (since I'm unsure how easy it will be to come by sushi grade fish in Europe easily), and I'm definitely going to invest in getting my own set of equipment (which is shockingly cheap, apart from the rice cooker).I also feel like I've made a friend in Naoya! He's really passionate about food and cooking and learning about other regions' cuisines!Definitely recommend this if you're a casual passer by looking for a quick crash course on making sushi. If you're a professional chef looking for something a bit more intensive, this probably isn't the right setting for you.
Great. We had such a great time here. We learnt how to make great proper sushi and the history. I highly recommend coming here.

Such a pleasant time!. I was a bit worried about finding the location but actually google map solved all problems, although there's about 10 mins walk from MTR station but along the way i felt harmony in the area. Yurico's home is very nice, with a bit of european style decorations, high ceiling big windows, sunlights coming making the feeling so good. Our menu is Udon, having it made from scratch, it's a really good experience because i have never thought of making noodle myself though i love eating it so much, every process is fun and interesting!Yurico is such a nice lady, gentle, patient, she explained well and she taught us some japanese traditional cooking method, i must go and learn other menu next time!

Experience to don´t miss in Tokyo. The cooking class was amazing!! From the first minut to the last one we enjoyed. Yuriko was really friendly. We had the class only for us and that make us to feel relaxed and to enjoy every moment. Yuriko explaned us everything clearly and easy that we could understand. We had fun and the food that we prepare was really tasty and really good quality. We definiltely recommend to everyone to visit Yuriko´s class!!! The week after we come back from our trip, we manage to cook the same that we had learnt, that feeling was awesome!!!

Very Enjoyable!. We had a great few hours with Yurico in her home. She was super welcoming and very clearly explained the steps needed to make maki rolls. We did the class on the first day of our holiday and it was a great introduction to Japan and Japanese cuisine, I learnt a lot.She took photos of us throughout the lesson so we didn't need to worry ourselves about stopping to take photos and provided us unlimited tea to drink! The steps for making the food were clear and we got clear instructions to bring home with us as well. The food we made was delicious and we had plenty of time to sit and eat and enjoy it all after we had finished. Yurico took the time to ask about our itineraries in Japan and gave us lots of tips on shopping, restaurants etc too!Would highly highly recommend this experience!

Wonderful experience. Yurico was a patient teacher and very warm and welcoming. Her home is beautiful, and my friend and I had a great experience. I even made gyoza with her recipe when I returned home! Thank you Yurico!

Fantastic experience - highly recommended. A great 3 hour session to see how the Japanese cook, to talk to a local person and hear about their lives. It was a lovely experience and we really enjoyed it. Yurico was an amazing person and this was a highlight of our trip!Highly recommended

Best experience in Japan. Yuriko's class was by far our best experience in Japan. I went with my husband and eight-year-old son. We signed up to make maki sushi and she also taught us to make two different salads and miso soup. I learned so much in the three and a half hour class. She taught us a lot about Japanese cooking and lifestyle. She was great to answer so many questions we had about culture; and she has such a way of making you feel comfortable and welcome. She had a great sense of humor and that made the experience fun as well as informative. One thing I loved was her attention to detail when cooking. She not only teaches you to cook the food but also to arrange it beautifully (which is not something I usually do). Yuriko's home is nice, clean and welcoming. It was easy to get to by subway (just a few minutes walk). I was hesitant to take my eight-year-old son to a cooking class; However, he did very well. He really loved the experience and Yuriko made him feel so special. If I ever go back to Japan I will be taking the remainder of her cooking classes. Wonderful experience in every way!

Great day with Yurico. Spent a wonderful second last day in Tokyo, Japan at the home of Yurico cooking and learning calligraphy. Yurico was an engaging and professional host and teacher. We loved every minute and she provided us with wonderful memories of our time in Japan. We recommend her to all, and will go back again when next in Tokyo.

great cooking experience with Yurico. we had a wonderful experience cooking at Yurico's home. the environment was really nice and we felt like at home. Yurico prepared very fresh ingredients and taught us in a very simple and clear way. we are definitely going to cook some Japanese dishes at home :) highly recommended to everyone who is visiting Japan and is interesting in home cooking.

charming Japanese home cooking expetisnce. The host is charming. The whole workshop is fascinating Enjoyed ebery minute. I am forced by tripad to write at lest 100 words. I said it all in one paragraph Yurico knows a lot about cooking and dhe explains it well.

One of the best experiences we had in Japan!. Yurico guided us through our sushi making class in a very friendly, yet very professional way. Everything was superbly prepared, from instructions on how to get there, the ingredients, up to having recipes to keep and tips for the rest of the day. It was like having a great friend come over and a great insight into a Japanese kitchen.The meals we made were absolutely delicious and we could not even believe it was us who made them - of course, mostly thanks to Yurico's explanations and guidance :) I can only recommend this to anyone!

Cooking in a familiar atmosphere, just like cooking with a very good friend. This cooking class with Yuriko was one of our highlights in Tokyo and a recommendation for every tourist in Japan. After booking, Yuriko send us all the information we needed (address, metro station). It was not difficult to find her place in Tokyo. Yuriko introduced us into the japanese cuisine with a lot of useful and interesting facts about cooking. We had such a nice time with Yuriko in her wonderful home. She has definitely the right technique in rolling sushi. She is a great cooking teacher and generous host.

A fantastic experience in Tokyo!. I really wanted to make time for a cookery course in Japan, and I'm so glad I chose this one. It was a straight forward journey on the subway with a 10 minute walk from the station. Very easy to book with fast replies and excellent details provided. It was just me and another lady in the class, so we had lots of opportunity to ask questions and find out more about life in Japan. Yurico was the perfect host and instantly made us feel at home. It was great to spend time with Yuriko in her beautiful Japanese apartment, she is so warm and friendly,and so passionate about the ingredients and recipes. The making sushi was incredible and I have already tried making it again at home...successfully! Thank you Yuriko x

A Must Do When Visiting Tokyo. This class was such a fun and personal experience. Yurico is a great cooking teacher and a great host. My boyfriend and I love cooking and this class was one of our favorite experiences in Tokyo. We especially enjoyed how much more personal this experience was than the other cooking classes available in Tokyo. Yurico even talked to us as we ate the lunch we made and recommended places to visit and delicious foods to try! Definitely recommend this class!

Yurico is an awesome cooking teacher!. If I could give Yurico more than 5 stars, I would. Her english is excellent and she was highly prepared and organized to teach me. I learnt how to make Udon from scratch (and some awesome side dishes) which required alot of skill. She was a true professional and expert in Japanese cooking. If I can ever return to Tokyo, I will definitely arrange to take another class with Yurico!! I am a professional chef as well and I wanted to do this for continuing education which I certainly received!

Lovely, personal and delicious experience. My partner and I took the Kitsune udon and calligraphy classes with Yurico in her home. She was very communicative and provided detailed directions and instructions about the classes. When we were late, she was extremely forgiving and welcomed us into a relaxing and fun experience. There were two other students who were fun to talk to. Something that made Yurico's class stand out to me was that she told lots of stories as she was teaching us–that a certain ingredient was something her mother used to use or the history of a particular food preparation technique. The work was fun and interactive and she was always happy to assist as necessary. The meal we ate at the end of the cooking class was wonderful (and large) and prepared us to work hard at calligraphy! Yurico was very patient with us as she gave an introduction to Japanese calligraphy, and offered helpful tips to use the brush and interesting background on its presence in culture today. I would highly recommend you visit Yurico for a beautiful and authentic afternoon.

Pork Gyoza Cooking Lesson. An excellent experience:Yurico is a welcoming and knowledgeable host. She even managed to re-arrange an appointment with us during a typhoon in good time (the weather made it too dangerous to travel!). Her house really stands out from the crowd as well so its nice and easy to find and her directions made it even easier.As well as making gyoza we were also introduced to some side dishes and given insights into the differences between western and Japanese styles of food presentation. We were also instructed on cutting and salting techniques that could be applied to any recipe.We were even given photos free of charge as memento of our experience, this was definitely a highlight of our trip. Thank you Yurico

Fantastic sushi class . Myself and my partner booked a sushi class with Yurico for our Tokyo stay. Booking was easy via the website and email. I let Yurico know I was vegetarian and she very helpfully planned the lesson so I could make a vegetarian sushi roll, while my partner made the traditional version with fish. Yurico was very friendly and knowledgable and told us all about the ingredients and the correct way of preparing them, including the science of Japanese cooking. We had a lovely morning cooking and a delicious meal to enjoy after. I would recommend Yurico's cooking class to anyone wanting to learn some traditional Japanese cooking while in Tokyo.

Super Japanese cooking class!!!!. We learned several recipes of the Japanese cooking style while we had a really good time!! She speaks fluent english (something that is not so normal in Japan) and always smiling! She explains everything of their way of cooking and culture! If you have a couple of hours in Tokyo, I do definitely recommend Yuricos courses!!

Family cooking class - Making Gyoza. We (my husband and 2 children, and I) had a lovely day making gyoza with Yurico! She is a great hostess and really good with children - teaching them the proper way to hold knives and cut vegetables to ensure the best flavour. We made gyoza from scratch and they were the best gyoza we have ever eaten - all thanks to Yurico and her recipe. I would definitely say this was one of the highlights of our trip to Tokyo and would recommend her class to anyone! We hope to visit again and try out another class.

Fantastic Experience! Thanks Yurico!. We had a great time at Yurico's cooking class. Our chosen dish was the Kitsune Udon and Yurico did a great job explaining and walking us through all the (somewhat labor-intensive) steps. Her house is impeccably clean and she has clearly taken the time to source all the best ingredients. We also made a side of green beans and eggplant. Yurico was extremely professional and we loved getting to have a great conversation with her about Japan. If you can, fit this into your Tokyo visit. You won't regret it!

Amazing Dinner with Yurico. We (spouse and I) took a cooking class with Yurico during our first trip to Japan and it was one of the highlights of our trip. As I do not eat any meat or fish, we opted to do the udon menu. It was really technical (and tough), but it was so fun and the meal was unbelievable. We made dashi, noodles, two veggies, and Yurico made us tamago when she learned that we had not yet tried it. Her home is beautiful and it was fun to cook with chopsticks (she did have utensils too). Yurico provided us with the recipes in English and we have used them since our class already. Yurico was so knowledgeable and it was great to learn about the food, cooking, and life in Japan. We had no issue getting to Yurico's home, or back to our hotel, by subway. We consider this an absolute must do when in Tokyo. We will definitely see her again for another class next trip!

Excellent experience with yurico. We have an excellent time with Yurico! We learnt to make udon from scratch, make two simple but tasty side dish, make our soup base. Yurico is very friendly and has a good command of English, so we have a wonderful time chatting after we finished our lunch. We talked about differences in our culture, lifestyle etc. Chatting with locals is definitely a MUST experience when visiting new places! Yurico has a really nicely decorated house, simple but stylish! Her place is not far from the subway station, so can easily access, very convenient! I would definitely join her cooking class again when i visit Tokyo again!

Excellent authentic experience!. My family of 4 (husband, daughter age 13, son age 11 and I ) thoroughly enjoyed our time with Yurico. We will use the recipes and skills we learned for years to come. Yurico is warm, inviting and skilled in the kitchen. In fact, the moment we got home to the United States my daughter made 4 batches of tamago yaki to battle jet lag! We enjoyed experiencing the lesson in a home environment. Highly recommend!!!

Excellent cooking class with charming Yurico in her lovely home. We had such a wonderful time with Yurico. She is not only a first class cook but also a great teacher and managed to keep two teenage boys interested and engaged. We tried the gyoza class and they were absolutely delicious. Beautiful presentation shown to us by Yurico who has a lovely collection of china and chopstick rests. Her house is so cute, we felt like we were in an interior magazine. I highly recommend this cooking class and it coordinates well with a trip to the fish market. We had a lovely day which we will never forget.

Really good moment!. Me and my mom had a really good moment at Yurico's place. We learn a lot of thing about japanese customs. At the end of the lesson, it was with great pleasure that we sat aorund the table and ate the food we had cooked all togheter. Thank you again Yurico :D
Cooking like a local. Myself and husband had a wonderful time at Yurico's cooking class. Yurico is very knowledgeable and we made some great dishes. I would highly recommend.

Wonderfull time at Yuricos place. The time spent at Yuricos place gave a great introduction to japanese cooking. Yurico is verry sweet and has vast knowledge about japanese home cooking that she makes shore gets through to everyone. She also makes sure to give you tips on how to adapt the cooking and the ingridients to your own home country. I really recomend you to take one of her cooking classes.

Highlight of our Tokyo trip. I had arranged a birthday surprise for my girlfriend, a home cooking class with Yurico. We had great time with hands on experience and managed to make a very good Yakitori and Tsukune meal with fluffy japanese cheesecakes for dessert. Yurico communicated professionally before, during and after the class, we even got a copy of the recipe. Now I am not a chef and don't usually like cooking but when Yuricos approach to cooking is based on chemistry as opposed to the usual improvised intuitive cooking, the scientist in me woke up and wanted to learn more.Highly recommended experience, totally worth the money.

Perfect cooking lesson with Yurico!. We really enjoyed cooking udon noodle with Yurico! We learned a lot about Japanese cooking thanks to her but also about Japanese way of life. Yurico is really nice, she explains well and that's really a pleasure to spend a moment with her. Thank you again Yurico!!!

Authentic Maki Sushi. Yurico is a knowledgeable teacher. I learned to prepare maki sushi, miso soup and two side dishes from scratch. The class is highly recommended to those who loves japanese food and want to prepare them as well. It's a great bonding for couples and family.

Excellent teacher and meal. We had a wonderful time learning japanese cooking from Yurico. She was careful in her instruction and broke things down so that we could apply them to more than just the dish we were cooking that day. She was also very welcoming while hosting in her home.

Great Experience. We loved having the opportunity to visit Yurico in her home which was beautiful and inviting. It gave us a glimpse into Japanese life. She spoke excellent English, and had great cooking knowledge. She was very prepared with print outs of the recipes and fresh cooking materials. We made gyoza and some side dishes, which we loved. And came home inspired to make gyoza ourselves. We learned a few great cooking tips. The calligraphy class she taught was an added bonus and relaxing. We got to use a few pieces of Japanese cooking equipment that is not commonly used in the US, which was interesting. We were sure to pick up a ginger grader and sesame grinding bowl before we came back to the US. This was one of the highlights of our trip. It was not hard to get to from the subway. We absolutely reccomend Yurico. She was a sweetheart and very engaging.

Great udon class!. Highly recommend this class! I learned how to make udon noodles from scratch and a lot of great tips for making Japanese food. Yurico was very accommodating to my food allergy. It was one of the highlights of my trip to Tokyo, the kind of thing you can't get if you only go to the major tourist spots.

Professional Cooking Tips . Yuriko san is full of cooking knowledge. She taught me lots of cooking skills, and the "chemistry" of how to make food delicious with all the nutritions remained. Highly recommended.

Very informative and fun day for a couple . Yurico was a lovely host, very informative about Japanese cuisine! I would recommend, if you have a day in Tokyo, to book with Yurico gain a sample of culture!CD

Fun and informative lesson with excellent host. My friends and I would highly recommend a cooking lesson with Yurico if you are staying in Tokyo. We went for the kitsune udon class which was fun, educational and delicious! We each got to make our own portion of udon noodles from scratch the authentic Japanese way by kneading with our feet (the dough is inside a sealed bag) and also made two tasty side dishes to go alongside the noodles. We were so inspired that we bought some Japanese kitchenwares during our travels so we could recreate the recipes properly back at home! Our lesson lasted about 3.5 hours as there were three of us and we went for a more complex recipe - there is a great variety of recipes to choose from on Yurico's website so you can take your pick. Yurico is a wonderful host, she is very engaging and friendly and made us feel very welcome and comfortable in her beautiful home - she even gave us tips for the rest of our travels through Japan!

Amazing Time with an Amazing Host. My girlfriend and I took Yuricos cooking lesson while staying in Japan for two weeks and it was an absolute highlight of our stay. Yurico took the time to not only help us cook a great traditional Japanese meal but also taught us the science and technique behind the methods. She was gracious and kind and her house is beautiful. My gf is an accomplished chef and I can barely make a grilled cheese and we both learned a lot from Yurico. Highly recommend!!

Do not miss out on this experience. A wonderful host. Not only did Yorico teach us to cook a delicious dinner, but gave us insights into cooking techniques in general, as well as ingredients we could use at home. It was a lot of fun, a lovely environment, and we did not feel rushed at all. I think we would have stayed longer, except we had to leave.Thank you so much for making our trip so enjoyable. We had a three month stay in Japan in various locations, I would certainly place this as one of our top recommendations if you are near Tokyo.

Very cozy cooking class in Tokyo. We went to this cooking class based on reviews we found on Trip Advisor for Yurico.She was very pleasant and helpful. At the end we were really happy to have chosen her.Instructions were very clear and thorough. Length of the class was enough to learn, eat and make the food itself. The class itself was easy to get too, not far from the train. It was very nice to have it as a small more private lesson.

The best cooking experience ever with Yurico!. I have always been interested in learning how to cook Japanese cuisine here in Japan but my Japanese is not fluent enough so I could not take Japanese cooking classes that is not conducted in English. Taking Yurico's class is the best decision I have ever made - Yurico's English is fluent, and her explanation was very clear. Yurico's home is very clean and it was so comfortable to both cook and eat at her place. Yurico was willing to answer any question and I can tell she is a very professional cook as she knows all the basics. After class, she even treated my boyfriend and I two slices of sweet melon and we spent an hour just chatting. Yurico is one of the sweetest person I have ever met in Japan. I would recommend Yurico's cooking classes to anyone!

Great and happy experience cooking with Yurico!. It was a very happy and unique cooking experience with Yurico. Her class took place at her home, we can enjoy our food at her place. We have a nice talk while enjoying our food. Thank you for providing such a great lesson for us. Thank you Yurico.

Cooking with Eurico. I recently had the chance to take a cooking class with Yurico in Tokyo. The class was unique because it takes place in her home. Although a bit difficult to find, it was a great experience to do this in a home setting. We made ginger pork as well as a few side dishes, sesame green beans, which were delicious, miso soup from scratch, and grilled eggplant. What a great way to explore a new culture.

Cooking with Yurico. The class was heaps of fun, well organised and executed brilliantly. Yurico speaks excellent english and communication was effortless and highly enjoyable.Highly recommended for anyone looking to add alittle authentic home cooking to their travel adventure.

Great way to learn basic Japanese cooking. We arrived late because we got lost trying to find Yurico's house. But the man at 7-11 knew her and brought us to her doorstep. It would be useful to have a detailed map on how to get there as not all of us may have internet access while on holiday.Yurico was a patient and encouraging teacher. Despite us arriving late, she didn't hassle us to end the class on time, and she was very apologetic about us losing our way there. The class was only attended by my friend and I, so Yurico was able to be very attentive. Her kitchen was fantastic, super organised, clean and not as small as some of the other kitchens in Japan that we have been to. We asked her many questions on the tools that she used for the cooking process, and she gave us very good tips on where we would be able to get them. Maybe she should have a few of the items on standby to sell to her students as I'm sure others would have asked similar questions about buying Japanese kitchen tools. :)We had a great chat about family, travel and food while eating what we have cooked. I think we stayed at her apartment way beyond the time we were supposed to have ended the class. She speaks good English, which is really helpful for the cooking class. I would definitely recommend her class to others.

Great class with a great teacher. Our cooking class with Yurico was a wonderful experience. Yurico was a welcoming hostess who made Japanese cooking very straightforward and enjoyable, even for those with limited cooking experience. Our group opted for the okonomiyaki menu and learnt many useful techniques in making okonomiyaki and the side dishes (miso soup, tamagoyaki and grilled aubergine). Yurico was a great teacher and clearly explained the science of cooking and Japanese flavour combinations. I also appreciated that Yurico was able to adjust her recipes for my dietary requirements.We then ate our food at a traditional Japanese table and chatted to Yurico about Japanese vs British life. Yurico was very engaging with each member of our group and we gave us a real insight into Japanese cuisine and culture. Overall her class was one of the highlights of our trip and I’d highly recommend it to anyone visiting Tokyo.

Home cooking class. The cooking class with Yurico was great. Travelling to Japan we wanted to take as much of the culture away from our visit as possible. Learning how to cook dishes that local's cook is a great way to do that as well as enjoying some delicious food. The class was held in Yurico's home which lends itself to the friendly and informal atmosphere of the class where you are able to chat to Yurico. She obviously has a great interest in food as we were able to ask her all sorts of questions about Japanese food culture, and she ask us about our national food and culture... We had a great time cooking and we were also able to add a 'calligraphy experience' to the class.

Great Experience!. We had an awesome time cooking with Yurico. She was so nice and helpful and paitent with us. Our phone had a problem in japan so we could not open the map she sent to us. We wandered around for nearly an hour before we were able to find where we needed to go and she was so patient and helpful with us while we were lost. We made Okonomiyaki and it was delicious! We made it 2 more times after getting home! Here directions were easy to follow and she discussed good substitutes for the few ingredients that may be hard to find outside Japan. Overall it was a great learning experience and a great time!

Preparing Japanese food with a friendly and gracious expert!. We had a great time with Yurico-san! For me, it was one of the highlights of our trip to Tokyo. Four of us (two keen chefs, four keen eaters!) took part in the class with Yurico-san to prepare norimaki, various vegetable side dishes, miso soup (including dashi from scratch) and my special request – tamagoyaki, which I absolutely love! I am so happy that she patiently explained and showed us how to make all of these things properly and I will definitely be making them again at home soon. She also gave us some invaluable tips for cooking in general, as well as the Japanese approach to balance in the national cuisine. Her home was bright and welcoming, just like her! I would definitely recommend this to other travellers hoping to do something a little different while in Tokyo. She emailed me some pictures of the class, as well as extra information that our jetlagged brains might have forgotten, and I'm really looking forward to looking through it all!

Great cooking class with Yurico. We were visting Japan for the first time and decided to attend Yuricos cooking class as we both love cooking and wanted to learn about japanese cuisine. We really enjoed our class with Yurico. She is a very professional chef and shared a lot of special knowledgewith us. We learned about cutting,salt, temperature and texture of food. Everything was prepared very well so that we could easily start to cook. The meal was soooo delicious and we felt comfortable all the time. Yurico was friendly and helped us a lot. She printed all the recipes for us so that we can took them home. We very so happy that we choose her class. We really recommend to attend this class. Thank you Yurico, we will definitely try the recipes at home :-)

Informative cooking class and open and welcoming teacher. I went to Yurico's class alone. She was very efficient and clear in sending instructions on registration and how to get to her house before my trip. Yurico is very welcoming and an excellent teacher at not only Japanese cuisine, but also the science behind cooking. She is also keen to learn about other cultures and cuisines as well. I would recommend this class to anybody who wishes to learn traditional or modern Japanese cooking.

Unique & Fun. I love to cook & bake, so when I read about the Japanese private cooking classes in homes, I was ecstatic! After convincing my husband to come with me & searching through TA for a good one, I landed with a reservation with Yurico.Yurico was very prompt & professional when corresponding via email, her English is fantastic, and her house was fairly easy to find. The class itself (we made Gyoza & sides) was so much fun - even my husband had a great time & told me he was so glad we did it! The price is very reasonable considering the market prices, and I can't wait to find some of the ingredients locally to start making my own gyoza at home!Thank you, Yurico! Next time I'm in Japan, I'll definitely make a date to learn a new dish :)

Awesome experience. What a fun afternoon! So glad we decided to do this. We met Yurico in her cute home and started our time with a tea service (barley tea was delicious!). We wanted a taste of local culture and got exactly that. Fun conversation with Yurico, the experience of being in her home, and yummy food. We tried the Okonomiyaki (Japanese savory 'pancake') to opt for something different. We made that, Tamago (egg- best we had whole trip), green beans with sesame dressing, and homemade miso soup. Yurico was a very good teacher and provided us with printed recipes to take home. She explained which ingredients were essential and which wouldn't matter if you left out (you know, in case you don't have small dried shrimp lying around). Recipes were pretty easy and definitely reproducible at home. We even hand shaved our bonito flakes (our workout for the day- though we will buy them shaved at home). The whole experience was very fun. Definitely recommend! Thank you, Yurico!

professional friendly exoerience. i Joined the class with my Japanese friend and together with a couple coming from Spaign/australia.Yurico has been very warm offering us tea and explaining step by stp what we were going to do in the next 3 hours.The home is very nice and clean, the kitchen is open on the living room and functional enough to accomodate all of us. Yurico gave us printed receips very detalied with pictures and clear explanation of all the ingredients. She explained and showed us each passage and let us prepare helping to improve the technique. We prepared home made udon noodles , the dash soup and side dishes, she presented the dinner in a very elegant tray offering us sweet strawberries for dessert and we enjoyed everything at the end of the class sitting in the traditional japanese way.I have been very excited as I really found was I was expecting in terms of learning and traditional experience and I can only say Arigatogosaimas to Yurico for her class.

Wonderful cooking class!. My family loved our cooking lesson with Yurico! We learned to make maki sushi rolls, miso soup, and two side dishes. She was a patient and gracious teacher while also being very efficient and informative--giving both lessons on cooking and also on the techniques and some cultural insight into what we were making. In addition, she was incredibly kind with our two children, ages 10 and 6. And we very much enjoyed eating our meal at the end! Really a wonderful experience, highly recommend.

Home cooking in Japanese home. Learning how to cook Gyoza with Yurico has been a very stimulating experience. She gave us many useful tipps concerning also two side dishes and miso soup. We alsoe received printed recipes to bring home.Yurico is a very nice person, speaks fluent English and it has been really interesting to get an insight into Japanese daily life.
Find the time to try it. I truly enjoyed Yurico's class. She teaches all you need to cook a delicious Japanese meal.I left with the desire to buy food and cookware to cook Japanese home.

Amazing class and teacher!. Yurico was the nicest, sweetest host and teacher! I had so much fun at her sushi and calligraphy class and will absolutely do it again next time I'm in Japan with friends! Highly recommend!

Brilliant experience!. I would recommend this to anyone interested in either getting to know some locals, japanese cooking (in particular the more practical and fun home cooking) and/or calligraphy! It is situated fairly centrally and is very easy to get to (5min from the subway station). Yurico is such a pleasure to get to know! She is a very good teacher, motivated and very knowledgeable. Not only does she have years of experience cooking for her family and friends on a daily basis, but she has also taken several professional cooking classes and food science classes. I learnt a lot not just about japanese cooking, but food science in general!The class itself teaches you a nice variety of dishes - I took the sushi maki class and made: sushi maki, miso soup (from scratch - i.e. making the stock first and then adding miso!) and two sides (delicious!). You get great tips along the way and some instructions to take home at the end. I also did a calligraphy class at the end - I found it was a great way to unwind after the cooking (almost meditative) and gave a great insight into Japanese culture. It's definitely worth investing in as well!

Great way to understand Japanese culture!. I am a Japanese, attended the class to accompany my friend from Italy. We made Udon noodle and side dishes. I assure you that you could learn "Genuine" Japanese cuisine through the class together with Japanese culture! Highly reccomended.

Wonderful cooking class in Tokyo!. I was delighted to take Yurico's cooking class when I travelled to Tokyo last December. It was a great experience learning and cooking Japanese dishes. Yurico was very friendly and patient. She provided step by step instruction on how to make Sushi rolls, Japanese omelette and Miso soup...etc. She also shared some useful cooking tips and advices to help improve my cooking skills. (Now I can make Japanese omelette at home!) I would recommend this cooking class to anyone interested in Japanese food and cooking. I had a great time here and would like to come back for another Japanese cooking class. Thanks Yurico!

Great experience. Had an amazing afternoon with yurico, my fiance and i felt very welcome and yurico was an incredible teacher, we learnt heaps and cant wait to get home and cook all by ourselves. Would recommend to anyone wanting to try something a little of the normal tourist trail

What a lovely experience. Having had experience in sushi and gyoza making we booked in for the yakitori and tsukune class. Yuriko was very welcoming and knowledgable, and introduced a few scientific principles into the class which we found very helpful (e.g. how much salt to add). She also indulged our requests to make an eggplant dish and to christen the knife we had bought the previous day at Kappabashi St (aka Kitchen St, which we'd highly recommend for foodie types, near Asakusa).Our meal was sensational, with the yakitori, tsukune, eggplant dish, a green bean dish, made-from-scratch miso soup and some lovely homemade yuzu pickles. We will definitely use the recipes again.It was also lovely to be in Yuriko's home, and I confess to some kitchen organisation envy ... a place for everything and everything in its place.

Great experience!!. Yurico is very knowledgable not only on Japanese cooking, but cooking in general. My husband and I had a wonderful time learning the Japanese culture and flavours and also had the opportunity to meet new people not to mention the food was really authentic and tasty too. Will definitely be trying the recipes at home!

Fantastic Japanese cooking class!. My family and I attended one of Yurico's Japanese cooking classes and we all loved the experience (our children are aged 11 and 14). The menu we chose was teriyaki fish but the class included making dashi stock, miso soup, two vegetable dishes and the fish. She is a great teacher and very organised, explaining some of the science behind the food preparation techniques and recipes we learned. We all had to chop and cook the food, plate up the dishes and of course enjoyed eating the fruits of our labour! It was an absolute pleasure to meet Yurico and we learnt so much from her class!

Japanese Home Cooking Lessons. My husband and I wanted to do something different while on vacation in Tokyo. We enrolled in Yurico's class to learn how to make gyoza. We had so much fun. We learned not only how to make yummy Japanese recipes but also about Japanese life and culture. The class was in her very comfortable home. We had a preview of a typical Japanese home.Yurico has a good command of English and explains each recipe clearly. We enjoyed our 3 hours with her. This was the highlight of our trip! We will definitely return one day and try more recipes! Thank you very much Yurico!

Amazing. Absolutely loved the cooking class!!Yurico was so lovel and spoke about the science of cooking and how flavours compliment one another. I would recommend this for everyone to do. Delicious food and a great experience

Great cooking class!. Attended Yurico cooking class on 19th Dec!She knew that i wanted to make some dessert and visit the supermarket, she actually offer to change the cooking menu and brought me to the supermarket after class.She is very patience and helpful, we had made Miso soup from scratch, Green Bean with Sesame dressing, Oyakodon and Dorayaki. She even prepared receipt print out for me to bring home.

So homely and fab food!!. We arrived and sat at a traditional Japanese table where there was tea waiting for us. Our host was so friendly and met to all of our needs, she even suggesting if we're tired we could have a nap :).When we were cooking we made Some omelette eggs, miso soup, sesame green beans and gyozas. She explained instructions very well, encouraged us to help out and even suggested variants to suit our taste. I would absolutely reccomend her for a traditional personalised experience and I'm really happy I chose this class over the larger classes that were offered in Shibuya.

Fantastic, must-do experience. Me and my partner took part in Yurico's cooking class on our last day in Tokyo and it was truly one of the highlights of our trip. Yurico was friendly and very informative and passionate about her culture, cooking and learning more about her customers. We really enjoyed learning how to make sushi and the calligraphy lesson afterwards was an extra lesson on Japanese culture. We thoroughly enjoyed our class and would recommend to anyone.

Absolute highlight of our trip to Tokyo!. My fiancé and I did a cooking class with Yurico recently, we learnt to make Udon noodles, and a few side dishes. After travelling through Japan for 2 months, this was one of our absolute highlights! Yurico is a talented chef, very good English speaker and an incredibly nice, generous and interesting person. Her class combines a lesson in history, Japanese cuisine, cooking techniques and life in Japan. We had an amazing experience and would recommend to anyone
A worthwhile class. A very nice cooking class, Yurico was a very friendly teacher who spoke English well. She gave good information and tips on Japanese cooking.

Amazing experience. Yuriko's Cooking Class has been an amazing experience. She is such a sweet and kind person and we really enjoyed cooking japanese dishes with her. We later also bought some of the ingredients at the markets in Tokyo and still enjoy doing some of the dishes now at home in Berlin. We could have stayed at her nice place for hours, keeping on chatting and laughing. Thank you again - as promised we'll gonna teach you some vegetable stews when you come to Germany. All the best to you and your family!

Wonderful time with Yurico!. My mother and I did a girls' trip to Tokyo last month, and thought that a cooking class would complement the other 'more standard activities' of eating and shopping. The reviews for Yurico's class were amazing and her website was appealing, so we signed up for a class. The experience was perfect from start to finish – everything from registering, the class itself, and the follow up afterwards with pictures of our experience. Not only is Yurico a great cook and teacher who is passionate about her work, but such a caring person too. Her home is beautiful and a joy to learn in. And the food we made was absolutely delicious! I would not hesitate to recommend Yurico's classes and would do another one with her if we come to Tokyo again! Thanks Yurico for a lovely time!

Home cooking with Yurico. Yurico was very flexible with arranging a time for the cooking class. Her home is conveniently located close to the subway and is very close to other tourist attractions. If you want to have a more involved experience during your travel, a cooking class is an excellent way to get to know the country and Yurico's class was a highlight. Yurico was very responsive to questions about both the cooking as well as Japan in general. Highly recommended if you're into cooking.

Wonderful experience. My boys and I enjoyed the whole process of making udon and it certainly was fun for us! Yurico-san explained in detailed the process and even taught us how to make small dishes to go along with the udon!Thank you Yurico-san for your time!

Maki sushi. We visited the maki sushi class and it was a good expierience. First of all yurico picked us up from the station and we walked to her house only about 5min. Then we got introduced and started with the cooking. She explained everything very exactly and if she couldent findnot the right words, she tried to discripe us with others. It was a nice atmosphere and we learned a lot.

HIGHLY RECCOMEND. So much fun! Welcomed into the beautiful home of Yurico where she took the time to explain and interpret Japanese culture. Go on an empty stomach, there is plenty of food! My partner even enjoyed his time, said it was his favorite day in Tokyo! I've been to a few cooking classes in Tokyo on previous trips, this was my favorite!! Easy directions and very quick with email responses! (Even emailed us photos of our day) Thank- You again

Home cooking class with Yurico. This is our first cooking class with local Japanese. Yurico warmly welcomed us and provide us tips, Japanese cooking culture,and knowledge about cooking & science. This is a great experience for us to understand more about Japanese food and culture.

Cooking Udon with Yurico!~. My husband and I had the pleasure of learning to cook Udon with Yurico in her home.It was a wonderful experience. Yurico is so lovely, she made us feel very comfortable and she is an EXCELLENT teacher. We learned a lot of new things, not only about Japanese cuisine, but also about the science of cooking. Tips and tricks we can now use on a daily basis.And the best part... The food we cooked was absolutely delicious!! I would recommend Yurico's home cooking class to anyone traveling to Tokyo, and we hope to be back again to learn something new!(Thank you again for your hospitality and a great time!)

Excellent Japanese Cooking class!. Yurico's class was one of the best foreign cooking classes I've attended. She has a good command of English so it is easy to understand her instructions. She combines both science and cooking in her techniques which is really interesting and informative. It was nice to have a private class with her - we were just two participants so she was really hands-on with the teaching and both of us really learned from her. She has a lovely home which is a short walk from the station and is incredibly hospitable (serves you tea upon arrival, shares tips on places to visit, even provides you a train station map as a guide and in our case, even provided a strip for back pain for my companion!!). Would love to take another class with her if I were to visit Tokyo again. Very recommended!!

Fantastic cooking experience. If you are in Tokyo and want a Japanese cooking experience I really recommend this! Yurico was so friendly and knowledgable.There were three of us doing the class and we opted for the Okonomiyaki menu (a kind of thick Japanese pancake). We chose this as we'd eaten quite a bit of Japanese food already but had never heard of Okonomiyaki. The class lasted just over 2 hours and was very interesting. I cook a bit myself but I felt like a learnt a great deal about Japanese cooking. We also cooked a Japanese omlette, green beans with a sesame seed dressing (it was delicious) and an cold aubergine/eggplant dish. The Okonomiyaki was different to anything I'd had before but was really tasty.Yurico was a really lovely person, she gave us great advice for the rest of our trip about the best delicacies to try in each area of Japan. It was also great to do the class in a local persons house rather than a cookery school.I would really really recommend it, it was one of the highlights of our fantastic 2 weeks in Japan!

Great cooking class!. Yurico's cooking class was a great experience. We had a great time making delicious udon and side dishes from scratch. She taught us a lot about Japanese food and cooking! Would highly recommend doing if in Tokyo.

Authentic and Delicious Cooking Class. Yurico's cooking class provides an excellent value if you're looking for a cooking class preparing authentic Japanese cuisine.Booking online was simple and Yurico maintained great communication. Upon confirming our booking, we received directions to her place. We took public transport to the closest station, and it was an easy walk to her place from the nearest train station.Yurico was welcoming and her house was very nice. She had all the equipment, utensils, and ingredients waiting for us.Her English is very good, and we had no issues communicating during the session.We opted for the sushi class and learned how to make not only sushi, but miso soup, Japanese style omelets, and more.Yurico continues to perfect her culinary skills under a highly trained chef, and you can tell she has both a passion for cooking and a deep understanding of culinary fundamentals.She even took some great photos of us with her professional camera and emailed it to us after.I highly recommend Yurico if you're looking for a fun cooking class in Tokyo.

Very Pleasant Experience!. My husband and I were very excited to take the class with Yurico at her house since this is a type of experience you can't just get anywhere. Her home was very easy to find from the train station. We used our phone to navigate the way. Her house is so adorable and very comfortable. Yurico is probably one of the nicest and most sincere people I've ever met. The class was definitely interesting and she has taken culinary classes which she shares her tips with us. I'm not a good cook by any means and she provided many tips along the way. Honestly our most favorite part of this experience was our conversation with Yurico while eating our food. It was very neat to hear about the Japanese culture from someone from Japan. Her English is very good and the conversation was very pleasant. She made us feel at home and even took photos of us while cooking and eating and a few days later, emailed us the photos. I appreciated it. If you have some time, definitely take her class! I'd even suggest her having some mini classes too in case people are short on time. We really enjoyed her class.

Fun, fascinating and interesting cooking lesson. First off, for all you English-speakers out there, Yurico's command of the English language is very good indeed and you'll have no problems communicating.Secondly, if you're interested in knowing a little bit more about how Japanese people eat at home, Yurico is your lady. Her class is held in her very own home, which is wonderfully decorated and has a very nice atmosphere. So not only is she an excellent English speaker but also a generous host for allowing us all into her home!Finally, whatever yummy Japanese food you wanna eat, it's worth asking Yurico because she will probably be happy to indulge you in most things. We chose gyoza, so after preparing the ingredients we had a lovely chat around her dining table while we folded dumplings, got to know each other and determined by observing the dumplings' quality who in the group was the most successful during arts & crafts lessons at school.Yurico is a friendly, gracious, good-humoured host and I would absolutely recommend her class to anybody. She even gave us good tips on what else to do during our time in Tokyo. Worth every penny!
Fun experience. I took Yurico's class twice. It was very enjoyable. Teacher was very nice.Recipes is easy to follow and tasty.

Good home cooking class. As described, Yurico's home cooking class give you an excellent overview of some of the traditional (and tastiest) dishes Japan has to offer. Yurico accommodates you by taking on board things you'd like to lesrn how to cook - I'm not sure if this would be possible if it were a big class, I was in a group of 3. You also learn some basic but useful cooking tips which you can take back home. Brilliant afternoon spent in Tokyo. Would recommend.

Be prepared to create your own Okonomiyaki and much more.... Yurico knows a lot about the traditionnal japanese cooking. During the class, we learned how to prepare Okonomiyaki, Miso soup and green beans. All the explanations are clear and you do a lot yourself, you will remember all of it. Yurico's kindness just make this experience more enjoyable. You will get a writen copy of what you cooked (and ate) at the end of the session.

Great Cooking Class!. My mom and I very much enjoyed our cooking class with Yurico in her lovely home. The dishes that we prepared were delicious and the techniques that she taught us were very useful. For every dish, she went into detail about the science behind achieving the perfect results. We learned about checking temperature, using proper cutting technique, choosing the right ingredients, and the art of Japanese presentation. Not only was she very thorough in her instruction, she was also a very charming host and a great conversationalist. It felt like cooking with a friend rather than just a teacher. Thank you Yurico!

Excellent experience with Yurico. We spent about 4 hours with Yurico, cooking a typical Japanese meal. Even with our average cooking skills, the meal was excellent thanks to Yurico's help and guidance. More than a simple cooking class, this was an authentic experience that we would recommend to anyone visiting Tokyo.
Yurico home cooking. We had the best time . Learnt much more than what Yurico taught us. Friendly knowledgable , beautiful meal. Beautiful lady . Highlight of our trip. Highly recommend !

family sushi class. We took the cooking class with our two kids aged 9 and 10 and the four of us enjoyed the experience a lot. I highly recommended. It is a great way to go into the japaniese culture.

A Homemaker's Perspective on Japanese Cuisine.... My son and I took the Japanese Home Cooking Class with Yurico on a Sunday in August, 2015. First of all, great flexibility on the times and dates of availability for her class... this was very convenient given our short stay and packed schedule. The class itself was fun, informative and full of juicy tidbits and details regarding the preparation of classic Japanese dainties. Everything from ingredient selection to proper cutting of a roll with a knife was covered. Yurico was a great teacher and a gracious host in her home. My son and I enjoyed the cooking class very much. Our only regret is that we didn't have time to learn more! Arigato Yurico!

A very memorable afternoon. My wife and I were in Japan for a book tour for her children's mysteries and I got to have one afternoon of my choosing for me. I chose Yurico's cooking class because the class was small and in her home , where we could talk about cooking and the different cultures we come from. Yurico was very knowledgeable about cooking and the science of it. We cooked 5 dishes that I got to choose , since I was the first to sign up for this particular class.Since her kitchen is not very large,so she keeps the class size small, which gives the students more time to interact, ask questions and get the "hands on" experience that I was looking for. Thank you Yurico. I will definitely tell all of my friends about the experience. I will recommend anyone traveling to Japan who wants this intimate and rewarding experience as well as learning to cook some excellent Japanese food, to take this class.I did, however have to go to some kitchen supply stores and buy an omelet pan and some other really cool gadgets to bring home , that make the dishes easier to prepare, which for me made it even more fun.

We couldn't believe that we did that fantastic sushi maki. We had our cooking class with Yurico in August 2015 while on our honeymoon in Japan. Yurico was really sweet and a great teacher and taught us how to make 4 or 5 Japanese dishes - including sushi. In the end of the lesson we couldn't believe that we did that fantastic sushi maki ourselves! After the class we bought our own wooden bowl for rice making, rice spoon, pan for Japanese omelette etc. and will definitely throw a sushi party back home!Yurico also gave us some recommendations on dishes we should try in different regions of Japan and that was really helpful.

Great cooking lesson with Yurico. We had a cooking class with Yurico in August 2015 while on our honeymoon and spent three fantastic hours in her house preparing the tasty Japanese dishes - including sushi. In the end we couldn't believe that it was us who did that fantastic maki - we learnt how to put rice on the seaweed, how to roll it properly etc. After that cooking class we went to shops to buy wooden bowl for rice making, rice spoon... We will definitely throw a sushi party back home!

Excellent Experience!. We really enjoyed Yurico's cooking class. She was very welcoming and made very clear explanations, mixing science and cooking. All the ingredients were fresh and the end result was amazing. Yurico made us feel part of her family, we truly felt very comfortable. Thank you so much!

fantastic. Enjoyed our first cooking class.Yurico is a very friendly patient person. She explained to us every material, every step how to make jap. Foods. I love her smile and appreciated she taught us how to make chanwanmushi which not in the menu.Strongly recommended to anyone who wants to join cooking class

Unforgettable Fun Learning Japanese Cooking and Calligraphy. We spent a great afternoon in the attractive home of our teacher, Yurico. She was so welcoming and organized, and was able to work with our different styles. Her English is very good. Our son (15) was immediately comfortable and she involved him in all the doings and praised the things he did well. He was on cloud 9 by the end of the session. The dish, a kind of home-style rice and sushi comfort food with side vegetable dishes and miso, was excellent for explaining the preparation of the main foods in the Japanese diet. The calligraphy lesson was rewarding. Yurico helped us develop our word characters, then prepared models for us to work with in her own lovely calligraphy, and knew when we were ready to be left to try it for ourselves. It was very relaxing and absorbing. The afternoon was extremely good value, especially considering how involved the preparation of materials and patience necessary to work with different individual abilities. Really, really great.

More than a cooking teacher, we became friends. We were in Yurico's class in July 2015 and we had an excellent time with her. She was very kind with us! She was so kind in helping us with the directions to the station near her house sending a video (which was very helpful).We choosed our lunch menu and she picked up very fresh ingredients. The fish was very nice, as all other ingredients. We felt very welcome in her house and she took a very good care of us offering a cold beverage and lending me an umbrella for sun protection (I was pregnant and it was a very hot day). We could talk about the differences in Japanese's and Brazilian's culture and a lot of other stuffs. She is very nice and communicative. More than a cooking teacher, we became friends.

Amazing cooking class with Yurico. We spent an afternoon with Yurico in Tokyo in early Aug 2015. She was very thoughtful and considerate in her preparation. She asked what kind of food we like and was very understanding when I told her I have a very picky eater (11 years old girl). She was very communicative throughout and even let me know when she was going to be away from town for a few days (and therefore not able to access her email) to make sure I didn't have any urgent questions for her before the visit. On the day of the visit it was extremely hot and she came out to drive us to her apartment from the subway (which was of course not part of the package but something she wanted to do to make her customers more comfortable. Her house was very sweet in a somewhat European style, very clean and very neat. We felt really welcome cooking there. Throughout the class Yurico was very positive and encouraging, and gave us lots of hints on how to improve our cooking. We can see she simply loves cooking and is a really great teacher. For the first time in my daughter's life she actually ate green beans and that itself was an achievement! The sushi was very fresh, the soup delicious and we had a fantastic time overall. I also asked her lots of questions about Japanese culture and felt I learnt a lot more than just cooking. Overall it was definitely a five star experience and I would most definitely go back if we are in tokyo again.

Gracious hostess with excellent food knowledge. I was in Tokyo in May and spent an afternoon with Yurico for a cooking class followed by calligraphy. What a wonderful cultural and food experience! Yurico is not only a wonderful Japanese cook but she has great knowledge about health, food science and generously shares her life and customs with her students. This was a real highlight of my time in Japan and it was a great way to spend my time. Once you register, she makes the process of finding the class easy, provides guidance and recipes so you can repeat the experience at home. Thank you Yurico and best wishes in your classes.

Tonkatsu lunch. Thanks Yurico for her guidance. We really enjoyed the class and had a great time. Yurico was friendly and taught us many things that we did not know about Japanese home cooking.It was also an experience for us to visit a local Japanese home. We really like your place and your kitchen which had everything you would need.We will sure visit you again next time to Tokyo for another class.

Joyful!. We are family with 2 boys to join this wonderful class. We really appreciate Yurico to arrange such a fun and practical class for us. She is so friendly and enthusiasm. The food we made was absolutely delicious. Also, Yurico is so kind to the 2 boys, aged 13 & 14. She always show her caring and encouraging to them, let them do everything by their own. In the sense, she has pay 200% attention in them. I'm so happy that the boys can cook the dishes by themselves when we came back to HK. We're sure we will join the Udon and sushi class in next time.

Wonderful :). Yurico greeted us with a wonderful smile in her pretty and cozy house :) There's no doubt about it, she takes care of her guests! We have learned to cook recipes that were both delicious (try the course on dumplings !!!) and easily achievable at home (to have taken other courses during other trips, I think this is what makes Yurico's course the most interesting I did).She is just lovely! Go and meet her, you wont be disappointed!

Fantastic!. My boyfriend and I had a lovely time at Yurico's cooking class. Yurico is a very friendly lady and really welcomed us into her beautiful home. Very enjoyable and would definitely recommend her class. Once again thank you for all your help Yurico :)Emily & Matthew

From miso soup to sushi rolls - learn to cook japanese at home!. There are many things to do in Tokyo, but a cooking class with Yurico is a very nice opportunity to meet locals and to learn how japanese food is made.We enjoyed our afternoon with Yurico, where we made Sushi rolls and miso soup, but also a delicious side dish with green beans and sesame as well as a dish with aubergine. Most fun was making the rolled japanese omelette, with only chop sticks as tools. Yurico showed and explained everything necessary to know, but would always aks us do it by ourselves in order to learn it. Now we are planning our sushi party back in Germany...

Fun, educational and delicious!. My girlfriend thought it would be a good idea to have a Japanese cooking class while on our trip to Japan, and boy was it worth it!We found Yurico through TripAdvisor and booked a class. When we arrived there, we found out we were the only ones that day, so we would have a private class.Yurico is a fantastic and fun person, she is a very good cook and speaks very well English. There were no problems with translation at all. Her instructions were very clear and very educational; for instance, she taught us the importance of having a proper salt ratio in the food with regard to the salt ratio in human beings! Definitely not things you would find out easily anywhere else.We made Maki sushi, Miso soup, green beans, fluffy omelet and eggplant. All of which were extremely delicious once we got to the eating stage! :)We definitely recommend Yurico's class to anyone interested in learning to cook authentic Japanese food. When we go back to Japan, we will probably have another cooking class with Yurico.Thanks again Yurico, we had a wonderful time!

SO GREAT MOMENT!. We made futomaki with Yurico 1 month ago. This was an amazing experience!! Yurico is a really nice and good teacher! The best maki I never eat! We discovered japanese cooking and so much more... Everyone who come to Japan should take a cooking lesson with Yurico :-)!

Japanese home cooking made easy. Yurico is fun and a great person. Learning to make Okonomiyake and talking about Japanese cooking and society with her was one of the highlights of our trip.Her explanation and demonstration of how to cook Japanese food makes it easy, even for someone whose main experience is cutting vegetables. She also gives a lot of tips on best practices for cooking that could be applied for other types of cuisine.We were very impressed with how Yurico makes a lot of testing and research at home (using her own family as test subjects) before presenting any recipe in her class in order to make sure that the outcome will be as fresh and fluffy as possible.When it comes to scheduling and lesson content Yurico was very flexible and accommodated our wish to make Okonomiyaki even though it wasn't on her program for that day.We definitely recommend this cooking class.

Awesome cooking experience. We cooked a Kitsune Udon which sounds easy but actually took a bit of skill.We made Udon noodles from scratch, made a japanese (square) omelet and created the soup base from scratch. We also made a simple tempura batter for some fish cakes.The dish was delicious and Yurico was a great teacher.
