She's studying cooking so she puts emphasis on created a dish that is consistently good every time.

Delicious and fun cooking lesson. This was such a great experience, perfect int he middle of a city walking week. Yurico taught me and my girlfriend how to make gyozas and a few appetizers all from scratch. Besides fun, everything was simply delicious! Yurico is professionally trained, her advice is always on point. She was also very nice and we had a very good time in her beautiful home.You can also learn a bit of Japanese calligraphy after the lesson which results in you bringing a self-made souvenir home.Definitely a must!

Such A Warm Welcome!. Yurico gave me such a warm welcome to Japan. I took a solo cooking class & calligraphy class in her home, and she was a lovely hostess. From meeting me at the subway station, to teaching me tasty new dishes, to instructing me on calligraphy strokes, to helping me figure out more of my plans while in Tokyo, Yurico added so much to my trip.

Wonderful home cooking class in Tokyo!. This was a marvelous day for this mother and 2 daughters who love food and love to cook. Yurico is delightful and a great teacher. We prepared a delicious meal of gyoza, green beans, eggplant and miso soup. She welcomed us into her lovely home and served us barley tea and fruit dessert with the meal. We learned the recipe preparation but also technique, Japanese tradition, regional Japanese food differences and nutrition and science of our meal. She is extremely knowledgable about all these things.Arrangements were easy via email. Yurico is professional and also very warm and helpful. She gave us many tips and directions about touring in Tokyo. We hope to return and cook another menu with her on our next trip to Tokyo.

Excellent afternoon!. My wife and I booked an afternoon of cooking goyza with Yurico during our visit in Tokyo and enjoyed every bit of it! Yurico was even nice enough to meet us at the nearest train station and walk us back to her home for the class. The meal was delicious and we would definitely recommend you contact Yurico if you are at all looking to take a Japanese cooking class during your time in Tokyo. You won't be disappointed and you surely won't leave feeling hungry!

Amazing Experience! Highly recommended. My friend and I were traveling through Tokyo and we wanted to try a cooking class. It was very easy to coordinate with Yuriko, and she offered many different types of cuisine we could cook together.She welcomed us into her home and we had an amazing time learning about Japanese culture and cooking several different dishes.We also opted for the calligraphy class and it also was an amazing experience. Overall we spent around 6 hours in her home, and it was a peaceful amazing experience. The highlight of our visit to Tokyo!

Japanese Home Cooking class with Yurico in her home, Tokyo, Japan. My husband Tom and I were stopping over in Tokyo for a couple of days on the way to Thailand and we decided we wanted to have a cooking class in Japan to learn how to make sushi.I went to tripadvisor and found "Japanese Home Cooking Class Yurico" and read the reviews, which were glowing. So, I booked a class, and we were so glad I did! Before leaving the USA, Yurico and I exchanged emails regarding the specifications of the class, logistics, transport, etc., and when we got there, everything went flawlessly thanks to Yurico's careful planning and attention to detail. She met us at the train station and walked us to her lovely home. We learned how to make Miso soup, Norimaki sushi, a steamed egg custard with shrimp and chicken, and green beans in sesame sweet dressing.It was absolutely delicious, and Yurico led us through the process step by step, and also explaining the science and tradition behind what we were making.The entire experience was so informative and enjoyable. Yurico is an accomplished chef, in both Japanese and French cuisine, and her warm personality made us feel so at ease in her lovely home. I would highly recommend Yurico's cooking school, and we hope to go back for another lesson, this time, bringing our daughter, who is in Thailand right now, studying overseas. When she returns home, she will be greeted with the home cooked meal that Yurico taught us to make. Hands down, a great class. Thank you so much Yurico! Kindest regards, Elizabeth & Tom Waller

Amazing personal cooking class. If you want to learn how to cook, go with Yurico. I've looked at many classes online but the thing that worried me the most was the fact that there are usually many people in a small kitchen, which takes away the hands-on experience.So from the large selection of cooking classes I ended up going with Yurico's class and I'm very happy I did. I booked about 4 days in advance and Yurico emailed me a few days in advance to ask what kind of menu I would like to make. She was really thoughtful and tailored the class to my wishes. The directions to her house were clear so I arrived well in time. The menu ended up being Gyoza (my #1 wish to learn how to make properly), green beans with sesame dressing, grilled eggplant and a leek and egg soup using her soup broth from chicken.The cooking was very eductional; Yurico explained a lot about the methods that are used (and why) and the ingredients (and also substitutes for when the ingredients are not available in my home country). One of my wishes beforehand was to learn about the broths for ramen but this simply was not possible in the time frame of the lesson. Instead, she taught me how to make a simply soup broth from a chicken breast (the chicken breast comes out amazingly tender by doing this btw!) and we actually made two soups, 1 with her broth and 1 with artificial flavouring, so that I could taste the difference. Everything ended up great, especially the gyoza were the best I've ever had.Yurico really goes out of her way to give a great and personal class. She had the recipes printed out and put into a nice plastic folder, she also wrote down the recipe for one of our spontaneous dishes. She is also very friendly and easy to talk to. she claims that her English is not very good but she is lying:) Both communication by email and at her home was pretty much flawless.This is normally the part where I list the negative points. However, I cannot think of a single thing!

A wonderful day experiencing Japanese culture. We recently travelled to Tokyo and are absolutely delighted we made the time to schedule a day with Yurico as a part of this trip . What a wonderful experience we had!From my original enquiry Yurico was only too happy to enter discussions to find a menu that would be suitable for us. Would we prefer beef or fish? A formal celebratory dish or something more ' everyday'. We decided upon our menu and signed up for her cooking class and the calligraphy session about a month in advance.On the day she met us at the local train station and we walked back to her home where we began cooking. - her blog and Facebook page talk about the menu we created (with pictures). The food was delicious ! Yurico was a humble lady who was well organised and a delight to talk with. She has attended many formal lessons in japanese cookery and was able to share many helpful hints with us throughout the day. Not only did we gain great insight into Japanese food but with teenagers of similar ages we discussed education, employment, politics and a range of other things we never would have had the chance to do in a large commercial cooking class. Following the cooking session we were guided in calligraphy scripture ( another area where Yurico was extremely insightful. her patience was apparent ( and very much appreciated) she allowed us many ' practice runs' before attempting our ' good copy'. Yurico offers a very personalised service. This was made so very apparent after I left my mobile phone on her bench ( didn't realise until several hours later). By the time we had dinner and arrived back at our hotel she had been in contact with the concierge and messages were left about the incident. On arrival home from work her husband personally drove my phone back to my hotel. We were overwhelmed with their kindness and generosity.I cannot recommend yurico's classes highly enough. We are hopeful that in the future we can return and take our children to experience this delightful insight into Japanese food, art, culture and hospitality.

Highlight of our Japan adventures. My mother, sister and I decided last minute that we wanted a unique Japanese cooking experience and after checking out multiple options on trip advisor, I am thrilled that we chose Yurico's class and am confident that it is one of the best experiences around. She is a truly beautiful soul, opening her home to us and sharing her deep knowledge of Japanese cooking.Not only did she stay up late to make a last minute accommodations for us the night before, but she also allowed us to add on a calligraphy lesson (also a unique experience from which you have a souvenir to take home- highly recommend). We made gyozas as our main dish, along with miso soup, rice and two appetizers. She will try to meet you at the train station but if she cannot, don't fret it's only a few blocks away and very simple to find on your own! I cannot express how happy I am to have met such a lovely lady. Thank you so much for a memorable experience that my family and I will cherish forever.

Japanese Cooking Lesson. My husband and I had the opportunity to take a cooking class with Yurico on our recent trip to Tokyo to view the cherry blossoms. Spending an afternoon with Yurico was one of the highlights of our trip! Although we were quite late to our lesson due to travel issues Yurico graciously welcomed us into her home and gave us a full lesson. Yurico is an accomplished chef having received both Japanese and French training, and she is very patient with those of us who are not as skilled. Her lesson was focused around making healthy every day dishes that can be easily recreated at home. During our three hour lesson we were taught how to make ginger pork, Japanese sweet egg, green beans in sesame sauce as well as miso soup. When we were finished Yurico presented us with a cute dessert and we were very surprised and delighted as my husband loves dessert!Afterwards she took us for a walk to view the cherry blossoms in her neighbourhood. If you are visiting Tokyo, I highly recommend taking a cooking class by Yurico. It was a highlight of our trip and if we return, we will be coming back!

Such a wonderful addition to our honeymoon!!. My husband and I were on our honeymoon in Tokyo, and decided to take a cooking class together as a fun way to prepare for our marriage. We're both huge fans of Japanese food and culture, and Yurico was such an amazing teacher. She's very modest about her English skills, but we had such a relaxed, easy time learning from her (we barely know any Japanese). She teaches the traditional and formal methods of creating the delicious Japanese courses. We chose to learn hot Udon soup, and my husband had two servings of it, it was so delicious. I highly recommend Yurico's cooking class to anybody visiting Tokyo, whether it's your first time there, or your hundredth time there. We plan to return to Tokyo again in the future, and we wouldn't mind taking this class with her again to learn all different dishes. We can't wait to make Udon at home in the United States!

Authentic Japanese Experience. Yurico's home cooking class and Calligraphy lesson was a very authentic experience that was the highlight of my family's trip to Japan. Yurico opened her home to our family and was just as excited as we were to share the day together. We first entered her home and found some cute little Japanese slippers to put on our feet….I already felt at home. We then went upstairs to find a small but very organised kitchen that fitted the four of us in comfortably. We started by sitting around her Japanese table with cushioned chairs sipping Japanese tea while Yurico explained what we will be preparing for our lunch. I loved that Yurico offered something different but traditional to her menu, as most places seem to stick to only sushi and tempura. Everything on the menu was prepared in such detail and as a result the flavour and texture of the food was a real delight to eat. My 10 year old daughter prepared the dessert with Yurico called dorayaki which were 2 little japanese pancakes filled with custard cream…..mmmmmm delicious! Yurico also offers a calligraphy lesson and so my family and I all chose a symbol that meant something to us all. Yurico was very warm and inviting to my family and shared with us a very beautiful experience. Thank you so much Yurico, my daughter already wants to come back :)

Wonderful Way to Learn about Japan. My husband and I cooked with Yurico on a Friday afternoon. We had only a short time in Tokyo and we chose to take this course with Yurico. I am really glad we did. This was a great way to get to know Japanese food and also spend time in a real Japanese house. Yurico is a fantastic host and very knowledgeable about Japanese cooking. She is pleasant, fun and has a great attitude. I highly recommend this class. Not only is she a good cook and teacher, but she also was open to all questions regarding Japanese life and food. Two thumbs up!

Great lesson in Japanese cooking. Great to cook together with Yurico and learn more about Japanese cuisine and ingrediënts. Yurico is a great teacher an knows a lot of background of the ingredients and recipes.Great fun and great food too :)

Great experience. Yurico did a great job preparing for and teaching the lesson. She asked my menu preference prior to the class and had all the ingredients ready to go. We reviewed Japanese home cooking techniques, which helped me reproduce the recipes back in the US. And I bought a rice cooker when I got home to make things a little easier. Her home is warm and welcoming and I immediately felt comfortable. If you're looking for a fun afternoon or evening learning about Japanese cooking in a comfortable atmosphere, this is for you.

authentic udon and family cooking. Spent an afternoon with Yurico making udon from scratch and learned wonderful Japanese home cooking techniques. Yurico gave clear instructions and is well prepared with recipes. I was able to folow the recipe and reproduce the meal exactly at home. YUM!! Not only that, Yurico is very nice and warmly welcome me to her home. Wonderful experience! Highly recommended for anyone want to see how Japanese really cook at home.

Authentic Japanese. Recently on our sixth trip to Japan we decided to try something different and did several cooking schools while on our three week vacation. We so enjoyed Yurico 's class.Her home was easy to find and as it was raining she met us at the train station.We made udon noodles from scratch which we will now make at home, far better than the prepackaged ones. The deep fried tofu in mirin and soy garnished our Kitsune udon. For one who doesn't like tofu I have been converted. A Japanese grilled e,gg plant accompanied the dish as well as tempuredfish paste tubes. Another great hit.Yurico is an enthusiastic teacher eager to make sure we tried many Japanese treats. As we wished to take home some of the ingredients Yurico took us to the supermarket and helped purchase the products.We had a fantastic day learning so so so much about the finer points of Japanese food in a most enjoyable way. Her classes are new and the enthusiasm and eagerness to teach about Japanese food was infectious. We would take another class when in Tokyo again. We like the class as it was in a real home and not in a commercial kitchen and part of a large group. Thank you Yurico for a wonderful day.

A wonderful cooking class where I learned much about Japanese food and it's preparation. We spent an awesome day with Yurico learning how to prepare delicious Japanese food with great care. Our udon noodles were amazing. We prepared Inara and miso from scratch. We also prepared eggplant and cucumber salad with chicken and simmered lotus root. What I really enjoyed about Yurico is her love of food. She makes her own plum wine, pickles and she kept bringing things out to show us what we need to look for. I run my own cooking class in Australia and have been to many cooking classes in other countries. This is the best.

Best cooking class. Today my husband and I were met at Kikukawa station by the lovely Yurico who directed us to her home. What an amazing day we had. Yurico's home is modest but beautifully decorated. Her kitchen was small but we managed to cook a most amazing meal and learn so much about Japanese food and culture. The food was amazing and Yurico finished our meal with the matcha tea making. We both feel we have been spoilt.

Authentic home cooking with a friendly teacher. Three friends and I spent some time cooking with Yurico. Her lovely home is conveniently located in central Tokyo and close to several stations. She will come and meet you if you want.Yurico is a charming and friendly hostess who loves cooking and meeting new people. Her English is pretty good so you won't have any real problems communicating.She introduced a number of recipes to us, some traditional and some a little more modern. Yurico likes to make things from scratch and her dishes are authentic, but she also adds her own uniques touches here and there. She is happy to share her tips and answer questions. At the end of the lesson, you can all sit down for a relaxed meal.Whether you are just visiting Japan for a short time and want to see a glimpse of family life, or whether you have lived in Japan for some time and want to learn more about Japanese cuisine, you will have a fun time cooking with Yurico. My friends and I all learned something new during our visit.

Outstanding Food Tour in Kyoto. The food tour done by Arigato Japan in Kyoto was amazing for many reasons; the introduction to wide range of Japanese cuisine - (it is so much more than the sushi restaurants of North America) the informative and enjoyable discussions that I had with the tour guide Toshi, the picture taking opportunities, walking the streets in the evening searching for elusive geishas. and a special thanks to Arigato for doing the tour for one guest (me) after others dropped out. Definitely a tour company that is committed to serving its clients.

Should never be missed!. Nishiki Market Fodie TourIf you are foodie, book the Nishiki Market Tour! Our guide was fantastic, no quite moments, every single minute of it was all about food, culture and excellent flavors! Knowing so much why food in Kyoto was so good really made such a big difference! This tour is a must, you will learn so much in 3 hours and sample a lot of stuff. The lunch was very delicious, what a great way to spend our first day in Kyoto! I can do this tour over and over again, amazing!

Nishiki Market Food Tour with an outstanding guide!. This was an absolute highlight of our one week stay in Kyoto!The food samplings were just amazing, the stories about the local people and how the food is made was a great way to appreciate the beauty of this precious market. This came with a great lunch that we really enjoyed.I hjghly recommend this tour!!!!

An amazing Food Tour in Tokyo-well done!. We were very shocked with how little English was spoken in Tokyo , it wasn not as easy as we had hope it was. This tour really made a difference, our guide Anne, was very knowledgeable, fun spirited and really helpful! The tour provided great food and tons of inoformation. She also helpful in so many ways that mde our stay so much easier! We were very pleased with the amount of food, the booking process was also very easy. This is a great find here on Tripadvisor, I highly recommended the All-star Tour!

Kyoto Nishiki Market Tour with a local. WE had the best time on this tour because our guide was simply amazing! Every single food stop was really enjoyable and had so much story behind it. We would have not had such an amazing time if we ventured alone. A tour like this is very important if you are a real traveler and a foodie.We wanted to say thank you for making our trip extra special and for really helping us out with the rest of our trip. You guys are truly excepcional!

Great Golden Gai Experience- a must!. We booked this tour based on the reviews we have seen on Tripadvisor and we are very very happy we chose Arigato Japan! Our experience was beyond outstanding, the food samplings, guide and information flow was just wonderful!We loved immersing in the word of salarymen in the piss alleys of Shinjuku, our guide, Anne, introduced us to some Japanese drinks , izakaya culture and yakitori, it was yummy!The second stop was even better, regional food and it came with great explanation of where and how they were made and also eaten in Japan.Then there is Golden gai, an absolute must see spot in Tokyo! Our last stop was very unforgettable! This was really the best tour we have ever had! Will do it over and over again!

Top class. Our tour of Nishiki Market by our guide Toshi Kanda was superb, and one of the best things about our week in Kyoto. Toshi San not only spoke fluent English, he also was a fount of knowledge about the culture and history of Kyoto, and led us around the market, sampling different tastes and buying ingredients that were later served up at a nearby classy restaurant. He then helped us buy a cooking knife from possibly the best knife shop in Kyoto (which is in the market). He is a real gem.

Kyoto Nishiki Market Tour. I couldn’t recommend this tour high enough! If you are in Kyoto, you have to book this tour! The city is not just about the temples and other amazing sights, it also has some of Japan’s best food! You can learn so much from this tour of the Nishiki Market, what’s amazing is it comes with a huge lunch that you will never forget!Our guide was very helpful and made sure we all had an awesome time! This tour was very insightful, so much information and delicious food for three hours. Our favorite was the dashi tamagoyaki, we’ve had many of this on our previous trips but this was the BEST! The rest of the food on this tour were all yummy, wish I could go back and have them all.I highly recommend this tour to anyone coming to Kyoto!

Arigato!. All-star Food Tour, Bravo! Terrific guideThree places in 2 hoursAmazing ambiance5 Yakitoris2 Drinks6 local foodYummy dessertGreat unforgettable sights of TokyoMy experience with this tour was really the highlight of my trip to Japan! Arigato Japan really hit all elements of a great food tour! Every single moment was filled with laughs, sights and great info about Yurakucho, Ginza and Shimbashi. We met so many amazing people on this tour , we ended up having drinks after the tour. The food we had on this tour were from the South of Japan, I love how they had so many kinds of food to sample , even the skewers on the first stop were delicious. Seseri or chicken neck was my favorite! The pizza with nori sauce and white bait fish was unforgettable!This tour is a must! Thanks Tripadvisor for this great find!

Tokyo Walking Food Your. This was an outstanding walking food tour. 3 separate locales with 3 different varieties of traditional Japanese cuisine that one would have a hard time getting on their own. Anne our guide and host was very helpful and a pleasure to spend 3 hours with. Highly recommend this walking tour

All Star Food Tour!. For our second night in Tokyo we booked the All star tokyo food tour to help attempt to make the culture shock a little more absorbable and I'm so glad we did. Not only did we learn more about a very rich food culture and eat some delicious food, but we had a genuinely great time with our guide Akira and the other Australian couple (Raelene and Paul) who were in our group.

Kyoto Nishiki Marker Tour was very fun!. We had a great tour with Kanda-san walking around the kyoto nishiki market. It was nice to be with someone who clearly enjoyed what they do and his excitement really amplified the experience. Walking along we stopped at so many little shops and it goes without saying that if we were on our own we probably would have just passed them up and even if we went inside, we would not have known the history or even main ideas and purpose behind the store. We highly recommend this tour if you have a free 3 hours in the afternoon in Kyoto. Well worth it!

Golden Gai Food Tour! A Must!. This is an absolute hidden gem of Tokyo with so much history and beauty behind it! We joined this tour with another couple and we were so pleased with the three stops. First was an alley form post war Japan that had the smallest izakayas. We had a very personal experience here with some local salarymen who were having some drinks and wanted to practice speaking English. I couldn’t explain how amazing this moment was! They bought us another round of drinks which was really very awesome, we felt like we were one of them! Wow, it was such a great time. Our guide, Anne, was extremely helpful, knowledgeable and really accommodating. She made our tour very enjoyable, fun and memorable. Our tour was amazing because of her!The second food stop was even better, we had 5 kind of dishes that we sould have never ordered on our own. The variety was really great. The last stop at golden gai was even better, our 3 hour tour went so quick and we wish it was longer. We actually booked a Kyoto Food Tour at night with this company because we were very pleased with the first Golden Gai Food Tour that we had with them. Highly recommended to anyone looking for something to do in Shinjuku!

Extremely Amazing Tour!. Nishiki Market food tour in SeptemberThis was definitely the highlight of our trip in Kyoto. We have joined 4 other tours and this one was the best ! We got to eat so much food and learned so much about Kyoto’s Kitchen. This market is extremely amazing but exploring it on your own won’t have the same impact as having a local person giving you specifics in detail everything that you want to learn about the food, culture and even history about this wonderful place in Kyoto. What’s even great about this tour is that it came with a huge lunch on top of all the samplings that we’ve had. This is such a great value, I assure you, you will be very full after this tour. We consider this tour to be the most unforgettable tour that we ever did in our last 4 trips in Japan. Book this one if you ever make it to Kyoto!

A must see tour when over night in Tokyo. Anne was an awesome tour guide and ensured we had a great experience. Cost of tour includes food and two drinks, unlike many other food tours that I have seen on Trip Advisor. I highly recommend this tour for just about anyone visiting Tokyo.

A night time food tour in Shibuya? Yes please!. We spent a couple of days in Tokyo before boarding a cruise ship that took us down the coast to Nagasaki and, eventually, Shanghai. We have now made it a habit to take food tours in 'new' cities, and this tour was one of the very best.Our guide, Maya, was charming, friendly and very knowledgable.There were only four of us on the tour, which meant that it seemed more personal. Dusk was gathering as we set off, and increasingly the neon and LED advertising started to predominate - very atmospheric!The first stop was at a small restaurant where two Japanese specialities, one from Hiroshima and one from Nagasaki, were tantalisingly cooked in front of us on a hotplate. One of our fellow guests had food preferences that were immediately catered for. The second stop was at a bar/restaurant specialising in dishes from Hokkaido, which meant that by the end of the tour we had spanned Japan from north to south in culinary terms!Along the way, Maya was explaining about Tokyo and Japan in a very informative way - after all, food tours are supposed to get you into a city's culture and history as well as it's cuisine. She also accompanied us on the Metro after the tour to make sure that we reached our hotel without difficulty. We can therefore thoroughly recommend this tour and this company.

Unforgettable Nishiki market experience!. If you want an authentic Kyoto Food experience, join this! This is not just a tour about food but also information about culture, traditions and japanese way of life. The food stops were all worth it, this market is immensely filled with so many local products that foreigners like us won't even know about. I loved how our guide was very knowledgeable, funny and considerate with with everyone on the tour. We all had a blast on this three hour wonderful tour. The lunch was just FANTASTIC! This tour is a must, we highly recommend it! Thank you very much Arigato Japan for giving us a great experience we will never forget

Wonderful Tour of Shibuya!. We couldn’t be more thankful to this company for being very considerate and understanding of our requests. We had to change our booking because of unforeseen circumstances and they were very kind to really help us out in making this trip possible. We had such a great time on this tour, our guide showed us to some hidden alleys, showed us some cool maid cafes on the way and shared so many interesting info! This tour is really recommended, I’ve joined 3 tours in my past trips to Japan but this one I really liked a lot because of two things : FANTASTIC GUIDE and AWESOME FOOD CHOICES! This one they really did well, we enjoyed ever single moment of it and will try their Kyoto Tour next time we visit Japan. A must try to fellow travelers who are looking for a good food tour! You will love their okonomiyaki for sure!

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED . I highly recommend this this tour if you have limited time in Tokyo or its your first time visiting. Traveling and eating in Japan is amazing but can be challenging and overwhelming at times. This tour definitely made it so much easier and fun! We did the Shibuya food tour and we really loved the first stop which was a Okonomiyaki, this was my first time having it and I have to say , it was very unforgettable! I loved how our guide explained in detail all the food that we had, the history behind it, manners on how to eat them ,etc. It definitely made such a big difference having a local guide you along the way and really make you understand everything you want to know about food and culture!I find this tour to be very reasonable, the food stops were good and we were able to experience food we would have never ordered on our own. The reviews on tripadvisor were right, this is a must if you are in Tokyo!

Shibuya Food Tour at Night. What a fun, amazing night on the town while visiting here in Tokyo. Anne couldn't be more gracious and knowledgeable. Food was fantastic and we really got to experience the local tastes of Japan. Highly recommend.

Tokyo Food Tour at Night in 3 places. We had one day to visit Tokyo and we decided to join a Food Tour , Arigato Japan did not disappoint. It was such a wonderful tour with an energetic, excellent guide! Fantastic experience, the guide was very insightful and friendly. We loved the balance between food, culture and trivia! This was definitely one of the strong points of this tour, our guide Anne spoke perfect English so there was no moment of silence, all fun and informative moments that everyone in the group really enjoyed.I like the idea of trying 5 yakitoris plus drinks on the first stop, 6 kinds of food on the second and a great dessert to finish it off! How could you go wrong with this? If you want a good food tourm book this! Excellent food choices, great guide and great value, I highly recommend this tour!

Great welcome to Tokyo. We thoroughly enjoyed our Golden Gai tour with Anne. It felt like it was tailored to our small group and we felt like we were part of the night not just tourists in a city. Anne is so generous and is genuine in wanting to ensure you have the best experience possible both on the tour and for the rest of your stay. I would definitely recommend this tour!

Great walking and food tour in Kyoto! . Akari is a great guide! Very helpful and will try her best to explain the culture and answer our questions. We r also every lucky to be able to see geisha and maiko along the gion street!

Excellent sampling of Japanese cuisine & culture. Tour provided excellent sampling of food and culture in and around Tokyo. Anne was extremely knowledgable and friendly. Highly recommend this tour especially early in your trip to get a sense of the Japanese cuisine and traditions.

Excellent Shibuya Food Tour. My fiance and I were recently in Tokyo for a day and a half, so we decided to book this food tour in order to see as much as possible and try as many different foods as possible in the short time we were there. We happened to be the only two on the tour, and our tour guide Anne was amazing. Very knowledgeable and friendly and took us to places to try food that we wouldn't have discovered on our own. I would definitely recommend this tour to anyone who is looking to try regional Japanese cuisine that's different than the typical ramen or sushi spot. Anne was an awesome tour guide and was able to customize our tour so that we were able to try new foods and see new places. I will definitely book more tours through Arigato Japan if I ever find myself in Toyko again!
Kyoto Nishiki Market Tour. We had Kanda as our tour guide today and he was brilliant. He give us insight and access to the markets that made this such a wonderful experience.

Feeling Local..... Kyoto Food Tour in Nishiki was great!Our guide gave us an amazing tour throughout Nishiki market giving us interesting facts and history about the various local food that we saw in the market. We visited so many small businesses, some owned by the same family for hundreds of years now. I was fascinated with a sake store that we went to, this was probably the nicest sake I’ve ever tried! The sparkling sake was very good, I have never tried this in my life and I am glad I was introduced to this now! I love sake and this was really a great opportunity for me to ask so many questions to our ever patient guide. We got to explore so many food in the market , the tamagoyaki, tofu donuts, octopus and fish cakes were all delicious!One of the best things about this tour is the guide, he spoke perfect English and was very pleasant and funny! He is very passionate about sharing Japanese culture, we were lucky enough to get an hour extension of the tour. This was unexpected, we were all just having a great time and the guide didn’t wanna end the tour yet and just decided to stay and explore more places with us. There were 3 other couples in the tour that we became friends with after. This tour is a MUST! You will never forget it.

Foodies... Best Layover in Tokyo!We only had one day in Tokyo and decided to book the Shibuya Food tour with some friends. We were very happy we did! In three hours we were able to see lots of great spots, eat some great food and even be on a TV program because we were interviewed at Shibuya crossing! This was a great experience we will never forget, our guide was extremely a great key, she was so warm, funny and informative! We will stay longer in Japan and make sure we book other tours with them, what a great night!

Sushi class. Had an amazing time learning how to make sushi as well as information about the cuisine and how it is incorporated in everyday life! Also were fantastic at giving pointers for other places to visit while in Japan. Very insightful and great time!!

A True 5/5 Experience. Signing up for this tour helps you see another dimension to Japan that you wouldn't see if you walked around on your own. Anne and Maya, our two tour guides, were very knowledgeable of Tokyo, the local restaurants, and the many dishes we tried during our food tour. With the amount of information that you learn about Japan and the food/drinks that you get, this tour is definitely worth it.

A great way to see Tokyo!. We booked this tour because we saw their pics on Facebook and Instagram and we were very happy we did! We enjoyed every food stop, the drinks and food choices were plenty! I have never tried raw chicken in my life and I was very scared at first, I was so happy I did! The rest of the evening was filled with sights and sounds of Tokyo, a very good way to see the city while enjoying the food! Our guide was spectacular, Anne , thank you for making this night special for my brother who celebrated his bday on the tour! You really went out of your way to make sure we had an amazing time! Definitely a must do tour!

Shibuya Food Tour was fantastic!. I only see the crossing in movies and it was such a great evening spent with our guide Anne who showed us so many things in Shibuya we wouldn’t have found on our own! Three hrs wasn’t enough because it was so much fun and the people that we met on this tour were also part of the wonderful experience! We all ended up going to karaoke after such an unforgettable night! Two great things : Wonderful guide and amazing food – they killed this! She really knew her element, spoke perfect English and gave us so much information about Tokyo! So happy we booked this tour, we will definitely recommend this tour our friends coming to Japan!

Arigato Japan. Great value, very informative guides!We were a big group, 10 people, they had 2 guides to make sure everyone was given enough attention. We were divided to two groups when walking but over our food stops we were all in one table so everyone still got to know each other and it is one of the best tours I’ve ever been to! This All star Food tour in Tokyo is a great way to really experience Tokyo the local way! We got to try some drinks, really loved the highball and the yakitori on the first stop. The second stop was even betther The food potions were good, we were so full and we didn’t realize we sill had dessert! Wow, this was really a great tour! Thanks to our guides Anne and Asha for showing us the beauty of Tokyo!

Golden Gai Food Tour -- A fun, educational & delicious night out!. The perfect combination of both a food and sightseeing tour of top spots in Tokyo. I highly recommend this tour for anyone looking to try something new and learn about the many local dishes from across Japan. Everything was delicious and learning the history of the Golden Gai area just fascinating! Our tour guide was amazing and extremely knowledgeable. Top notch tour that is not to be missed! And plan to explore Kyoto tour tours too.

Great!. Very pleasant guide, enjoyable afternoon!We had three days in Kyoto and decided to book the Nishiki Food tour, this was a very enjoyable way to spend the day! We were unlucky to have two days of rain in Kyoto, so thankful we found this tour on Tripadvisor because it was indoors and was perfect! The tour came with lots of food samplings, I can never get over how great the tofu donuts and sushi were! We enjoyed this tour with another couple, our guide Toshi gave us so much information about Kyoto! Definitely an unforgettable experience!

Kyoto Nishiki Market Tour. I booked this with my parents and we all loved it! The tour was very enjoyable, we have been to the market before and never understood anything about it. We were very happy we decided to join this tour because now we have a better understanding of why food in Kyoto is just amazing!We had so many food samplings and they were all so good! We really liked the tsukemono and tofu donuts (yum!) , we ended up buying so many stuff from the market. Our guide was very well versed, he had a great sense of humor and made the tour as enjoyable as possible. We wished it was longer because we were having so much fun, three hours went so quick!We will surely book their Tokyo food tours as well when we visit next year. This is a highly recommended, must do tour! You will never regret it!

A night in Kyoto. A great night in Kyoto!We booked arigato based upon positive reviews and, true to expectations, it was just spectacular! The walk from Gion was very nostalgic, the old tea houses were so beautiful. We were very lucky to have seen some geishas who were about to start a show! It was surreal! Our guide told us stories about the geishas of Kyoto over dinner, we enjoyed it. By the way, this dinner came with 10 kinds of food so be prepared to be very full! Everything was very delicious and unforgettable. This tour totally exceeded our expectations, will do it again if I have the chance!

Allstar Tokyo Food Tour - Yurakucho, Ginza & Shinbashi. Just got back from a fantastic food tour with our guide Maya who showed us a great time tonight. The first stop was yakitoris, sake and plum wine, all were fantastic. I didn't even think I liked sake but I was wrong. The second stop was fresh veggies with miso dipping sauce, gyoza nabe, udon noodles, chicken namba, tuna rice balls, taro balls, fish pizza and chicken sashimi - yes, raw chicken but it was not at all what I expected, very good. The final stop was a fish shaped dessert custard which was the perfect finish. While enroute to our food stops Maya showed us the back streets, shops, bars and restaurants of the local neighborhoods and answered all of our questions in perfect English. We even saw Godzilla!Come hungry, wear comfortable clothes and enjoy three great neighborhoods while eating delicious Japanese food in a fun, friendly environment.

Absolutely Fantastic!. What a great dinner, Kyoto Food tour at night!AugustExpect to be full with some of the best food you’ll ever have in Kyoto! My friend booked this as an anniversary present for us, we will never ever forget it! We had our own private room, our guide explained everything about the food that we were eating and it all made sense to us! Now we understand what kaiseki is and why it’s such an elegant and delicious meal carefully prepared using the freshest, most seasonal ingredients! To this day, we can’t get over two things: SASHIMI and KYOTO BEEF! This was really something that will always be in our minds, the sashimi was enough for 8 people, I’ve never been served so much food in my life ! The Kyoto beef was to die for, every inch of it!Will definitely come back, thanks Arigato Japan!

Kyoto Nishiki Market Tour was more than we expected.. Leading up to this tour we had a few so-so experiences with guided tours around Japan. Sometimes the guide didn't speak English very well, our questions went half-answered and the experiences we had were not what we were hoping for. Thankfully, our experience with Kanda-san was more than we could have asked for. Every step of the way we were explained the history of the steps we took and the food we ate. Along the way we tried tsukemono, kushi katsu, sashimi tofu and it was all delicious. The whole time our guide was collecting food for our end of the tour lunch at an amazing little japanese restaurant tucked away in the heart of the market. We 100 and 10 percent recommend this tour for anyone looking for a complete understanding of what the Nishiki Market has to offer and how it sustained the city of Kyoto then and even now.

Sushi Cooking Class - Unique Experience In Tokyo. Learning how to make sushi in Japan is a truly unique experience, and I'm so glad I chose Arigato Japan. The entire experience felt like I was visiting someone's home, not a formal or rushed class. It was held in a small group which allowed everyone to participate, ask questions and get attention from the instructing cook. I absolutely loved the idea of learning how to make different types of sushi, especially the flower maki! I cannot wait to recreate everything I learned at home, BUT I have to buy one of those super sharp knives first! Read my full review of the entire experience on my blog #TravelWithNanoB.

A great night of food and fun. I had the pleasure of taking one of food tours in Ginza, Tokyo. The food was amazing, the tour guides were extremely kind and friendly, and I not only learned more about Japanese food, but was also able to learn about some of the new and historical buildings around Ginza. This tour was hands down amazing, and I would highly recommend it to anyone visiting Tokyo for the first time, or for anyone just looking to have a great night out!

Kyoto Dinner-Book this!. We couldn’t believe the amount of food we had, it was a LOT! The quality was great and our guide explained the relevance of each ingredient that complemented a particular food! We had a 10 course kaiseki meal ( sounds complicate, it is !) , we ate some of the most local food of Kyoto and was extremely satisfied! We’ve been to Kyoto 4 times and this was the BEST meal we ever had. The yuba tofu was great, wagyu beef was to die for and the matcha dessert was just amazing! The price was very reasonable, dining in Kyoto for a kaiseki meal isn’t as cheap as some peole may think, this is definitely a great deal! If you come to Kyoto, do yourselfves a favor and save the hassles of ordering the wrong food , this is what we’ve done several times. I am so happy we got this dinner, thank you! Will definitely recommend it to my family and friends traveling to Japan!

Fantastic Allstar Tokyo Food Tour around Ginza - YUM!. We absolutely loved this 3-hour walking tour through Ginza, Yarakucho and Shinbashi. Our expert guide Anne not only introduced us to some fantastic food options, but also gave us a brief history of the areas we walked through, the Japanese food culture and the restaurants we visited. I had a whole list of food items I wanted to try and thanks to Arigato Japan, I was able to cross quite a few off of my list. I really liked the combination of walking and visiting restaurants where we could sit down for meals and socialize (amidst locals). Again, super tour which I highly recommend!

Unforgettable Kyoto food experience!!. My wife and I joined the Kaiseki Tour in Kyoto. As promised, this meal with the most unforgettable meal of our lives. Obviously, with such a big claim you go in a bit skeptical, but when we are eating freshly harvested sashimi on a 300-year-old Kyoto ceramic picce of art and we still have 9 courses to go, I knew I was not going to be let down. This tour is an absolute must if you are spending time in Kyoto during your trip to Japan. Domo arigato, Arigato Japan!

Food Tour and Cooking Class - A taste of Tokyo. We booked a food tour with Arigato Japan as we wanted to gain an insight to local food by a local living in Tokyo. We were not disappointed! Anne and her guide took us to a couple of great izakayas who served authentic Japanese cuisine that was delicious. Part of the tour was also being taken through to a satellite shop and a department store food basement which was all part of the experience.I was also lucky enough to enjoy the hospitality of a cooking class which was great! The lesson of the day was sushi and I couldn't believe how easy it was to make! So much fun, throughly enjoyed it! - Anne I would love to get those recipes from you I'm still waiting for them!!

Kyoto Food Tour at Night - Kaiseki Dinner. Having lived in the UK for so long, I found traveling in Japan a bit overwhelming. We went to so many restaurants but most didn't have english menus. We decided to book Arigato Japan's Kyoto Food Tour at Night and it was the best dinner that we ever had in Japan! The sashimi was unbelievable, it was so fresh and I can never forget the taste of the fatty tuna, it was followed by some local tofu that is one of Kyoto's specialty. We couldn't believe how much food there was, it never stopped! The star of the meal was the wagyu, this one was to die for! It was really unforgettable! Our guide Kanda San was very knowledgeable and shared with us stories of Kyoto people, it was like having dinner with a family in Kyoto. He made sure that we are taken care of the whole time. It was a very personal experience. I highly recommend this tour, the food alone is an understatement of this tour. The guide and information that they provide really makes this tour extra special. I highly recommend this tour, will do it over and over again!

Arigato to Arigato Japan!. Definitely worth the sum we paid. We dined on Japanese foods while hearing a little bit of history that gave us amazing insight to the people, culture and surrounding areas. I will highly recommend this specific tour to my friends and loved ones.

Kyoto Food Tour with 10 course meal. A friend recommend Arigato Japan , they joined the Shibuya tour in August when they visited. They said that their guides all speak great English and we were very happy we chose them! There was no quiet moment in the 3 hour tour, the food kept on coming like it was not gonna end. I was very surprised with how much quantity, not to mention great quality as well. I will never forget the wagyu beef and fish sashimi. in the past, I've always eaten meat sashimi. Their sashimi came in a very fancy plate and it was perfection! We should have never ordered any of the food that we had for this dinner. If we had another night, I would book it again. I really recommend this tour, what a great last night in Kyoto! Thank you also for walking us to our hotel, your guide was very accommodating and dedicated to making the guests happy.

Nishiki Market tour - Great Lunch!. We all met up close to the market and was greeted by the guide, Toshi was a very warm guy who made us all feel very welcomed! We started by sampling some local food that we've never had before in our 3 previous trips in Kyoto. We walked around different stalls and were told the different stories behind some of Kyoto's most traditional and local food. We were all happy with the food that kept on coming, all the food tastings were just delicious. This was even preceeded by a scrumptious lunch that was so enormous we couldn't finish it all. If you are in Kyoto, book this tour! A guide who speaks great english does make a huge difference in making your tour better. We really had a great time and will definitely recommend this to friends!

Market Tour in Kyoto, so fun!. Me and my co-workers flew to Kyoto and had nothing planned, this was a spur of the moment decision and turned out to be one of the best decisions we’ve ever made! We met up with Kanda san at the entrance of Nishiki and we were so surprised with how many stores there were mostly owned by the sames families for generations and generations! We tried sparkling sake, bonito flakes, peppers, curry crakers and fish cakes! The food choices were phenomenal and we wouldn’t have bought those on our own! There was very clear and detailed explanation for every single food stop, you really get to know Kyoto food up close and personal and we were extremely full after lunch! We had some great match and we will never forget that!Highly recommended!!! You will have the best experience!

Arigato Japan lives up to its name. This is an excellent concept. You attend their various cooking classes and then go on a Tokyo food tour. My favorite dishes are okonomiyaki which can feed a family of four, yakitori, and yakiniku. Arigato Japan are your instant friends there, they are warm and helpful and speak English, putting you at ease if you have any concerns about not knowing the language. We were very lucky to meet the charming owner, thank you very much. Arigato gozaimasu!

Wonderful way to start our Tokyo holisay. We started our weeklong stay in Tokyo with an evening food tour with Maya. Calling our night just a food tour is understating it. Not only, did Maya introduce us to some wonderful Japanese dishes and take us to back alley bars and restaurants, she also introduced us to the Tokyo Metro system, found a store to buy a SIM card and made sure we were on the correct train to return to our accommodation. We loved the Yakatori bar and the local restaurant we visited. The only negative for us was the noisy patrons at restaurant. Saturday night brings lots of loud tables of people. If you are taking the tour make sure you have a light lunch that day as the food is very plentiful.
Excellent!. Great food and perfect ambiance! The owner is very accommodating, We will definitely comeback and try other dishes

Amazing 3 hour food drink tour . We had an AMAZING time with Maiya this week who took us for a 3.5 hour food tour in Yurakucho, Ginza and Shimbashi. I've been to Japan 3 times previously but never took any tours and definitely never been on a food tour before despite having done some Viator tours in Paris before. Let me just say this tour was so educational and fun. The rest of the group had a cancellation so Arigato gave us the option of doing the tour with another group another day or staying same day for our tour for a private experience. We opted to keep the same day since we had other plans different days and we didn't regret it because it was more personalized and we had a blast with Maiya who was outgoing and sociable and fun to be around. Maiya has great English and was able to explain to us the different areas and even talked about the high quality fruits we have been seeing in both the "cheaper fruit stalls" and the most luxurious fruit shop in ginza. We were pleasantly surprised also the amount of food we were fed on the tour as there was a lot of food we couldn't even finish. The restaurant we went to was awesome with great service and we opted to pay extra for extra alcoholic drinks and also added some pickled vegetables that we paid for to try. We took many photos and Maiya was a great photographer capturing many great photos of me and my boyfriend during this tour. Five stars and we would recommend this tour to all friends!

Shibuya Food Tour and Nishiki Market Tour. We have been on four tours during our time in Japan. Two of them have been with Arigato Japan Cooking Classes and Walking Tours and I can't recommend them enough. Informative, entertaining, so so friendly, and patient with my slow walkin mum. Elizabeth Anne and Toshi San were our wonderful guides who showed us local sights and delicious Japanese food that we wouldn't have otherwise had the opportunity to try. It was like meeting up with a friend of a friend who was stoked to be showing us around their town. If you would like a taste of real Japanese food with great local sights get in touch with these guys! You will be so happy you did.

Gion, Kyoto Dinner, 10 course kaiseki!. My husband surprised me on our honeymoon and booked this dinner and it was spectacular! We couldn’t believe how much food we ate, there was a lot! I could never forget the wagyu and fatty tuna, everything was nicely presented and our guide was very helpful the whole time! We got to know so much about Kyoto people, their culture and most of all their food! It is the best dinner we’ve had in Japan. The food kept on coming, we were so full and could hardly walk after, it was a night to remember. We will definitely book their tours in Tokyo next time we visit, we love how our guide was explaining everything with some humor. His stories about Kyoto were brilliant, the 3 hour tour went so fast and we wish it was longer. Book this tour, you will never regret it! Thanks again to my husband for making this possible!

Food tour in Kyoto. We booked this last minute and we were very happy, satisfied and full at the end of the tour! We booked the Nishiki day tour, me and my family really loved it. We were in Kyoto for three days and we so glad that we did it. It was a rainy day and this tour was perfect because it was mostly indoors. The food of Kyoto is the best in Japan, this market has it all. Our guide Kanda san was the most informative and helpful guide ever! He helped us in finding food that we wanted to take back home as presents. We sampled so many kinds of food, it was unbelievable!Then the MATCHA! This for me was the best I’ve had, the perfect bitterness and taste! We even had some warm tofu donuts, this was the first time for me to try this. We also had some tamagoyaki which was yummy! We enjoyed our lunch at a traditional place, this was really a good part of this trip, enjoying everything that we had from the market! My family and I really were fortunate to have booked this tour on our last day!Highly recommended!!!

Kyoto Dinner- unbelievably great!. I booked this tour for me and my girlfriend and it was just outstanding! We would have never ordered any of the food served to us on our own! They came in the most beautiful plates, we had our private room so it was a very intimate experience! The walk around Gion was just awesome, we even got to see some geishias. We met up close to the Kamo River, here’ you’ll have a great view of the restaurants by the river. After this we enjoyed a very succulent dinner that we will never ever forget! The sashimi selection was to die for. It was very delicious !!! This was really something we never expected, I am so happy we booked this tour. It was a great way to spend our last night in Kyoto. I will do it again next time I visit! I highly recommend this dinner!

Golden Gai, my favorite part of tokyo. We joined the Golden Gai Tour and it was amazing! It’s hard to believe that there are bars so small and closely situated next to each other but yes it exists! There was so much to this than just a food tour, we enjoyed the stories about this historiical and controversial part of town! Our guide was extremely passionate and gave us so much knowledge in just a short time! We ate so much and really enjoyed the nabe dumplings and miso, one of the restaurant’s specialties. I highly recommend this to travelers, it will be difficult to find the places that our guides took us to on your own. We enjoyed the tour very much, we look forward to the next one

Japan Tour 2016. GOLDEN GAI & NISHIKI MARKET TOUR – BOOK THEM!Me and my friends joined their GOLDEN GAI FOOD TOUR in Tokyo and that was so surreal, it was our best Tokyo experience! Our co-workers have joined Arigato Japan’s food tours in Tokyo and was recommended to try them because their guides are great, they speak great English and very informative and fun as well.We got to see Golden gai with Anne, she was extremely great! There was not a dull moment in our tour and we even extended another hour. The first stop was just so amazing, bars so small you can hardly fit 5 people, we had yakitori and it was yummy! We walked around Kabukicho and ate after. We had 5 different kinds of food, wow it was amazing! We headed out to Golden gai after and had the best night in Tokyo! Wow, it’s beyond words, you have to see it yourself! Our group eneded up going to a karaoke after. Anne was very accommodating and even guided as to make sure we find our way to the Karaoke, she even drew a map so we can find our way to the station.We booked their Nishiki Market and it was just unbelievably awesome! Don’t go to the market just walking, book this tour because there is so much to learn about it! It was very affordable considering that it came with lunch and we got to try so many things, this was really the highlight of our stay in Kyoto.Overall, I highly recommend Arigato Japan! Their guides, food choices and information is just great. We’ve had two tours and they were exceptional. Not a dull moment, every single minute was fun! Highly recommended!

NISHIKI MARKET TOUR - the best! . Nishiki market is Kyoto's best market, a lot of people just walk around the stores and not realize that there is so much behind these markets. If you are in Kyoto, this tour is a must! There's so much history behind Kyoto's food, we learned so much from this tour and we highly recommend it! It's a very good value because it comes with lunch and lots of food samplings. We had a group of 4 so it was the perfect size and we got to hear some of the market's stories and history. Each store has their own unique appeal to it, I will never forget this experience. Highly recommended!

NISHIKI MARKET TOUR, A MUST TRY . On our last day in Kyoto , we decided to book the Nishiki Food Tour and it was an amazing food tour! The guide was extremely knowledgeable, a Kyoto native who used to live in America. He was extremely fun too! Everything that you need to learn about Kyoto's food market is in this tour, we got so many food samplings and we were so full at the end of the tour. The lunch was absolutely enjoyable and we will never forget the experience , I highly recommend this tour!

GOLDEN GAI TOUR-HIDDEN GEM OF TOKYO! . I went on this tour with some friends over a business trip to Japan, the experience was beyond outstanding! I would have never found the narrow, charming and historical streets of golden gai! I have been on other tours but this was by far the best, the guide, Anne was very passionate, fun and knowledgeable! She helped us with our other plans for Tokyo as well which was a big plus, she spoke perfect English ! There was not a dull moment, the whole group was very happy the whole night. Overall, this was really the highlight of our trip. From the food selection, information, guide and coordination, this is really a top caliber tour that's very affordable! Glad we took this tour, would love to come back and try the rest of their tours as well

KYOTO NIGHT FOOD TOUR - THE BEST DINNER!. We are a family of 5 from Barcelona, we flew to Kyoto for a short visit and decided to join a food tour. We decided to book the NISHIKI MARKET TOUR, it was so great! We got to try so many things from sake, tofu donuts, tofu skin, fish and japanese eggs that were so tasty! The tour was with only 6 people, it was very intimate and we got to ask so many questions. Every place where we stopped was just heaven! All the food samplings were great and we really loved the flow of the tour, honestly it all went so fast because we had so much fun. I definitely will book their Tokyo tours next time we visit. Thanks Arigato Japan for a very memorable tour!

Fantastic, Delicious and Informative Tour!. The 3-hour, 3-neighborhood Allstar Tokyo Food Tour was fun, informative and delicious. Anne, the owner and our tour guide for the evening, was absolutely fantastic. Her love of Tokyo was apparent as she pointed out fun facts about the city and gave us plenty of restaurant recommendations and tips for the rest of our trip. We were in a small group of 6, including my husband and I, and she took the time to get to know us and our preferences. She lead us through random narrow streets of local izakayas, which we would have never found on our own, to the wide streets of luxury shops in Ginza. We sampled super tasty skewers and drinks on the second floor of some random building (again, we would've never discovered this place by ourselves), stuffed ourselves with local dishes (udon, dumplings, fried chicken, raw chicken, the most delicious miso paste ever). We finished off the evening with a crispy golden Taiyaki (pastry in the shape of a fish) oozing with custard goodness. By the end of the tour, we were patting our bellies in satisfaction. We also randomly ran into her in Kyoto and had dinner with her! Thanks, Anne for such a memorable experience on our honeymoon!

Kyoto Nishiki MArket Tour-Unforgettable. We took this tour with our family and it was THE BEST experience we ever had! The guide, Kanda San was extremely knowledgeable, funny and very professional! The tour highlights all the great local food of Kyoto we would have never discovered on our own, the experience was very memorable! There is no better way exploring Nishiki market than joining a food tour like this, we have read great reviews about their Tokyo tour and was curious to try the Kyoto one and it was not a disappointment! I highly recommend this tour, the best thing is that you also get to have lunch after you buy some amazing food from the market. Book this tour, you will never regret it!!!!

KYOTO FOOD TOUR - THE BEST! . This is the ultimate food tour! How awesome is it that you get to try all Kyoto's best ingredients and local food like Tofu donuts, tamagoyaki, matcha dessert, pickled vegetables and the list goes on! We went with my family and it was the highlight of our stay in Kyoto, the guide was amazing and spoke perfect English. I believe having a great tour also depends on how well the guide can explain things, Toshi was very witty and extremely knowledgeable. We couldn't have asked for a better guide! This tour is THE BEST we've ever had, the food quantity was great, very educational tour and a memorable experience. Highly recommended!

Food Tour and Sushi Class. We booked both a night food tour and daytime sushi-making class with Arigato and have to say both were fantastic. The food tour was on our first night in Tokyo with a small, friendly group and our guide Anne was amazing - so welcoming and knowledgable and showed us places we'd never have found on our own that gave us the insight for places to go during the rest of the trip. As well as some great restaurants, we also went to some really cool shops and a food hall so you really do have a varied, interesting and fun evening with some awesome food thrown in!The sushi-making class was also in a small group in a nice apartment with really friendly and informative tutors. You learn a lot about what goes into traditional Japanese sushi and make a load of things with a choice of ingredients that you get to eat at the end. Again, a brilliant way to spend a couple of hours! All in all we can't recommend Arigato enough - great value for money and a really cool way to throw yourself into seeing and doing things you normally wouldn't.

Fantastic food! Fantastic tour guide!. We decided to take this tour on a whim and were so pleased that we did. Anne answered all our Japan related questions (food related and not), and regaled us with stories of her life inJapan. She tailored the food choices to our interests and tastes, and even recommended other places to try throughout the city. Highly recommend taking this tour!

An amazing Tokyo experience!. The class was fantastic! The food was great and we had a ton of fun making our own Gyoza.The owner - Anne - gave us a ton of recommendations for activities throughout Tokyo and Kyoto. The restaurants she recommend were delicious, and she set us up with an informative - and fun - tour in Kyoto.This was definitely a highlight of our trip to Japan!

Walking tour : recommended in the beginning of your trip ! . I recommend this walking tour to be taken at the beginning of your trip because Anne (the owner) showed us so many hidden passageways filled with izakayas ! We would have loved to go back and explore these places if we had more time . The Food/ walking tour started in Yurakucho through Ginza and ended in Shimbashi. Anne met us directly outside of the Yurakucho station and after short introductions of the group we were on our way through 3 cities. During the tour we learned a lot about the culture, people and places of Japan. We explored lots of hidden alleys and narrow passageways that we wouldn't have even thought to enter. At our first stop we had some yakitori. It was a little sampler with 5 different kinds. The minced meat was my favorite. The tour also comes with two drinks and with Anne's suggestions, I tried highball and plum wine. Two popular drinks in Japan and both were amazing. We walked through Ginza and saw some outrageously priced fruits at some markets and a lot of high end + name brand stores. Great area for shopping. Our next restaurant was located in Ginza. We had a great meal which included : Raw vegetables with Miso. The best miso I've ever had. We even purchased a few bottles to take home with us; fried chicken with tartar sauce- juicy and the tartar sauce was delicious; chicken sashimi ! Taste like chicken! The food regulations in Japan are strict and we had no problem trying this recommended dish; gyoza soup- this was one of our favorite dishes. So simple but so good. The gyoza was so soft and the broth was so tasty . We had it with a little yuku to add a little fresh citrus flavor; rice ball with American cheese ; udon ; blacken charcoal chicken- this was their regional special and award winning at that. It was very smoky and juicy; a thin crust pizza with little white fish, miso paste and furukake . I could have eaten the whole thing. It was so light and easy to eat. And for dessert we had mango jelly! The best part about this meal aside from being able to try 8 dishes was that there was always extra so if we wanted more servings we were able to have more of our favorite dish. The tour continued with dessert at a stand that served the equivalency to a pressed cream puff in the shape of a fish. Our choice of custard or azuki bean paste filling ( I chose custard). It was warm and delicious. After our dessert we walked through Shimbashi where there were a lot more little alleyways filled with izakayas (bars)! Anne explained that a lot of salarymen worked around the area and would have their late night dinner or drinks there. We left the tour with full bellies and a lot of recommendations for food, shopping, sites and other izakaya alleys in the cities we were staying in. Anne has a great heart and a true passion for food, culture and friendship. Arigato for all of your recommendations and amazing food tour!

Lots of attention, great food, big smile. I got in touch with Anne during a short trip to Tokyo with my 10-year old daughter. She was extremely responsive, accommodated our requests and pampered us with amazing service with a big smile. She took photographs and videos through out the experience to share with friends and family (at no extra charge). I highly recommend Arigato.

Fascinating: Hard to find, hard to forget!. Once you are to find the school in her Roppongi apartment, Anne entertains and makes you rapidly feel at home. She is eager to share her knowledge about Japanese cooking traditions. You will never forget the different tastes that make Japanese such a special cuisine.Don't forget to ask for a visit of the different shops around her place, fascinating walk and sample what they offer you to discover!

Now I can MAKE my favorite Japanese foods!. I joined one of Arigato Japan's cooking classes in Tokyo and had a great time learning how to make some of my favorite Japanese treats! I've been studying Japanese culture and language for years and would always try to recreate some Japanese dishes to share with my friends. This time I finally got to take a class with the hilarious, adorable and really helpful chefs, and learned really AUTHENTIC recipes that I can recreate at home! My favorite was the 'Ichigo Daifuku' dessert, which is a delicious, ripe strawberry wrapped in layers of sweet bean paste and sticky white "mochi" rice. I've bought this from street vendors during my trips, and now it takes EVEN better because I know how to make it. ARIGATO to you guys at Arigato Japan! I can't wait to go home and share some of these flavors with my family back home.

A new way of seeing Tokyo. The All Star food tour was fantastic! They gave us a very informative tour on Ginza and the scenery was fantastic as you walk from one stop to another. They served food that tourist won't be able to enjoy when going on a trip on their own. The food was excellent and a lot. I highly recommend this tour to any age group since our group was composed of couples in their 70's who enjoyed the walk and food. The tour guides where very accommodating and friendly. A trip to Tokyo would not be complete without this tour! -Francesca Deus, Philippines

Amazing and Delicious!!!!!!. This is our first time in Japan so we decided to try and experience the food tour with Anne. The whole food tour was amazing and worth it. Anne was so knowledgeable about the Japanese culture and expert on where to take us for delicious Japanese food. We would never find the small side streets by ourselves for sure. We had a great time thanks again Anne.Raul and Marie (Melbourne, Australia)

Great introduction to food and culture in Japan.. We thoroughly enjoyed our walking tour with Anne who was so knowledgeable, enthusiastic and dynamic. We had a few hiccoughs with our flights and had to change dates at short notice. Anne was so obliging and accommodating of our requests. We found it all very interesting walking around the back streets and the food was delicious and of good variety. Anne was helpful in giving insight into Japanese life and customs. It was over all too quickly and wouldn't hesitate to recommend or do again next time we are there. Thanks Anne!

Must do Japanese Cooking Class in Tokyo!. We weree looking for something to do on a rainy day when we thought about joining a cooking class, went through tripadvisor and saw that Arigato Japan had lots of great reviews and it ended up being the highlight of our trip! We ended up making Gyoza and three side dishes. The kitchen was extremely clean and organized, Shitley and Anne were absolutely very outstanding and helpful! What I really liked about the class is the fact that we made something that we can definitely cook in or country! They gave us plenty of ingredients that we can substitute. The kitchen was also in the most convenient location. I highly recommend Arigato Japan!!!
Interesting and Delicious!. We thoroughly enjoyed this tour and saw things that we would never have seen otherwise. The food was good and there was plenty of it.

Amazing food tour in Tokyo. A friend and I did the Tokyo food tour with Anne and it was a wonderful experience, full of knowledge and good vibes. Anne and her team definitely know how to introduce Japan to your plate and you will learn (and eat) a lot.Both drink and food were plenty and delicious and the variety of places visited give you a great overview of Tokyo's food. Definitely great value for money.I will highly recommend to do it at the beginning of your trip like we did so you can understand better the food you will find during your trip.Big thanks to Anne and her team for the amazing pictures and the video they sent us after. Great memories :)

Delicious food!. As first time visitors to Japan, it was nice to get a very broad introduction to the japaneese cuisine and customs. Everything we had tasted SO delicious! The tour took us from small, local restaurants hidden away in alleyways, that we would never have found on our own, to the posh Ginza where we got to see some super expensive melons. I quite liked the contrast of it. We were on the tour with 2 other people, and we all just bonded right away, which made the tour even better. So don't be afraid to go with people you don't know. I would definitely recommend it.

Simply Wonderful!!. We loved our tour with Anne. She brought us to some delicious hidden neighborhood gems. We learned tons about Japanese culture & history too. It was simply wonderful! I highly recommend booking this tour!!!!

Great Experience, Excellent Food. My husband and I were in Tokyo on an apartment hunting trip and decided to learn a little bit about Japanese food and culture by going on the Shibuya Food Tour. We met our guide, Timothy, outside Shibuya station. Despite the craziness we were able to find him easily. We started our tour by doing a short walk through some of the less seen areas of Shibuya and getting a bit of a history of the importance of culture and food in Japan. Our first stop was at an Okonomiyaki restaurant. It was fantastic. Timothy provided excellent information on what we were about to eat, the flavours that we would taste and the differences in the two different styles. Needless to say it was a very tasty stop. We then moved on to Tsukada farms and got a taste of several chicken dishes. By the time we were done were stuffed, but we walked over to one of the department stores and headed to the basement. We never seen so many beautiful desserts. It was wonderful.Timothy was an excellent host and after finding out we were moving even offered to help us out once our family arrives in our new home. It was such a nice gesture as Tokyo can be very overwhelming. We enjoyed our evening, got a great taste of some Japanese food that we had never heard of, and We will definitely recommend Arigato to any friends and family that come over for a visit.

Your go-to food tour in Tokyo. I took this food tour early spring of 2016. Our guide Anne was just the best. She brought us to a lot of cute, hidden restaurants/bars that I would have never found on my own. She is also a lovely person who truly cared about everyone, making sure we all had a good time. Highly recommended!

Sushi cooking class was great!. We learned how to cook four kinds of beautiful Sushi in the class. They are not just beautiful. All the classmates agreed that the food we cooked was very delicious.I'm a Japanese. The rest of the classmates were foreigners. This means that the food is tasty regardless of whether one is a foreigner or a Japanese.The teacher and her assistant are very nice as well!I'm sure I'll go back to another lesson to learn a different dish.

Extraordinary food tour. The food tour with Anne was the perfect introduction to Tokyo. It was a great way to start our holiday in Tokyo. My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed the experience. Seeing the tiny Izakayas under the train tracks was amazing. We were so lucky to be able to catch the once a year Japanese festival. Anne, our tour guide, was energetic and effervescent. She challenged us to get to the Festival in the Amazing Race style, which was memorable and thrilling.

Cooking classes recommended . Learning to cook with Arigato Japan was a highlight of my trip in tokyo. I attended the traditional lunch class first and ended up coming back for a sushi class. Both were filled with informative information about ingredients and techniques and taught in a clear, friendly and welcoming way. On coming home I have made great use of what I learned in these classes so they are worth every penny. Would recommend!

Oustanding Food Tour. Our host Ayimo was very informative and we visited many restaurants we would not be able to able to find on our own. We had a great late afternoon with our family. My son also enjoyed practicing his Japanese.  Look forward to returning and joining the cooking classes.

AMAZING FOOD TOUR!. We had a wonderful personalized food tour with Arigato Japan Cooking Classes & Food Tours!!! We would definitely recommend booking a tour!! We had a great and unique experience with our guide Elizabeth! She took us to a local izakaya and other special spots where we would have never gone to without a local. The food we ate was unbelievable- best meal we've ever had! We had a great time talking to Elizabeth about the food culture in Japan as well !! This was one of the best experiences we had while we were in Tokyo!!! MUST DO!

Best time ever!. My husband and I spent a wonderful afternoon learning to make Japanese food. The instructor made the class so fun and we especially enjoyed the outcome. Thank You Arigato Japan for a wonderful time!

Learn how to cook with chopsticks!. I had my first cooking class with Arigato Japan and I enjoyed it very much. In 2 hours, we made gyoza (Japanese dumplings), miso soup, sweet omelet and shabu shabu salad. The place was clean and tidy. Some ingredients were prepared. For example, cabbage, garlic and ginger were already thinly sliced so we could fully focus on the recipe. For this class we were only 2 students and the atmosphere was friendly, relaxed but professional. The teacher Shirley showed us first how to do, then we had to follow her instructions. Have you already tried to roll an omelet with chopsticks? Not really easy! We also learnt about the ingredients we used? Finally, we were very proud of us when arranging the different dishes we made on our tray. It looked beautiful and you know what? Everything was really good!
