Well, Ayuko gets you up to speed in just over an hour.A group of us went in with zero skills and came out confident that sushi and sashimi was now part of our culinary repertoire.Ayuko is a brilliant teacher, very zen and her English is excellent so there's nothing lost in translation.Right by the station so it's easy to get to.

Great cooking school experience in Tokyo!. Buddha Bellies cooking school is a must do experience for any foodie visiting Tokyo. Ayuko was an excellent teacher and host who not only taught us how to prepare some delicious decorative sushi and sashimi, but also shared some of the interesting history and traditions associated with Japanese cuisine. The school is easily accessible via Tokyo metro and Ayuko speaks fluent English (also teaches English).

Okonomiyaki to go. Now I can cook some delicious okonomiyaki back home thanks to Ayuko! She was very instructive and very helpful. In addition to that, we've tried some ultra fast and simple yakisoba and have learnt a little about the matcha ceremony! Great experience!

Delicious Bento!. My boyfriend and I have lived in Japan for a combined 4 years, and were looking for a way to refine our cooking skills during a recent trip to Tokyo. Ayuko was a very good teacher who not only showed us how to make a Kyoto-style bento, but also explained the history and symbolism of the foods we made. We got engaged while we were in Tokyo, but Buddha Bellies Cooking School was the second best part of our trip. :)

Fun sushi making experience. I took the sushi making class with Ayuko and this was a very fun experience for me. She walked us through the recipe for making rice and we got to make our own sushi lunch. Ayuko was very pleasant and helpful. The red bean dessert and matcha making at the end of the class was a very nice touch and much appreciated. Ayuko went above and beyong to answer our questions and she even helped me make reservations to a nail salon after I noticed her beautiful nails. Highly recommend as a fun addition to your trip to Tokyo!

Sushi Know-how by a licensed Sushi Chef Ayuko-San. The Teacher created a fun and relax atmosphere. The place was cozy and we were given notes apart from books to refer to for further introduction of sushi. I got to know that there are a few sushi types and there are different ways of making sushi. And to be able to be a chef takes a long time as it takes lots of patient. We made four seas sushi and the teacher showed how to make it step by step from the preparation of the rice to rolling to cutting and presentation. We got to learn a little origami and making the soup as accompaniment. And she did gave a surprise at the end, after having a full belly of our handiwork. The Teacher is so gracious and I would strongly recommend the class to anyone. It was my very first and it wont be my last. I go to her class again when I got the chance.This made my trip to Japan different and enjoyable.

Fun fun fun!. Such a great experience and very good introduction on Japanese foods.We attended the sushi class which includes decorative sushi, the instructor speaks fluent English and has a professional skills. We learn so much from her. I highly recommend this program to anyone who travel Japan!

Great place for learning Japanese culture!. I joined udon class with my friend.We really enjoyed the traditional way if making it. The teacher Ayuko is very knowledgable, patience, kind and she was professional as well.We learnt tea ceremony and origami from her :), which were a great entertaining!The result of udon turned out fantastic. The decor if the kitchen studio and atmosphere is very relaxing and trendy surrounded by many good books.This is probably the best thing that we ever done while traveling abroad. You can see the real culture of Japan ;)

great experience with getting to know food and japanese culture. great experience with getting to know food and japanese culture.It was fantastic way to learn how to make food and also to get to know a few cultures "rules" of the Japanese people. Also it was a good escape from the hot hot weather for couple of ours:)

Lovely Experience!. I went for the decorative Sushi making class. It was a lovely, cosy class and the experience went beyond just cooking. I will definitely recommend this to my friends coming to Tokyo to experience Japanese cooking and culture in a friendly setting.Kratika

Great experience making noodle!. I have participated in noodle class! Her class is very well organised and amazing that I made it from scratch by myself with Ayuko's help! The result was beautiful and yum. Recommend to anyone who are in Tokyo!

Highly recommended. If you are going to be in Tokyo, this should be a must do on your list. The class is held in a smaller area but makes it fun. The class we took was on sushi. The instructor was very nice and knowledgable. We got to make susi from beginning to end. Learned about tea ceremonies and culture of Japan. At the end we got to eat the sushi, have some desert and tea. It went by too fast. Excellent trip.

Great time with nice experience. We didn't know what to looking for and this cooking experience was much more.The place was nice book store with good music :)The curse was great we learn all the steps from sketch and the teacher was so kind and nice.

Fun, tasty and interesting. What a fantastic way to spend out first afternoon in Tokyo. I took the sushi making class with my teenaged daughter. The entire experience was super well organized, we learned a lot about sushi and how to prepare the ingredients, had plenty of hands-on time and the perfect amount of time to get to know the other guests as well. I hope to return one day for more classes.

Experience This!. This is something everyone needs to do when coming to Japan. Not only are you going to learn how to make Japanese food from a skilled chef, but you're also going to get the experiences that coinside with learning from the Japanese, as well as making additional international friends that can last a lifetime. Really, this was the greatest thing that had happen to me during my stay in Japan.

Highly recommended. Took the sushi course with a friend. Course held in (very good) english by a professional chef named Ayuko. The instructions were clear and easy to follow. Ayuko shared many interesting facts during the course, not just about sushi but also about other parts of japanese culture. At the end of the course, tea making was taught and a small gift was given to the course participants. I highly recommend anyone visiting Tokyo to take this course.
A fun experience. Had a great time making Udon noodles for lunch. Instructions were very clear and the food tasted great. The setting was very interesting in a bookshop type environment!

Learning how to make Okonomiyaki in Tokyo was just FUN!. My sister and I signed up for the class and both of us enjoyed it a lot. Keeping in mind that I can't cook to save my life, Ayuko's class was a great introduction to me. The location is cosy, the materials well prepared, and because of the small size of the class, it was easy to make new friends with others attending the same class. Ayuko spoke good English so communication was never a problem, and when the class ended she even made us Japanese fried noodles for lunch and it was absolutely delicious - better than what I tasted in other restaurants since. Must have been the fresh home-cooked taste!If you're in Tokyo and would like to learn something new and have an enjoyable experience at the same time, don't miss this :)

Enjoyable :). The entire process was very well prepared, and the ambiance of the 'classroom', which was actually an interesting library, was very clean and comfortable :) The food was easy to prepare and tasted to good! Just as I thought things are wrapping up, Ayu brought out one surprise after another -- a mini-origami session, sake, fried noodle, a mini tea ceremony and dessert! And we only signed up for Okonomiyaki :DThe fellow participants were awesome too! Everyone had great fun and good food! Suggest to have this after days of crazy shopping and sightseeing to wind-down and just enjoy a pleasant Japanese moment.

Great experience a must try!. we loved our sushi making class at Buddha bellies cooking school Tokyo, Ayuko was wonderful her english was great and her stories even better. she could relate to us about many topics we brought up and gave us an insight into other aspects we asked about japan. the sushi was fresh and delicious and the green tea was such an added bonus.We unfortunately had our babysitter cancel last minute so it was great she didnt judge us for having to bring the baby and accomodated as much as she could.we have already bought some ingredients and will be making Ayukos sushi this week for friends.the bookshop attached was amazing we wish she sold the books and knives or sushi sets!

Great fun for aspiring chefs. We was very fortunate when booking the class - fish cutting and sushi making, since there needed to be 4 people and the exact same weekend that we wanted to do it - another couple had also expressed interest. So - we met up at Jimbocho station and walked the 20 metres to where the class was held. We had a great time! Ayuko is a great teacher who speaks perfect english, so whenever you had a question - especially since we were only 4 people, it was really easy to ask and understand the answer - both questions regarding where to buy things in Tokyo, restaurants to visit, what ingredients were named in japanese and english as well as questions to why things were done in a particular way.The fishcutting + sushi making + eating it all took around 4 hours for us.Highly recommended!

Very pleasent experience with alot of fun. I really liked the class with Ayuko. She was a great host, spoke perfect english and was patient with all of us. The class size was good as well with 5 people overall. The instructions of making sushi were clear and I cannot wait to try it out at home. At the end we ate our delicious sushi that we have made and we got to make matcha tea. Ayuko also gave us a little surprise at the end and the recipes. I warmly recommend this really nice cooking experience with Ayuko. You are in the best hands.

Great way to fill in time before our flight home.. We had to be out of our hotel at 10 and needed something to do to fill in a few hours until the bus to the airport at 3pm...this was PERFECT. Sushi making class was from 11-1.30 and we had a great time learning and doing. I an vegatarian so I was expecially appreciative of the fantastic choices that Ayuko made for me. It was a fabulous lunch and I will definately be doing it all again at home. Thank you for your help also finding a taxi for us afterwards and telling the driver in Japanese where we needed to go.

Fun food experience with lovely host!. Ayuko, the woman who runs the class is so lovely and welcoming. The class is interesting for anyone whether they have never cooked before or are an avid foodie. As she is a trained chef her knowledge is expansive but she is still very good at explaining things simply and clearly for those who do not know. I recommend this to anyone coming to visit as it is also a great opportunity to get advice on places to visit from a local of Tokyo!

Amazing food, Amazing people. I made sushi and Udon with this school.It has been an amazing experience, while working on my food I met new people all over the world.I can guarantee you that at the end of your kitchen class you will be satisfied and will make again sushi or udon at your home with any problem !

It's even better than any review you will read. We are just returning from Japan, my wife, me, and our 3 children. I contacted Buddha Bellies at the last minute on the off chance they would be available to give us a private sushi making lesson. Ayuko was super responsive and made herself available for a special session. She was amazing and thanks to her, our family has a memory that will last for a lifetime. I couldn't recommend it enough! Thank you soooo much.

Buddha Bellies Cooking School. One of the highlights of our stay in Tokyo. Ayuko was able to organise a special class for us we couldn't fit our group of four people into her schedule. She met us at one of the train station exits so it took the hassle out of trying to find the address. It was a very relaxed class and we had lots of fun making udon noodles and teriyaki chicken. Highly recommended!

amazing, amazing, AMAZING!. This has been a highlight of my time in Japan so far. The class is located basically right at Jimbocho station, and our teacher met us right at the nominated station exit which took any stress out of finding the location!The class itself was really enjoyable! We learned how to make okonomiyaki, and everyone had a great time. We also had some fabulous yakisoba made by our teacher, we learned how to make green tea from powder and the traditions behind it, drank beer or sake (depending on your preference!) and had Japanese dessert and got a gift to take home with us!They do different classes (udon, sushi, okonomiyaki) and I am already thinking about returning for another class, I loved it that much!I have a million good things to say about this class - it really was a wonderful time, and I was privileged to be with a super fun group of people.If you are seeking a unique cultural experience whilst in Japan and you also want to hone your cooking skills, Buddha Bellies is for you!

Wonderful experience-yuheh I can make sushi myself!!!. Our teacher and owner of the school met us at an exit of the subway - she gave me customized info on how to get there from my hotel and just around the corner is her classroom. Very well explained - details I never read in any cookbook and hands on experience how to make the proper rice for sushis etc. so we knew right away that we got now the perfectly working recipe!!!our group all managed to make quite lovely sushis - wonderful fish quality. we even learned how to make the cover of for the sticks with origami papers! and a lovely sake to go with our selfmade meal. Wish I had more time to take some other classes with her! See my pics...pretty good hm??and to finish off we learned how to properly make green tea from green tea powder - very nice! (went to buy some afterwards!)

Fantastic introduction to Japanese cuisine. This cooking course is based in a relaxed, casual setting and offers some insight into the ingredients and preparation of some delicious, simple and traditional Japanese dishes.

Awesome!. This was such a great experience. I have been wanting to take a japanese cooking class for quite some time, so during my stay in tokyo I took a class at buddha bellies. It was worth every penny. I have already cooked Nabe for my family and it's a great hit. I wish I was able to take a few more classes there before I departed.

Fun & professional cooking class!. I did the Udon & Chicken Teriyaki class, and had a great time! I would definitely recommend the class to friends visiting Tokyo.Ayuko is a great teacher, and runs a very professional operation. Everything was well organized and smooth, and immediately felt at home. I had a really fun time learning from her, and it was nothing but a positive learning experience. I also now know how to make Udon and Teriyaki, and can't wait to do so for my friends (and myself!).

Excellent! Highly recommended. My wife and I took the sushi making class and had a great time. The teacher Ayuko was very friendly and the made the class a very enjoyable experience. The class was in very good English and the sushi itself was delicious. The combination of the small class size (5 people), warm and personable teacher, great food and "extras" (green tea, dessert and sake!) make this a must do for anyone visiting Tokyo that loves sushi.

Just Fantastic!. My wife and I just had the best time today for the 2.5 hour Sushi Cooking class. Ayuko is just so friendly, lovely and professional. She makes all the guests feel right at home and has an easy teaching method. The way Ayuko goes about demonstrating Sushi and Sashimi making enables everyone in the class to get involved and make real Japanese food. The small class size and lovely decor makes the atmosphere very inviting. There was a very generous amount of food to eat that went down well with the lovely glass of Sake. There were some other surprises on the day such as green tea making/ceremony, and a little bit of origami. The location is so easy to get to and Ayuko will meet you at exit A2 at the Jimbocho subway station where you walk right next door to her cooking school premises. This is must do even if you are not a foodie! Thank you Ayuko I will recommend Buddha Bellies to anyone I know that will be travelling to Tokyo.

Wonderful cooking experience in Tokyo. If you travel in Tokyo and would like to have a unique experience, this is the one you should take. Ayuko will teach you how to make Japanese cuisine in English at a cozy and clean place.When I took the class, the menu was Gyoza (Japanese dumplings) and Ramen (noodle), both are very typical Japanese food which are beloved by most Japanese people and I've heard they are becoming more and more popular now outside Japan. Ayuko explained the details of the ingredients we used, which shops we should visit to get them, also told us what else we could use in case we won't find the same item.The class was attended by some Japanese ladies (including me) and some non-Japanese people who were staying in Tokyo for business, all of us with different background. So, it was very fun!!I hope I'll join another class and surely recommend the Buddha Bellies Cooking School Tokyo for those who are keen to explore Japanese culture in a way which are not on travel guidebook :-))

Happy cooking experience with fun ideas and relaxing atmosphere!. I took a one-day class for summer a la carte appetizer. 5 members including me were participated. All dishes were delicious, and after the class I could make them in my kitchen.The teacher Ayuko is very kind and warmhearted, and has wonderful sense of beauty. I could learn not only how to cook but also how to make dishes beautiful. You'll have an wonderful experience and find a profound essence of Japanese cuisine in Buddha Bellies!

Learn about sushi!. We are so glad we attended this sushi class! We learned not only to make our own sushi, but we learned a lot about sushi, how to eat it, how to recognize quality, how the japanese eat it, and so on. It can be smart to know a little more about what´s custom in Japan, before you go to a upscaled sushi restaurant. The teacher will tell you a little about it. She was a great teacher, and she spoke fluent english. It was a a very nice atmosphere in the class, and it was very international. we met people from many different countries and had a great time. It was a very social thing to do and you met other people with an interest in food. The only thing that was a little disappointing was that the wasabi was not fresh. Once you have tasted it fresh, you´re hooked. But don´t let this stop you, it´s really a great thing to do when you´re in Tokyo!

Excellent Cooking School - a must do in Tokyo. I was planning to open a Japanese restaurant in my country thus wanting to take an intensive cooking course to learn about Japanese cuisine. I was very lucky to have found the amazing teacher, Ayuko who is also the owner of Buddha Bellies Cooking School.It is not easy at all to find a teacher who can speak good English in Japan but Ayuka speaks English perfectly. She makes all the cooking classes very interesting; especially, she makes all the recipes so easy to learn, prepare and cook.I was amazed about her garnishing skills, her magic hands can turn all into art. I was lucky enough to take private classes where I have learned everything from scratch and learned a lot from her.Besides, Ayuko is extremely helpful; she spent her own time to show me around different supermarkets and introduce to me a variety of Japanese ingredients, vegetables, fruits, meat, fish etc. She was also kind and knowledgeable enough to recommend me many interesting restaurants where I was taken to the real world of Japanese gastronomy.I was absolutely touched that she even helped me organize my accommodation in Japan and even picked me up and sent me to the private cooking class on my first day. This is very helpful as you can easily get lost in Tokyo where Japanese language seems to be the only communication.I completed about 30 dishes and I am very happy that these can be on the menu for my up-coming restaurant.Honestly, I can’t express how wonderful it was to learn with Ayuko - it was all fabulous and she is definitely such the loveliest and most awesome person I have ever met.She has made my my trip a complete.My huge thank to Ayuko and I do hope to come back for more cooking classes.Last but not least, Buddha Bellies Cooking School is a must do in Tokyo.Anthony H

Excellent classes - must do when in Tokyo. Excellent classes! I was living in Tokyo for a year and found it difficult to find a class in English that was interesting and where I was able to learn skills I could use when I moved back home. I did three classes with Ayuko - bento, sushi and nabe. I highly recommend all of these classes. Particularly the Nabe class - a great winter dish and easy to make once you learn how to! Ayuko is also extremely friendly, her English is excellent and she has some interesting history on each dish. The class sizes are also small (max of 4 people) which makes it more personal.

Great fun- a must do!. Very fun and informative class. Ayuko teaches you about different kinds of sushi and then shows you how to make it. Afterwards you enjoy a beer or sake (or juice) while you enjoy the sushi you made yourself. A small personal class in a very comfortable environment. A must do while in Tokyo for a fun activity. Also a fun way to meet other international travelers.

Sushi making lesson - great fun!. My wife and I booked this after seeing all of the other rave reviews. Ayuko's class was excellent, with easy to follow instructions and fun bits of information about the history and art of making sushi. By the end, we had made a delicious lunch and some new friends. Highly recommended!

Great class a must do for any short visit. Brilliant class, in just a couple of hours we completed our lesson on Nigiri sush, and some scrollsi and then had it for lunch with a drink. Great! Ayuko speaks excellent english and clearly explains all the steps with a lot of background on what you are doing. Highly recommend the sushi class because of no cooking and it is easy enough for kids to do too. Or anyone with no cooking skills.

A fantastic lunchtime treat!. Great food, a relexed atmosphere, and easy-to-follow instructions all made for a fantastic lunchtime lesson. I took my boyfriend for a vegetarian sushi class at Buddha Bellies Cooking School for his birthday. After reading on the website that there were only weekday classes, I was a little worried that we would not be able to go, as my boyfriend works full time. However, Ayuko very kindly offered to hold a class on Sunday for us, which was a great relief, and very lovely of her!The class itself was really good fun. Ayuko was both knowledgeable and patient, and I felt that I learned some really interesting inside info on the sushi world. Take-away recipe sheets were thoughtfully provided for us to try out our newly-acquired techniques at a later date. It was lovely to take part in a mini tea ceremony as well, really gave a flavour of Japanese culture and cuisine.With Ayuko's help, I couldn't believe my finished product looked so good! And tasted even better... Thanks so much for a lovely time.
Super!. Hi did the Sushi class, and what should I say... AWSOME!!! :DA very good experience, I rally recommend to everyone that is passionated in cooking.

A different Tokyo experience. I have been to Japan quite a number of times and I try to explore different places or do different things each time. This time, I decided to take a small group cooking class and I found Ayuko's class from Trip Advisor. The class was conducted in a library room with chic New York design and full of Japanese culture books. We made teriyaki chicken and soba noodles (from scratch)! Ayuko speaks very good English and it was interesting for us to learn the different procedures while chatting with her the day to day life style of local Japanese. I have eaten teriyaki chicken and soba noodles before but never really appreciate them that much. After all the cutting, stepping on the dough, rolling the noodle machines, etc, these two dishes have a new meaning to me. Home made soba is the best! The highlight of the class was to enjoy the finished dishes with other classmates and Ayuko, over some Japanese beer/ sake and lots of laughter. I would strongly recommend anyone who enjoys Japanese food and culture to join this class!

A fun and different experience in Tokyo. I really like to cook and I love sushi so I decided to take this cooking class while visiting Tokyo. Pros:Informative and friendly instructor Hands on experience (literally) Delicious food Cons: It was a class of 7 which I felt was a little large I would have liked to learn more about the fish -- how to cut it etc. (it was presented in sashimi form) *this may be a pro for some people Overall, it was a fun and different activity that I would recommend but I would rate it as good-average as oppose to good-excellent

Great Experience and something Japanese to take home!. My wife and I love Japanese food and before we went to Tokyo, were looking for a way to take something authentic home with us. This was the perfect experience! It was very easy to find off the subway and the Host Ayuko was very friendly, easy to talk to, and very good English!We took the Udon noodle class and had a great time making them from scratch and cooking. It was somewhat simple and good recipies. When we finished cooking, we couldn't believe that we made it! We would definitely recommend this as part of your Tokyo and Japanese experience!

So much fun even for local people. I hesitated between Vegetarian Sushi and (Shokado) Bento, and finally chose the bento. I am Japanese but I had almost never took this kind of class, particularly in English. I really enjoyed the class and learned a lot. The instructor knows and understands Japanese "kokoro (mind)" very well and she explains the procedure very clearly so that we can easily represent the dishes at home. Her recipe is not difficult, but it tastes very good and genuine. The class is small-sized and we can enjoy chatting while cooking. We never got bored and I felt the time passed very quickly.I would like to visit there again to take other classes and would recommend my friends from other countries.

An authentic Japanese cooking experience. I have always loved Japanese food but have never been able to cook it so that it looked like the picture in the recipe book. Well not anymore, Ayuko is a fantastic teacher and helped me to create a bento box that not only tasted good ... looked good as well! I highly recommend Buddha Bellies Cooking School, Ayuko is patient, friendly and very helpful. She has cooking tips as can also answer those other questions you may have about Japanese food. It was a lovely environment to be able to learn how to make Japanese food and then to sit back and enjoy the flavours of the dish I created. If you like cooking and want to learn how to make Japanese food, this is a must for your next trip to Japan.

Great introduction to Japanese cooking. This past weekend, I attended a bento-making cooking course at Buddha Bellies cooking school. From the first email to her final send-off (with a small gift and some great restaurant recommendations), Ayuko-san was a joy to work with. Her explanations for the various dishes we prepared were clear and easy to follow and she showed us some techniques for home-style Japanese dishes that I am looking forward to applying in my own kitchen here in Japan. While the work space for the class is small, the number of participants is deliberately kept low, meaning we weren't always bumping into each other and had plenty of room to work. The best part of the class was, of course, eating the final product. I had a wonderful experience and would certainly consider returning to take one of her other courses.

A fantastic way to experience Japanese cooking!. I had the pleasure of taking Ayuko's class with a few friends while we were visiting Tokyo in November last year. Ayuko was very accommodating, and even picked us up at the station when we got there. The class was so much fun and had a very at-home atmosphere. In our lesson, we learned how to make sushi. It was very interesting to learn various styles and techniques. When I make sushi now, it not only tastes good, but it actually looks good now, too! If you're planning on visiting Tokyo and want to experience Japanese cooking first-hand, I highly recommend taking a Buddha Bellies Cooking class. It's an unforgettable experience!

A fabulous experience!. This has been a fabulous experience. I have attended several classes at Buddha Bellies Cooking School and have always had a great time. Ayuko-san's classes are small in size, friendly and inviting. It is an interactive class with lots of opportunity to ask questions and learn more about Japanese cuisine and culture. I would recommend her classes to anyone!!

Great class and yummy food !. Ayuko is a wonderful and very friendly teacher. Her class at Buddha Bellies Cooking School was really interesting and the food we learnt to prepare was delicious. Ayuko not only taught us how to prepare and cook a traditional Udon Noodle dish, she also helped us with some useful Japanese language words, and answered our questions about her culture.We highly recommend her classes!

Great Japanese experience!. I attended a sushi cooking class in March at Buddha Bellies Cooking School. Auyko, the teacher was very informative and answered my cooking and cultural questions. Her directions were easy to follow and I have now successfully made sushi at home. I was able to ask lots of questions about what to look for in terms of rice, fish and sauces in western style supermarkets. The class was a lot of fun and I feel very confident in my sushi making now.

Excellent cooking class!!!!. I attended the very first class last year. It was very interesting and so much fun. I could learn how to make cute temari sushi, traditional tasty tempura and so on. The teacher, Ayuko is very kind and helpful during the lesson. Even more she is not only teaching how to make Japanese food but also explaining about Japanese culture. It was easy to understand and such a good experiences for me. I would defenitly recommend this cooking class for foreigners who are visiting in Japan. It's worth to take this wonderful class!!

Such a wonderful experience! You must try for yourself!. Ayuko is the one of the sweetest people I have had the pleasure of meeting on my trip to Tokyo, and a wonderful sushi teacher!Have you ever wanted to try making your own sushi? And fancy sharing the experience with others who have traveled to Tokyo for the same reason? Then you must try this for yourself!I had such a fun time learning new cooking techniques to amaze my family and friends back home. Thank you Ayuko for your lovely hospitality (and patience!)I truly recommend this to anyone who wants to add to their Tokyo / Japanese cultural experience.

Wonderful introduction to Japanese cooking and culture. We had the pleasure of attending a sushi cooking class the very first morning we arrived in Tokyo. Ayuko took the class through the food preparation and presentation, discussed the ingredients and parted with a lot of historical knowledge behind the dishes, we definitely learnt a great deal and got to ask plenty of questions. The class finished off with a lovely glass of sake, tea and biscuits - plus you also get to have a beautiful lunch after all of your hard work - our sushi platters were delicious. Ayuko also gave us a bamboo sushi rolling mat, wasabi paste and recipe sheet - very sweet of her to do so. The class is near Jimbocho station A2 exit in an upstairs book library. The atmosphere was very friendly and I can highly recommend anyone travelling to Tokyo to sign up for a class - you will enjoy it and it is affordable. All email correspondence and bookings were done prior to travelling, it was very easy dealing with Ayuko and she was prompt in responding each time. I wish this business all the best.

Such a fun experience. I had the best time taking this class with my boyfriend from Ayuko (the sensei), and one other couple, making vegetarian udon and tofu teriyaki! Ayuko is so kind and made the lesson flow so nicely. I learned very traditional methods such as stomping the udon dough! :-) and commonly used japanese ingredients and origami chopstick holders! Buddha's Belly cooking school is a gem!

Wonderful experience!. I had the pleasure of taking a sushi making class w/ Ayuko with two of my friends during my visit to Japan last fall. It was so much fun and informative. Ayuko taught us not only the proper way to make/roll sushi, but also taught us about Japanese culture. We also were able to meet a wonderful French couple, who we still keep in touch w/ via Facebook! I was so thankful to Ayuko for being a wonderful teacher and sharing some of her culinary talent. I cannot wait for my next trip back to Japan and I will definitely be scheduling another class with Buddha Bellies Cooking School. I highly recommend it to anyone who is not only interested in Japanese cooking, but also in learning about the unique and wonderful traditions of Japan (like how to properly make matcha green tea).

A welcome change of pace. Ayuko is a very fun, informative, and patient teacher! We went to the udon-making class, and the the time seemed to fly by fairly quickly. Within the 2.5 hour timeframe, we were able to cook chicken teriyaki, fold an origami chopstick holder, and knead/cut/cook our own udon noodles from scratch. We were all pleasantly surprised how delicious everything turned out! If you're looking for something fun and hands-on, then you'll find the udon-making class a welcome change of pace from the hectic surrounding city!

A Great Time!. We went last year in Oct. 2012 while on our honeymoon. Thought it would be great fun to learn authentic Japanese cooking, and it was! Ayuko showed us how to make a bento box and we had a sake tasting. The bento consisted of rice, chicken, shrimp, sashimi, vegetables, and we also learned how to artfully arrange the food in the box. There were two different kinds of sake - one sweeter and the other dryer. I loved the sweet one she provided. The kitchen was clean and new, and we also received paper copies of the recipes to take back with us. We even received a beautiful parting gift. It was a friendly environment - even if you are a novice at cooking, you will feel at ease! The communication between us was good - Ayuko told us what was the best route to take from our hotel, and even picked us up at the train line to drive us to the kitchen - a great help! I wish we had a chance to do the dessert - oh well, next time! We'd love to travel back to Japan in the future. : )

Excellent Japanese cooking experience!. My wife and I both had an extremely enjoyable evening with Ayuko making Udon noodles and Teriyaki chicken. The class was very hands (and feet!) on in a very lovely and cosy setting of the small library next to Jimbocho metro station. There were only six of us in the class, so Ayuko was able to spend a good amount of time with each of us. Ayuko speaks very good English and was a perfect teacher. We loved that we got to take home the recipes and the other gifts were a very nice surprise.We highly recommend Buddha Bellies and Ayuko!

Awesome sushi class. I took the sushi class with my 6 yr old!. We had the best time ever!. The class was done very professionally covering all the important basics for making sushi. The instructor Ayuko is kind, speaks good English and is very helpful with any questions u got. She finished the class with a small origami class and had a little gifts to take home to remember! ... Very classy touch! I would definitely take this class again and would recommend all my friend who might visit Tokyo to take this class!!

Lovely evening activity. My boyfriend and I went to Ayuko's Udon noodle lesson on our second night in Tokyo and had a lovely time. Making the noodles was fun, very hands on, and they were tasty. We also made some terryaki tofu, and the class was well organised so we were never bored. Ayuko accommodated our vegetarianism very well, and is knowledgeable and enthusiastic about Japanese food. The class is very good value, especially considering small number of people (6 in our lesson) and it's dinner too! Thanks Ayuko, good luck with the school!

ichiban! a great learning experience. ayuko-san runs a great little cooking class in a stylish private classroom in an easy to find part of central tokyo. I came for a bit of fun in the middle of a 2 week stay in tokyo but was so impressed I returned for a second class and came away with real, useable recipes to teach my cafe and restaurant staff in bali where I live (search cafe zucchini and green ginger noodle house on here if you are interested).my first lesson was in udon noodles. ayuko's father is an expert noodle maker and the handmade (feet, actually!) ones she taught us were superior to any store or restaurant bought ones I had ever eaten.this week is was sushi. again, the perfectly cooked and vinegared rice combined with well selected quality ingredients made for the most delicious sushi. as well as ayuko's clear instruction and successful recipes she gives lots of interesting cultural background (we made origami chopstick rests and learned about her experiences learning kaiseki cooking, how longs it takes to become a sushi chef, her favourite sake, restaurants etc) and gives generously in every way. I am a vegetarian and ayuko supplied separate materials for both classes while the others in the group used meat and fish (enough variety so I could make 10 different pieces of sushi too).highly recommended!

Must experience in Japan!. My friends and I booked a class on our recent trip to Japan. The place was right next to the train exit. It was clean, intimate and cozy. We were just a class of 8 at that time. We were making sushi in the middle of a library so it was an interesting background for pictures as well. I learned that sushi was really serious stuff. You had to train for 5 years before you become a "proper" sushi chef. Ayuko gave a lot of helpful tips for beginners. The ingredients we used were fresh. Everything was made simple and quick so it was never boring. And best of all, I ate every sushi i made. And it was a lot! :)

Great activity for foodies!. This is our first time in Japan and me and my girlfriend booked this course for an easy and fun way to learn about the local cuisine. We attended both the sushi and the udon course.The location is very easy to find if you first spend some time learning how to use the Tokyo Metro. The teacher will meet you right outside the Jinbocho Station. The teacher Ayuko is great. She is not a chef, but she has professional training and knows a lot about japanese food and the art of kaiseki. She also works as an english teacher, so communication is easy.The courses were small with only five and six people attending. Cooking instructions are easy to follow and the result was delicious. We chose to learn sushi on the first course and we learned how to make our own udon noodles and chicken teriyaki on the other.I highly recommend this to anyone going to Tokyo who want to learn about traditional Japanese cooking. :)

Great way to start our trip!. My wonderful girlfriend booked us into this for our 1st day in Tokyo, it was easy to find and right next to Jinbocho tube station. The teacher was extremely pleasant and friendly with very good English. We chose to learn sushi which was presented expertly, was easy to follow and tasted delicious, it was a great lunch which most of us could barley finish and had to take with us afterwards. Atmosphere was very relaxed with nice music playing and we learnt a lot about sushi and the process behind it. Would highly advise a visit and book in advance as it seems to fill up fast.

Udon noodle and teriyaki chicken dish. Thanks Ayuko for a great Japanese cooking experience. I highly recommend this to anyone staying in Tokyo who want to try their hand at traditional cooking. Small but comfortable venue which is on the second floor of a tiny book store. Not suitable for more than 4 people for the Mount of kitchen space but great for a couple who enjoy cooking.Ayuko gave us great tips for back home and sent us on our way to find the best value Japanese knives, which we found and bought and had our initials engraved for free.

Best thing we did in Tokyo!. My friend and I saw this on trip advisor and thought it would be fun to do something different. We emailed them and got an answer right away. We went to the Udon class, and we had the best time ever! We learned how to make our own noodles and chicken teriyaki! The woman was the sweetest of the sweetest, she had great english, knew what she was doing and she was very helpful! We both thought the class would be bigger and not so "personal", but to our great surprise it was only us two and another couple. It was based in a very nice room with a sweet little kitchen, while playing some nice and relaxing music. The class was so great that we decided right away to go to the next sushi class they had. The sushi class was just as good and we got to try some new and exciting things!We would definitely recommend this to everyone! It was so much fun to do something else and this will not disappoint you. :) have fun!

Authentic Japanese home cooking. We had an absolutely fabulous evening preparing Japanese Nabe (Hot pot) dish. Our teacher gave us a wealth of information about Japanese ingredients and how to prepare them in a very fun and relaxed environment. 2 members of our private group don't cook but they loved doing the class! The reward at the end of the evening was a scrumptious meal that hopefully we can recreate at home!I highly recommend spending 2-3 hours of your time in Tokyo learning about Japanese cooking :)

Great alternative to tourist traps. My wife and I were on our honeymoon in Japan and when we travel, we like to try to do as many different kinds of activities as possible. This class was right up our alley. We chose the udon class and it was a great experience. I'm 3rd generation japanese and have never liked udon (at least the udon we get in the states) but Ayuko did a fabulous job changing my mind. She made the class fun and engaging and made sure we had all the info we needed to recreate the dishes at home. The cooking room was beautiful and had lots of great books on Japan and japanese cooking. Ayuko even answered some of our sillier questions about japanese culture and superstitions that we were dying to ask. Highly recommended. My wife and I will be back to Japan and to her sushi class as soon as we can.

Homemade Udon - Yummy!. Me and my boyfriend are living in Japan and wanted to try out some Japanese cooking. As a start we thought Udon would be good as not too complicated. So we booked a lesson and were enjoying 2.5 hours introduction to Japanese Udon cooking as well as other interesting information on Japanese cooking. Ayuko is a great teacher and we liked the nice atmosphere with all the books surrounding us. Time was flying and the self-made Udon and Teriyaki Chicken tasted very good. All in all I would definitely recommend this school to anyone looking for an introduction to cooking some of the most popular and well-known Japanese dishes.
Fun and easy. Ayuko is a great teacher, made the class fun, non stressful, and easy. Even as a non-cooker I was successful. My cooking Wife aslo had fun. Would be happy to do another class,

Demystifying Japanese Home Cooking. I'm a big fan of Japanese cuisine. Although I cook regularly, I've never attempted Japanese staple dishes because the cuisine's techniques, ingredients, and cooking ware seem to be in a world of their own. So, when I had a free day during my visit to Tokyo last week, I thought I would take a cooking class. The choices for English-speaking, Japanese cuisine cooking classes in Tokyo are pretty limited (at least from my online search). I found a few specialized schools for soba or sushi-making but are mostly catered to professionals and priced as such. While a couple of others mostly featured international cuisine. I think Buddha Bellies fills a niche that you can't really find in Tokyo for approachable instruction and introduction to basic Japanese dishes.I had a great experience with Ayuko, who runs Buddha Bellies. From start to end, Ayuko was very attentive and accommodated every need. I had emailed Ayuko with rather short notice to inquire about fitting me into a course with 1-day schedule. Not only was Ayuko really prompt with her responses, she offered to hold a private Bento Box lesson for me since I couldn't make a group class. During the lesson, Ayuko provided a clear overview and went through the steps in detail for each dish I was going to make. I was pleasantly surprised how hands-on it was with Ayuko watching by my side and on occasion taking over to show me an alternate way of doing something. The most endearing part of the lesson was when Ayuko switched to instruct me in Japanese after she found out, through our conversation, that I was currently studying the language and had very little opportunity to speak it where I lived. I really appreciated the thoughtfulness and patience! Overall, I found the lesson very insightful with good tips that I've incorporated in my attempt at Japanese cooking at home. Besides the lesson, Ayuko shared cultural insights (including how to make, serve, and drink matcha) as well as shopping recommendations for good quality food products and cooking ware (from a foodie/local's perspective). Finally, the place where the class was held (in a personal library of English books on anything Japanese) was such a treat. It truly felt like you were learning to cook in a friend's home.I'll be back soon and have convinced my boyfriend to join me in the next class!

Unleash your inner foodie!. Really fun way to pass a couple of hours. Our teacher was very friendly and sweet and gave very specific instructions. I couldn't believe I was able to make such great Oyakodon. She also thought us how to make traditional hot tea and gave us a gift at the end. Highly recommended!!

Buddha Bellies - Sushi Lesson. As many reviews have said before, Ayuko is a fantastic teacher! I enjoy cooking and trying all sorts of different food types so a Sushi lesson was perfect for me. Not only did we get to make all sorts of different sushi but we got in depth knowledge of Japanese culture and some tips on where to buy authentic Japanese cooking equipment. I would thoroughly recommend Buddha Bellies cooking school to anyone who is seriously interested in their cooking, the friendly and relaxed environment is a credit to Ayuko. I will definately be back for another course the next time i am in Japan.Thanks again

great time!. Hi,as staying in Japan for business a couple of months , I wanted to learn some tips about sushi preparation to surprise my friends home ( ok, my girlfriend explicitely asked for it! ).I attended the lesson with a colleague of mine, and we were both very happy as Ayuko , that held the lesson, apart from speaking a perfect English, gave us very good tips, was very friendly, explaining not only about ingredients and cooking but also culture! we even went through some advises on how to behave at a Tea Ceremony!I would recomment the Buddha Bellies Cooking School to anyone is passionated about cooking and interested in preparing, once back home, some of the wonderful food you can find here in Japan!!

Great teacher and time spent. Ayuko is a great teacher. This was a very well spent 4 hours, not only learning cooking, but also an indepth knowledge and other local tips from her. She is very devoted to cooking, and very open to learn from you too. A true culture exchange. She is very accomodating in fulfilling your request for the different Japanese cuisine that you are interested in. Her tips and tricks will make your life easier making these different Japanese food, it might not be haute cuisine or professional, but what matters most is that it tastes good an authentic, which is delivered. Too bad I did not have more time to follow her other courses. Will certainly recommend her for those looking for a casual experience (which is nearly impossible to find) and value for money.

If you're a foodie, take this class!. My husband and I love taking cooking classes when we travel. So when I found out we would be moving to the Tokyo area, I immediately began researching potential cooking schools...and I can say that I am so glad that I found this school!We did a group class for making homemade udon. Udon has long been a favorite but it was interesting to finally see how it's made and hear some of the history behind it. We were with several other couples so it a fun social event as well. After preparing the udon, the instructor Ayu provided us with a traditional appetizer plate that we each put together in traditional Japanese-style. There was instruction, laughter, "udon dancing" and more!The instructor Ayu is incredibly knowledgable and has a great passion for cooking and teaching. Her English, and instruction, is excellent. She keeps everyone on time (even reminded us that we needed to catch the train in order to make it home before they stopped!) but in a relaxed atmosphere that feels like you're at home. After the class, she even sent us a few pictures so we could remember our time making udon. My in-laws are coming to visit soon and I'm already planning to add a private cooking class to their schedule. There's no better way to experience Japan and its foodie culture!

Great authentic Japanese cooking classes for foodies. My husband and I visited Tokyo in November and as avid foodies were keen to learn how to cook and prepare some traditional Japanese dishes during our stay. As we are both vegetarian, Buddha Bellies tailored a lesson of authentic recipes free from any meat or fish products specifically for us. Our teacher Ayu, who is very knowledgeable and enthusiastic, provided us with copious notes and clear instructions for each dish. Her genuine passion for food made the class a lot of fun as well as informative. By the end of the session, we had produced an impressive platter of vegetarian sushi and teriyaki tofu (delicious!). After cooking the dishes we were then able to enjoy them with some lovely sake, while perusing the shelves of books on all aspects of Japanese culture that lined the studio. Buddha Bellies is a culinary gem in the centre of Tokyo and was definitely one of the main highlights of our trip to Japan. We hope to return again in the future and would recommend it to anyone who is interested in learning more about Japanese cooking and having a wonderful time while doing so.

Cook, Enjoy and Eat.. Sometimes it happens you find out something special to share. We booked several lessons with Budda Bellies Cooking School in Tokyo last December (2012). The issues ranged from Sushi, Tempura, Udon, Hot-pot, Oyako-don, Shogayaki, Teriyaki chicken, Okonomiyaki, Bento Box and some snacks that were not meant to be the main course. All of the dishes were prepared by us with the teacher help. A written explanation of each dish was given to us in each lesson. The teacher has a perfect spoken English and it is very easy to follow. To sum up, all the lessons fulfill my best expectations.

Japanese Cooking Classes. We attended two cooking classes over two mornings recently. Interestingly the classes are held amid a fantastic array of books, in English, on Japanese culture. We were free to browse through these. We learnt to cook several dishes and had so much fun as well. Our teacher Ayuko was delightful and an excellent instructor. We gave her an 'A' for teaching and an 'A' for effort. Ayuko taught us so much more than just cooking. We also really enjoyed eating our dishes! I would recommend this experience for 'foodies' or for people wanting to really experience more about Japanese culture. Ayuko was very patient and guided us through all steps; any level of cook would enjoy the experience. We were able to take lots of photos. We will definitely return for more lessons next time we are in Tokyo.

Relaxing and heaps of fun!. My partner and I visited Tokyo in December 2012. One of the highlights of our trip was the morning we spent at Buddha Bellies Cooking School. We were very warmly greeted by our teacher Ayu and were made to feel at home straight away. Ayu is absolutely wonderful - extremely friendly and personable, her knowledge about all facets of Japanese culture is extensive and her cooking (and ours by the end of the lesson) are fantastic! We did the udon class which was heaps of fun. Ayu had everything organised and the class ran very smoothly. We were given a thorough handout to take home with us so that we could put into practice what we had learnt . Ayu tailors the class to your level of experience so don't worry if you're not confident in the kitchen, help is always close by!In the hustle and bustle of Tokyo it was lovely to spend the morning in a relaxing and calming environment. We had such a wonderful experience and intend to revisit every time we go to Tokyo. We HIGHLY recommend it!

Highlight of the trip!. We visited Tokyo in the autumn of 2012 and one of our favorite parts of the trip was the cooking class with Buddha Bellies. Our teacher was Ayu and she was absolutely lovely! Ayu is so knowledgable and personable and she made us feel like we were cooking as old friends! It was a rainy day so it was the perfect setting to stay indoors and enhance our cooking skills. We took the Soba noodles class and we had a blast learning how to make the noodles from scratch (you step on them! :) ) and making tempura. It was very relaxing and enjoyable. It is also great if you feel like you need a break from the hustle and bustle of sight seeing. I felt like I learned so much about Japanese culture by learning how they prepare their food.Thank you so much Ayu and Buddha Bellies! I will definitely be referring my friends to this cooking school!

Fun, interesting and delicious. When I was in Tokyo I took a soba (buckwheat noodle) making lesson at Buddha Bellies Cooking School. Our teacher Ayu welcomed us and explained more about soba. The soba master had many years of experience and showed us the traditional technique. It was a great experience to learn how to make the soba from scratch. After cooking the soba we enjoyed eating it together with some delicious tempura Ayu made and a nice bottle of sake. It was a fun night and I really recommend this for people who like cooking or love Japanese food.

Great intro to the Japanese food you'll be savoring the rest of your trip!. BB graciously agreed to let me sneak in a private lesson when I couldn't make the other times. She was really nice, very friendly, ready to explain, knowledgable. The class was great and I will recommend it to any friends who visit Tokyo.

Brilliant cooking class with clear instructions. Buddha Bellies offers a good choice of traditional Japanese dishes in their cooking classes. instructor, Ayuko ensures you have plenty of notes and assistance to create fail-free delicious Japanese dishes that don't only taste great, they look great too!Enjoy a fun filled lesson learning traditional methods by an English speaking teacher.

Experiencing local culture and art. What an amazing experience. Mariko and her family treated me to the most amazing experience. I was welcomed into their home of 4 generations under 1 roof. They took me patiently through the steps of teaching me some incredible crafts. The finale was lunch prepared by Mariko's mum. Her food was comparable to any top restaurant and I felt leaving so special and spoilt by my experience. Take a cooking class and learn the local culture. I cannot recommend enough.

well-rounded. My 11-year old daughter and I equally had the most wonderful time! It was a well-rounded class and certainly a must experience for all ages. we ended up with so much more than we expected. Mariko also gave us tips which we used straight away so I suggest you all take this class on the onset of your trip. It was reallya lovely bonding experience with my daughter. keep it up Mariko! You are inspiring and touching lives with your work.

Manga Paradise . This is a must visit for every Manga aficionado! And you won't getan wet even on a rainy day as the broadway is completely covered shopping arcade. While at street level you have many restaurants most of the manga shops are on the second to fourth floors (elevators; wheel chair accessible )

Excellent Way to Understand Japan. I took my family of 5 to Japan for 2 weeks over Easter and everyone wanted to go to Tokyo. Unfortunately there are no hop on hop off tours of the city and the guided tours I found were full or inconvenient.When I found Mariko's one stop Japanese culture session I signed up not knowing what to expect. We started at 10am in the morning and everyone was begging to stay when we had to leave at 3pm. My 9 year old girl loves the origami, and Calligraphy, my 12 year old son loves the food, learning how to use Japanese ingredients to make awesome food from scratch, my 18 year old found visiting a 4 generation Japanese family home in Tokyo a more intimate and interesting way to learn about Japan. My wife and I loved it all. We highly recommend it! Mariko's English is good, and she customizes the time and and content to make it perfect for everyone involved.

Lovely. This is such a lovely and genuine experience when visiting Japan. Mariko not only teaches you about Japanese traditions but invites you into her home. We had the privilege of meeting her mother and her beautiful daughter and all amongst a fun and cultural experience. Thank you Mariko, it was such a lovely way to spend the day. Both my sister and I had a great time. PS I am very sorry about the lateness of this review! We visited in April last year!

What a great way to spend half a day - loved every minute. We have just spent the day with Mariko and her mother in their home, participating in a number of traditional Japanese arts. Origami, furoshiki, calligraphy and learning how to make okonomiyaki was all very interactive and lots of fun. In addition to making okonomiyaki, Mariko's mum had prepared many side dishes all of which were delicious and we were stuffed full . I would recommend this to anyone who wants to get a taste of some of the unique crafts Japan has to offer. As an aside, we had no trouble making our way to the right metro station or finding the right exit - easy as!

A fantastic experience highlighting parts of Japanese culture.. This culture experience provided by Mariko and her mother is excellent, they are very accommodating, and make sure you get the most out of your experience. I enjoyed every part of my day with Mariko, it was a lot of fun making origami and learning about furoshiki and calligraphy, and making the delicious Okonomiyaki was by far my favourite part of the whole day. If you have a spare day in Tokyo, make sure to consider Mariko's culture experience, it's worth it!

Arigatogozaimasu Mariko-san!. Mariko met us at the subway station (I messaged her on Facebook that we were running late, as we had trouble finding the correct entrance to the direction we wanted initially) as promised, then we stopped by a Japanese confectionery before she welcome us to her home. She taught us origami, furoshiki, shodo (which is harder than it looks!) and gyoza-making. Her mom is certified to work at Japanese restaurants and made many more fabulous side dishes to go with our gyoza, serving a delicious meal fit for royalty that left us stuffed. My 12 year-old had picked this over Disney Sea (disclosure: we are from the US and have been to Disney World multiple times) and we have no regrets. Thank you to Mariko-san and to her mother for welcoming us into their home!

Wonderful! If you visit Tokyo you can't miss it!. It has been a wanderful experience we really reccomande! She is a wanderful person and her mom too! You will understand much more of the amazing Japan culture. "One stop" with a wonderful person! ありがとうございました

One of the best moments we had in Japan!. My wife and I had a great time learning a bit of cooking, calligraphy, origami, furoshiki and tea time. But the best thing of the experience is Mariko and her awesome family. They are so kind, patient and truly interested on us that we ended loving the japanese culture even more. The program is an incredible cultural exchange experience that I highly recommend for everybody.

Just wonderful!. We had such an awesome day with Mariko. She was very polite and welcoming and being in a real Japanese home was eye opening for a Westerner. The activities were interesting and not too difficult that is until we got to the calligraphy! Mariko was so patient with our daughter who is 6 and she was totally engaged in all the activities. Did I

Amazing Japanese experience !. This One-stop Japanese culture experience was briliant! Our host Mariko met us at the subway station then after a short walk we arrived her home. We were shown how to make origami and then with some help we made sushi for lunch! We were taught Japanese calligraphy and practiced the art of furoshiki ( wrapping gifts with fabric ). We also made 'matcha' green tea, which we enjoyed with a little dessert we chose from a traditional Japanese sweet shop. My husband, my teenage sons and I really enjoyed our day and recommend this to anyone who wants to find out more about the wonderful Japanese way of life. Thank you Mariko for your kindness , it was an honour to meet you and your family!
👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻. Great moment !! Learnt a lot of good stuff and had a wonderful hands-on experience on japanese culture! It is very recommended for those who want to try as many things in one go !

Our time with Mariko is etched in our memory of Japan. From the moment my husband and I saw Mariko's smiling face at the metro station, we knew we had chosen the right way to spend one of our days in Tokyo. She was standing exactly where her directions told us she would be, with a sign with our names on it, and a great big smile! We were within a five minute walk from the home she shares with her mother, daughter, and extended family. Her home, her mother, and her daughter are as lovely as she is. She got us settled in and away we went with learning a bit about the Japanese culture. We started with learning some origami shapes, moved on to learning the art of furoshiki - wrapping gifts with cloth, learned very basic strokes of Japanese calligraphy, known as kanji, and finished off a wonderful morning with a lunch that her mother taught us how to prepare. Not to mention she made a lot of little side dishes as well as teaching us the art of making the Japanese Pancake known as Okonomyaki. These ladies were so generous with their time and talents and genuine kindness, as well as the opening of their home, so we really did experience Japan.We will be eternally grateful, Mariko!

Lovely time, priceless experience!. My friend and I had a wonderful time with Mariko! The Cultural Experience was well worth the money and definitely a highlight of our trip. Thank you for welcoming us into your lovely home, Mariko!

The best way to know the Japanese Culture!. This is one of the best highlights of our trip. I suggest you schedule this at the first part of your trip. You will learn a lot of things that you can use throughout your whole stay. Ask Mariko to bring you to the pastry shop that serves the mochi that has Strawberry inside it - heavenly! If you're having trouble contacting her cellphone number, you can try to message her through Facebook. It is faster, trust me. Highly-recommended!

AMAZING! Dai suki desu!!. We came to Japan for our honeymoon and have just gotten back after the most amazing day with Mariko and her family.. We were originally just looking for a cooking class, but got so much more, and I'm so glad we chose this experience!!! The food we cooked was delicious, but the food Marikos okaasan (mother) cooked was AMAZING!! And nothing was too much trouble.. There was so much food, and such variety, the best meal we have had in Tokyo this far (and that's saying something because Tokyos food is really great!) We got to learn some origami and some traditional arts, which was both fun and educational and we walked away with some truly awesome trinkets that we had been able to create ourselves.. The art of wrapping (forgotten its name) will amaze you (we were left wondering why we even HAVE wrapping paper!!) If you're wanting to take in some culture, learn some cool stuff about JAPAN, cook/eat some amazing food, or just hang out with a super cool family, this is the experience to beat them all!! This really has made our trip..

Wonderful Experience. I cannot recommend this enough! My wife and I had the BEST time with Mariko and got so much out of it. If you have never been to Tokyo/Japan before, or if you have but haven't had the opportunity to learn a little more about the food and culture I suggest you book a class. We learned about food, drinks, calligraphy, origami, we got shopping tips and advice for our holiday.Mariko is the perfect host, beautiful, kind, patient and welcoming.Don't think - just book!

A more personal experience with Japanese Culture. We've been trying to look for activities that can spice up our trip to Tokyo, aside from the usual temples, and museums. Mariko's Culture Experience allowed us to experience calligraphy, origami, furoshiki and sushi making in one sitting. Additionally, the experience allowed us to talk with a local, and ask all our questions on daily Japanese life. The experience was definitely worth it, and definitely was one of the highlights of our trip.

Make every effort to do this. After playing tourist with all the sight seeing and hectic subway rides it was really nice to join Mariko for the day in her home and learn about several Japanese arts. Mariko met us at the train station and from that point on it felt like I was visiting with a friend. She took us into her home where we spent time with her mom and daughter. It was so nice to be in a home and treated so warmly while being educated about the culture. Mariko speaks great English and is a wonderful teacher. The food that we helped prepare was excellent. Mariko's mom cooked for a restaurant and the taste proves it. Make sure you do this when in Tokyo.

A truly lovely experience!. What a lovely way to spend the day. We learned so much and we had such a great time. The kids really enjoyed it and never got bored. Mariko(our host), her mother, and her daughter made us feel so welcome in their home. I highly recommend this experience!

Super all-in Japanese one-stop cutural experience!. We visited in February 2015 and had around 5 hours with the lovely Mariko and her mum - what a super time we had! We took part in origami class, furoshiki (tying cloths to carry / wrap things in), calligraphy and cooking, all of which were excellent fun. Mariko is a patient teacher (she needed to be with my clumsy origami inabilities!) and speaks very good English. Her mum is a treasure and she made us the best feast we had the whole time we were in Tokyo - really delicious. We would totally recommend Marikos experience day - we loved it!

Very entertaining, insightful unique experience! I loved it!. This was one of, if not the most fun tour of my entire trip to Japan. I loved it and find myself showing off my origami skills to anyone who will pay attention. The best part was the attention to detail and the opportunity to ask questions. I have practiced making gyoza since I came back as well. Now, I should add that my favorite meal (of all meals) is Chicken Katsu Curry and when I mentioned my failed efforts at finding the perfect and particular spice that is in use to make the curry sauce, Mariko answered that question and then took a step further. She showed me the spice, provided it as gift and delivered in email the directions in how to make it. Wow! Now every time I make the curry sauce following the provided instructions I think of this experience with a giant grin on my face.This experience really meant a lot to me. My brother and I had a great time. I recommend this experience to anyone and everyone.Thank you again to everyone involved!!!

Hands on culture and home visit. Probably the best food I had in Tokyo thanks very much to Marikosan's mother. All together a lovely day. This day was late in my trip and very different from some of the other 'experiences', all together less formal and more spontaneous. I enjoyed the different activities but probably best of all was visiting a Tokyo home and family. Tokyo can be very hectic, so it was really good to have a calmer more focussed day. Almost forgot to say- Marikosan's english is ver good!

Amazing Japanese day!. We were spending only 6 days in Tokyo and wanted to experiment the real Japanese lifestyle, and that is what we found! Mariko was really nice and inviting, we learned a lot about the culture, the food and the traditions. We really recommend it!

Highlight of our trip. What a fantastic experience, this had to be one of the highlights of our trip to Japan. I can highly recommend spending the day with Mariko-san. We (2 x A, 2 x C) thoroughly enjoyed having the opportunity to partake in Japanese cultural activities such as origami, calligraphy, furoshiki and making tea. For lunch we learnt how to make gyoza's and then enjoyed them with some fabulous dishes that we prepared by Mariko's mum - yummo! Thank you Mariko for hosting us in your home and for the opportunity to experience the 'real' Japan.

An amazing day with a wonderful family. This was an absolutely amazing experience for the whole family. Marika-san met us at the station and then we walked back to her house after picking up a few Japanese treats on the way. Then for the next 5 hours we we had the chance to try our hands at origami, furoshiki, calligraphy and making tea. We also made the gyoza's that we then ate at lunch along with a superb set of accompanying dishes prepared by Mariko's mother.We are traveling with 2 children (9 and 6) and it was unanimously voted by all that this day was the highlight of our time in Tokyo.

What a worthwhile experience. Mariko and her mother were the perfect hosts. Her mother used to be a cook so we were treated to the smells of her excellent cooking while Mariko patiently taught us origami, calligraphy and a bunch of other stuff.It was an excellent way to spend a couple of hours and to immerse yourself in Japanese culture the way no other attraction could.Highly recommended.

Wonderful . This was an amazing experience. Mariko-san took very good care of us. All activities were well prepared, the explanation very good, the food was delicious and - most important for us - Mariko-san speaks excellent English. After all day kneeling or sitting on the floor our bodies were a bit aching but also that is authentic Japanese. 100% recommended. We really enjoyed.

Great experience to let me travel like a 1day exchange student.. It was a great experience, i really enjoy it. unlike going to disney or shopping in tokyo, this one stop experience gave me opportunity to stay with a japanese family, in their house, for half a day, interacted with them face to face, did specific activities related to their culture. Each activities gave me a taste of japan and travel like a one day exchange student, more in depth experience than just a shopper or a landmark stop by traveller. i will really recommand my friends to go.PS， i really appreciated the food, really awesome, a family style in above average hotel quality and taste. And they taugh me how to make it too. Even though i am sure i cannot repeat such wonderful meal on my own.

A lovely day. We had a wonderful day at Mariko's house and we enjoyed it very much. This is a must for everyone interested in Japanese life and artwork. We had lovely food and learned about cooking and different vegetables etc . We also had the oppurtunity to talk about the daily life of a Japanese family, a unique experience if you are on holiday in a foreign country. We had lots of fun trying out the different crafts and Mariko is a very considerate host. We recommend this experience.

One-Stop Japanese Culture Experience Tokyo. I had a wonderful experience with Mariko she is very kind and patient and teaches you step by step In her lovely home with her lovely mother. In the following areas. Shodo experience Origami experience  Furoshiki experience Matcha tea time I was gaining confidence with her helpful assistant and found all experience's enjoyable interesting and beneficial which I can apply to my modern lifestyle. Great experience and the wonderful food what more can you ask for. AnandLondon,UK

Ramen and Gyoza Lesson Lesson. I'm quiet a seasoned traveller to Japan (14 + years) so I thought there was not much left to learn about Japanese culture or food. However I was wrong! Yoshimi is an excellent teacher and the ramen and gyoza lesson was good fun. She has a great sense of humour and adds energy to the classes. I forgot to mention to Yoshimi that I had food allergies and one of the key ingredients had shellfish in it which I could not eat. This was no problem as she was quickly able to make an adjustment to the menu on the fly for me. A testament to her cooking skills and it was still delicious! I can't wait to apply what I have learned from her class into my kitchen back home. The lesson comes with a printed cultural guide and recipe cards so you won't forget what you have learned. I'd highly recommend taking this class near the beginning of your holiday as the cultural tips you learn will serve you well during your stay in Japan.

The best fun!. Yoshimi met my boyfriend and I in a very central location. We arrived a little early and had a nice walk around - the area is great to explore. Yoshimi was waiting for us wearing a traditional kimono and had a "tokyo kitchen" sign, so finding her was not difficult! She walked us back to her apartment, which was lovely. Inviting, tidy, and great views to see while cooking! We made the teddy bento, which was so much fun. Yoshimi taught us a lot about Japanese food and etiquette. It was lovely to get a real insight to the customs of Japan. I can't wait to try out these newly learnt recipes when I get home!
Very good experience. A really good experience if you want to explore more Japan culture no matter you go alone or with friends. Food is vey tradition and the teacher speak perfect English

A must if in Tokyo. The cooking class was a perfect start into our 3 week Japan visit. We learned so much about Japanese food, and most important table manners! The class was perfectly organised and huge fun to follow. And the gratification after to eat your own cooked Japanese meal is amazing. Plus the studio is perfectly situated in Asakusa. All in all had a perfect time!

Great start to a culinary trip in Japan!. We went to a tofu-centric cooking class on the first full day of a two-week trip to Japan. The introduction to the course was great as we learned about Japanese cuisine and table manners before moving on to cook. The meal was simple to make and consisted of ingredients that should be easy to find in a large city with Asian grocers, or otherwise substitutable. The food came out delicious not only to my tastebuds but also to my eyes. Learning how to graciously present the food is half the meal in Japan and it was great to learn how to do it! Yoshimi speaks English very well and you should not hesitate to take a course from someone who truly knows what they're doing!
Very informative. Yoshimi class was very well prepared, she speaks very good english and has good knowledge about eating culture of Japan. At the end of the class I felt like I learned something.

Cooking in Tokyo. We had a wonderful meal and amazing time learning our way around a Japanese kitchen and table! Our chef made this a memorable experience with her enthusiasm and clear passion for her art! This was a unique and delicious experience!

blew our expectations. We loved every second of this class. I'm so glad I found it!!! Yoshi did a very comprehensive but easy to understand intro to japanese food,culture, and table manners. I found this super helpful. We then went to the cooking portion which was very explained and the handson portion could not be more fun. The food was absolutely delicious, I ate every drop. I hope Yoshi continues to do this and expand the class even. I'd love to take this again if new courses were taught in character bento, thank you so much for a fun morning. We really really enjoyed it!

Bad chef becomes MASTER CHEF in just 3 hours!. I'm a terrible cook, I burn toast but Yoshimi helped me to create delicious and beautiful mosaic sushi rolls!Very importantly before hitting the kitchen she explained all about Japanese food and table manners. I lived in Tokyo for a year but learnt SO MUCH about etiquette and how to put together a Japanese menu!She was very patient with me and gave me lots of praise to encourage me whilst we were preparing the sushi! Her English was natural, demonstrations very easy to follow and we had a print out to take home too!After creating our menu our group had fun chatting whilst eating.Also amazing was she INSTANTLY created a little video for her Facebook which I could share with friends and family back home!

Amazing cooking class with Yoshimi. Wow, I didn't expect much with the class but I was impressed with Yoshimi-San. It was well organized and started with a brief introduction to Japanese dining etiquette and commonly used ingredients. We wished we had this lesson at the start of our trip! We highly recommend taking advantage of this experience. Now we plan to make great Katsu and curry at home.

Tokyo Kitchen sushi making class. Our Tokyo Kitchen class was one of the highlights of our trip! We choose the Mosaic Sushi Making Class. I loved that the class was in a Japanese apartment. The cooking school was very intimate but also was clean and a modern kitchen to work in. My two children age 8 and 13 joined me for this tour and they had a great time. My daughter loved all the hands on experience of working in kitchen. My son tried his best at making the rolls too but really just love the eating part! All of the side dishes were amazing. I am glad that we took this class early in our trip since the class included a good lesson on Japanese etiquette. We were provided all the recipes and are excited to try making some at home!

A must do on your trip to Tokyo.. Loved this class and everything about it. I Took this class at the beginning of my trip and learned so much about Japanese table manners that it helped me during the rest of my visit. I loved creating intricate looking sushi and hope I can replicate it at home. Yoshimi is super friendly and a great instructor.
