mosaic - sushi on the next level!. The course was great! First Yoshimi explained us everything about Japanese food culture and table manners then we prepared special makis and side dishes like tofu as well. At the end we ate all together. You receive a manual to prepare the mosaic sushis at home. The course is very recommendable. The location is quite central and Yoshimi was very nice. If I would be allowed to make one minor suggestion to improve the course even more it would be to give people a little bit more time. We were quite in a rush from one step to the next.

A Fun, Authentic Experience. Yoshimi's class is well worth the cost of admission. She takes you to a nearby apartment which has been set up as a kitchen and dining room, gives you a quick introduction to the rich culture around Japanese food, and then walks you through preparation. Along the way there are tips for how to find ingredients in the US, and at the end you just have a nice meal and a fun discussion about Japan, food, or whatever else interests you!Yoshimi is very knowledgeable, very patient, and very fun to interact with. There's a reason this experience is so highly rated and you will be happy you signed up!

Beautiful introduction to Japanese cooking and dining etiquette . We signed up for the mosaic sushi class, which turned out to be so much more than a cooking class. Yoshimi, our gracious host, met us at an easy to find and centralized location, dressed in a kimono and holding an identifying sign. The apartment she led us to was cozy and incredibly inviting. We started off by learning about dining etiquette, different textures and tastes in Japanese cuisine, and the seasonality of different foods. All such information and recipes were provided on beautifully printed materials. Though my husband doesn't normally cook, Yoshimi did a great job engaging him in fun and creative ways. Once finished, we sat down to enjoy the meal we prepared before heading back into the sweltering heat. I highly recommend this class to anyone; you might surprise yourself!

Highlight of the trip!. We had the best class with Yoshimi today! We learned so much about Japanese culture and cuisine in the intimate setting of an authentic Japanese home. Yoshimi's English was outstanding and she prepared beautiful recipe cards for us to take home. She was even able to give alternatives for how to make ingredients (like sauces and condiments) that might not be readily available in our home countries. She was an excellent teacher and I am looking forward to taking my new found Japanese cooking skills home to treat my friends and family. The food we made was beautiful and delicious and we enjoyed a lovely feast together after the class and chatted about things to do and see during our remaining time in Tokyo (great tip about kitchen street, we loved it). Thank you so much, we will come back next time we are in Tokyo to learn how to make more incredible dishes with you! If you are looking for a way to connect with the local culture and cuisine in a friendly and educational setting, book this class - it will be the highlight of your trip to Tokyo!!

Great way to learn Japanese cooking and food culture. Me and my two kids took the Mosaic sushi rolls class, Yoshimi pick us up at the Kaminarimon Gate in person. We learned to make the sushi roll as well as 2 side dishes and miso soup! Unlike some other class, Yoshimi let us do most of the cooking, the kids were having so much fun. Yoshimi is friendly, experienced and she speaks fluent english, we have no problem understanding each other. Her kitchen is clean and neat, with a view overlook the skytree and some other attraction. I will definitely recommend her class to my friends, specially family with young children.

I can make sushi now.. I was looking for a cooking class I could do either on the weekend or in the evening, as I am working here full time. I luckily found this class. Yoshimi is a wonderful teacher -- clear, patient, and an excellent cook. I liked learning about the cultural aspects as well, and she answered all of my questions thoroughly. I can now make: three different kinds of sushi, miso soup from scratch, tofu with spinach on top and a spinach sesame-seed side dish, and I can explain how to hold and use utensils, how to arrange plates, etc. It was basically everything that I wanted out of a lesson.

Highlight of Our Trip!. My wife, 6 y.o. daughter, and 16 y.o. niece had an absolutely fantastic time learning to prepare teddy bear bentos from Yoshimi during our stay in Tokyo! In addition to learning to cook, we really appreciated (at the beginning of our trip) learning basic Japanese table manners. Overall, we HIGHLY recommend taking a class from Yoshimi at TOKYO Kitchen! :D

Reasons you should book this cooking class (now):. 1. Yoshimi is lovely: she’s kind, positive, helpful, and great with kids. Our five and seven year-old enjoyed working with her. 2. If you’re the first one to book for that day, you get to choose the menu. (There are even vegetarian and gluten free options.)3. You get to make (and eat!) tasty food.4. The location is convenient (near Senso-ji Temple).5. Her kitchen is quaint, and the dining area has a beautiful view of the river6. The class included a couple of small surprises along the way. She pays attention to the details.7. See all of the other reviews.

"Excellent instruction on how to cook Tempura with Tips". Visited in May 2016.Easy to book and pay for class online.Instructions on where to meet and how to get there emailed to you and were accurate. Yoshimi in costume dress there to meet you with sign.Walked to kitchen with other class mates.Yoshimi speaks excellent English and was happy to answer questions as she instructed. Instructions clear and she demonstrated well. All classmates entered into food preparation and cooking processes.The huge benefit was learning the 'as you go' TIPs which are not written down in recipes. So you learn more. Take a pen and notebook and note down any tips that you find useful.Lots of classmates took photos on phones as the class progressed and Yoshimi ok with that.At end of cooking class we all sat down and enjoyed the cooked meal - which was substantial. Recipe was handed out at end of class.The event took 1/2 day and was very worthwhile. I went on my own but there was a couple there too and other singles.I feel confident now in cooking Tempura. Yoshimi very professional instructor, excellent in English and a very nice person who is full of fun and friendly. I would take another class by Yoshimi and highly recommend her classes to others
Really fun and interesting. We had a great time, you'll learn etiquette as well as how to cook some great food!Yoshimi was an awesome host :)Make this a part of your trip to tokyo straight away!

Gracious Hostess, Wonderful Food. I can't recommend this class highly enough. The lessons learned regarding etiquette were as valuable as the cooking lesson and made the rest of my trip feel more comfortable as I felt at more at ease dining. Yoshimi is a wonderful host and provides you with a plethora of take home material for recipes, place setting, and manners. The cooking itself was enlightening, especially learning about ingredients that we don't normally use here in the States, (myoga for one). Seeing how produce differs in terms of size and flavor, what combinations you utilize, and what techniques are more common to the Japanese kitchen was fascinating. The small class size lends itself to a friendliness and camaraderie among the students culminating in a beautiful homemade meal overlooking a river. Take the class early as suggested, you won't regret it.
Great cooking class!. Awesome cooking class! Plenty of real technique advice, as well as Japanese etiquette lessons from Yoshimi! She is a lovely person and a wonderful teacher!

Super Fun and Delicious!. Yoshimi was an amazing host! We learned all about Japanese cuisine and table manners. Had a fun time preparing food and ate a delicious meal. I encourage everyone visiting Tokyo to spend a morning with Yoshimi!

So much fun, I came back the next day for another class!. Yoshimi does a great job of explaining how Japanese ingredients come together to create unique textures, tastes, and aromas. She also gives an great explanation of how to properly eat food in Japan. The class is hands on with explanation every step of the way. The best part is we got to eat the full meal when we were done. I can't wait to get home and try what I learned. The video she does is a great recap of the day if you forget to take pictures. So much fun, I came back the next day for another class!
Do this!. We had an amazing time with Yoshimi! Book a place on this cooking class! You will learn so much about Japanese culture and food and you get to have a yummy meal!

Excellent, would highly recommend it!. Absolutely fantastic experience, we learnt so much about Japanese food and culture in such a short time! Yoshimi was patient and knowledgeable and answered all our questions fully, we have come away able to make a full meal and will definitely be trying this again at home - thank you!

Excellent Class. This class was absolutely fantastic, our teacher covered everything from Japanese table manners to cooking methods. I would highly recommend this class for anyone visiting Tokyo. Yoshimi, our teacher had excellent english and a high level of detail which showed through in how she presented information in the class. One very interesting part of the class was a chart she presented which outlined how Japanese has many more words for textures then english does. These sort of details about Japanese food and cooking really helped me appreciate the food during the rest of our trip in Japan.

Enjoyable learning experience!. A friend and I booked a sushi making class with Tokyo Kitchen in the hopes of picking up some sushi-making skills and we were not disappointed! Yoshimi is funny, encouraging and extremely knowledgeable. The class started off with her going through the foundations of Japanese cuisine which I found really interesting. It's also great for meeting other people - we shared our class with four others which was a perfect number. I'd highly recommend booking a class - it may only be two hours but it's so much fun. You'll be stuffed afterward with a full stomach which is always a bonus!
Private classes. Yoshimi was very accommodating. She personalized my classes according to my needs. Will go back again.

Great fun - worthwhile education!. I was recommended this class by a colleague who did the class a month or so earlier than our trip, so we booked in on our second day in Japan.Yoshimi is a fantastic host and teacher so it was a great cooking (and eating) experience but it was also very worthwhile as we got a lesson in all sorts of Japanese etiquette which we made the rest of our trip even better. Definitely recommend this experience!

Highly recommended. We made beautiful and creative sushi as well as other very tasty side dishes and a wonderful miso soupWe got really good handouts with images and recipiesYoshimi is very friendly and fun

Ramen Class. Yoshimi was a wonderful and knowledgeable instructor. She laid out the class in an organized and fun manner and provided us with hand outs and flash cards for easy reference. I especially enjoyed her pre-cooking advise regarding Japanese culture and correct tables manners. The class itself was hands-on, a great learning experience, and the results delicious and easy to replicated at home. Thank you Yoshimi!

Learning how to prepare delicious Japanese food in Tokyo city. The experience of cooking with Tokyo Kitchen was a highlight of my Japan trip. The host is very extremely friendly and very knowledgable with preparing Japanese dishes. I made the tempura dish which was very delicious and the instructions given to the class made it very easy to prepare. The recipe was given to us when we left and is written very well making it easy to duplicate. The cooking class was just the right amount of time of learning about cooking culture, cooking the food and enjoying what we prepared. I will highly recommend this experience.

Sushi class. I took the Tokyo kitchen Japanese cooking class in English. Yoshimi was so organized and informative and fun. I am better at making sushi than I thought I was! These are definitely recipes I will use at home. I'm staying with friends who work during the day and so I took the class alone and enjoyed it just as much as if I went with friends.

Great cooking class. My 6 year old and I took the bunny and bear sushi class. We had a great time. It was very informative and the recipes were easily replicated at home. Yoshimi was a great instructor and allowed all of us to be hands on. I would highly recommend Tokyo Kitchen to those that want to learn about Japanese food or simply have fun cooking.

The best of the best. It did a lot of research to find a place that can help me and my wife to have a sushi making class with halal ingredients. But i couldn't find a some one as understanding as Yoshimi. Her place was so neat and everything in place. She was so nice and sweet. She was prepared for anything.I learnt a lot and we loved it. The experience was amazing.Thanks Yoshimi.

Fun!. We loved the cooking class! Yoshimi san was a great teacher and made it very fun! We learned about many Japanese customs and cooking ingredients. She also welcomed my toddler and provided a high chair to make it easy for us.

Awesome cooking class!. We had a great time learning about Japanese food, cooking, and culture. We got to participate in a lot of the process and we were given recipes to take with us that should be easy to replicate at home in the US. Yoshimi was an excellent host. Went with my wife, brother, and his girlfriend. Total of six people in our group. Plenty of room in the kitchen for all of us. Made fried chicken, miso soup, tofu with tomato sauce, and a spinach salad. All were excellent.

Delicious and so much fun!. We were lucky enough to be able to make a last minute online reservation for our last day in Tokyo for a cooking class with Tokyo Kitchen, seamlessly paid via PayPal and received a confirmation all via email. We met Yoshimi in Asakusa near a major tourist landmark and she walked us to her beautiful, sparkling kitchen space overlooking the river. She gave us a brief background about Japanese cooking: flavors, ingredients, philosophies then we got to cooking. My husband and I were the only students that day. We learned how to make maki sushi, potato miso soup and two very simple sides: a chilled tofu and seasoned spinach dish. Yoshimi is knowledgeable, skilled and encouraging. She also speaks excellent English, honestly the best English I heard during two weeks in Japan. I'm an experienced home cook, but my husband is not as comfortable in the kitchen. She got us both equally involved and made the whole experience really fun and informative. Yoshimi is a delight and just a lovely person. At the end, we got to enjoy all the dishes we made. Everything was so fresh and delicious. Highly recommend. I can't wait to come back and take another class with her.

A great introduction to Japanese food. We had a great time learning about Japanese food and etiquette. We then bustled into the kitchen and learned to prepare a number of dishes including miso soup, sushi and two traditional sides. We ate our meal with Yoshimi and she produced a mini video as a souvenir to share with our friends!

Great Oyakodon Cooking Class. We visited Yoshimi san last year for her geometric sushi class and had such a great time we couldn't wait to try again to learn something new!We took an Oyakodon lesson and as before, it couldn't have been any better! Yoshimi san takes care of making sure you have everything you need to have fun and learn during the hands on lesson!From booking to the meet up to the lesson and meal that follow, this is an awesome class that you shouldn't hesitate to book if you can!We can't wait to come back and bring family/friends!Thanks Yoshimi san

Love, Love, Love!. I absolutely loved this class! Yoshimi was awesome! I must say this cooking class was the highlight of my trip to Tokyo. It was a great experience learning about the food and culture of Japan. We made sushi, Japanese paella, gyoza, and miso soup...all delightfully delicious! The best take away was learning how to properly eat with chopsticks and place setting of dishes. I highly recommend Yoshimi's cooking class while visiting Tokyo.Robin S.

Highlight of our trip!. This was definitely one of our favorite experiences in Tokyo. We learned a lot about Japanese culture and food. Yoshimi was really fun to cook and chat with, and the food was delicious! We really appreciated receiving information and recipe cards to take home with us. Would definitely recommend this for anyone visiting Tokyo! Thanks Yoshimi for such a great time!

Great food and fun. Tokyo Kitchen Cooking School is a fantastic experience for the whole family. We did a private class for a family group of 7 (aged 19-60) and everyone thoroughly enjoyed themselves. Yoshimi was an excellent host and is also very good at English! Highly recommend adding this Cooking School to your itinerary while you are visiting Tokyo

Great experience learning to cook Japanese!. My family and I took this cooking class in Aug 2015 and it was a blast. Even my grown sons of 20 and 25 (one who never cooks) loved the experience!The teacher spoke great English, taught us all about the Japanese ingredients and food, and then we learned how to cook several dishes. She was very knowledgeable, very well organised, and made it a great time. We gobbled down everything we had cooked and we had the recipes to take with us for use at home!
Great Food, Great Tips. It was a wonderful experience, i went home with so much in mind and so much knowledge about japanese food. Will definitely come back again for classes when i am back in tokyo,

Amazing experience!. I've been to two classes so far, and both have been absolutely wonderful. Her instructions are written very simply, which makes it easy to replicate at home. She even gives you examples of alternate ingredients, for those of you that aren't living in Japan and can't find some of them. Not only was she an excellent teacher, but she also gave me suggestions on different places to check out after I was done with the class.If I had enough time here, I would sign up for a lot more of her classes! Highly recommend this to anyone interested in Japanese cuisine.

Tokyo Kitchen. Yoshimi is fantastic and speaks perfect English this was a great morning cooking with Yoshimi my son and I made Wagyu beef Sukiyaki with her great skills and teaching ability Yoshimi made it simple for us to learn and the pre cooking education on how to correctly use chop sticks and the do’s and don’ts with them also how and why the food is arranged when served and in what order made it a enjoyable morning best of all yes we got to eat it thank you Yoshimi and I put the short movie you made that morning on Facebook everyone liked it. I highly recommend this class this class was only my son and I but normally still would only be small number of people so a must do

Best experience of my Tokyo trip!. I previously lived in Japan and spent a while in Tokyo, so my second time coming back, I didn't really want to visit the tourist attractions anymore. I thought learning how to cook Japanese food would be a great way to do this. Yoshimi's Tokyo Kitchen had interesting options, a good price, and I was able to book it the day before. Yoshimi met me at Kaminarimon, the famous landmark gate in Asakusa. From there, it was a short walk to her house. She is very responsive to questions, helpful, and was interested in hearing about my trip around Japan. There is also a great view of the river and the Asahi building! In the spring, you can see cherry blossom trees from her window. Before the cooking began, Yoshimi went over the basics of Japanese cooking, which I'd never learned before. It was very interesting. Then, we started cooking. We made a tofu dish, a spinach salad, and tempura - but she has multiple classes, including one that sounds great where you make shapes of animals like bunnies and teddy bears on sushi rolls. Yoshimi is a great teacher and this was a wonderful addition to my trip!

A fabulous experience to be repeated!. This cooking class is very professional, organized, structured and Yoshimi has an in-depth knowledge of the subject. All the explanations are clear and detailed. The two hour class is fun and enriching. Yoshimi is a very charming, friendly and welcoming person. She makes the whole experience memorable.

Great cooking instructor and entertained us with Japanese table manners!!!. Yoshimi (instructor) made the class seems so easy! We learned how to make the Mosaic Sushi, tempura, miso soup, Okonomiyaki, tofu and table manners. It was a good review on hashi usage at the dinner table. This is a great way to learn how to cook Japanese food and Yoshimi put you at easy. We were very pleased with what we learn and plan to come back and take another class!!!

The cooking instructor entertained and explained well Japanese home style cooking.. The instructor is really friendly and sweet lady. I learned decoration Sushi roll at the class. The instructor's explanation was clear to understand. I enjoyed cooking.

Great cooking experience in Tokyo!. We spent three very pleasant hours with Yoshimi, who's a lovely teacher and speaks great english! she talked us through some japanese manners/traditions first, before getting into the cooking. We prepared a bento box full of colors and taste!Definitely recommended if you're in Tokyo

Funny and interesting !. The course started with an interesting introduction to Japanese food culture including seasonning, table manner. We then preparated Bento.The teacher was kind, it was a real hands-on experience with clear instructions (good challenge: try to make Onigri with bare hands!).I highly recommend this course for whoever that is interested into food culture!

Fun, relaxed and extremely informative introduction to Japanese cookery.. My mother-in-law and I had a great morning with Yoshimi cooking tofu teriyaki. She is bright and friendly, knowledgeable about Japanese (and many other) cultures, as well as a great cook and relaxed teacher. I'll be back for another lesson soon, and I recommend this as a good way for visitors to get a feel for Japanese food and some useful tips on table manners.

Wonderful sushi making class!. We had made sushi many times before at home so we were excited to see the mosaic sushi designs offered in this class. The class was fun, well paced and offered lots of hands on experience for all participants. Yoshimi speaks English very well and was very well organised. We were so happy with the outcome of our efforts and all of the food was delicious. It was also fun to chat with Yoshimi and ask questions about Japanese food and culture.

Fantastic cooking class! . Yoshimi gave us a wonderful cooking class. She walked our group to her beautifully located kitchen in Asakusa. We learnt so much about the culture, etiquette, tastes and textures of Japanese cuisine. Our family all helped cook Gyoza and Ramen, before enjoying eating it for lunch. A fantastic experience and one of the highlights of our trip. Thanks Yoshimi!

Great time at Tokyo Kitchen!. Highly recommend a visit to Tokyo Kitchen! Yoshimi is a very friendly host with impeccable English. She taught us not only how to make delicious Japanese food, but also about Japanese customs and table manners that are very helpful to know while traveling. We can't wait to try out our new cooking skills at home, so that we can continue to enjoy delicious Japanese food!

One of the highlights of our Japan adventure. Treat yourself and make this one of the first things you do in Japan. Not only will you learn some of the tips and tricks for successful Japanese cooking, you'll also learn how NOT to make a buffoon of yourself while dining out in Japan. Yoshimi was a delightful host and, despite us being the only two students on the day, no corners were cut and we had a marvellous morning and early afternoon in the kitchen.

Melt in mouth sukyaki. Yoshimi is such a friendly and welcoming teacher and host! She met a group of five of us and walked us along the river, past the Asahi Headquarters (golden poo), to her apartment and cooking studio. She ran us through Japanese etiquette, history of food in Japanese culture and how to better use chop sticks! Her English is great and the Sukyaki was absolutely amazing. We were all very involved in preparing a huge feast, and more importantly in the eating of it all. We've walked away with recipe cards, beautiful memories and can't wait to cook this sukyaki for our friends and family back home!

Engaging and informative host. Yoshimi-san was an engaging and informative host who was very good at English, was accommodating of our endless questions, and prepared for all sorts of trouble we got into. Her info script is fun and even though I already went in knowing a lot about Japanese food, I still learned many things. Very gracious and elegant lady. We truly enjoyed her company.

Great Japanese cooking class in Tokyo!. I had a one-to-one class with my teacher, Yoshimi, in her custom-made teaching kitchen. Over the course of 3 hours, we made a range of dishes, which we enjoyed over a sociable lunch at the end. It was relaxed, very informative and Yoshimi was very friendly and enthusiastic to teach. In the first week since I have been home, I have made a number of the dishes. I could have gone to temples or museums, but I got more insight into the culture in these three hours! Great value. Highly recommended.

Amazing experience and lesson. I had a wonderful time learning about japanese food and flavours!this is a must do for any tourist visiting Tokyo! Yoshimi is very friendly and knowledgeble and gives a great overview of japanese food, ingredients, traditions and table manners in a fun and relaxing environment. I definitely recommend it to everyone!

Great day with Japanese cooking. I really enjoyed my day at Tokyo Kitchen where Yoshimi taught me how to make a lot of small dishes for bento boxes.Yoshimi is a very lovely person whom I enjoyed cooking with, and the kitchen was in beautiful setting in Asakusa with a great view to the river.The food turned out very tasteful and still it was relatively easy to make, so I'm sure I'll be able to cook it at home as well - especially as I got the recipes with me.It was indeed one of my unique experiences while visiting Tokyo, and I can highly recommend it.

Absolutely essential for any visit to Tokyo. My daughter and I booked a class during our very brief (2.5 days) stay in Tokyo, and I couldn't be more pleased. What a great experience! We learned so much about Japanese cuisine and table manners. Then, we cooked (and ate!) an incredible meal. The teacher is amazing. The view from the kitchen is incredible. The entire experience exceeded my expectations. I can't wait to go back to Japan! My strongest recommendation. Thank you, Yoshimi, for an unforgettable time.

Exceptional Cooking Class - you must go!. What an amazing experience! Yoshimi is incredible. She is sweet, hospitable, and very funny. The meal we made was fabulous and very authentic Japanese cooking. The food and overall experience was incredible. The thing I enjoyed most was her thorough overview of Japanese culture as well as very specific Japanese cuisine elements. We had a fabulous time and would definitely take one of her classes again. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

A must do for Tokyo visitors. Great experience for anyone looking to learn a little bit about Japanese cuisine and have a great meal too. By the end of class I was able to make some amazing sushi rolls!

Great host and Great experience.. This class did not disappoint in anyway. The teacher was great and the food we made was fantastic. I learned a ton and would recommend doing the mosaic sushi. a cool twist on sushi to bring home and impress your friends. definitely don't miss out on this class ! Thank you Yoshimi !

Great fun and a tasty outcome. This came recommended by a friend, who came along with us. We were met by the lovely Yoshimi at the entrance to the Asakusa shrine, and then we walked to the apartment nearby that houses the kitchen itself. We started out with a cup of tea and a lesson covering what makes Japanese food so well-regarded before moving on to the main event - the cooking!Because one of our party had been before, we chose to do something different to the first time he'd been, so we were making adorable sushi bears and bunnies, along with a couple of side dishes. Yoshimi talked us through what we were doing and did some of the more complex things while we helped with chopping and mixing (at one point trying to fan rice with one hand and mix with the other - that didn't go well for clumsy ol' me!) Yoshimi is a great teacher, and treated us with great patience and humour, and the end result showed this - it all looked and tasted great!Highly recommended for anyone who likes a bit of a challenge, a bit of learning and an appetite for tasty food.

Best meal in Japan. My husband and I were fortunate to be able to visit with Yoshimi for a special gluten free cooking class to prepare soboro don! We decided to book very early in our trip when we knew we would be jet lagged, but we managed to stay awake for our dinner class! We learned so much and the food was wonderful!! I highly recommend doing this early in your trip, since we learned so much and had a deeper understanding of the Japanese cuisine and customs during the rest of our trip. Since returning home, I have managed to cook our meal during two busy weeknights! I'm amazed at how easy it is for me to prepare an authentic Japanese rice dish/bowl with ease!

Amazing cooking class - highly recommended!. Wow! Where to start about Tokyo Kitchen's cooking class! First, the location and facilities - I was met by the lovely Yoshimi at Kaminarimon and we walked a short way along the river to the kitchen. Along the way we passed the Tokyo Sky Tree and Asahi HQ. The kitchen itself is spacious and bright, spotless, super well organized and has great views of the river. But what about the class? It was so informative, I learned so much! I loved the pre-cooking section where Yoshimi discussed Japanese foods, key ingredients, the thinking behind good meals, etiquette, etc. She is very organized and takes you through it clearly, with notes provided to take away with you. Then to the cooking - we made pork katsu curry, miso soup, rice and 2 side dishes. All along, Yoshimi taught interesting ways of cleaning, chopping, flavoring, and the reasons why, etc. She's just as organized in the kitchen and everything comes together nicely. And the food! So delicious! And, importantly, I actually feel like I could recreate the meal at home.Yoshimi is calm, knowledgable, enthusiastic, funny, a wonderful host and teacher. If you are looking for a cooking class in Tokyo, this is the one to book. I know next time I'm in Tokyo I'll be checking the menus for another class with Yoshimi.

Great fun + very informative. . Yoshimi is a great instructor. Highly recommend. It's easy to find too. I booked on a Monday morning in November and was the only one on the class - one on one tuition!

Yoshimi is the best!. We have taken cooking classes all over the world. We find it is the best way to connect with a culture. Yoshimi went above and beyond in this way, teaching us etiquette as well as recipes. Her English is nearly flawless.The location in Asakusa is perfect--good-sized kitchen, spectacular views, easy access to public transportation.This one definitely one of the highlights of our trip to Japan!

Entertaining Intro to Japanese Cuisine!. We had a wonderful time with this class! Yoshimi is a very friendly and knowledgeable host. We really enjoyed getting to learn about Japanese culinary customs and traditions before diving into the cooking ourselves. Highly recommended!

Fantastic insight into Japanese cuisine.. Yoshimi is a great hostess in an amazing kitchen set up across from the Sumida River. She has a pleasant and friendly manner with everyone and will teach you lots of things about the cuisine of Japan. It is reasonably priced so great value for money as you eat your feast for lunch. There is plenty of food too! Small classes of up to 7 so plenty of hands on cooking. This is the best cooking class I have done (and I have done a few).

Amazing once in a lifetime experience!!. HiThis was a fun, informative and mainly delicious experience!! I had a wonderful time and would definitely return to learn another dish. It was easy with all the ingredients and step by step instructions to take home. Thank you for an amazing time :)

Intro to Japanese cooking. Yoshimi was a really good teacher and condensed a lot of information into an easy framework. I have always been interested in Japanese ingredients but not really sure how to approach this and the lesson was really worth the time. In my case, I took the sushi roll class. Yoshimi speaks excellent English so there was no communication barrier - a relative rarity in Japan!

Great, tasty fun. What a great way to spend a morning. Yoshimi was informative, entertaining and personable and taught us a bit about Japanese culture as well as just making food. Who knew the Japanese have 400 words to describe food?!We did the sushi class and made things we'd never seen before, let alone eat. Highly recommended for anyone who wants to have a bit of fun on their visit to Tokyo.

Fun and informative cooking class. The food was fun and interesting to cook. Yoshimi was very informative and taught us a lot about Japanese culture and cuisine.
I had a lot of fun and would definitely recommend these cooking classes.
Memorable experience. We absolutely enjoyed our day learning how to cook gyoza and ramen. Very practical and fun! Fantastic English and learnt a lot!

Fun at Yoshimi's. I just got back from Japan. One of the most fun experiences was the cooking class at Yoshimi's. We learned alot, about Japanese food, and about Japanese culture in general. The food was great and Yoshimi managed to adapt well to my request for a vegetarian meal. and mostly it was really fun!

Fantastic and fun class!. Spent a wonderful morning with Yoshimi learning to cook Okonomiyaki, as well as side dishes. Yoshimi taught us cultural aspects of Japanese cuisine. A must do for people who have come to Japan for the first time.

Amazing experience with an awesome host. Had a great time with Yoshima. She was a lovely host with excellent English. Taught us about the Japanese cooking history, along with some great skills to take back. Cooked okonomiyaki and it was a great success. Highly recommended to any traveller.

Definitely try it. I had not seen any emails from Yoshimi in advance so we had a bit of a problem meeting up, trying to find the kitchen itself from the address, which is in an unmarked building. However, she was kind enough to accommodate a late start and we were very grateful not to have missed out on a really fun and informative experience. We not only learnt how to cook a delicious katsu curry (as well as miso soup and tofu and spinach side dishes), but also more information about Japanese culture, food and chopstick etiquette! Yoshimi is wonderful and the setting is bright and airy on the river - well worth a visit.

Wonderful class. We did the sushi class - we made three types of rolls, miso soup, and two sides. Before we started cooking, she gave us a quick lesson on Japanese culinary etiquette, which we thought quite interesting.She was a great teacher and we had a wonderful time.

Fun food experience. . A great Tokyo morning. Tokyo Kitchen is located in a beautiful, bright apartment on the river. We learnt so much about food and life in Tokyo while cooking and enjoying scrumptious food. This class is a must do!

Awesome Class.. Highly recommended.Yoshimi was lovely, coherent and very knowledgeable.Don't think twice about it... Book a class.I was taught to make Gyoza, Wagyu beef Sukiyaki and side dishes. And the outcome was delicious.
Great experience. Totally enjoyed our cooking class and tour. Not only was it fun but very informative. Even learned chopstick etiquette.

Must do whilst in Japan!. We did not fly out till 8.30pm back to Australia and we booked this to fill in the morning! It was the best Idea! I was not feeling the best at the time of the class and I was accommodated by being allowed to sit down and join in still. We had a little video made of our experience and that is better than any photo! We would highly recommend Tokyo Kitchen to any English speaking visitors! And recommend do the morning class to fill in the morning if you have a night flight back home!! We did the sushi making class, and we cant wait to make some again at home!

Great experience even for a Japanese!. I joined Sushi class and i really enjoyed the time with Yoshimi. Her kitchen is really efficient and explanation of Japanese cooking, ingredients, manners of chopsticks is clear and easy to understand! The result of assembling of sushi is more than expected. Highly recommended even for a Japanese!

It's a must experience as soon as you arrive Japan. Our class was one of the best things we've done in Tokyo. It was really entertaining and interesting. Of course, we didn't become cooks after our class, but it allowed us enjoyed Japanese food much more than we could have done without doing it. Yoshimi is super friendly and knowledgable and she has an excellent English level so you can understand absolutely everything.

Unexpected Surprise :). This cooking class was one of the most unexpected, and truly delightful experiences during my trip to Tokyo. I booked this cooking class with the Backstreet Guide tour, and it was an exceptional day. Actually, I wish Yoshimi offered her classes and tour on Mondays, because it was a very helpful, and it would've been a great introduction to Tokyo/Japan. I learned so much about Tokyo, and the Japanese. The cooking class itself was well-organized, fun, practical, and easy to follow. We started out with a small intro to Japanese cuisine and table manners (I can't say it enough, but I totally wish this was the first thing I did in Tokyo!!). Then, we started cooking. She taught us how to cook rice, miso soup, chilled tofu, spinach, and katsu curry. The food was delicious, and she gave us recipe cards so that we can replicate what we learned. The tour itself was so much fun!! I had the opportunity to see a kombu shop, we went to a supermarket, Ameyoko market, and Mitsukoshi Department store. I was fortunate enough to have the tour all to myself, so I asked a lot of questions, and Yoshimi was so patient and helpful. She answered all my questions, not just about food, but Japan in general. All this, I might add, despite a raging typhoon pouring gallons of rain over our heads. Yoshimi's daughter, Lynn, spent the day with us because schools were closed in preparation for the typhoon. She was the most well-behaved and polite little girl, and she kept up with the adults in all the heavy rain - a real trooper! the class, plus the tour truly offered a range of experiences, from simple home cooking to more gourmet offerings Tokyo has to offer. It's definitely a must-try experience!

The cooking class you can not miss. We had a really great time! Classes are super well-organised and very well-conducted by the best teacher ever :) The participants during clases not only learn how to prepare sushi, but also get to know some basics on Japanese cuisine and table etiquette. Knowledge gained is priceless, but I recommend the classes also because they are super fun! In short, when planing your visit to Japan do not forget to include them in your must-do list! I promise you will not regret!

Awesome Cooking class!. I signed up for the Curry and Miso soup class, it was WAY better then expected! Not only did she help us with cooking but I learned a ton about the local culture and how to properly use chopsticks! We got recipe cards to take home as well which was a great idea! The food was AMAZING, probably the best curry and miso soup Ive ever had, plus we made two sides which were also so delicious. Then ice cream for desert. So much food. I honestly can't recommend this class any higher, if there was 10 stars I would put it!

Such a fun cookery class. We booked a class with Yoshimi that would cater for my vegetarian needs and my other half's love of gyoza. It was a wonderfully relaxed and informative session with info on Japanese cuisine, seasonings and dining etiquette before starting the cooking proper. Yoshimi speaks excellent English so there are no issues around language or comprehension. Her small but perfectly formed kitchen was the ideal place to learn about Japanese cooking techniques and the different ingredients used. We had great fun perfecting gyoza filling and pleating - and they tasted great! Would highly recommend a class with Yoshimi to anyone interested in Japanese food and preparation.

Great Cooking Class!. If you love Japanese food as much as my wife & I do and you're visiting or live in the Tokyo area, this is a must do!Yoshimi san will teach you everything you need to know about Japanese dining from table etiquette, flavors & ingredients, and customs/history.Then it's cooking time, where she walks you through each step to prepare the main dish and side items for that day's menu and even provides material to take home so you may do it again on your own.We had a great time and can't wait to try another lesson!
Great cooking class. Yoshimi is really Nice and explain very well. I was so happy to learn more of japanese cooking. I have never never made sushis before and the class was adapted to our level ! :)

Great cooking course!. We did the sushi cooking course and it was great to make different types of sushi, to understand the most important points of Japanese food and eating manners. We would do it again- it was great!

Great!. We had an awesome cooking class! Having taken cooking classes abroad before, there are a couple differences that stand out at Tokyo kitchen. 1) the location- it is very centrally located and she meets you at an easy to find location. No wandering, lost, through back streets of Asia, trying to find a tiny hole in the wall. Also, there is a great view!2) replicable recipes- you could make these recipes on your own again!3) gluten free- she can accommodate visitors with gluten allergies. This is very hard to find in Tokyo. If you have a gluten allergy, this may be your best Japanese meal in Tokyo. 4) cultural context- she teaches you about the significance of the food you are eating and how it connects to the broader context of Japanese food. Highly recommended!

Cooking Class with a View. Yoshimi's cooking class was very comprehensive and fun! We were taught a lesson not only in cooking our delicious sushi dish but in Japanese cooking overall! She had everything prepared and was very professional the entire time! We made the decorative sushi which was very fun, but we also got to learn how to make miso soup a Japanese staple! The location was ideal with views of Tokyo Skytree and the Sumida River. After the class you can also enjoy the Asakusa area!!

Taught in English with great attention to detail, great fun activity. Yoshimi is a brilliant teacher who speaks fluent English and wont just teach how to cook but gives cultural insights into Japanese table etiquette. The class was great value for money and the food produced is great!

The best way to spend a morning in Tokyo!. My friend and I booked a sushi making class with Yoshimi last week on our vacation in Tokyo. It was easily one of the best parts of our trip. Yoshimi was informative, helpful, and incredibly patient with us. Our sushi turned out beautifully and I can't wait to make the things we learned again. Everything was fresh, delicious, and surprisingly easy!

We cooked up some laughs!. We looked at a few cooking courses in Tokyo and were staying in the Asakusa area. We chose this course as there wasn't much difference in price between them all, and it offered a variety of dishes. We chose an evening course that started at 4pm, and made Okonomiyaki for dinner. Our teacher Yoshimi was excellent, we were given specific instruction on techniques and ingredients for our main, side dishes and miso soup, and cooked while both observing and preparing the meal. Yoshimi is lovely and welcoming, we felt instantly at ease, and had a barrel of laughs in good humour. She ate dinner with us (it was so tasty), and taught us how to lay out a Japanese meal and all about chopstick etiquette. We are very happy we chose this course!

Amazing cultural experience.. Highly, highly recommended. Yoshimi is an excellent cook and a great teacher, no matter your level of experience. This is a fantastic way to get immersed into Japanese culinary culture and a superb gateway into tokyo's foodie scene (Yoshimi is full of tips on what a budding chef and foodie should do in this city!) I can't think of a better way to spend one's morning in Tokyo.

Amazing! . The expirience was magical! We learned Japanese table manners, Japanese flavors, and more! The dishes were really simple and easy to make, not to mention extremely tasty. We watched the Asakusa firework during dinner and had a wonderful chat (the hosts speak fluent English). I recommend this to anyone who comes to Japan and wants to not only learn but meet great people! Friends who cook together stay together!

Great learning experience. The instructor was a Japanese, so no worries if you are looking for authentic method for Japanese cuisine. And the best part, she speaks very fluent English! Great for people like me who keens to learn authentic japanese cuisine but unable to speak Japanese. Class flow was well organized. Will definitely recommend her to my friends! Will come back for lessons again on my next trip to japan!

Tempura cooking class. I did the cooking class whilst my partner was at a conference. I was the only person on the course that morning but Yoshimi was really friendly and an excellent tutor. The recipe cards were useful and background to Japanese cooking and food was really interesting too.

Great easy way to learn about Japanese cuisine.. We took this class near the end of our stay in Japan and wish that we had taken it at the beginning because it would have assisted us greatly in understanding what we were eating and why we were eating it in the restaurants.Yoshimi is charming, knowledgeable and a great teacher. She instills her love of Japanese cuisine in her students and you come away with a much deeper appreciation of Japanese foods and culture. Her English is excellent.The apartment is located close to Asakusa Station and have beautiful views of the river and surrounding buildings. If you have any thought of making your own Japanese food at home, take a class from Yoshimi and you will not be disappointed!

Cooking up a storm. We loved our cooking class. Yoshimi was kind and lovely with our children also. Learned so much about the detail of Japanese cooking including texture words, flavors and table etiquette and meal placement. Fabulous!

Fun family day making animal rolls!. This was a very fun and educational experience for us! Yoshimi-san was very accommodating when we brought our two young kids. We definitely recommend this place, it's fun for all ages!

Great way to learn about Japanese culture. We has a brilliant time at the sushi making class. The class was really interesting and incorporated lots of info about Japanese culture and cooking. We made lots of food - three types of sushi, miso soup, and 2 Japanese side dishes. The class is in an apartment with nice views overlooking the river which was a lovely place to sit and eat all the food we made. Yoshimi was very friendly, knowledgeable and welcoming. I would thoroughly recommend doing this in Tokyo.

excellent experience cooking!. We really enjoyed this class and got a lot of cultural tips that helped us during our subsequent 10 days in Japan, such as table manners and information about ingredients. We cooked a surprising amount of different dishes from scratch, and they were all delicious. We also signed up for Yoshimi's foodie tour of Tokyo in the afternoon after we ate the delicious lunch we prepared together, and it was really fun and informative. Yoshimi is delightful, an excellent teacher, and her English is outstanding. Thanks for a great time!

Excellent Cooking School Class in Tokyo. Did an excellent cooking class at Tokyo Kitchen in central Tokyo today with my wife and daughter. Yoshimi-san has excellent English and runs classes in a private kitchen for up to 6 persons. A lot fun, well priced and she is an excellent teacher. Abd then you get to eat the meal together.Highly recommended and a great tourist attraction. A selection of meals available.

An amazing cooking class. I really enjoyed this cooking class!! After being picked up at the police station in front of the Kaminarimon Gate, we walked to a cooking studio, where we learned about the elements that make up Japanese food. Then, we prepared and ate a delicious meal, including a wonderful tempura! I highly recommend the class and hope to take another one the next time I visit Tokyo.

Excellent Japanese Cooking Class. Yoshimi's cooking class is one of my favourite memories from my trip to Japan. I took the mosaic sushi class which also included several other side dish recipes that I look forward to making when I get home. The class also included a lesson on Japanese cooking basics (seasonality, seasonings and texture) and some handy info on table manners. Yoshimi is lovely, welcoming, speaks great English and happily answered any other questions I had about Japan. I would definitely recommend taking a class.

Great experience. We spent 9 days in Tokyo and this was definitely the highlight of our stay. We found out so much about Japanese cuisine as well as their history, mentality and tradition. It is not easy to find English speaking people in Japan, but Yoshimi is perfectly fluent. Enjoyed some great food and learned how to cook it ourselves. We brought back all the ingredients and now have a valuable addition to our family cooking book. This is a must for every food lover in Tokyo :)

🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟. I am an experienced Japanese home cook, but Yoshimi-San shared tips and techniques that are taking my cooking to another level! Her instructions were clear. Her written materials easy to follow. And her timing was exquisite. All that and the food was delicious!My husband is an eater, not a cook. But he was willing to participate when I told him we could make Katsu Curry, a dish I don't make because I never fry food. Well, DH had a great time, and I got over my fear of frying!

Slice of Local life. It was a pleasure to meet Yoshimi san! On the way from Kaminarimon to the Tokyo kitchen, she pointed out buildings of importance and recommended places to eat around the neighborhood. She is very organized in presenting her material so her students can get a better understanding of nutritious balances, ingredients of Japanese cuisines, health benefits and Japanese dining etiquettes.I really enjoyed making nikujaga, tofu salad, miso potato soup and sesame spinach in class. It was definitely a treat to have homemade lunch overlooking beautiful Sumida river! If you have a chance to go to Tokyo, I definitely recommend this class. Not only will you learn how to make delicious food, you will get to meet friendly Yoshimi san who is a local who would teach you a lot about Japanese culture and food. Thank you Yoshimi san :)!

You can learn a lot from Tokyo Kitchen whether tourist or Tokyo resident. I spent a recent Sunday in a surprise one-on-one cooking lesson with Yoshimi of Tokyo Kitchen (I was the only one who had booked for the day). I think that I surprised her because I have actually been a Tokyo resident for many years and didn't know how to cook some of the basic dishes. Yoshimi was very knowledgeable and incredibly organized. She first goes over the basics of Japanese food including tastes, textures, and basic composition and then the fun moves into the kitchen. Yoshimi clearly has a lot of experience with preparing traditional Japanese food, and I especially enjoyed making sushi rolls for the first time and learning how to make the perfect rice to go with it. Thank you very much, Yoshimi-san! I look forward to learning more from you again very soon. I just bought more ingredients :)

Great experience - both the creation and the eating!. Yoshimi was friendly, very knowledgeable and good fun. My husband and I really enjoyed creating the Bento Box and then eating it accompanied by many good stories and interesting conversation.

Super tasty and fun!. I am usually not the biggest fan of sushi but making it in Yoshimi's class was first and foremost super fun and it turned out so delicious!! I guess I never tried the right one. It was not as easy as I had imagine but then Yoshimi doesn't just serve boring food. Everything looked so well put together, she explained each and every step perfectly and even gave us a short introduction on Japanese eating culture and history. I loved it! Would highly recommend it to anyone who loves food and cultural insights! By the way, you can make all different kinds of food, not just sushi and can get a vegetarian option as well on some.

Wonderful. My kid was totally enjoy the class , Yoshimi is such a great teacher she shown us all the culture , cooking exp and her passion !We definitely to visit back next time !Thank you very much again !

Simply the ***BEST*** Ｏ(≧∇≦)Ｏ. My boyfriend and I decided to take a cooking class while we were in Tokyo and after doing some research (via TripAdvisor) we decided to contact Tokyo Kitchen (Yoshimi) and make a reservation for a class we were interested in. But: oh no! The class we wanted was the next day, and it was already late! Yoshimi got back to us very quickly and told us it was okay, and we were so relieved. N.B. - We speak zero to no Japanese. Yoshimi speaks perfect English. Way to go, Yoshimi. Boo on us. Yoshimi's directions on where to meet her were clear, and she was there a little before the appointed time (like us!) and from there she walked us to the kitchen... it is a cosy apartment on the waterfront with a beautiful view of the river and the Asahi building across the way. Yoshimi's introduction to Japanese cuisine was so helpful, and she answered any questions we had with ease! After that, we got to cookin' .... Bento! The amount of preparation and care that went into the lesson was apparent at every turn (Yoshimi had already done some of the prep work). We learned how to make egg omelette, but ours didn't turn out so well. I mean, there's 'barely competent', and then there's 'what we produced' --- which by no means was a reflection of Yoshimi. By the time our lesson was over we had made Inari Sushi (making the sushi rice and tofu pockets), a spinach side (in amaaaazing sesame sauce), Chilled tofu (with a Japanese ginger, onion and tomato topping), Miso soup (from-scratch dashi!), and a number of little bento box garnishes (cheese and seaweed, ham flowers, and omelette hearts). Eating and talking with Yoshimi was perhaps the best part - we got to pick her brain about different social and cultural Japanese issues. Our conversation ranged from graveyards (we brought it up because we had walked through a graveyard the day before) to the different neighborhoods of Tokyo and their mascots.When it was time to go we were so sad because we had such fun with Yoshimi. She is a delight in every way, and if you are traveling to Tokyo (or are already here and want to brush up on some skills) we couldn't recommend Yoshimi highly enough. Not only were we full at the end of the three hours we spent with her, but we took home recipe cards and some information on Japanese cuisine. To Yoshimi all we can say is: ｍ（．＿．）ｍアリガト!!!!TLDR: DO IT! DO IT! DO IT!

Great way to learn about Japanese food & culture. I booked the cooking class with Yoshimi at the start of our trip to Japan & it couldn't have been easier to arrange. She introduced us to the culture of food in Japan, which was fascinating - Yoshimi is a very good communicator & clearly passionate about what she does. We learnt how to make a variety of lovely dishes, all of which I am keen to replicate once I get home. The class is a great experience & one I'd highly recommend.

Invaluable experience for a foodie with an excellent teacher / host. During our travels in Japan it's fair to say we indulge in the wonderful cuisine. This class with yoshimi is a little gem. We chose the decorative sushi class. Yoshimi taught us about japanese food culture and we learnt to make omelette, the sushi itself, miso soup and a side of spinach salad. All very hands on. Her English is great and we enjoyed our meal together at the end which also gave us a great opportunity to ask her questions. Yes, japanese people do eat kfc on Christmas Day !Would highly recommend this class ! Happy travels ☺

An amaising joining with nippo cousine and culture. We had the chance to meet Yoshimi and her deep knowledge of japaniese cousine and table manner! Yoshimi, nice and smily person, led us into the different stages of a traditional recipe in a cosy and quiet appartment. The result? A very enjoyable lunch!Francesca and Enrico

More than just a cooking class!. I have lived in Japan for many years and I accompanied my friends who were visiting Japan to this class. Before getting into the day's cooking, Yoshimi took us through the history of food culture in Japan and I actually learnt many things that I did not know before. The food was fun to make and tasted fantastic. I have actually already made the tofu accompaniments for my family here and they loved it too!!I would highly recommend Yoshimi's class to anyone who is either living in Japan or just visiting. I garuantee you will learnt alot and leave with lots of new recipes and a full tummy!

Sushi making class. I attended the sushi making class with my 14yo daughter & a friend at the end of our 2 week stay in Japan, I wish this had been one of the first things we had done! The class was not just about making making sushi, it was also very informative about Japanese culture and other aspects of dining in Japan.Yoshimi's English is very good, much better than other guides we encountered. She is a very knowledgeable and patient teacher with a great sense of humour and I found our time spent with her very worth while and an absolute pleasure.And my sushi making since returning home has improved dramatically!

Excellent for learning about Japanese cuisine. My husband and I really enjoyed Yoshimi's cooking class, in which we learnt how to make sushi, a couple of side dishes and soup. The lesson lasted 3 hours, which was enough time to learn about Japanese eating etiquette, make the food and eat it! Yoshimi gave us the recipes to take away with us, which are really clear and well explained. I was really pleased that Yoshimi was able to accommodate my gluten-free dietary requirements and went through every effort to source ingredients that I could use for an authentic Japanese meal (including wheat-free soy sauce!).

Fun, informative and child-friendly cooking class. My 8 year old and I very much enjoyed Yoshimi's excellent cooking class today. I want to thank Yoshimi for her patience as she went slowly enough to let my daughter take part in all the preparation, so she really felt part of the class despite being a bit shy around new people. The main (katsu curry) and side dishes were delicious and we got plenty of tips about cookware, techniques, etiquette and even local sights. Thank you!

Sushi making in Tokyo . It was a great experience, and definitely a highlight of mRy trip so far. I saw the pictures on the website and didn't think my sushi would look anything like that. Thanks to a patient teacher we were all able to make some cool looking mosaic sushi. The instructions were clear and the explanations were really thorough. I would highly recommend Tokyo Kitchen to anyone looking to try their hand at Japanese cooking.

Fun and a really good experience. A really nice experience where we had much fun and learned a lot about japaneese food and culture.Yoshimi was a really good teacher and the class lasted 3 hours which gives you a lot of time to do other thing that dayRecomend this class to everyone who wants to learn more about Japans food or just having a good time

Wonderful!. I chose this course as it fitted my only free morning... & what a piece of luck that was! I really enjoyed the cookery school (beautiful location over looking the river) but even better was Yoshimi's information about Japanese culture. Highly recommend it.

Great experience!. We had the sushi roll class today and had a fantastic time! We didn't think we would be able to cook beautiful rolls but the result was great thanks to Yoshimi's guidance!We also learned how to cook miso soup, spinach with sesame and seasoned tofu. We really enjoyed the cooking and then the tasting!We definitely recommend Yoshimi's classes as she is really nice and welcoming and her place too is really pleasant!

Efficient and informative cooking class. Yoshimi is the perfect cooking class teacher; she speaks english very well, has lots of knowledge about japanese cuisine and is efficient and still proper while teaching the different courses. She's very sweet and has lots of good advices, both when it comes to cooking and sightseeing and shopping.If you contact Yoshimi in advance, you can yourselves decide what kind of food to make during the class!We were very satisfied with Yoshimi and this cooking class, and her appartment where she teaches cooking is centrally located and not too hard to find (especially if you meet up at the gate of the shrine).We really recommend Yoshimi and her Cooking class and will definitively og back NeXT time we're in Tokyo!

An amazing begin to our adventure in Tokyo!. We loved Yoshimi's cooking class! My mom and I took the class together and learned so much about Japanese cuisine and culture. Now I am able to cook multiple delicious dishes. The kitchen is a beautiful spot overlooking a river in Asakusa, which added to the experience of cooking. We made traditional Japanese fried chicken along with multiple side dishes, each of which we were able to fully experience making and tasting. At the end we ate our feast and truly enjoyed the flavor and deliciousness of the meal. Two thumbs up for Tokyo kitchen!

All questions answered!. We had a really fun morning learning the secrets of sushi. Then we ate lunch and Yoshimi answered all of our (many!) questions about Japanese food and culture. It was one of the best things that I did in Tokyo.

Oishi oishi. Today my 9 year old daughter and I did a mosaic sushi class with Yoshimi, in Akasuka. We had such a great time, and learnt so much about Japanese cuisine and table manners. We really loved this experience. Everything was straightforward from the booking, finding the meeting spot, and Yoshimi's knowledge and instruction were excellent. We had so much fun, lots of laughing and it was such a great thing to do in Tokyo. The food was incredible. So delicious, and definitely something we can replicate at home.I highly, highly, highly recommend this wonderful experience. You will not be disappointed!!

Japanese Pork Cutlet and Chicken Egg topping. Very easy to follow and fun to know about Japanese way of cooking and terms. I am such a bad cook, now I feel more confident and like to try more cooking.

Very nice cooking class and excellent tempura. We took a cooking class today and it was a very nice experience. We learned a lot about the Japanese cuisine and table manners. Afterwards we made some delicious tempura together with different side dishes using very fresh and well selected indigence. Our very nice teacher, Yoshimi, also took the time to answer all of our questions about Tokyo and Japan.Very much recommended.

Great Experience!. The cooking class is fantastic! Not only do you get to learn how to cook a delicious meal, but Yoshimi-san also spends time giving you information on Japanese cooking in general, along with the culture and dining etiquette. A most enjoyable and fun experience! Highly recommended!

Why this class is a "Must do" while in Tokyo. My husband I like to take a cooking class in every country. Cooking classes are a wonderful way to immerse yourself in the real customs of the country awhile sampling delicious local cuisines. We’ve been to the Cordon Bleu in Paris, classes in New Orleans, and many other places, but this experience in Tokyo Kitchen was by far my favorite!What makes this class outstanding:100% hands-on from the start! You put on aprons and Yoshi puts you to work! Unlike many other cooking classes where we played a passive role (occasionally chopping or prepping), we made our own dishes, under Yoshi’s tutelage.Yoshi met us at a central location and we walked to her kitchen together.Before cooking, Yoshi treated us to a culinary and cultural lesson (everything from proper chopstick etiquette to the Japanese words for different food textures. This really made us feel as if we understood not only the food, but the delicious culture surrounding the food and customs.The class can be customized and scaled. We were on a business trip with several others form America and Canada. We ended up being an intimate party of 3, but Yoshi remained flexible. Yoshi was informative, and we kept the class on schedule (we were meeting others in our party at an assigned time after the class) but she took the time to answer questions and go on tangents when needed!Highly recommended!!

Great Tokyo experience. Did a tempura cooking class with Tokyo Kitchen in Feb 2015. Yoshi was an incredible host and so flexible and accommodating. From changing the menu specifically for us, to allowing us to do an evening class rather than a daytime one, everything was perfect. We had a great time and would highly recommend this experience to anyone.

Great intro to Japanese home cooking. We were at the end of a twelve day trip to Japan when we took this wonderful course with Yoshimi-san. She met us at the Asakusa shrine gate for a five minute walk to her kitchen. All was laid out and ready for a classic menu: miso soup, chilled tofu, spinach and tonkatsu in curry on rice. We managed the whole thing, including dining time, in about two hours, an accelerated pace that accommodated my flight time. The instructions were simple and beautifully demonstrated, allowing us to follow easily in the prep of the meal. Technique was straightforward and would all be easily replicated at home (as I've since proven, following my return). For me, the most instructive part of the class was in the handling of unfamiliar ingredients. It all turns out to be very easy. Mishimi-san is a wonderful teacher, moving smoothly through the courses and prep steps but making sure we were following. She is a fount of knowledge on Japanese cuisine and begins the class with a brief intro on the basics of Japanese food culture. Her English is very good. This is a great value, a strong lesson and lots of fun. Highest recommendation.
Great experience, highly recommended.. Yoshimi is such a fantastic teacher and great fun too! I'm recommending to any friends that visit Tokyo..

Yummy and Fun!. Had a great time at Tokyo Kitchen. You can read my review on my blog. http://www.bestlivingjapan.com/tokyo-kitchen-japanese-cooking-class/The other day I took the Tonkatsu Curry (fried pork chop and curry) class at Tokyo Kitchen in Asakusa. One of my personal goals, this year is to learn how to cook Japanese food proper. To find the right school for me I tried out Tokyo Kitchen. Yoshimi, owner and sensei, met me in front of the Kaninari -Mon (big red gate) at Senso-ji (Senso Temple) in Asakusa. She was easy to spot dressed elegantly in a kimono. We walked about 3-5 mins to her cooking studio on the Sumida River. I think Yoshimi gets the award for best cooking class view. The view must be gorgeous when the cherry blossoms are in bloom. The cooking studio is comprised of two rooms a kitchen and dining room that are newly renovated, bright and well equipped. The place is spotless since Yoshimi just started her business in August 2014. I was the only student for my lesson that was great for me (maybe not good for Yoshimi). Yoshimi began the lesson by teaching me about the basics of Japanese seasonings and flavours, table manner and an overview what and how we were going to cook. You can tell Yoshimi's background is in consumer products purchasing and marketing because her printed materials and explanations are excellent.The main dish was Katsu-curry, but I also learned three side dishes. Love all of them, as my family did as well. The side dishes included 1. blanched spinach with sesame dressing, 2. tofu with tomato, ginger and onion topping and 3. potato miso soup. That meant we needed to actually cook curry, rice, katsu (pork cutlet) and three side dishes! Despite the diversity of dishes, Yoshimi was able to walk me through each step of each dish quite well. I have since reproduced this menu twice at home with good reviews from my tribe. I also learned some tricks of the trade such adding garlic or a piece of chocolate to curry, draining tofu for 30 mins before making salad and chopping katsu, not slicing. After cooking, we sat down together and enjoyed a wonderful lunch with hot tea and green tea ice-cream.I really enjoyed my lesson with Yoshimi and think she will build a great business for herself. All she needs is more students. Support this young mother who is trying to make her dream come true! She even made a short video of our day together and has it on her website.Tokyo Kitchen also has special menus for private lessons, offers a 1/2 day cooking and 1/2 day tour in Asakusa, and offers a Kimono dressing class for women!Differentiators: Beautiful view of Sumida river, the wide variety of classes, instruction into flavours and manners, very useful recipe cards to take home, and received a gift of drink coasters.Possible improvements: Needed to stand the entire lesson (ok, for me but not everyone). Kitchen areas may be a bit tight for more than four people, but additional dining area could be used. Pricing might need to be adjusted per menu (all the same set price now).

Highly Recommend. Highly recommend Tokyo Kitchen cooking for anyone who wants to have a great time learning about Japanese cuisine and customs while creating incredibly delicious traditional Japanese food from fresh seasonal ingredients. Yoshimi is a fantastic teacher who is very friendly and good fun. Lessons are insightful, easy to follow and enjoyable. Yoshimi provides information and handy recipe cards so that you can remake with confidence at home the delicious meal prepared in class. The location of the kitchen is alongside the Sumida river with picturesque views overlooking the cherry blossom filled park with Tokyo Skytree towering in the background. We had a great time preparing a beautiful looking and delicious meal and were amazed at the final product. Thank you Yoshimi for a great cooking class and we look forward to our next Tokyo visit and cooking class with you!
Brilliant time!. The cooking classes were great, Yoshimi went through everything concisely and the execution was delicious! Would highly recommend. Thanks again!

Had a fantastic morning. We had a fantastic morning creating the Japanese dish we chose. The host was friendly and extremely informative. We were taking the lesson with another couple, and we all got on well together, and had a laugh over dinner. Highly recommended!

A fantastic japense cooking experience. I booked the bear and bunny shaped sushi class. Despite very little cooking experience and thanks to Yoshimi's patience and kindness, I learnt not only to make sushi but also miso soup and different side dishes. Yoshimi also gives a lot of advices and cooking tips as well as a thorough history of traditional Japanese food. I had a lovely time and learnt so much! A highlight of my time in Tokyo!

Great experience when in Tokyo - Must do!. We booked a tempura cooking class last week. Yoshimi was a lovely host, teaching us about Japanese seasonings, cuisine, etiquette and how to make dashi, rice, side dishes as well as the tempura. My partner and I had a great time, this was definitely a highlight of our trip, we have even bought everything to make the same meal for our friends back home!

Wonderful cooking class!. Yoshimi was an amazibg host. She taught us about seasoning, culture and how to be a polite vistor to Japan. The cooking class was small and had lot of hands on cooking. And the food was delicious! Would recommend this to anyone!

Excellent!!!. Yoshimi is wonderful, and her class was definitely a big highlight of our trip to Tokyo! I love Japanese food but I have celiac disease,which makes it very difficult to eat out. On top of that my partner is vegetarian. Yoshimi carefully went through her menu with me and found gluten-free soy sauce and miso paste, and we made a tasty selection of sushi with miso soup and two side dishes. Everything about the class was just brilliant, from insights into Japanese food culture to the delicious meal.Thankyou again Yoshimi! We are looking forward to making the dishes again at home! :)

A memorable experience if you want to do something different. After visiting Japan numerous times, I was keen to do a cooking class this time round something that's a little bit different - the ease of online booking and convenient location decided it for me and I made a day of it in Asakusa. Yoshimi met me right on time and it was a quick 5mins walk to the apartment. I did the tempura main dish and it was really not that difficult, Yoshimi is so friendly and very patient in answering my questions - I learnt about the Japanese "ginger" and also bought the bonito flakes and konbu from a nearby supermarket. The lunch was enjoyable on what was a crisp early winter day and a bonus, Yoshimi shared some restaurant recommendations for places I was going to visit. I plan to replicate the meal for my family this holiday season and will certainly try do another course next time in Tokyo. I also liked the homecooking style is authentic and achievable; recipe cards are fantastic, very handy in the kitchen. If you have a morning to spare, definitely recommend a unique experience.

Such a great day with Yoshimi!. We booked the tempura cooking class and then foodie tour in the afternoon. We had such a great day with Yoshimi. She is a very warm and relaxed person who showed us her love of Japanese cooking and Japanese culture. She met us on time at the meeting place and took us back to the cooking studio/apartment in Asakusa. We prepared a delicious meal of tempura, tofu, spinach, rice with a green tea ice cream treat for dessert. Yoshimi is very organised and explained all of her procedures and recipes clearly. She also talked about Japanese culture and eating, which we found really interesting. Our afternoon saw us visit the Imperial Palace, a food market and department store food floor, which was fun to learn about all the different foods and preparations. We had some great laughs and really enjoyed the company of Yoshimi. I would highly recommend this tour for a full packed day of interesting hands on activities, lots of useful knowledge on Japan and good company.

So worthwhile!!. The cooking class with Yoshimi was a fantastic experience! Yoshimi met us at the Kaminarimon gates and we walked together back to the apartment. My two friends and I had a great time learning how to cook the tempura main dish as well as a couple of side dishes. The food was delicious and Yoshimi was great company. A real highlight of the class was spending some time talking after lunch about the differences between our cultures - Yoshimi was surprised to learn about the Australian custom of a beer fridge!! It was also great to be able to take away recipe cards. I would definitely recommend taking the class early in the trip as Yoshimi taught us etiquette basics as well as important information about the composition and significance of Japanese food. A must do! Thanks Yoshimi!!

Everything we had hoped for. We have done a number of cooking classes around the world and this one certainly is up there with the best. Yoshimi takes you through not only how to cook Japanese food but also the etiquette of eating which is great as we did the class two days into our trip - highly recommend doing this class early into your trip. We did the tempura class which was great and incorporated many side dishes- you certainly will be full when you finish eating!! Yoshimi is very welcoming and speaks very good English and answered all our questions we had not only about Japanese cooking but Japan in general. The view from the kitchen and dining area is also incredible! If you are in Tokyo you would be silly to miss out on this incredible experience!

Must do Tokyo cooking experience.. I spent an absolutely lovely morning learning how to make Japanese Curry and some yummy side dishes. Yoshimi is lovley and gives a great lesson on Japanese cuisine (and chopstick etiquette) before cooking. Being the first person to book on my chosen day I was able to choose the dish I wanted to learn how to make. Yoshimi is very fluent in english and her instructions are easy to follow. I am looking forward to using the colour printed recipe instruction cards. Thank you for great morning and the poncho to keep me dry!

Great experience even if you know how to cook!. It was great to learn to cook a Japanese meal properly - I found out the reasons why my tempura never turn out crispy and light. Yoshimi tells you tips not found in cooking books. The class is well organised and informative. Learning the basics will give anyone the confidence to cook Japanese food. We enjoyed a great meal at the end. All visitors to Japan should try it! Thank you Yoshimi!Lily from Australia

Authentic Japanese Cooking Class. I can only agree with the other reviews, if you have the time and the chance to book a class with Yoshimi - DO IT! She is a great teacher, and also a gracious and welcoming host. The experience was definitely a game changer and a true blessing to have had this opportunity. Thank you so much for all of your helpful insights into the Japanese culture and cuisine.I'd come back for another lesson at any time and highly recommend this to everybody!

Total absolute experience-an absolute MUST when in Tokyo. So you like Japanese food, hey? Tokyo is the vildest place on earth for food. So why not learn the Japanese food culture once and for all: this is the place to be. First class greating by a real lady who will go through the Japanese way towards food that is all about respect for the best. Then you go to the learning by doing phase with all explanations of why's and how with the basic techniques that apply to all fundamentals. The "teacher" masters her knowhow, explains it so well that you really get into it and in a nice kitchen with a great view on the river,you learn exactly what needs to ne done. All the tricks are revealed and the teaching is in a perfect English.
