You cut, cook, fry, etc.... in a learn by doing process and when it's all ready you eat the meals that have been prepared and continue sharing. This was the best experience an absolute MUST. And when you're back on the streets again, you not only learned how to prepare the best food in the world but you say to yourself that you have met one of the top persons you will meet during your life. I will never forget this and only rencourage all types of visiter to join her next classes. Thanks again and I can't wait to be back home to apply all I've learned.

Fabulous experience!. This was a super experience! One of the highlights of my trip. Yoshimi is gracious and kind. The food was great. She was so helpful and explained the steps for sushi making with ease and perfect English. The kids at home are thrilled that mom now knows how to make sushi!Thanks Yoshimi!

Best cultural experience in Tokyo!. Without doubt the most interesting activity to do in Tokyo! I made the Teddy bear bento box with miso soup and chilled tofu. All were so delicious! Plus it is home style cooking, relatively simple, so I'm looking forward to trying to make it at home. I learnt so much about Japanese traditions and customs too, which I didn't expect but was a very welcome surprise. I can't recommend this class highly enough!

Great experience in Tokyo - must do!. Towards the end of our three week trip to Japan we decided to take part in Yoshimi's cooking class in Tokyo - we wish we had done it earlier!! Using Yoshimi's website to make our booking was extremely straightforward and she was really helpful in explaining what we could cook and accommodated our request to cook tonkatsu. Meeting Yoshimi was easy - clear instructions on time and place of the meeting point are sent via email upon booking. As a tourist in Japan having the planning done for you is so helpful, thank you!The location of Yoshimi's kitchen is perfect - a short, lovely walk to a great spot over looking the river and the Sky Tower. The class started with an introduction to Japanese cooking and food etiquette including correct use of chopsticks - we realised we had made a lot of mistakes in the first two weeks of our trip!The cooking experience was great. Yoshimi was very inclusive and made sure we understood every step of the recipe and explained why we were using certain ingredients and techniques for the meal we were creating. We had so much fun and the food was delicious - worth every penny. I would highly recommend Tokyo Kitchen and based on the quick lesson at the beginning around food etiquette in Japan I would recommend you do this class early on in your trip so that you don't use your chopsticks to stab your food :-) Thanks Yoshimi!
teddy and bunny maki menu. Thanks a lot for your warm welcoming and cooking class, it was a great experience. i got the sushi set in a supermarket in Kyoto just after the class haha!Arigato !!

Intimate cooking experience. I wanted to learn to cook　Ｏｋｏｎｏｍｉｙａｋｉ and Yoshimi kindly tailored the class for me.　Ｉｔ　ｗａｓ　ｈｅｌｐｆｕｌ　ｆｏｒ　ｈｅｒ　ｔｏ　ｍｅｅｔ　ｍｅ　ａｔ　ａ　ｔｏｕｒｉｓｔ　ｌａｎｄｍａｒｋ　ａｎｄ　ｈｅｒ　Ｅｎｇｌｉｓｈ　ｉｓ　ｗｏｎｄｅｒｆｕｌ．Ⅰ　ｅｎｊｏｙｅｄ　learning more about what makes Japanese cuisine unique and how to improve my table manners and it was fun and easy to prepare the Okonomiyaki and side dishes.　I would highly recommend this class. Yoshimi is very warm, accommodating and a great teacher.

Really fun cooking class in Tokyo. We really enjoyed our cooking class. Yoshimi's English is impeccable and she told us all about cooking, serving and eating food in Japan - we particularly liked the lesson on chopstick etiquette. We had specifically requested tonkatsu and Yoshimi added a selection of other delicious dishes. So we cooked a lot more than we expected and it all looked so beautiful and tasted so good. We left feeling not only that we had cooked and eaten a delicious lunch, but that we had learnt lots about Japan. Yoshimi is a great host as well as a great teacher so we really enjoyed spending the morning with her and are looking forward to another lesson.

A Wonderful Host and Awesome Food. The cooking class with Yoshimi was really great. She is super nice, easy going and a great teacher. We took the sushi class and Yoshimi tought us a lot about Japanese table manners and the general seasoning of Japanese food. The recepies we learned are extremely tasty but easy to make, something we can repeat at home on our own. While cooking she took a tiny movie of the class, that is really cute, all my facebook friends love it. All in all a truely wonderful experience.

A real introduction to Japanese cuisine!. Yoshimi took us to her lovely appartement and at first taught us (she has very good English) about Japanese table manners. After the lesson, she gave us detailed recepies of our meal and explained us which ingredients to buy and where. This way, when we go back home, we will be able to get to the same results on our own. It really was a great experience!

Great experience. This was a fantastic experience. The class took 2.5 hrs and within this time we prepared a main course, miso soup, and two side dishes, which we subsequently ate together, chatting about good places to eat around Tokyo. Yoshimi is very friendly and easy to talk to, and her explanations of the cooking process and ingredients were excellent. The recipes she selected were really easy to prepare, yet taste great, and I have been cooking them non stop since returning home! The location is convenient and very easy to find, and the view from the dining room is stunning. What was extraordinary though, was the introduction to Japanese food culture, that preceded the cooking. I have learnt a great deal from it - how a Japanese meal is composed, how you mix textures and tastes, how you mix ingredients, and my favourite - chopsticks savoir vivre. Overall - it was a great experience, both in culinary and cultural terms and I highly recommend it.

Great lesson in the why's and how's of Japanese Cuisine. I strongly recommend this class to anyone wanting to lean to cook Japanese food. Yoshimi explained the background and principles behind the dishes we prepared. The recipes were very tasty and easy, and the basics will allow us to expand the foods we can cook Japanese style.

Culture for the taste buds !. As other reviews have said, this class is full of information! Not only hands on preparation of good food but the reasons why each type of food is chosen. For a newcomer to Japan it really just made sense! As I finished my vacation in Japan I realized just how much I had learned. Each dish in each meal had a purpose. Thank you so much! This should be one of the first experiences anyone has in Tokyo!

BENTO BOXES FOR KIDS. I would recommend it to anyone who wants to learn about basic Japanese Home Cooking. The foods that we cooked were so tasteful. Yoshimi is so good at making cute Bento Boxes for the kids! To all the Moms - Does your kid trade his or her lunch at recess, or go all day without eating? Anyone with wee ones knows kids can be very choosy eaters. So how do parents prepare interesting and appealing lunches kids will eat. Here is the answer Try the Bento Box for kids – these creative lunch ideas will keep your kid munching !

Fun and practical cooking class that we can replicate at home!. It was a pleasant surprise from my husband for our one year anniversary. I tried to cook some Japanese dishes at home before by following recipe books. Only until the cooking class with Yoshime I realized the importance of hands on experience. In addition, Yoshime has a very down to earth personality which makes the whole experience even better. I highly recommend anyone interested in Japanese food/ cooking to attend this class and I hope you will enjoy the class as much as I did ;)

fun cooking experience. This class is highly recommendable for a quick 2-3 h insight in Japanese cuisine, with hands-on experience, recipes to take home and enough instructions to repeat the home-style dishes again yourself. A fun experience in a very pleasant atmosphere.

One of Tokyo's must do!. It a great experience learning about the intricacies of Japanese culture and food. Yoshimi was not only knowledgable but personable. Her cooking school is fairly young compared to others in the area, however her passion for food shines through. She was also quick to respond to our emails and tailored our cooking class. This is a must do for any foodie! Anél & Donna

Wonderful experience even for Japanese. We went there with our friends from the USA. Yoshimi taught us not only Japanese cooking but also background knowledge on Japanese cuisine, Japanese culture, and so on. She kindly arranged the menu upon our request (with additional fee). Within a limited time, Yoshimi and we cooked sushi roll, braised beef and potatoes (niku-jaga), miso soup, and small dishes. Her English instruction was very nice and it really helped us. It was a lot of fun to cook with international friends. Before their departure, we cooked roll sushi and small dishes again at home, which was a really precious experience for us.

Awesome way to experience Japanese culture and cuisine!. I did the cooking class with my two kids during our short stay in Tokyo . Yoshimi explained to us about the dos and don'ts of chopsticks, the main seasoning and flavors of Japanese cuisine and other basics. Then we got to cooking! We did some prep work for our meal and she helped us prepare it and showed us how to do it properly. We made Japanese beef stew, miso soup, rice tofu with a topping of dressed tomato salad and egg roll! Overall it was a great class and a must do if you are in Tokyo! I would definitely recommend this!

One of My Best Experiences in Tokyo!. This was such an amazing experience! Yoshimi is a wonderful teacher. Her lesson was very clear, and she really took her time to explain the foundation of Japanese cooking to us before we got started. The class was interactive and fun, and the food was absolutely delicious! I will recommend this class to everyone!

A taste of Japanese culture. I was looking for a Japanese cooking class that taught real Japanese cooking in English and We found Yoshimi san's website and it ticked all the boxes. She was waiting for us at Sensoji Temple in Asakusa wearing a kimono and holding her "Asakusa Tokyo Kitchen" sign so she wasn't hard to miss. What an introduction to Japanese culture and cuisine!! My daughter and I had a fantastic time learning from Yoshimi San in her private kitchen with a great view of the Tokyo Skytree. It was a very relaxed and fun atmosphere to learn. Finally I've learnt how to cook tamagoyaki - one of the Japanese foods that I've always wanted to make for my kids. We'll be back again definitely!

Cooking Japanese Food is So Fun. My wife and I are so glad, we stumbled upon the weblink to this class. The website was easy to navigate and the information was so very detailed I had no question as to where to meet, or what to expect. The meeting spot is a perfect choice especially if you would prefer to show up earlier to do a little shopping. Yoshimi san arrived at the meeting spot wearing a lovely summer kimono. After a short but beautiful walk along the river we arrived to the cooking class. Yoshimi's english is impressive as she speaks very clearly and pronunciates very well. The brief history, meanings, and food culture of Japan was really helpful in understanding why certain foods, ingredients, etc are used. She takes her time in both explaining and demonstrating the preparation and cooking of each food item. We never felt rushed to get through any food item. The hands on cooking portion was awesome. What we prepared turned out so delicious (Oishi des - in Japanese). The icing on the cake was after the class finished their meal, Yoshimi, my wife and I, and the other class member sat for the next hour laughing and getting to know each other. Yoshimi makes you feel so at home and welcome. We plan to visit Tokyo again - for sure we will book another class with Yoshimi.

An unforgettable introduction to Japanese cuisine. My husband and I are visiting Japan for two weeks and joined this class early in the trip because Yoshimi had a great website, it was easy to book online and created a menu that we could do at home. We asked if she could teach us to cook okonomiyaki instead of her posted menu and she was incredibly prepared on the day to make that and show us two other easy side dishes. We had a lot of fun spending time with her and learning what ingredients went into Japanese dishes. We are lucky to be able to buy all the ingredients close to home. She explained what to look for if we didn't have the same at home and why that substitution was acceptable. I highly recommend that anyone wanting to deepen their cultural understanding spend a morning and delicious meal here.

Yummy, Thanks to Yoshimi !. My husband and I went to Yoshimi cooking class in Tokyo. As it was our first time in Japan, we wanted to discover things from the inside... Booking the class was really easy from France and Yoshimi changed the menu for us om à simple asking ! She gave us rendez-vous at a really easy place to find, and I can assure that you will find her when you'll go to your cooking class !The class took place in an appartment from Where you have a gréât view on Tokyo's river and famous Sky Tree...Yoshimi first explained us how japanese food is and why it's so healthy and everything you need to know.Then we cooked a Teddy bento, which was really interesting an fun !Finally, we ate our lunch wich was really yummy !We had a dessert too that we hadn't cooked but what a nice surprise !And, we left with a sooo nice gift again. I won't tell you what, it's a surprise !Yoshimi is a really nice person, patient, and She explains clearly everything. We had a great time and we highly recommend it to you !

Yushimi cooking class is excellent. My wife attended Yushimi's cooking class and enjoyed learning from Yushimi.She has learned a lot from Yushimi's cooking class. Yushimi is very friendly and has good knowledge in Japanese food.My wife learned how the ingredients are used, foods that Japanese will eat in different seasons, how to keep the food fresh as well as the way to present the food.They cooked Tempura as the main dish, and it is the most delicious Tempura my wife had during this Japan trip.She feels it is interesting to learn the cooking in Japan with Yushimi wearing her Yukata and Yushimi made her feel very welcomed.She highly recommends Yushimi's cooking class.

I cooked Japanese food!. So my wife made this booking because of the reviews on Tripadvisor. We went two weeks ago, and this was as advertised. Mayuko is a doll and is also a terrific cook and teacher. I can barely boil and egg, but by the end of the session we had a really nice lunch cooked by me (and mostly my wife and the other couple). She supplied the ingredients and the instruction and we did the rest. Besides cooking, she also spent time talking about Japanese culture and made us feel like long time friends. When I go back to Japan, I am going to book this again. Well worth the time.

Chicken teriyaki, yummi!. We loved Mayukos cooking class! Mayuko picked us up at the metro station and brought us to her home. Her home is in a very quiet and peaceful area even though being in the middle of Tokyo. In her cosy little kitchen, she started with explaining us some basic concepts of Japanese cooking. Her English is perfect. Then, we cut all the ingredients for teriyaki chicken, miso potatoes, cucumber salad and miso soup and started cooking. Mayuko explained everything in a very understandable way, flavoured with a pinch of humor, and we are positive that we can cook this delicious meal at home without big accidents. Before eating, she explained us how to arrange the food in little “mountains” on the plates because with the mountain-form, you can be sure that nobody pinched from your plate while you were not watching ;-) Finally, we were ready for the first bite and it was YUMMY!

Like visiting a long-lost friend. I visited Mayuko during a trip to Tokyo in autumn 2016, where I opted for a class of tofu-based recipes. She offers the classes in her own house, which naturally creates a very cozy atmosphere. She makes you feel at ease right away. In excellent English, Mayuko patiently explained the basic ingredients and cooking techniques, as well as the customs associated with the meal. She is both an excellent cook and a very knowledgeable person. Throughout the course, we merrily chattered away on a broad range of topics. She even recommended some good restaurants to go, which led to another memorable experience (but that's another review). In all, if you happen to be in Tokyo, do not pass on the opportunity to visit Mayuko.

Wonderful cooking class with Mayuko!. We had a wonderful experience taking a cooking class with Mayuko. She is a terrific teacher and a very warm and friendly person. We enjoyed learning about the making of a traditional Japanese meal and the ingredients that go into it. The meal came out delicious and it truly was one of the highlights of our trip to Japan. I highly recommend Mayuko and her cooking class!!

Best cooking class we've ever done - anywhere!. We travel regularly and a major reason is we love trying different foods, so we try to do a cooking class in every country we go to. Mayuko's is by far the best we've done anywhere. She is a lovely, bubbly person who just makes you want to smile.Mayuko welcomed us at the train station and we took a quick stroll to her apartment. It was so lovely to be invited into her home. No question was a stupid one and we learnt some much about the customs in japan.We cooked chicken karaage (Yummy Japanese Fried Chicken which we love) two side dishes and miso soup. I loved learning to make Dashi and alsoloved learning about the different type of miso.Mayuko also gave us some tips on where to go and wrote down some instructions on how to get there.This is so much more than a cooking class, it's a must do when you're in Toyko!

Experience True Enjoyment and Hospitality. This was our first time every doing a cooking class period. We were excited about it, but had no idea what to expect. When I first contacted Mayuko, she responded within 12 hours and setting up the menu and time / date of the class was a breeze. She gives you all the information needed as far as where to meet.The class itself was amazing. She goes through and not only explains the dish you will make, but also goes into detail about what each ingredient is and why it is used in Japanese cooking. She provides everything, from her cozy and lovely apartment to the music of your choice! The atmosphere is perfect. You will undoubtedly learn some great tips and tricks as we did, and if you are lucky to have others in your class, you will meet some amazing new people from around the world!I highly recommend this experience to anyone visiting Tokyo looking for something which will teach them about Japan and its culture. A Must Do!! Thank you Mayuko!!

Great Experience!. Visiting and cooking in Mayuko's little kitchen was a highlight of our trip. Mayuko is very welcoming and provided us with great insight into Japanese cooking and culture. She gave us great tips on how to prepare sushi on our return. I would definitely recommend this experience!

Warm hospitality in a real Tokyo home. We were met at Mayuko's nearby station and took the brief walk to her home, where we spent the next 2.5 hours learning about some of the staples of Japanese cooking - sushi, miso and Meal presentation. But this class is so much more. Because you are in a real home you are presented with how hospitality is managed and what some of the customs mean. Everyone has an opportunity to be hands on with both preparation and presentation and then at the end, you share a meal with your new friends. Mayuko is warm and generous, knowing both how to teach and how to host. Her generosity with information and ingredients was absolutely a stand out aspect of this class. I would recommend this to anyone wanting to find out where to begin with Japanese cooking and also eating. Definitely one of the most worthwhile activities of our two weeks in Japan.

One of our favorite activities in Tokyo!. We loved our class with Mayuko! She has an infectious, sunny personality, and instantly felt like a good friend. She was very welcoming into her kitchen, and gave us a great background of typical Japanese ingredients. We made Japanese dumplings, miso soup, and 2 other side dishes. Her instructions were clear, and she made the class fun and interactive. On top of the great experience, the food was delicious, too! Her class was a highlight of our trip to Japan. Highly recommend!

#1 food in Japan, cooking with Mayuko!!. Amazing cooking class!! I loved the class, from the very beginning, Mayuko was extremely welcoming and made me feel right at home. I've learnt many tips and had a great experience that will stay with me for a lifetime!!Exceptional food, just as good as a five star restaurant!! Teriyaki chicken, Gyoza, cabbage side dishes and miso soup get my appreciation and 10/10!I loved the detail Mayuko went into each ingredient, and multiple uses outside the set menu we were cooking. She is extremely helpful, and a great host.Will be recommending to my friends, and will pop back in next time coming to Tokyo!!

Great cooking class, with a lot of knowledge about japanese ingredients. I spent a good evening with this cooking class - Mayuko has welcomed me warmly and speaks perfectly english so that I have learned a lot about japonese (healthy) ingredients, like miso and tofu, how to use and keep them. The size of cooking group was good, a small group with open-minded people (we have been 5 persons for the whole group), the atmosphere was nice (everything has been well prepared by Mayuko) and the cooked food so delicious. Thank you, Mayuko! Arigato gozaimasu.

Amazing cooking class!!!!. I loved this cooking class!!! Mayuko was a great host, and instructor. I'm a home cook/foodie that had a little bit of prior experience making Japanese food (sushi, ramen, hot pots), but there were holes in my knowledge that prevented me from feeling confident when preparing it. Mayuko's Little Kitchen cooking class helped fill some of these holes and I now feel like I understand Japanese cuisine much better, and I will try making it at home again. For our class, we made gyoza, cucumber seaweed and sesame salad, miso soup and kabochano squash. All of the dishes were very simple to prepare, but incredibly flavorful. After I finish writing this review, I'm going to make some miso soup :) When I visit Tokyo again I will definitely take another class with Mayuko.

Best Gyozas Ever!. We absolutely loved Mayuko's cooking class and can highly recommend it. Set in Mayuko's great little apartment, this was a very intimate culinary as well as cultural experience that felt very much like an afternoon cooking with friends. Mayuko was wonderful and showed us step by step how to prepare the food and how to visually present it. And on top of that, it all tasted amazing!
Wonderful Experience. Mayuko was a fabulous host! I highly recommend this activity. She taught us alot and was very welcoming.

Great experience with Mayuko!. I am a Japanese and joined her panda bento box cooking class.I have never tried Character bento box before, but I really enjoyed! It was so fun and easy, but looks so lovely as a result. I would like to recommend to Japanese people, too. Mayuko is really kind and good at make us relax. Thank you so much for your class, Mayuko teacher!Her kitchen is very close to Shinjuku Gyoen park, so take a nice walk before or after is highly recommended, too.

What a Treat!. We had five participants in our class, and had a fantastic time. Mayuko spoke wonderful English, and was helpful in answering all of our questions. We learned about Japanese culture, traditional foods, and how to make three dishes. Mayuko was well prepared to keep everything moving along well, but allowed enough of the preparation to be done by the participants so we could learn and remember how to do it in our own country. It was a fabulous experience and would recommend it during your visit to Japan!

Excellent cooking class. Mayuko was very well prepared and knowledgeable. She is also very kind and friendly. Together all of these qualities make her a great teacher. We learned a lot about Japanese cuisine during our 3 hour group class as well as enjoyed getting to know Mayuko and the other guests. This was one of our best experiences on our trip to Japan!

Family cooking class. Mayuko went above and beyond. She was really great with my older children and her food was delicious. We had a hands on cooking experience and learned about the typical flavors and ingredients of traditional Japanese cuisine. We made fresh sushi and teriyaki chicken that was absolutely delicious. What a wonderful experience to learn to cook typical Japanese foods and learn about the culture while visiting Japan. I highly recommend Mayuko's Little Kitchen!
Fun and informative!. Had a lovely morning in Mayuko's kitchen. Learnt a lot about ingredients and traditions. Thanks Mayuko!!!!

An unforgetable evening. We did a cookingclass with Mayuko with three dutch friends. We loved it. First of all Mayuko was really social, funny and made us feel at home. The cooking was great: we made okonomiyaki and a few sidedishes like miso, lovely patatoes and salad with a very tasty dressing. Mayoku told us al lot about the ingredients, the way of preparing it etc. Mayuko speaks very good english. Beside of all that: check the mayonaise-dispenser, we loved it and will definitely take it with us to Holland. It was a lovely experience, Mayuko, once again: arigatou!,

Couldn't have asked for more! . We didn't know what to expect but this cooking class turned out to be an amazing and invaluable experience! Mayuko was a very informative and pleasant host, very well organised and even with a group of 6, everyone was able to get involved and felt comfortable around each other. Her place was very easy to get to from Shinjuku (where we were staying) and was very cosy and welcoming. The lesson focused on Gyoza and tempura. We also made miso soup and sesame cucumber salad with Wakame seaweed. We learned so much and the food was delicious! I definitely recommend paying Mayuko a visit and learning about Japanese food and culture!

Wonderful cooking class. This cooking class was really one of the highlights of our trip. Mayuko picked us up from the subway and took us to her beautiful home and we really felt very welcome. We had opted for cooking Okonomiyaki and it was a great choice. Mayuko took time to explain many details about Japanese cooking and culture and we also cooked delicious side dishes and soup. Our group had different levels of previous cooking experience and the class was equally interesting and fun for everyone! We really enjoyed learning so much and sharing many laughs! we will definitely come back on our next trip to Tokyo. Thank you again Mayuko

Really good cooking class. We made four dishes with Mayuko, which were all tasty and easy to make. Mayuko speaks excellent English and talked us through everything. She was also happy to answer any questions about Tokyo or Japanese culture. Overall a really good experience and well worth doing during a trip to Tokyo.

Fantastic and Intimate Cooking Experience. This class was a highlight of our trip to Japan, and my friends and I (four guys in our late twenties) are so glad we decided to do this. Mayuko met us at the train station and we walked over to her kitchen, which is small and cozy. The dish we made, salmon in foil with vegetables, was delicious - especially the Japanese potatoes, which I'll definitely be making again. Mayuko did a great job describing the key ingredients used in Japanese cooking and in involving each of the 6 members of our group in the cooking process. One of the parts I enjoyed the most was the conversation during and after the meal. It was great to get Mayuko's thoughts on life in Japan (her English is very good) and then for us to compare that with our experience in America. Overall, highly recommended.

The best cooking class in Japan!!. Me and my husband went to this cooking class and was one of the best moments in our holidays in Japan. Mayuko is a nice and such talent cooking chef. We learn a lot with her and had wonderful experience and delicious lunch.I deeplu recommend Mayuko's cooking class!! :-)

Fantastic cooking class in downtown Tokyo. Mayuko was a wonderful teacher!! We had such a fun time learning to make okonomiyaki and other traditional Japanese dishes. I would highly recommend this activity to anyone visiting Tokyo!

Best part of Tokyo. Mayuko's class was definitely one of the best things I have done on vacation. The panda bento box was definitely adorable, and very delicious. As she keeps her class sizes small, it was great to have a personalized experience, and since no one else was there, I got a private lesson! I learned so much about Japan and Japanese culture from Mayuko, as well as getting to experience some delicious food! I would hands-down recommend this to anyone traveling to Japan, it is a great time, with a wonderful and kind person, who is extremely helpful. Don't miss out on this amazing experience!

Great cooking experience. We had a wonderful experience cooking with Mayuko. She let us select two main dishes and they were amazing (okonomiyaki and donabe). We also had two side dishes that were equally good and easy for a dinner party. We were in Japan on our honeymoon, and Mayuko even prepared a special gift for us. Mayuko had professional training and was very knowledgable about Japanese cuisine. Would definitely recommend!

Super way to spend a day. Mayuko is a wonderful host and presents the cookery class is a friendly and informative way. There is no feeling of pressure or urgency, just a relaxed, informative and enjoyable session. My family all went and the food we prepared was tasty and I was glad to learn more about Japanese cuisine. Highly recommended.
Highlight of our trip to Japan. The workshop with Mayuko was one of the highlights of our trip to Japan. Besides being a skilled cook Mayuko is also very kind, open and helpful. Highly recommended!

Delicious food, Amazing atmosphere. This was definitely a highlight in our trip to Japan. Mayuko is so welcoming and knowledgeable and speaks perfect English. As well as teaching how to cook traditional Japanese food, she also explained about different flavours and the history of Japanese cuisine. After the lesson she referred us to some of her favourite restaurants around Tokyo, and also gave advice on some things to see and do. 10/10 for sure.

Learning to cook in Japan. One of the most memorable experiences of our trip to Japan was the Japanese cooking class we took from Mayuko. She is very knowledgeable of the nuances of history, flavor, texture, pairing, and presentation of Japanese food. On top of that, she is a great communicator.She is also flexible and creative. We prepared vegan (for my vegan mate) and regular sushi and miso soup side by side. All turned out looking very good and delicious. I highly recommend Mayuko for the best and fun experience in learning how to prepare Japanese food.

Excellent!. Mayuko was a very gracious and welcoming host, she is really eager to share her love for japanese food in a very humble way and friendly atmosphere. She speaks very well english and was able to explain us a lot of the subtilities of japanese cooking as well as to answer all of our questions. I strongly recommend this experience !

Most unforgettable experience in Tokyo. My daughter (5) and I had the most amazing experience with Mayuko san. Mayuko's Star War bento box class was fun and exciting for both adults and kids. She was very patient, warm and inviting. My daughter was taken by her immediately. The class was about an hour and a half and it was my daughter's first cooking class. The steps and methods Mayuko provides was just right for both of us. After the class, we walked to Shinjuku gyoen and had a Star War bento picnic outside by the lake. It was such an unforgettable experience. I hope we get to visit her other classes next time we come back to Tokyo. Thank you! Mayuko san!

Splendid Experience. I joined the Star Wars bento class on 31th July and did have a very good time there. Mayuko san was a very good host with warm welcome and super service mind. Her email replies was constant and fast. Her class was easy to understand and effective; even I who do not regularly cook could make a wonderful bento after her instruction! If you are looking for homely and warm cooking class in Japan I recommend you Mayuko's little kitchen! : )

Great cooking class in Tokyo!. Mayuko's cooking class was fantastic. She's a great host, knowledgeable about Japanese cuisine and the flavors/ingredients and why they're used for specific dishes. We signed-up for a class where the initial group had chosen to make curry and teriyaki chicken. We also made miso soup, salad, and an eggplant dish and it was all delicious. There were four of us in the class and Mayuko made sure everyone stayed involved and participated in making the whole meal. The class took about two hours total with the prep and cooking. I would definitely recommend this to anyone looking for something a little different to do while in Tokyo.

Japanese home style cooking. Mayuko was a great host, I was in a group of four made from three separate bookings, a couple of Americans, a single American who is currently working in Korea and myself, a Brit. Mayuko demonstrated parts of the preparation of the dishes then divided up the tasks, so that between the four of us we prepared a delicious dinner.

Friendly cooking class. I really enjoyed my cooking class at Mayuko's Little Kitchen. Before the class, during the booking process, you are able to nominate the dish or dishes you would like to make.Mayuko, who is fluent in English, meets her students at the train station and walks them (5 minutes) to her home where she runs her classes.Mayuko is very knowledgable about Japanese food and teaches her students not only about cooking, but also provides lots of helpful information about Japan in general.The day I attended, there were only 4 of us plus Mayuko. We made okonomiyaki, fish in foil, plus a number of side dishes which we got to feast on at the end of the class.I would definitely recommend Mayuko's Little Kitchen to anyone looking to do a cooking class in a relaxed environment in Tokyo.
Must do. Authentic Japanese cooking in the home of a great host. Knowledgeable about cuisine and engaging about life and Japanese culture as well. Don't miss it. Great value.

Take the time to do this while in Tokyo. Mayuko was warm and welcoming. Her English was impeccable and she attended culinary school. She met us at the train station. Her modest apartment is a brief walk from the station. It was interesting to see the neighborhood where she lived, away from tourists and hotels.We made dishes that I could make again at home (USA) - miso soup, steamed salmon, Japanese eggplant, and a cabbage salad. All the food was simple and delicious. The kitchen isn't luxurious - it is an authentic every day kitchen for Japanese families. I left with a good understanding of the key ingredients in Japanese cooking. Mayuko also shared with us some of the customs and manners during a meal. Overall, I highly recommend this on your trip to Tokyo. Not only is it an opportunity to learn about Japanese cooking, but also a chance to share a meal with a local. It's a really nice break from all the tourist attractions.

An amazing Japanese cooking experience. We had an amazing night at Mayuko's Little Kitchen cooking school. Mayuko speaks excellent English and is so accommodating. She picked us up from the local metro station (Sendagaya Station) and we walked for about 5 minutes to her apartment. We had chosen to learn how to cook Gyoza's (Japanese dumplings), Teriyaki Chicken, Grilled eggplant with sweet miso paste, cabbage with salted kelp and miso soup, learning how to make the stock from snatch (incredibly easy by the way). We had a really lovely evening and would highly recommend Mayuko's to anyone looking for an authentic Japanese cooking experience whilst they are in Tokyo.

Fun, delightful and delicious!. We really enjoyed our cooking class with Mayuko. She is a sweetheart,and made the booking process very easy. We did the Japanese home cooking, which was great- the recipes were fresh and tasty, and she explained how to make them clearly and thoroughly. Everything was delicious and we all were able to help make the dishes (and some of the best miso soup we've had!). Mayuko was a delight to work with, and made us feel very welcome in her home,as well as giving us lots of good advice about things to do/see in Tokyo. We would absolutely recommend this!

Good food, good vibe. We made Okonomiyaki the Japanese pancake. Very tasty everyday meal, easy to make and ingredients easily available back at my home country! Mayuko is a very friendly person and the whole environment with other students was friendly and fun :)

A great way to experience Japanese food. I did the Okonomiyaki class with Mayuko and it was loads of fun. I've done a few cooking classes, but this is the first in a house which was really comfortable. Mayuko made us feel at home and we cooked not only Okonomiyaki but several other side dishes as well. As with other cooking classes that I've done, the food was amazing (best miso I'd eaten [drunk] in Japan). Highly recommend.

Cooking class-okonomiyaki. Attended with teen age daughter. Mayuko was very accommodating, organized and informative. Her English was very good and worked well with our group. It was enjoyable and we had more than enough food to eat. Easy to find with other attractions around her apartment.

One of the best things we did. We had six people in our party. Three made sushi and three made teriyaki chicken. It was a great experience and learned a lot. Mayakovsky picked us up from a nearby coffee shop. She engaged all of us in conversation and made us feel very welcome. The miso soup, rice, potatoes, sushi, chicken and broccoli salad were all fun to make and try. Awesome experience.

Great way to get the feel of the culture :). Mayuko was very friendly yet focused on making us learn in a hands on way! to first comers,Tokyo might seem big and busy, this got us involved and even more curious to learn about tradition through cooking! we were a small group, its was fun , respectful and inclusive :) i would most definitely recommend solo travellers and ever more, couples to enjoy a fun evening at Mayoko's!! A small, cozy kitchen that made us feel home away from home :))

Fantastic cooking class!!!. We where lucky to be first to pick the everyday traditional Japanese meal. Mayuko met us at nearby train station which from there was short walk to her house. Everything was very organized with a recipe sheet with every thing we where going to cook. We made a delicious meal consisting of miso soup, tofu salad, miso potatoes and a seafood okonomiyaki . We where also drinking a very nice refreshing drink throughout the class which was roasted barley. A very unusual taste. We really enjoyed our experience with Mayuko, she was very knowledgeable and directed us to the end of what was a beautiful, yummy Japanese lunch. Mayuko also gave us some information as where to go to buy things and places to eat ect very helpful.Thank you We loved it! Jemima and Sam

Experiment a "Little"!!. "Little" is definitely the right word. Mayuko's Little Kitchen is small, but it has a lot of variety! This class is a perfect way to socialize and learn more about anything Japanese. On top of that, the masterpiece you create in the class will probably be the most authentic food you eat. Mayuko's Little Kitchen offers dishes simple enough for anyone and everyone to enjoy. With that being said, don't be afraid to try new things, but do a little research beforehand. If you have questions, don't be afraid to ask. Mayuko doesn't bite. I've got to admit, this is definitely a class I'd take again-- if I had the time :(

Unique and unforgettable experience we would love to do again next time!. Mayuko's Little kitchen is a wonderful and unique experience if you love Japanese food and culture! I took my kids—age 7 and 9—to Mayuko's cooking lesson which is based in her cozy but well-equipped flat. We made bento boxes with panda and Star Wars onigiri (rice balls)—which the kids loved!—and also made fresh-from-Tsukiji-sushi. There was more food than we could eat but it was all super oishi/delicious and fresh. Mayuko is so welcoming, accommodating and friendly, and is a patient and kind instructor. As we left her flat, waving good-bye, my kids couldn't stop telling me how nice she is. It was like being in the house of an old friend. She also gave us some great local tips near our hotel, like grabbing those trendy pancakes overlooking Shibuya crossing. We also went for dipping ramen today per her suggestion, a place we would have never found but we all LOVED! Thank you Mayuko for such an unforgettable experience! We will always think of you when we make sushi and bento boxes at home!

MUST DO during your trip to Tokyo!!!. I recently spent two weeks exploring Japan and was able to see many of the major citifies and attractions. Looking back, my experience with Mayuko was the best during the entire trip!On the day of the class, Mayuko met everyone promptly by a subway station, guided us on a short, 5-minute walk to her apartment and welcomed us with a beautiful vanilla ice cream topped with matcha powder, all served in a piece of bamboo, as well as a cup of tea - a very classy and delicious way to start the lesson!As I was the first person to book a class for a specific date/time, I chose Okanimayaki - a Japanese style savory pancake. In addition to cooking this, we also learned how to prepare miso soup, simmered squash, and several other things. All dishes turned out to be delicious and at the end of the meal, Mayuko provided everyone with the recipe to take home as well as suggestions for where to visit/eat in Japan.

Lovely cooking class ! . Cooking with Mayuko becomes something very easy going and relaxing, like she said "folding dumplings can become a meditation process" !Explanation of Japanese ingredients & cooking methods were very clear. A very open minded little kitchen driven by a lovely person, full of curiosity and ready to help at any level with a smile & patience. Thank you for the recipes, I can't wait to try them out once again ( :

Such an amazing experience!. I had such a good time learning how to cook with Mayuko! She was very friendly and helpful. We cooked the everyday Japanese meal of gyoza (dumplings), miso soup, salad, and potatoes, and it was absolutely delicious! It was so interesting to learn how to cook these different foods. I thought that it was very affordable, considering how much I learned and ate!If I am ever back in Tokyo, I will definitely go again to make something different, because it really was a wonderful experience. Plus, Mayuko's apartment is right near the Meji Shrine, which was a great way to spend my afternoon digesting all of the food!

Taking a little Japan home with me. It's not my first visit to Japan, so was looking for something different to do.I am so glad to sign up a cooking class with Mayuko. It was a warm and fruitful session at her cosy abode. Dishes(we made dumplings,2dishes plus miso soup) was delicious, her explanation of ingredients & methods was so clear. I love the way she makes cooking so easy. It was a fun & enjoyable time for me. A wonderful memory of Japan, taking away knowledge that will last me many years to come.Thank you Mayuko. You are doing a great job. Ganbatte!

Great way to learn about Japanese cuisine and culture. It was a great experience for me and my husband. Mayuko met us (and other participants) at the train station and led us to her apartment. She is a great host and patient instructor, going through step by step and always with smiles. We all sat down and have the meal we cooked together at the end of the class and she answered to all our queries regarding cuisine, culture, shopping and places of interest. The dishes we made together were delicious and we definitely hope to take more classes when we visit Tokyo the next time!

A fun and delicious way to get to know Japan. We spent a great few hours learning some traditional Japanese cooking from Mayuko in mid-May. We made okonomiyaki, miso soup, and mirin potatoes. Mayuko is so knowledgeable about cooking and provides all guests with recipes before getting started. I'm hoping I can recreate this meal at home!

A delicious vegetarian meal. My daughter and I had a wonderful experience learning to cook some typical Japanese vegetarian dishes with Mayuko. She is a a great host, fabulous cook and patient instructor. We learned to make a lot of dishes in a short time: vegetable gyoza, cucumber with seaweed and sesame, potato with miso and the classic miso soup. Everything was absolutely delicious and we hope to take another one of her courses next time we visit Tokyo!

Unique Cultural Experience in Tokyo. When you sign up for a cooking class with Mayuko, she will send you directions as to where to go along with pictures of the meeting location so you can't get lost! She came and picked us (there were only two of us) up from the train station that is about two or three blocks from her apartment. It was a privilege to be able to visit the home of a local resident in Tokyo and compare it to my own home in Canada. It was more spacious than I thought it would be!I asked Mayuko to show me how to make Japanese Gyoza and you also learn how to make several side dishes along with it. She carefully described each ingredient, their use, some history of the dishes and ingredients, and let us taste each one so we knew what we were putting into our food. She provided us with recipes and directions on how to make the dish so even if you forget, you can always refer back to the recipe! The lesson was about 3 or 4 hours, I cannot recall exactly, but it was great to learn more about Mayuko and Japanese culture from her.Mayuko is incredibly kind, friendly, and helpful when we asked her questions, even if it was not related to the lesson. She helped me look up certain places and activities I was interested in and told me to e-mail her if I ever needed any help or had any questions. She also gave recommendations on desserts or foods to try while in Tokyo and locals know best! She recommended this one dessert/treat that I could buy in Asakusa since I was staying there. I cannot remember the name but it was two pancakes with a red bean paste in the middle which I got the very next day to try. Delicious!If you are visiting Tokyo and you are looking for something unique or different to do during your stay, please give Mayuko's Little Kitchen a chance as it really is a small kitchen! You do not need to bring anything with you other than yourself. Everything will be provided for you! I truly enjoyed the lesson even though I stayed up the entire night before to attend the Tsukiji Tuna Auction!Thank you for a wonderful time and experience Mayuko, I will definitely recommend it to friends who visit Tokyo in the future and wish to learn something while they are there!All the best,Daniel

A unique and excellent experience in Tokyo. For those looking to leave the beaten tourist path, see a bit more of everyday life in Tokyo, learn some techniques of the Japanese kitchen, and enjoy a really delicious meal with friendly people, Mayuko's Little Kitchen is the place to go. Mayuko-san was a fantastic host and instantly makes one feel comfortable and welcome, while the small class size gives the feeling that you are enjoying a meal with friends. Highly recommended.

Brilliant fun in Tokyo. Amazing fun making our Star Wars bento boxes today with Mayuko, she is a fabulous teacher, great chef and a real fun person! We will definitely go back when we return to Tokyo next and might even try stepping up from the children's menu!A must do in Tokyo

A great experience. I thoroughly recommend Mayuko's cooking course. She is a wonderful host, very kind and with great communication skills and I learnt alot about Japanese food and etiquette in a relaxed and fun eviroment. In fact if I go back to Tokyo I would definitely go to Mayuko's again.

family of five, highlight of the trip. it all has to do with the teacher. mayuko's demeanor is friendly, engaging, educational, patient, fun and funny, passionate, open. it's in her apartment off a side street, and that's what made it so great. she's just this gal with a passion and skill for teaching and cooking in the middle of tokyo, and we took a subway to go see her. this is, for our family, what makes traveling worthwhile.details: 14 girl, 12 girl, 9 boy, two parents. did the sushi roll and miso soup menu. the food was the best we had on the trip, honestly. so full we had to take leftovers home. the apartment is modest, and we loved it. going back again next time :)she said she'd done younger kids - i'm sure she'd be great at it. there's not a lot of room for them to run around, but my 9 yr old boy was quite engaged the whole time.

Wonderful experience!. I can totally recommend Mayuko's cooking class! I was lucky to participate in a course, where two main dishes (Japanese curry & dumplings) and a couple of side dishes (including miso soup) were being prepared. Everything was absolutely delicious. Apart from me there were only two more participants, so each of us got enough of our sensei's attention and none of the errors we were making went unnoticed. Besides all the cooking, Mayuko told us many interesting things about Japan, its culture etc. I really had a great time!

Great cooking course in a small group. In my traveltimes through Japan, did i on my last week a sushi course in Tokyo, I did a cooking class with Mayuko in her lovely appartement. We were a small group, 4 peopley.I love japanese food and cooking as well. I realy enjoyed the course with Mayuko. She explained everything how to, what's the different taste,.... Mayuko is a very kind person and she welcomed us friendly. She speaks a perfect English and she’s keen sharing all the tips and recommandations with us. We prepared the 2 kinds of Sushi, a miso soup and cooked patatos with miso. Everything was yummy and I’m sure I will do it again at home!Thank you Mayuko, I had a great time during the class!!!

Great cooking class . We are traveling in Japan with two children ages 10 and 7 and was looking for a cooking class that would appeal to all of us! Mayukos cooking class was perfect! She met us at the train station and after a short walk to her apartment (a peaceful oasis in the heart of the city) we enjoyed a wonderful few hours making sushi, miso soup and a potato appetizer. It was fun, informative and delicious. I knew my 10 year old daughter would love it but it even captivated my 7 year old son and kept his attention! (Although he decided to just make cucumber rolls when we did the sushi). Mayuko was so nice and her English skills were excellent. We all enjoyed discussing Japan and culture and she provided great insight to the city of Tokyo! Highly recommend this class! We all enjoyed the food we prepared as lunch before the class finished.

Long-lasting memory for Japan. I took her Okonomiyaki class on May 28th. She came to meet us at JR station. How nice! She gave full details of Japanese food in fluent English. So I was able to follow a recipe easily. Foods tasted great! It's different from that I'd eaten in Korea. If I have another opportunity, I will take her sushi class.

Great time cooking a traditional dinner with Mayuko. During my holidays last week in Tokyo, I did a cooking class with Mayuko in her lovely appartement.I love cooking and I wanted to learn how Japanese people are cooking traditional dinner at home, some dishes they used to prepare and I can easily do myself without spending a whole day.Mayuko is a very kind person and she welcomed us friendly. She speaks a perfect English and she’s keen sharing all the tips and recommandations with us. We prepared the daishi stock, a miso soup, salmon in foil, some appetizers with fish cake and cooked pumpkin. Everything was delicious and I’m sure I can do it again at home. For dessert, she also offered homemade vanilla icecream with matcha powder, so yummy !Thank you Mayuko, I had a great time during the class. I’m sure I’ll come again to try other recipes during my next stay in Tokyo.
Great cooking class. We had a great time at this cooking class, and the host was brilliant! We cooked some of the best food we have tasted in Japan!

Salmon in foil. Had a great time at Mayuko's kitchen this week learning an everyday Japanese meal (salmon in foil). The course was in English. Mayuko is a great teacher always willing to answer any questions and the pace was very relaxed. A great way to learn plus you get to eat your creation!

Great Sushi class in English. It was a fun, cosy place Mayuko offers. She bought great quality products and everything turned out as she told us it would. She can explain very well and makes it fun to do.

authentic japanese home dish. Mayuko is a very nice and helpful person.I ordered a supermarket tour and the cooking class.If you want to learn the basics and principles of japanese dishes, you can learn it from her. The supermarket tour is also very helpfull, to learn the different unique japanese foods and so on, which I never saw in european supermarket.She is even willingly to help you after the class. whether some more explanations or even sending the original miso paste from japan or other goods. Which I could not find a proper one in Germany. I am happy to get her know. I just can recommend her! :)

Lovely, practical and delicious class. This was a wonderful class. Mayuko knows her stuff, understands her students interests and needs, and speaks English very well. We made a delicious lunch of several dishes with a miso theme. Mayuko happily answered my dozens of questions. She is a knowledgable and charming teacher.As a nice bonus, the class is a short walk from Shinjuku Gyoen park, Tokyo's finest Japanese garden.

Wonderful Cooking Class. What a wonderful experience doing our cooking class today. Mayuko is a lovely host and teacher regarding the food, cooking and ingredients. She even gave us some recommendations for restaurants and sights to see. The food was delicious and very filling, I could not eat it all!! Thank you Mayuko.

Big cultural experience in a llittle kitchen. What a wonderful introduction to Japanese cooking! Mayuko is a great host, excellent cook and just a fun person to be around. I really liked preparing the food and of course, eating the meal with the other guests. Besides the food, the best part was that this took place in a real kitchen which made it feel like I was cooking with friends. Highly recommended to anyone wanting an authentic and hands-on cooking experience in Tokyo. Thank you Mayuko!

More than just a cooking class. I wanted to experience something of Tokyo beyond the tourist trail, and the time I spent cooking and chatting with Mayuko was perfect. As many of her reviewers have noted, Mayuko is not only an excellent and encouraging teacher but a lovely and generous person. She provided a great introduction to the basic tastes and unique ingredients of everyday Japanese food, and expertly guided the creation of a really delicious lunch, which we then shared. But what made it extra special was the conversation - the ability to ask questions and share insights in a delightful friendly atmosphere. Highly recommended.

Greatest experience in Tokyo. Mayuko is awesome ! Her cooking lesson, as well as her english are perfect ! Funny, very well prepared, explication where fluent and very usefull, and everybody was able to cook ! Furthermore, everything was just delicious ! I highly recommand Mayuko !

Great cooking and cultural experience. We ve spend 2 hours cooking and talking with Mayko and her other guests in a nice and cozy Japanese kitchen. The class was excellent, and the result was delicious. Will try this "chicken karaage" at home as soon as get there.  At the end Mauyko also gave us a bunch of advices on shopping and eating in Tokyo. Definitely recommended!

Great experience in Tokyo!!. The food class with Mayuko was definitely one of our highlights in our 2 weeks trip to Japan. We are a family of 4 with 3 teenagers (13, 18, 21) and all 4 of us enjoyed the class tremendously. Apart from the fact that you actually learn about the Japanese cuisine and to cook tasty dishes, it's also a great cultural experience to visit a "regular" appartment in Tokyo and talk with Mayuko about the different aspects of the life in Japan. Mayuko is a great host, such a nice person, answered all of our questions and even gave us recommendations on what to see and do in Tokyo. We will highly recommend her class to all of our friends and family going to Japan. Thanks for the great hospitality!

AMAZING EXPERIENCE!!!!. Mayuko is a master! She was a wonderful host who took the time to teach us about traditional Japanese spices and ingredients. This was such a fun class and I would LOVE to visit Tokyo again and take a different class with Mayuko. Definitely a 5-star class!

Fun and tasty! . My fiancé took me here for my birthday and I loved it so much I took my friends back 2 weeks later! We did the okonomiyaki and gyoza both times because it was so delicious. She is a great teacher and I learned so much from her both times. The second time I went with my friends who were visiting from America and they loved it! It felt like we were cooking with one of our closest friends! Mayuko is very sweet and I love the atmosphere of cooking in her home. I have done cooking classes all over the world and this was the most authentic. Go hungry because you get a good amount of food and it's all so good, you won't want to leave any behind. It is soooo good. Don't think twice and book a class at Mayuko's little kitchen!

Perfect introduction to Japanese cuisine. Mayuko is a great person, and her class was her pleasure to attend. I have two left hands when it comes to cooking, but managed to make a couple of decent Japanese dishes, which is no small feet for me! I highly recommend to anyone who wants to discover Japanese cuisine.
Justin. Absolutely a wonderful time. Mayuko is very friendly and fun. The food and teacher were great. I couldn't imagine a way for this experience to be any better. I would recommend this to all.

Awesome Star Wars Bento Boxes!. The Star Wars Bento Box cooking class with Mayuko was one of our highlights of our trip to Japan. Everything from the emails to organise the class, meeting up and the cooking class itself, were all well organised. We met at the train station and instantly knew that we were in for a great experience. Everything was laid out and ready to go when we got to Mayuko's house which was great. Mayuko explained everything, we got to try different flavors before using them in the cooking and we didn't feel rushed! Mayuko was hospitable and we will be recommending Mayuko to everyone back in Australia. Thankyou!

Wonderful insight into Japanese home life. Other reviewers have talked about how the class proceeds ... so I'll mainly let my photos do the talking.That said, this class is a great way to get a small glimpse into real life in Japan. Catch the subway to a quite suburban station and meet Mayuko (if you get there too early there is a coffee shop just near the meeting point). Walk five minutes or so through residential streets to her apartment. Squeeze into the (very typical) tiny lift. Shoes off at the door and you are in an actual Japanese home.The class is great and chances are you will be working alongside some interesting fellow travellers. You'll work together to create a wonderful feast and depart for your next adventure with a full belly, new friends, recipes you can easily recreate at home and some great recommendations for further foodie activities during your stay.I visit Tokyo regularly and will most definitely be back.

Great time and great teacher!. As something different, we decided to try a cooking class while in Tokyo. We picked Mayuko's based on the reviews and we were not disappointed. Mayuko met us at the subway station and we took a short walk to her place. She was fun to talk to, and her English is excellent. For class, we made tempura and ginger pork. She started the class by explaining to us some of the different seasonings and spices used in Japanese cooking. She demonstrated how to cut and cook everything, and then we went to work! Mayuko was there to guide us every step of the way, and the results were amazing! The food was excellent. We really had a very enjoyable time. Sitting down and eating with her was like a little party of friends. At the end, she pointed out some places of interest near her place and showed us how to get there. I highly recommend taking a class with Mayuko if you wish to learn how to cook some Japanese cuisine.

Worth going back for more. This was our second visit to Mayuko's Little Kitchen. We had such a good time the first time, we just had to go back for a second helping. This time the class was about miso. Mayuko explained in clear, easy to understand English, about the different types of miso in use, how they were made and how the tastes differ. We tasted each of five different types of miso and we could clearly tell the differences. After the introduction to the fresh and the dried ingredients, we began the peeling, chopping and mixing. With the preparation completed, we moved on to the making of the dashi for the miso soup. Next came the cooking of the main and side dishes. Everyone was kept involved throughout the cooking and table setting, where we learned the correct way to present a Japanese meal. Finally, we all sat down to a scrumptious home cooked meal which we will be able to reproduce for friends and family once we get home.There can be no doubt that the high praise that Mayuko receives in these reviews is well deserved. Do yourself a favor and book a class early during you stay in Tokyo. Mayuko is happy to give you customized recommendations for what to see and do in Tokyo. It becomes quickly evident that she wants you to enjoy Tokyo to the fullest and go home with a heart full of happy memories.

A truly great experience. A definite highlight of my recent stay in Tokyo was the cooking class at Mayuko's Little Kitchen. Mayuko takes time to introduce you to the main ingredients of Japanese cooking and then step by step she takes you through the cooking process. In our case we cooked Japanese dumplings with cucumber and sesame, a traditional squash and bean side dish and the staple miso soup. I would highly recommend taking one of Mayuko's class. She is very accommodating and knowledgable. It was truly a pleasure to meet her and learn not only about the Japanese cuisine but also about Japanese culture and tradition.

Excellent cooking experience!. A must have on my to do list for Japan was to attend a sushi cooking class. I read reviews about Mayuko's kitchen and I knew she was the clear choice. After a few emails back and forth I was ready to pay for my booking and eager to attend the class. The communication with Mayuko before and during the class was seamless. I was concerned there may be language barriers but that was not the case at all. My husband and I were welcomed by Mayuko and two other couples at the meeting spot I was given and we all headed back to Mayuko's apt which was conveniently located to the subway and tourist attractions. The class was entertaining as well as knowledgable on the elements of traditional Japanese cooking. Her home was clean and all the items we needed to cook with were ready for our use. I had such a wonderful time at the class and I would highly recommend it to any one looking to learn how to make sushi and learn about some Japanese culture by such a lovely sweet person.

A lovely family experience. We had a lesson for our family (including two reluctant teens) and we all thoroughly enjoyed the experience. Mayuko was fantastic at involving everyone and I learnt some really handy tips and techniques. Three of our children are vegetarian and this was taken into account - we made some really yummy food for all of us to enjoy. One of our highlights of a wonderful trip to Japan, thank you.

Wonderful experience and very Friendly Host. Bev and I found Mayuko a very friendly and knowledgeable teacher. The many tips and techniques that Mayuko taught us will enable us to replicate the dishes here for our friends. The fact that we cooked in Mayuko's own kitchen and then enjoyed the dishes with her made everyone relax and chat with her. It was like a dinner party with friends which made it an all round wonderful experience.

One of the highlights of our trip to Japan!. My daughter and I loved our visit to Mayuko's Little Kitchen. Mayuko is a truly lovely host who made us all feel very relaxed, the time absolutely flew by. We learnt so much about Japanese food and what the different main ingredients contribute to a dish. We then learnt how to set out all our dishes in the correct Japanese way. Finally we ate a delicious feast. I would definitely recommend Mayuko's Little Kitchen to anyone visiting Tokyo, I wish now that we had brought my husband and two sons along too.Thank you Mayuko!!

Awesome. Whether you have some experience with Japanese food or if you're a complete beginner you will thoroughly enjoy Mayuko's cooking class. We had an awesome time, a great experience in great company.

Amazing cooking class and very kind teacher!!. Today we had our amazing cooking class at Mayuko's. We prepared sushi and okinomiyaki along with some very delicious side dishes together with another nice couple. We had an amazing time! Mayuko was so friendly and welcoming and she explained everything so well to us. Everything went so calm and peaceful, starting of with a nice cup of green tea. She learned us a lot about Japanese food and also about the Japanese culture. The food was truly amazing! It was such a big meal it was almost too much to eat. It was a great experience, we would recommend it to everyone who loves cooking and wants to learn more about Japanese food. Thank you so much for everything Mayuko!

An unforgettable experience!. We had a truly incredible evening at Mayuko's Little Kitchen! She was a kind and attentive host who made us feel welcome from the moment we met her. My husband was a little apprehensive when I booked the class as he had never cooked before but he was pleasantly surprised at how Mayuko tailored the class to his ability. He's looking forward to trying out his new skills when we get home now. We couldn't recommend this class and Mayuko enough! Value for money, fun and an experience that felt like cooking with an old friend! Thank you again Mayuko!

So much fun!. Mayukois such a lovely person. I did the everyday meal class with my sister and a friend. Mayuko's home is lovely and she came to meet us at the station. We made a variety of sides and goyoza, all of which were delicious and some of which I'd not tried before. My friend is a vegan and Mayuko changed the menu for is no problem. I'd never done a cooking class before and had the best time. Deffinitley worth it and highly reccomended.

Highlight of our trip! . We had a wonderful time at Mayuko's little kitchen. Mayuko is so nice and polite. She explains everything very well and makes you feel like home. The food was amazing. We made sushi and two side dishes, just perfect. Her mom even came by to bring some fruit. So nice! Thanks Mayuko! You made our trip and introduction to Japan even better!!Also thanks for the all the tips. We would recommend this cooking course to everyone. If our friends/family will come to visit Tokyo, they definitely will come by.Kiss from Holland, Ava and Ruud

A Locals taste of Japan. We booked cooking school through tour company. We were advised was sushi cooking school however on day learned it was traditional local food dc Japanese would eat for lunch/dinner. This course ended up suiting us better than sushi course would of.Mayuko has wonderful knowledge of Japanese cuisine. Speaks brilliant English.we found her extremely helpful & would recommend anyone to attend. Please outline your preferences. Can't wait to return and attend curry & dumpling course

We really enjoyed it!. We had a fantastic time with Mayuko. So many things add to this cooking class and make it a unique experience - let me just mention some:* delicious food, warm and welcoming atmosphere* our menu included seafood but Mayuko also prepared a vegetarian version for me* Mayuko even let us taste from a dessert she happened to have in the fridge (was not part of the menu)

One of highlights of my holiday. If you enjoy cooking and food, this is a must do whilst in Tokyo.I was fortunate to be the only person so had a private cooking class and dinner, which was fantastic.Mayuko is a very sweet and engaging person, and in addition to being a great cook and teacher, she gave great insights into local life in Tokyo, seeing her local suburb and home, and provided me with lots of other tips and recommendations for restaurants and shopping.Definitely do this at the beginning of your holiday to take advantage of her tips. Everything was very easy from booking to meeting at the station.

Probably the most special experience we had in Tokyo. My daughter and I visited Tokyo in March, and I signed up for this class during our pre-trip planning based on the many positive reviews Mayuko received. Mayuko was quick to respond to my emails, and helpful with suggestions in choosing the menu we would be cooking (the first customers to sign up for a particular class gets to pick the menu!). Mayuko takes no more than six customers per class session, allowing for an individualized experience for all. We elected to make a traditional Japanese home-cooked meal, with Japanese dumplings as the main course.Mayuko met us at a train station near our hotel, and together we walked to her "little kitchen." She was well-prepared with the ingredients we would be using laid out on the table, and explained to us over tea the basics of traditional Japanese flavorings and foods. We learned how to make a delicious miso soup, a side dish, salad, and of course the dumplings. The mystery ingredients I sometimes see in Asian stores are no longer so mysterious! When we finished preparing the meal, we asked if she would join us to eat, and thus enjoyed another great part of the evening: talking to her about her culture. Mayuko was extremely gracious, very informative, and a real pleasure to spend time with. We thoroughly enjoyed our time in Tokyo, finding it remarkable how helpful and accommodating the Japanese people are, and we agreed that our time with Mayuko was the most special of all. Mayuko's class is very much worth the time and investment for people visiting this lovely city.
Yum!!. We had a fantastic time with Mayuko, learning how to cook Japanese foods. A relaxed atmosphere and a lovely host. Recommend to anyone!

Amazing cooking class and a brilliant, open-hearted teacher. I wanted to give something really special to my husband as a Christmas present. Since I knew we were going to Tokyo, I decided to get something in connection to our trip. I Googled something like 'cool and unusual things to do in Tokyo' and I found an article with a link to Mayuko's website. She was so friendly, fast to reply and extremely helpful! She had even made and sent me a gift certificate for my husband! On the day of the class she picked us up at the station. There was another couple from London to join the class. Altogether we walked to Mayuko's apartment, which was just 5 minutes away. We had a great time, learning how to make sushi, miso soup and a Japanese traditional pumpkin side dish! Mayuko has not only explained and showed us how to make this food, but she has also told us a lot about traditional Japanese ingredients, where they come from and what they are made of. She has also shared a lot of stories and traditions of her family. It was so interesting to learn more about local customs in Japan!The atmosphere was great and I had a feeling that I am not in a cooking class, but having dinner with my friends!In the end Mayuko gave us some recommendations on what else to see in Tokyo and recommended some great places to eat.I loved this experience and I would recommend to anyone who is visiting Tokyo to book a class with Mayuko! She is an excellent teacher, a talented cook and an open, friendly and kind person. Thank you, Mayuko! ❤️

A perfect afternoon. Mayuko is a wonderful host! She responds very quickly to queries and has quite a few cooking classes to choose from. She explains everything so well, and is great at getting guests all involved in the preparation process. The kitchen is spotless, and she has everything set out and ready for guests to get started right away. She was very prompt as well meeting us at the station. I attended by myself, there was one other couple there and we had a wonderful time. The 11am class was a perfect start to a great day out.

Great hands on experince in small group setting.. Mayuko provides a great hands on experience of what its like to cook a delicious Japanese lunch. When we scheduled she gave us a choice of recipes to prepare. We chose to leave it up to her and she made great choices. She met us at the train station and we took a short walk back to her apartment giving us a glimpse into a true locals environment. In the kitchen of her apartment the ingredients were laid out and ready to start preparing. While we prepared the meal Mayuko explained the fundamental flavors in Japanese cooking and how to use them. There were only 4 people in the class so it was very interment and hands on. In addition to teaching us about the food we were able to ask questions about Japanese culture and get informed answers from a local. Once we finished cooking we were able to eat our delicious creations. Overall the class was great and I would highly recommend it for anyone wanting a class where you are more than just a face in a crowd.
Great Experience . Thank you Mayuko San for the great hosting and teaching... Will be back for more.Get to know a beautiful lady from Italy - Ms Claudia and was fun cooking together.

Great learning experience!. This was one of the highlights of our trip to Tokyo. It was nice to get a little bit of a background on Japanese food. Everything was explained step by step and you felt like you were at a friends house learning a new recipe. Everything was delicious and I would definitely recommend the class for all ages! Mayuko also let us sample a dessert that she was testing out for possible use in a future class. It was fabulous. She's a very talented cook!

Great cooking and a new friend!. It's hard to describe what a truly special experience a visit to Mayuko's kitchen is! Everything was beautifully prepared, from the instructions on how to get to the nearest station, to the recipes to take home, to the thoughtful way the class was conducted. We learned Japanese curry and salmon and vegetables in foil, as well as accompaniments. All dishes that we can definitely make at home and look forward to preparing for our family and friends. Mayuko is really a delightful person and answered many questions, even booking a gig for us!!! Highly highly recommended.

Tokyo Highlight. Mayuko was so welcoming, knowledgable, and encouraging, she makes you feel right at home and like a cooking superstar even when you're just chopping some cabbage. We made vegetarian gyoza, miso potatoes, sesame cucumber and miso soup. The food was delicious and we were taught about all the different flavours in Japanese cuisine and the history of the dishes as well as how to properly serve food in the Japanese tradition. Our afternoon with Mayuko was one of the highlights of our trip and I would encourage anyone visiting to Tokyo to organise a class.

Such a cool experience! Loved it!. I am so glad I decided to make a little stop at Mayuko's little kitchen! To be honest, it was the first time, I stepped in a small Tokyoite flat. It felt like home. Everything for the class was so carefully prepared by Mayuko : ingredients, kitchen tools, instructions, aprons. The kitchen looks so cosy and cute... Mayuko made the whole group feel so comfortable that it felt like sitting with friends. She gave so many insights into the Japanese food culture. Instructions for the cooking were clear and she made sure everyone understood and took part .Needless to tell the food was great and I felt so proud when I looked at my first home made sushis ever! Tea and rice crackers were sooo yummy.

A Perfect cooking adventure. After few email exchanged with Mayuko, a day has been fixed, and we have decided the meal: it will be the Japanese Curry. Picked-up at the train station, I arrived at the little Kitchen, and what to say: A small kitchen as I was expected, really cosy =) You feel directly like at home!The cooking of Japanese curry and side dishes (miso soup, tamagoyaki, and tofu salad) have been a real pleasure. She gave me so much nice advices about Japanese cooking that I can't relate everything!Eating the freshly cooked food with Mayuko was really nice, and I learned a lot about Japanese cooking but also tradition and cultures! I'm really thankful for all those advices and this nice moment, and I would not hesitate one second to take another class here if I want to learn a new Japanese main dish!

Such a fun and unique experience!. My husband and I would highly recommend this class even for those that do not cook or have much interest in cooking. Mayuko is a very knowledgeable and fun host! It was definitely a highlight of our week-long trip here in Japan!

Fun and delicious activity!. Mayuko's cooking class was a very fun and informative way to spend a morning! The class is in Mayuko's kitchen - a really cute setting. There were 5 of us doing the class and we fit perfectly around a table in her kitchen. Mayuko herself was lovely, welcoming and very helpful, even with questions unrelated to cooking :) We were provided with little snacks and tea throughout the cooking process, which was a really nice touch. I did the sushi making class and Mayuko's instructions and guidance made it feel so easy to make your own sushi! I am not a very good or regular cook but this was very hands on and with the recipe we got, I hope to make it again myself at home. And the result was delicious and extremely filling! Our class started at 11 and we skipped breakfast that morning which was a good decision! I would definitely do this again and recommend it highly.

Superb evening. I highly recommend spending an evening with Mayuko. Mayuko was quick in her response to my booking enquiry and the booking process was very simple. She met us on time at the (easy to find) meeting point at her nearest station. It’s a short walk to her apartment from there.Mayuko’s English is really, really good and her accent was very clear and easy to understand.
