She was a pleasure to interact with and made me feel very welcome. First she gave us an interesting overview of Japanese flavours and cooking, and then an overview of what we would be making. Then we got into the actual preparation. She was extremely well organised and has obviously put a lot of time into working out the timings etc of the food prep and class. By the end of the class we had made a main dish, miso soup and two side dishes and then we got to sit down and eat the food we had prepared. Ended up being extremely full!Apart from the actual cookery class, it was very interesting to talk with Mayuko and learn more about Japan/Tokyo in general and fun to be in her home with her.

Unique Experience in Tokyo Japan. Love Japanese food! Exactly the reason why we decided to visit Tokyo Japan. We've heard many stories about Japan's beautiful Shinjuku. So we decided to take a short informal cooking class with Mayuko at Mayukos Little Kitchen which is actually at her cute townhouse.My daughter and I booked our lesson in advance through the website. Mayuko promptly responded and accepted our payment through PayPal. Then she arranged our meeting place by the train station. We were glad to see her big welcoming smile. Then she walked us to her house for the cooking lesson. Mayuko was well organized and speaks fluent English which made it easier for us. Very few Japanese know how to speak English which made it difficult to communicate.We had chicken karaage, seafood hot pot, chicken curry, and miso soup. Mayuko's instructions were simple. We prepared the food and had it for dinner. It costs $100/person which was very reasonable. I was so inspired that I went to the nearest grocery store to buy the ingredients. She wrote the ingredients for me because everything at the store is in Japanese. Besides sight seeing and shopping, I recommend taking cooking lessons when you visit a beautiful city. You learn their customs and tradition as well as food preparation. Cheers!

Best activity of my trip!. I couldn't recommend this more highly - the recipes were delicious and easy to replicate and Mayuko was a delightful host, explaining all of the ingredients and cooking techniques in detail and providing great recommendations on where to eat to Tokyo. I hope to return one day soon!

Loved every minute!. From the moment I met Mayuko she was nothing but hospitable and lovely. It was just me in the class and so I luckily got a private lesson. Her explanation of the different ingredients was informing and interesting, and she was very clear in her instructions for using these ingredients. Who knew there were so many different types of Miso out there? Her English was near perfect making it easy to follow along while she taught me how to cook with Miso. I definitely recommend one of Mayuko's classes if you are looking for authentic Japanese!

Great experience of Japanese food & culture!. Not to be missed when visiting Tokyo! Mayuko has a great understanding of what visitors might find interesting and explains not just the "mechanics" of cooking a Japanese meal, but also cultural aspects and what life is like in Japan in general and in Tokyo specifically.I would happily go back to Mayuko's any time and learn even more about this wonderful place!

More than a lesson. I was slightly apprehensive having such little experience in the kitchen as I met up with Mayuko and friendly Aussie girl and English/German couple. But we chilled, chatted and got to know each other. Mayuko explained Japanese cuisine and the okinumayaki recipe that we would be cooking. Through the evening it was a wonderful learning process and Mayuko has such a fabulous way of creating a relaxing environment to pass on some of her passion for Japanese food. The best recommendation I can make is that I now feel enthusiasm to sharpen the knives, buy a Japanese cooking book and try to learn more. Thank you for such a lovely time.

Brilliant. Mayuko prepared such a great cooking class for us.Thanks to her, I and my friend could learn how to cook Sushi as well as simple basic knowledge about Japanese cuisine.Such a nice time it was! Strongly recommended.

Wonderful time in Mayuko's. We had a wonderful afternoon in Mayuko's kitchen. She was very welcoming and accommodating to our family. We learned about Japanese flavours and cooked a delicious meal while having a lovely chat about Japanese culture. I've been home 3 days and already been replicating the beautiful dishes we learned to cook. Highly recommended :)

Above and beyond . Absolutely fantastic! Great food, teacher and friendly atmosphere. Not only have the skills now to cook home style Japanese food but also learnt about the culture. A must when in Tokyo.

Wonderful experience, excellent class and the BEST hostess ever!. My experience with Mayuko was absolutely phenomenal right from the time I first contacted her over e-mail for the class. She went out of her way to customize the menu to be able to take care of what I wanted to learn(Miso dishes and wagashi). This was something I had not expected and am very grateful to her. Mayuko actually spent some time to explain about Japanese food, importance of each ingredient and various ways that they can be used. I learnt a lot, and really really enjoyed Mayuko's class. The food that she made me cook was absolutely oishee (delicious) and I enjoyed a lovely meal with Mayuko. She even taught me how to lay the table Japanese style. In the end I have walked away having learnt dishes that i can cook when back in India. Overall, the best 3 hours for me. Highly highly recommended. Thank you so much Mayuko for your great hospitality.

Wonderful experience! . It was just my husband and I on this particular day so we had a private lesson which was fantastic. We learnt to make a few types of sushi, miso soup and a delicious tradition pumpkin side dish.Mayuko was so friendly and spoke perfect English. We asked her many questions and she happily told us all she knew, we learnt so much in such a short space of time. The food was great (there was plenty of it) and we were very proud of our new sushi skills! Really great experience and would highly recommend it!!

BEST cooking class!!!. I visited Mayuko's little kitchen on a trip with my good friend in February 2016. We had an AMAZING experience with Mayuko! She was so welcoming from the time she met us at the train station until we parted ways. Mayuko's class was fun, informative, and most importantly DELICIOUS. We chose to make the pork dumplings with a couple of side dishes. We were able to learn/cook with Mayuko while getting to know her. She is so sweet and friendly and went above and beyond to make us feel welcome in her home and in Tokyo (i.e. Gave us suggestions, directions, etc.) I would recommend this to anyone interested in learning more about Japanese cooking, or anyone who is looking to have a genuinely authentic experience. Probably one of the best experiences we had in Tokyo!

Authentic and charming home cooking lessons. Mayuko puts on a very fun cooking class with delicious food. We made the dumplings - yum! Mayuko is very friendly and informative. The class is suitable for beginners and for people who know how to cook but want to learn authentic japanese cooking. I would highly recommend it!

Great cooking class . We enjoyed our sushi cooking class with Mayuko she was very warm and welcoming and informative. It was fun learning to cook some Japanese food with other travellers. We would recommend this cooking class to people who would like to know more about Japanese cuisine and culture.

Tokyo 2016. I would highly recommend this class for anyone traveling to Tokyo. Mayuko made us feel very welcome in her home. If possible I would suggest doing this on one of the first days of your visit as Mayuko is very knowledgeable an willing to give ideas of what to do while there.

Amazing Cooking Experience. My partner and I had an amazing time in Mayuko's cooking class. We did the sushi class and it was so much fun. Mayuko was very friendly and a wonderful teacher. The class was a highlight of our trip. Highly recommend to others.

Amazing personalised class!. Mayuko's cooking class was great! From the very beginning when I first contacted her she was wonderful. She customised the menu to our request, even though it was something she doesn't usually offer from her menu online. On the day Mayuko met us at the station and brought us to her apartment. He unit and kitchen are beautiful, and you feel right at home straight away. We were very lucky and had a class all to ourselves, some days she has multiple groups in the class. She was a great teacher, and really friendly. Offering us little tidbits of extra information about the food and Japan in general. We learnt a lot, and really enjoyed our time with Mayuko, we can't thank her enough. Definitely recommend her class to anyone looking for an authentic cooking experience!

SUSHI!!. Mayuko's little kitchen was definitely a highlight of my time one Tokyo. Everything was well organized and she was able to answer all my questions. She also gave me suggestions about other places to visit in Tokyo. I would definitely recommend this to anyone staying in the Shinjuku area

In a word.. Perfect. I found Mayukos class whilst browsing for not the norm things to do in Tokyo and due to the amazing reviews (adding another!) decided to send her an email! To keep this from turning into an essay I will sum up with the facts,Mayuko is an excellent teacher, very laid back (loved the music on gently in the background) and welcomes you into her house with a huge smile and fluent English! Her teaching is very relaxed as she teaches you in her kitchen and explains every step and is always willing to go over anything again for you. I had such a brilliant time and found Mayuko to be such a good host/ teacher that I booked to have a second class with her later on in my holiday!

You can't miss it if you visit Tokyo !. We chose the daily Japanese meal option with the Teryaki chicken and it was delicious. Mayuko is very welcoming and will share a lot of tips with you - not only about food. The group was very nice which makes the experience even nicer. It was one of our greatest time during our trip in Tokyo. for sure, you can't miss it.

Great experience . My husband and I took this class last minute on our honeymoon. Mayuko set up a location to meet up beforehand and walked the group over to her home. Her directions were easy to follow and she gives you the recipes to take home. The food came out delicious. There were 2 young boys in our group (under 5) and she encouraged them to participate and gave them coloring books to keep them busy when they couldn't help. She even walked us over to a nearby store afterwards to help us buy the miso, so we could make it at home. I'm glad we took her class and recommend it to others.

The Best Cooking Class Ever!. We found Mayuko's Little Kitchen while browsing TripAdvisor and we were impressed with the outstanding reviews for this cooking class and felt it was something worth trying.We were very pleased that Mayuko responded so quickly to our booking request and she provided all the info that we needed to fit us into a time that worked for us. My wife and I were blown away by today's experience of learning authentic Japanese cooking in Mayuko's little kitchen as well as experiencing Mayuko's cheerful nature and generosity in letting us use her personal kitchen for this class, which only added to the overall experience of authentic Japanese cooking and dining. The food we cooked tasted better than any Japanese food I've tasted before because WE MADE IT OURSELVES and I am most gracious for this opportunity to learn to cook with a local! We really got our hands dirty with chopping, cutting and preparing the food and it was such an enjoyable and educational experience as Mayuko explained to us in great detail about each of the individual ingredients as well as how to complete each step.Mayuko speaks very good English and we had no difficulty in understanding her instructions and meeting with her, and she was so awesome she gave us copies of the recipe at the end so we didn't get overwhelmed with trying to remember everything! She even helped us with tips on what places to visit in Tokyo which we found really helpful as we really wanted honest recommendations from a local living in Tokyo. Upon finishing I feel that we've done more than just completed a Japanese cooking class but my wife and I feel we've just made a new friend in Japan and we would be most honored to have Mayuko over to visit us sometime if she so wished. It was an absolute pleasure spending time with Mayuko and if we visited Japan again we would definitely pop by to say hi whether it be for a cooking class or not. In conclusion, I highly recommend Mayuko's Little Kitchen to anyone interested in learning Japanese cooking with an experienced local. FYI Mayuko has a Facebook page which is worth checking out to see what types of food she's cooked before with other people.Thanks Mayuko we hope to see you again in future!!

Wonderful Experience!. Mayuko's class is one of the biggest highlights from my visit to Japan. I was in Japan for two months for a study abroad trip. This was one of the last things I did before leaving. I learned how to make sushi rolls as well as miso soup and a delicious potato side dish. I was the only person in the class, and we had a ton of fun. We listened to the Offspring while we cooked, which was an unexpected treat. After the class was over, Mayuko pointed me in the right direction to go to a nearby shrine and even gave me an umbrella because it had just started to rain. I can't recommend this class highly enough!

Amazing!. We had such a good time with Mayuko this morning - she taught us how to make dumplings, wonderful miso soup and some pumpkin and cucumber sides as well as being fantastic company for lunch. Meeting Mayuko and being welcomed into her home has definitely been the highlight of our visit to Japan. Don't miss it.

Terrific experience!. Mayuko's Little Kitchen is fantastic, and without a doubt the best experience I had in Tokyo. Mayuko speaks excellent english, she's is a wonderful teacher, and is just a pleasure to be around. She made everyone feel so welcome that it felt more like I was in the company of an old friend rather than a teacher. I absolutely recommend her classes to anyone who visits Tokyo, and next time I'm in Tokyo I will definately be going back.

Highlight of my trip!. What a wonderful evening I had learning to cook Japanese food with Mayuko! Before I even arrived she had been fantastic, carefully tailoring the menu to meet my request. I was welcomed into her kitchen as if I were an old friend and had great fun chatting (easy with her excellent English) whilst making sushi and gyoza. The food tasted amazing - just hoping I can replicate it at home! Mayuko also took the time to explain some of the intricacies and traditions of Japanese food and went out of her way to suggest places to buy ingredients (and other souvenirs!). A real highlight of my holiday in Japan!

Great Experience. We visited Mayuko's in November and we had such an amazing time.It was one of our highlights for our entire trip of Japan.We booked online and she met us at the metro station. Thankfully she waited 5 minutes because we were running a little late (Thank You). It was a 5 - 10 minute walk to her apartment and then the fun began.It was only myself and my girlfriend for the session we had, so it felt very personal and intimate.Mayuko does an amazing Job making you feel really welcomed in her home. The time flew by and by the the end it felt you had become friends. She speaks very good English and is well travelled, so you should have loads to speak about.We made Okonomiyaki. You also make accompanying dishes, such as salad, miso and the most amazing miso potatoes. She also gives you a recipe to take away to cook at home.We have subsequently made these at home and they turned out great.I can't recommend this experience high enough.

Authentic experience. If you like cooking and are interested in Japan's fascinating culture then you'll thoroughly enjoy Mayuko's class. She's a great teacher (with excellent English!) and adds extra flare by explaining the history behind many Japanese traditions. If you have questions, she's more than likely to have the answers. My partner and I took the class after spending a few days in Tokyo, so we definitely benefited from her explanations.Thanks again Mayuko for accommodating us at such late notice - we'll recommend you to all our friends!

Must do and must meet! . After an experience that is unique? Sick of being blasted by loud noise and neon signs? Mayuko and her cooking class can help! She cordially invites you into her home to do some classic and traditional Japanese food prep that you will love and create memories that will leave you saying "I'm glad we did that".Firstly, the cooking is done at her home after she personally meets you at a nearby station. The fact you get to be invited to see a Japanese home is already an experience. Secondly, cooking in a homely environment also lets you relax a bit and is a very nice change from your noisy tourist traps. This is a great chance for down time and an early night if you have been out late multiple nights in a row... Or alternatively, head out straight after to continue the party! Mayuko is very passionate about meeting new people and teaching not only Japanese cuisine but also Japanese culture. She quit her job to focus on this little business full time which is a very respectful risk to take. Because of this, she focuses on making sure your time is perfect. Special food requests and even help about travelling around Japan aren't a problem. English is not a problem at all so feel free to leave the stress of translation behind. As the other reviews prove, this is one you should get onto... And do it quick because it's really hard to get a booking. You won't regret it!

Our most memorable experience in Tokyo. We thoroughly enjoyed this class with Mayuko. We brought our two young kids (3 & 1) and Mayuko was very accommodating!! Our 3 year loved making his own little sushi rolls! We took the sushi class and Mayuko was simply fantastic... She gave a brief description into all the tastes/traditions of Japanese cuisine and gave thorough instruction in how to make and roll sushi. It was the hilight of our trip to Tokyo! Highly recommend the very personal cooking class with Mayuko! 5 stars!

There's a reason for all the excellent reviews!. This is a must-do experience while you're in Tokyo. From the moment Mayuko greets you at the Sendagaya train station with a smile and warm welcome, you know you're going to have a fabulous time. Mayuko has a gift for hospitality and you will feel welcome and comfortable in her home as she teaches you the basics of Japanese flavors, techniques, and recipes. I considered myself very lucky to be able to learn cooking in a Japanese person's home. What a treat! Booking the class was easy with a few emails...she responds very promptly and speaks/writes very good English. We made a fair last-minute request and although we weren't able to choose the menu because it was already set (chicken karaage), it was wonderful. In fact, I liked it so much I came back another time during our visit to learn how to make sushi. Mayuko shops for fresh ingredients every day, so the food is absolutely delicious, and it's fun and educational too! This would be perfect for families, couples, friends....or singles! I've made the kabocha squash side dish as well as the miso soup since I've been back home. She will help you figure out what ingredients to purchase in your home country, and will also help you if you need ideas of places to visit/eat while you're in Tokyo. I now consider Mayuko a friend and hope she'll come visit me in the U.S.!

A must try authentic class while in Tokyo! Delicious and informative.. Mayiuko was excellent, everything from meeting us, welcoming us into her home and giving us the awesome and informative class. We learnt miso, how to roll sushi and a delicious must taste sesame potato dish! Really enjoyed the class and recommend it while in Tokyo.

Delicious meal plus fun, informative experience. My boyfriend and I visited Tokyo for a week in December and our class at Mayuko's Little Kitchen was one of our favorite activities! We were the first couple to RSVP for that particular day, and we chose to learn how to make okonomiyaki, which was accompanied by miso soup, fresh tofu salad with sesame dressing (yum!), and potatoes with miso seasoning. To top things off, she even served us ice cream for dessert!We were joined by one other couple for an informative, tasty meal. Mayuko was very welcoming and friendly and spoke perfect English. She explained to us each dish and some tips on Japanese food culture throughout the cooking class. As she had all the ingredients laid out and some were already chopped, there wasn't a huge amount of prep work needed for this particular meal, and I feel confident that we can recreate the foods back in the U.S. I highly recommend Mayuko's Little Kitchen if you are interested in a Japanese cooking course or any other activity in Tokyo!

Dumplings Class. My husband and I took a cooking class with Mayuko during our trip to Japan and we absolutely loved it!! It was definitely one of our favorite activities during our 2 week trip. Mayuko was an excellent teacher. But not only did we learn to make dumplings (which we cannot wait to make again!), we also learned so much about Japanese culture from Mayuko. She was so welcoming and friendly we had such a great time with her!! Anyone traveling to Tokyo needs to sign up for a class with Mayuko. Whether you are going as a family, a group, a couple...you will have a great time!

Best activity of the holiday!. My girlfriend and I signed up to Mayuko's class having never cooked Japanese before. It was a fantastic experience, not only did we cook the best Japanese food we ate in Tokyo (maybe we're slightly biased), Mayuko helped us understand the purpose and history of many of the ingredients, she also gave us an extensive list of sights to see around the area! A class with Mayuko goes to the top of the "recommend for a friend" list for Toyko!

One of the best cooking classes I've had. My partner and I have been to a number of cooking classes overseas and we have to say Mayuko's Little Kitchen was one of the best we've attended. We made a seafood hotpot with several side dishes which were delicious and simple to re-create at home! Mayuko was very friendly and charming, explaining the theory behind Japanese home cooking, the different ingredients and their uses and the different methods used to make typical Japanese home-style dishes. Mayuko creates a very warm and inviting environment from the moment you meet her at the train station. The whole experience is excellent value and is more like going to a good friend's home to help cook dinner and having a good chat, which is fantastic! Thank you Mayuko!

Great way to learn about Japanese food culture. Mayuko was very friendly and learned us a lot. I asked her if we could make teriyaki chicken and miso soup and because I was the first student, I could choose the menu. My friend and I had a private lesson which was great. (I'm sure I would have liked it a lot less if there were also 4 strangers.) Absolutely recommended.

Very charming host and delicious food. We did the dumpling classic with Mayuko and had such a wonderful and relaxing afternoon at her lovely authentic japanese home. It was very informative and we learned a lot about the different basic japanese ingredients. Her English is very good and she explained everything in a very knowledgable but easy way. We came back from the class really inspired and will definitely cook the dishes we learned at home as they are easy, quick and so yummy. I really recommend this class!!!

An utterly fantastic cooking class experience. I did this class with my husband and 20mth old son. We thoroughly enjoyed a fantastic cookery class that felt more like a dinner at a friends house, with fantastic food, company and chat! We learnt such a lot about Japanese cookery and culture.We felt so welcome from the moment we met Mayuko at the station in the pouring rain.  I had got so wet getting there that Mayuko kindly offered me some of her own dry clothes to wear for the lesson! She even wanted us to take an umbrella as we left.  Our son was lively at times in the lesson, but the set up is so relaxed it wasn't an issue.  He then nicely fell asleep as we sat down to enjoy the food we'd made! It was utterly delicious and I can't wait to cook it again for family and friends.I can't recommend this class highly enough! You won't regret booking it.

The cooking class will be one of our best memorabel experiences in Tokyo! . After a few days in Tokyo we decided to take a cooking class in Mayuko's Little Kitchen. Together we had a wonderful evening cooking traditionally dumplings and Japanese side orders, all delicious and definitely something we will cook for friends and family back home in Sweden. We also learned a lot about Japanese food and culture. Mayuko meet us sharp on time at the station and we walked to her little kitchen just a few minutes away. For this evening we were the only ones that had signed up and from the beginning it felt like visiting an old friend and not a cooking class. Beside the cooking & eating it felt like we could have stayed the whole night just chatting about everything in life. During our stay in Tokyo we found out that we had a lot of questions regarding the Japanese culture and food that Mayuko helped us to sort out. Which for us gave a lot of extra value to our visit in Japan. The cooking class will be one of our best memorabel experiences in Tokyo!

Great way to learn more about Japanese culture and food. We enjoyed very much our two cooking classes with Mayuko's. We chose her because the location was close to our hotel and for the variety of classes offered. We wanted to learn more about miso and tofu. We are both fairly experienced (but not professional) cooks and have taken Japanese cooking classes in Japan but still we both learned an amazing number of tips. Mayuko is very organized - booking went smoothly and it was very convenient and easy to meet her at the train station. Mayuko is a trained chef - she knows what she is talking about. She works from home - but still it was a good kitchen for giving cooking lessons in. We also were able to learn a lot about Japanese culture - which is one of the main reasons we take cooking classes when we travel. For example, we learned the placement of dishes and utensils for a proper Japanese meal. The recipes seemed quite authentic, not "dumbed" down for tourists as at the other cooking school we visited. As a result, the meals were very tasty.

Very nice experience. We cooked chicken karaage at Mayuko's place, and I can rrecommend it to everyone. The first part was a small and enjoyable lesson about basic concepts of the japanese cooking, with tasting. Very informative. Then, we cooked and observed, with very good tools, especially knives. At the end, after à very good meal, Mayuko gave us all information we asked about Tokyo and walked us tio the nearby Meiji shrine. In the end, I can strongly recommend Mayuko's cooking lessons.

A hidden treasure. This was the best food experience I've had in Japan! Mayuko is an excellent chef and teacher. She gave us background info on the ingredients we used, taught us how to set the table for a Japanese meal, gave us a copy of the menu with recipes so we can fix our delicious dishes when we go back to the states. Mayuko is a very kind person, so sweet and attentive, and truly made us feel right at home in her kitchen!! If you enjoy cooking and eating, you HAVE to take a class with Mayuko!!!!

Lovely atmosphere- great teacher, learnt how to make great food!. I went for a vegetarian sushi cooking class with Mayuko, who kindly let me me book onto the class at the last minute! The class is held at her flat, and she is an awesome teacher- explaining how to use each of the flavourings and ingredients as well as how to make several different dishes, including miso soup and side dishes too. Would recommend her class to anyone visiting Tokyo and wanting to know more about Japanese cuisine!

Nice and yummy cooking class!. Thanks for the friendly and pretty teacher, Miss Mayuko. I learned a lot Japanese culture and food knowledge from the class. It's a nice cooking experience. I would like to visit again!

How to feel like living in Tokyo!. Amazing cooking class with Mayuko!She is a really nice person! Not only explained perfect the recipes but she gave us interesting information about Japanese culture and must-places to go in Tokyo as well. We felt like we have known each other before! We really enjoyed chatting meanwhile we ate what we had just cooked.Simply amazing best cooking afternoon ever! Almost felt like being invited for dinner at a friends place :)

A nice way to bring little bit of Japan back home. This funny and very inspiring cooking class I will never forget. In a very easy way Mayuko explains in here own little kitchen the main points of the Japanese cuisine before starting chopping, mixing and cooking. The food was delicious, the conversation very pleasant and Mayuko is open to give you even further information, write you down all the ingredients or gives you even some sight seen tips. I would highly recommend this experience to everyone who wants to know more about the delicious food of Japan.

This is far more than just a great Japanese cooking class. If you are planning a trip to Tokyo and are looking for a cooking class, then you could not possibly make a better choice than Mayuko's Little Kitchen. Not only will you learn the basics of Japanese home cooking, but in just a couple of hours you will also learn about Japanese culture, how the ingredients are made, and get recommendations for interesting places to visit in Tokyo.Mayuko will meet you at the train station and escort you on a five minute stroll to her apartment in a lovely residential neighborhood. By the time you arrive at the home, you will already have discovered what a truly delightful, charming, and welcoming person Mayuko is.Once the lesson starts you will also find her to be very knowledgable, experienced and helpful. She provides printed instructions for your chosen menu items so that you need not be worried about remembering all of the details. You can just enjoy the cooking experience first hand while she expertly guides you through each step. Even though you will be cooking multiple dishes simultaneously, Mayuko will ensure that the outcome will be a spectacular success.When the cooking is done, you will learn about the crucial step of food presentation. The finished product will be a feast for the eyes as well as the tummy.And the best part is having the meal together with Mayuko when all the preparation is complete. Have no doubt - you will have prepared a delicious and balanced meal. Mayuko will see to that. And Mayuko will make you feel like a welcomed friend in her home. I can only repeat what many reviewers before me have said. This may very well be the best part of your visit to Tokyo.

Mayuko's Little Kitchen - a perfect place to spend some time when you are in Tokyo. Mayuko is a charming person. During the classes she explains and shows how to prepare everything step by step. My 6-years-old daughter was able to make sushi by herself.Meeting Mayuko was a great experience - we were cooking, talking, enjoying the meal together, really having fun and we got to know so much about Japanese food, culture, religion and everyday life.If we are back in Tokyo someday I am sure we will visit Mayuko again.

Friendly and Fun Cooking class. We booked Mayo's cooking class for our group of adults and teenagers. Everybody had such a great time and Mayuko was so patient with us all. Mayuko is super friendly and very informative about Japan culture as well as food. We spent a wonderful few hours in Mayuko's kitchen and left with full stomachs and a shopping list to recreate some sushi at home.

Cookingclass in Tokyo. We booked Mayuko's cooking class in the end of October and it was a great experience! It is so nice arriving in Mayuko's home and cook in her kitchen. Mayuko is very friendly and gives clear information on all our questions regarding cooking japaneese food. She also gave us some advice regarding restaurant-bookings and shopping. We made our own sushi and miso-soup and ate it when we were done. Fully recommend this activity when visiting Tokyo.

Great experience!. Mayuko was awesome - super nice and felt as if we knew her for a long time already. She was really informative about the ingredients and has a great manner of explaining the steps to make each part of the meal. Making the meal together and then just chatting like with good friends while eating the delicious meal was a perfect way to spend the evening. Overall was a great experience and one of the definite highlights of our trip. -Catherine and Sam

So good we done it twice. . Me and a friend booked to go to Mayuko's within the first couple days of our trip to Japan. We went for the Okonomiyaki Everyday Japanese meal which consisted of Okonomiyaki, miso soup, egg rolls and pumpkin. Mayuko was an amazing teacher, it felt like we had known each other for years. So friendly and if she can make my cooking taste nice, she has serious skill. The whole experience was so amazing that before we left Japan we booked on for another night. This time making Gyoza Dumplings and Chicken Terriyaki. It was easily the best part of my holiday. Such an amazing experience and such a beautiful person. Thanks Again Mayuko. Dan

Wonderful class!!. We just took Mayuko's class today. What a treat!! Not only is Mayuko a wonderful cook; she is patient, precise and very organized. She explains the process for assembling each dish and allows everyone an opportunity to participate in its creation. I particularly liked that she shares the cultural significance of certain foods and how they are served. Oh, and what a delicious feast!! I will definitely tell any friend traveling to Japan to make time for her class! Bon Appetit!

Excellent place to learn what the real Japanese food and OMOTENASHI!. Excellent place to experience Japanese home cooking with very warm and comfortable atmosphere. The memu of that day was the miso-based simple and easy to cook, like steamed salmon with vegetables, miso-soup and potato simmered with miso, all of which were so yammy. And the high-light of the day for me was to cook Tofu! It took only 15-20min to cook but tasted owesome, very rich and flavorful of soy-beans! You must visit Mayuko’s Kitchen if you like to feel and learn what the real Japanese food and OMOTENASHI. Thank you Mayuko-sensei!

Highlight of our trip!. We took this class on the last day of our 7 day trip in Japan and it became the highlight of trip, and we are so glad we booked this! Some of the reasons listed below:1. Great location- very central. We took a train to teach there and Mayuko picks you up from the station so makes it even easier! We walked about 5 minutes to reach the location. The class is held in her apartment kitchen which gives an insight to Japanese lifestyle and makes it even more personal. 2. We are vegetarians and Mayuko was able to modify the menu to accommodate us which was really nice!3. Mayuko speaks great English so it was very easy to understand. 4. She began with teaching us the basics about Japanese cooking and then went on to making 4 dishes. It was a hands on class and really fun to learn how to make Japanese food! Can't wait to make it now that we are back home!! :) It was even more interesting when Mayuko told us how you can substitute ingredients if you can't find some ingredients in your country.5. After cooking we all ate the food - lunch was awesome :) She gave us a printed menu and recipes in English (with Japanese translation next to it) in case we wanted to buy any ingredients before we left the country. Thought that was extremely smart of her! To top it all, we didn't have time to go to the supermarket as we had to rush to the airport, so she was so nice that she gave us the bamboo mats! If I had to recommend one must do thing in Tokyo - it would be this!

Amazing experience with Mayuko's Little Kitchen. My partner and I reserved a sushi making class with Mayuko and I must say that it was one of our best experiences in Tokyo. Mayuko was very kind enough to meet us at the local train station to guide us safely to her home in suburban Tokyo.Within 2 hours, we managed to understand and learn how to make sushi roll, miso soup as well as squash for lunch. Mayuko was very knowledgeable and was able to answer all our questions especially the cooking method with her best possible explanation.We had a great time learning from her and would definitely try learning other dishes should we be back to Tokyo in the near future.

Definitely a "must do" when you visit Tokyo. I was searching for a cooking class in Tokyo before we went there. Of all the cooking classes I read, I seemed to keep coming back to her site. So I sent her a message via facebook inquiring about her cooking lessons. She was very accomodating. She answered all my queries. I told her what I wanted to learn and she gladly gave in to my requests. In Japan, she met us (I was with my husband and daughter) at the train station and accompanied us going to her house. She was very nice and cheerful. Although, I was the only one taking the lesson, she gladly welcomed my family and we do appreciate that. Her teaching was "hands on" so it was easier for me to learn. She even allowed my daughter to wrap the gyoza. My daughter had a lot of fun doing that. All the food we cooked were very yummy. We (together with my family) shared all the food we cooked. Thy were all delicious. No dull moment in the class. She even answered all our questions re: Tokyo like where to go, how to go there, where to buy stuff, etc. Indeed, it was all worth it. When I go back to Tokyo, I will definitely go to Mayuko again.

Fun and authentic Japanese cooking experience. I live in Tokyo but went to this cooking class with friends to learn how to use Miso (I did the Miso Course) Mayuko was so sweet, she picked us up from Sendagaya Station full of smiles. She was such a sweetheart over the course of the evening, teaching us everything we needed to know, and answering all our extra questions. We ate a beautiful dinner together at the end, and thoroughly enjoyed the whole experience. Would highly recommend!! You're awesome Mayuko!

Amazing must-do experience!. I did this with a friend on a 10 day trip to Japan. We prebooked before we left and Mayuko met us at the station speaking better english that me! She was very friendly and welcoming. We took the short walk to her home, and she was very keen for us to make ourselves at home. We learned loads - how to make Miso soup, Onamiyaki, spiced pumpkin and egg rolls! This was the best experience of my holiday so far, and before i go home next week, i'm going to attempt to do this again and make another few dishes!This is amazing value for money, and i can not recommend this enough to anybody! AMAZING. Thank you Mayuko!

A great, tasty Incredible local cooking class. A friend referred me to Mayuko's cooking class. It was my first time doing a cooking class and I learned so much! My friend and I did the class as the last experience in Tokyo and we wished we had done it as soon as we landed. Not only does Mayuko teach you about how to make the food, but she is incredibly knowledgable about the history, origin and tastes of the food. If we would have done this class to begin with, we would have been able to engage with Japanese food on another level throughout the whole trip.Mayuko creates a warm ambience in an authentic kitchen, so it feels like you are having a fun experience with an old friend. The best part about the course is that you can easily apply it for yourself when you get back home. You learn techniques that are intricate but simple enough to do on your own. I appreciated that I felt confident after the class that I could try it again on my own.The most important part though is that the food is DELICIOUS. We loved the food we made together and left Tokyo with a full belly and great memories. Mayuko is a great!!! Definitely recommend as a must do when in Tokyo!

So much fun :). I went with 5 friends, and we don't usually do these kind of things but I thought it would be fun and we could learn something... We all had so much fun and I can say it was one of the highlights of the holiday... Mayuko made us feel right at home which can't be easy with 6 adolescent boys hahah...Thank you :)

A must do experience in Tokyo. My husband and I were given Mayuko's cooking lessons as a wedding present as we were in Japan on honeymoon. So having done no research on Mayuko's Little Kitchen and having never done a cooking lesson as a couple before, we had little idea what to expect. However the cooking lessons turned out to be one of our favourite experiences whilst in Japan, aswell as the food we made, being some of our favourite we tasted during the trip!Mayuko was lovely and as a teacher, she couldn't have been more patient! We opted for vegetarian dumplings as I am vegetarian and they were delicious along with all the other dishes we made to accompany it and I will definitely do my best to recreate the everything we made.We thoroughly enjoyed this experience and I could not recommend enough, it was both a lot of fun and interesting along with it being a great way to meet a lovely local and sample some great authentic dishes.

Highlight of our trip to Japan: Excellent teacher, fantastic class, delicious food!. My partner and I took Mayuko's class after sifting through her website and examining her menu options. Her sushi menu was perfect for us because that's what we mainly wanted to learn and the duration was perfect: 2.5 hours! Mayuko is kind, patient, and allows you to take the helm during parts of the class. She kindly welcomes you into her Shibuya home. She thoughtfully teaches you the fundamentals of Japanese cuisine. This foundation is critical for anyone who hasn't cooked Japanese food before, much like us! We learned to make Miso soup, a bean & squash dish, and sushi. Definitely bring a camera to capture the dishes you'll make. What I really liked about the class is that Mayuko doesn't do all the cooking -- she starts you off, and then lets you go! This is how we truly learned. Her kindness and desire to give us tips about other parts of Tokyo is something we'll remember. We took her up an some of her suggestions, and they were a blast! If I could go back to Tokyo to do another class, I'd do another class with Mayuko. She was one of the biggest highlights of our trip to Japan.

wonderfully fun experience! more than just a cooking class!!. It was quite a last minute decision for us to decide to book something fun and out of the usual touristy activity in Tokyo. And I must say, it was totally worth it! We contacted Mayuko less than a week before the date of our class and her prompt and helpful response made the whole booking process an ease. We chose the Japanese meal option where Mayuko would teach you to make a main, two sides and a soup. This class not only teaches you to cook. Mayuko generously shares the many little tips for Japanese cooking and interesting facts of the Japanese culture! She is very engaging, ensuring we get our hands dirty (not to wash the dishes!) in preparing the meal. Classes are conducted in her very cosy and lovely abode. Mayuko candidly shares tips about exploring Tokyo. It was a pity that we hadn't gone to her place earlier during our stay in Japan. She is committed to improving her command of English to ensure communication with her guests is an ease! No language barrier at all! In short, Mayuko is clearly passionate about her craft and her culture! We left with full tummies and very warm hearts!!

More than just an ordinary cooking class~. If you would like to go deeper into the city than just endless shopping and dining in restaurant, Mayuko's cooking class is definitely your first choice. Thank you for the patience and detailed explanation, we had successfully made our first Japanese cuisine on our own. Mayuko is very nice and we had a great time not just about food but also culture-sharing and it's a wonderful authentic experience during the stay in Tokyo.

A GREAT and UNIQUE EXPERIENCE In TOKYO!. Mayuko's Cooking Class is a must do when in Tokyo. We had so much fun and learned a lot! She shared with us things about Japanese cooking, serving food and as well as ways to eat :) We hand rolled our own sushi. Made our miso soup from scratch. And deep fried our own tempura. Her little home kitchen is also a great way to experience a Japanese home and their hospitality. Mayuko is so sweet and kind - she will make you feel very at home and comfortable. We loved our after cooking/dinner conversation with her and it made us feel as if we have been friends for a long time. We did not only learn about Japanese cuisine. We also gained a beautiful friend. Thanks Mayuko! :)

You must do this in Tokyo!!!. Mayuko's class is a must! It was fantastic. She is helpful and very accommodating. The dishes I made were amazing and taught at my own pace. Mayuko is a great teacher and very passionate about food. She also explained Japanese etiquette when dining which was very interesting, and recommended places for my visit here in Tokyo. You must go to one of her classes.

Wonderful experience. Mayuko is very friendly and professional. I have learned a lot of tips to cook traditional Japanesemeal.I am expected to be in her kitchen again ~ Want to learn sushi roll.And Recommend to you!!Mayuko 非常友善热情而且有耐心,跟他一起做菜非常有趣,可以学习到很多制作和食的小诀窍. 一起晚餐时她会分享很多日本的风土民情,很像在东京多了一个好朋友!!非常期待下次能跟他一起学习寿司卷,也推荐给大家

Amazing cooking class for Japanese food. I attended Mayuko's class last week and it was incredible! I'd really recommend taking this class when you visit Tokyo, as it gives you great insight into not only Japanese cooking but also culture. Mayuko is a great teacher and cook, and she was very happy to answer all my questions :)

Mayuko's Little Kitchen is Epic!!. I would have never forgiven myself, if I had left Japan without taking a cooking class. I did a couple of searches, and Mayuko's Little Kitchen appeared on various sites. I sent her an email, she promptly returned my call and it was history!Mayuko is a very nice and sincere teacher, who created a menu that surpassed my needs and expectations! As a culinary student, I was thrilled at her expertise, professionalism, gentleness and humor. We made sushi, and beef curry. It was so amazing that I ran to my nearest Asian Market to by some curry blocks for myself! The experience was filled with comfort, good food, good laughs, and blessings of an incredible teacher in Mayuko. I'm coming back!!!
Enjoy cooking!!. Delicious cooked rice with seafood, miso soup, and so on, you can definitely enjoy cooking!! とても楽しく料理をすることができました！みんなで料理をすると美味しさも倍増です(^-^)/ぜひ！

Fantastic and yummy!. I absolutely loved the class, the food and the education and new awareness to Japanese culture. A relaxed setting with a wonderful atmosphere created by Mayuko. I can't wait to cook the meals back in Australia for my friends and apply the new principles I've learnt. I did the Okonomiyaki meal as its my favourite Japanese food! Thank you Mayuko, and thanks for sharing insights into things I've noticed here from a locals perspective!

Wonderful experience. This was one of the highlights of a short visit to Tokyo from Seattle, WA. Mayuko was a wonderful teacher and a great host. I learned how to assemble sushi and about Japanese culture in general. Mayuko's. And when it was over Mayuko even walked me halfway back to Shinjuku (instead of doing the dishes!).Little Kitchen is one of my must-do recommendations for anyone visiting Tokyo.

Fabulous experience!. Mayuko is a very gracious hostess and a wonderful teacher. She was open to all of our questions about Japanese culture and life in Tokyo, and provided interesting information about the meaning behind Japanese dining customs. The food was also excellent! We are excited to make the dishes again at home. Thanks again, Mayuko!

Great food, relaxing and informative. This activity was a highlight of our trip to Japan because we were able to learn about Japanese culture and experience a home-cooked meal that we can easily replicate on our return home. Mayuko was friendly and helpful, booking/payment was a breeze, and the course was customized to our specific interests. As vegetarian and vegan cooks we were keen to learn some traditional dishes that could be modified for preparation without fish stock and meat. Mayuko gave us several options, and we were even able to request a recipe using eggplant because we'd had some great Japanese eggplant dishes in the past.The cooking was fun, Mayuko was a pleasure to meet, and we gained some great insight into Japanese family life, culture, and eating habits.

Great experienxe. Had our best meal in Tokyo at Mayuko's Little Kitchen. She was very accommodating as we are vegetarian. We also learned a lot about Japanese culture and customs. Would recommend to anyone in Tokyo for a few days!

A great way to learn about Japanese food. After two weeks of restaurant food, we’re happy to try something different. A nice home cooked meal in a cozy setting and that’s what we’ve had in Mayuko’s Little kitchen. It almost felt like being invited for dinner at a friends place, although we had to cook the meal ourselves. Of course, with good instructions, preparations and some help from Mayuko. We choose the cook a hotpot (with shellfish), something we’re not familiar with, and it was fun. Together with the accompanied dishes, it all tasted very pure and subtle, we had a little feast meal after some hard work. . Taking a cooking class with Mayuko was a great way to learn more about Japanese food and culture, definitely recommended when you’re in Tokyo.

No wonder Mayuko is the number one in the category!. My boyfriend and I took the traditional Japanese cooking class and it was amazing. The booking and the payment was very easy and convenient. Mayuko's kitchen was in a very central location and easy to get to. Mayuko is the nicest person I have ever met! She gave us many explanations about the the ingredients we were using and the Japanese cuisine. The food was delicious and healthy! I was worried about liking Japanese cuisine, but everything was so good!It was an amazing lunch with Mayuko's company! Highly recommend!

Something Truly Special!!!. From the moment we met Mayuko (who greeted us at the train station) we knew we were in for a great experience! We had such a great night and honestly felt like we were cooking at a friends place!! It's easy to get to and a real authentic experience we couldn't recommended this highly enough... And the food- absolutely delicious!!! Thanks so much again Mayuko!!!!

Truly appreciated experience. Mayuko offered now only a great cooking class but also a great opening to the japanese culture during the course. Very friendly and opened for anyone who wants to leave Japan with a real japanese experience.

A great window to Japanese cuisine. Mayuko's classes are an absolute gem! She is very friendly, open and informative. We learned as much about contemporary Japanese culture as we did about cooking Japanese food (and that's saying quite a lot). Mayuko takes the time to time explain much of the significance of the way Japanese cook and eat. Her recipes are concise and easy, but delicious. We left feeling totally empowered and comfortable making dishes we never considered ourselves capable of at home. Do yourself the favor of a visit to Mayuko's! You'll share delicious food and great company, and head home with a full stomach and a collection of recipes which will dazzle your friends!

Great way to spend our last evening in Japan!. After all the meals in the Japanese restaurants we really like to try sone Japanese cooking by ourselves and enjoyed making our own tempura in Mayuko's kitchen. Mayuko teached us the recipe in a clear way and is great company to have dinner with and to tell you more about Japanese culture. We defintely would like to go back to learn some more dishes if we will visit Tokyo again. Don't miss it!

Great food - wonderful teacher. I have been to a lot of different cooking classes and it is obvious that anyone organizing a class is good at cooking, but what separates the good classes from the excellent ones lies in the personality of the teacher. I found Mayuko to be absolutely perfect for this. She is warm, funny, educational and interested. I would recommend this class to everyone and she will meet you at a train station nearby so you dont have to worry about finding her place on your own.

Highlight of our Tokyo trip!. We can't say enough about how much we enjoyed our time with Mayuko in her Little Kitchen. After several days of sightseeing in and around Tokyo with my dad and brother, we were looking for an authentic insight into Japanese everyday life when we stumbled upon this gem. Surrounded by the hustle and bustle of a world-class metropolitan city, we found ourselves in the comfortable confines of a pleasant Japanese neighborhood. We selected the Typical Japanese Family Menu, which included a cucumber sesame salad, pumpkin and red bean dish, miso soup, and pork and vegetable dumplings with a side of steamed rice. Mayuko began with interesting cultural and historical background on Japanese cuisine, including information about flavors and ingredients, as well as Japanese etiquette. Then it was time to get to cooking! We loved chopping, slicing, dicing, mixing, and wrapping our dishes. Mayuko was attentive and helpful throughout, allowing us to do the vast majority of the prep and cooking. All the food was phenomenally delicious, but I have to say my favorite dish was the typically humble miso soup. Will definitely make that dish at home! Aside from being a fabulous teacher and superb cook, Mayuko is the sort of person that you wish lived next door to you. We are thankful to say we made a friend in Tokyo.
Fun and relaxed evening. It was a great experience and would recommend. Mayuko was very friendly, funny and gave great tips on cooking.

Exceptional food, wonderful afternoon. I took my two children (7 and 4 years old) to Mayuko's little kitchen to make an "everyday meal" of dumplings (SO amazing!), sqaush side (my favorite, I'm eager to make it again), miso (a family fav), cucumber salad (YUM!), rice, and dessert. Mayuko was wonderful with both my young children, and figured out how to involve them in making every step of the meal. We had a wonderful time learning about all the parts of the meal, why certain methods/colors are used, and how to set the table. We all had a fantastic time. Mayuko is the warmest, most genuine person. I am looking forward to taking more classes from her while we live in Tokyo!

A great way to get to know more about the culture through food. Thank you, Mayuko, for your hospitality and for an educational experience through the universal language of food. My husband, son (8.5 yrs old) and I met Mayuko at a neutral location and headed to her home. We chose the chicken karaage and Mayuko chose 2 sides, a miso soup and a refreshing ice cream dessert. Everything was fresh and organized. Mayuko walked us through some of the thinking behind Japanese cooking followed by a step by step guide for each dish. She was very articulate and had tasks for everyone, including our son. Not only were the tips and instructions all very helpful, we managed to cook an amazing meal! This was definitely one of the highlights of our trip. We highly recommend it to anyone who wants a literal taste of what it's like to cook and eat like a local.

An entertaining evening with great food.. I went with a group of friends a week ago while on holiday. We booked a spot to cook 'An everyday meal in a Japanese home' as we thought it would be interesting and something a bit different to do during our holiday. On the day, Mayuko kindly met us at the train station, gave us a warm welcome and really made us feel at home, giving lots of praise and also taught us about the placement of dishes and the reason we clean our hands before each meal in Japan. She also provided information about other things we wanted to do on holiday. Overall, we really enjoyed our evening, having a lot of laughs and the food tasted amazing. I would highly recommend taking a lesson if you are travelling around Tokyo.

A wonderful experience. Thank you Mayuko for a wonderful introduction to Japanese cooking. The dishes were amazing. Your smile and your kindness made that moment a truly warming moment on our last day in Japan. We recreated the same meal back in Paris, and it was great. Thank you again :-)

Great class for anyone, including for families with kids. We had a great time at Mayuko's Little Kitchen. Our family of four (including children aged 11 and 9) all really enjoyed it. The kids were kept interested and involved, and did as much of the cooking as the adults. The food we made was great (we made an "Everyday Meal" with Japanese dumplings as our main dish), everyone enjoyed all the dishes we made, and we feel that we could actually make this meal back home in Seattle. Mayuko was very warm and engaging, and gave us great tips regarding other food and sightseeing around Tokyo. We highly recommend her cooking class. We would do it again if find ourselves back in Tokyo.

Cooking class (tofu menu). Mayuko led a class for my family (three generations) and we all learned a lot, had a great time, and somehow put together a delicious 5-course meal with completely new tastes for all of us. She is hospitable and friendly, altogether we had a wonderful evening and really enjoyed the hands-on involvement in Japanese cooking! Highly recommended.

Friendly and fun cooking class. Mayuko's cooking class (we took the shushi making class) was a great way for three friends to relax and enjoy a different side of Tokyo. After spending days touring, the cooking class gave us a chance to learn more about the cuisine of Japan, cook with a well-versed teacher, and enjoy a wonderful meal. Mayuko is friendly, well-prepared, and willing to share her home with travelers. The experience was well worth the time and I highly recommend it to anyone looking for something interesting and different to do in Tokyo.
Great experience. Very charming and fun way to learn about Japanese cooking! Mayuko is a very talented and kind young woman, who really made us feel at home in Tokyo.

Great culinary start to our trip!. Mayuko was an amazing hostess! She met us right on time at an easy to find location. She was bubbly and friendly and answered every crazy question we could come up with. Not only was the food amazing (best gyoza ever), but she took the time to explain all the cultural significance behind the colors, tastes, ways to cook, eating manners, and table settings. Thank you so much for letting us into your home. I highly recommend this to anyone visiting Tokyo.

Amazing start to our Japan trip. My husband and I did the dumplings dinner cooking class with Mayuko the first night we arrived in Tokyo. Booking, communication, and payment was all very easy from the very beginning, and Mayuko was right on time to our meeting spot. Our class turned out to be private since no one else signed up, and we walked to her adorable apartment a few minutes away from the meeting point. She was great at explaining different aspects of Japanese cuisine, and was very lovely throughout the evening, answering all of our questions and providing some great recommendations. We actually COOKED all of the food ourselves (unlike some classes that make you chop a few things and drop it into a pre-prepare pot) which was great, and our dinner was very delicious. Mayuko even printed out a map from her apartment to our hotel (complete with our route highlighted and landmarks written in). She was incredibly hospitable, friendly, and knowledgable from start to finish, and I would certainly highly recommend her to anyone going to Tokyo!

A great cooking experience with a fantastic host . My wife and I did a vegetarian class with Mayuko. It was the perfect way to experience part of Japanese culture, cooking with a local in a great setting. As well as cooking fantastic food (4-5 dishes), with very fresh ingredients, what made the class a treat was also Mayuko. She is very hospitable, knowledgeable, very responsive prior to the class and took time during the class to answer our questions. She enjoys teaching and it shows. We left with tummies full.

Delicious Sushi Lunch With a Delightful Teacher. Two colleagues and I spent a lovely couple of hours in Mayuko's kitchen today. Mayuko was prompt when she met us at the train, well prepared for our class, and lovely to chat with. She explained all of the ingredients and some basic guidelines for preparing traditional Japanese meals. We all had turns chopping, stirring, and rolling as Mayuko modeled for us and guided us in preparing some absolutely delicious food. We left with happy hearts and full stomachs.

Wonderful Experience. My sister and I attended Mayuko's class on our last day in Tokyo and it was a wonderful way to end our trip.We made Japanese curry, pork cutlet, tofu salad and miso soup, it was all so delicious! Mayuko is lovely and easy to talk to, the class is well thought out and relaxed. When you arrive at her home she explains about the dishes, why particular ingredients are used in Japanese cooking and the culture behind a particular dish. The food was beautiful and we couldn't stop giggling the entire class! If you are in Tokyo and interested in taking a cooking class I couldn't recommend Mayuko's Little Kitchen enough.

Friendly, fun and interesting Japanese cooking experience!. My friend and I experienced Mayuko's Little Kitchen on the last day of our trip - and it was a great way to end it! Mayuko was friendly, and great to chat to about Japan, aswell as about the dishes we were cooking. By the end of our session we had learnt how to cook a few different dishes and learnt about different ingredients that Japanese cooking involves, we also learnt more about Japanese culture.My friend and I would recommend this experience if you want to learn how to cook Japanese food and if you want to chat to a lovely Japanese lady and learn more about the Japanese culture!

Great experience!. I did a vegetarian cookery class with mayuko on Wednesday. I really enjoyed it-Mayuko is lovely and very friendly. She explained all the ingredients first before we started cooking and then showed me how to.do each dish.I thought the resulting food was delicious and enjoyed chatting to her while eating dinner as it's always nice to get a glimpse into the life of a local. I will definitely be trying the food made when I get home to London and would recommend the class to everyone.

Great Japanese Cooking Experience. On our trip to Japan we had a cooking course with Mayuko. She is a very nice person and picked us up at the train station.Our meal was "teriyaki chicken" with "miso soup", "steamed egg custard" and "salmon and avocado wasabi". Mayuko described us the different ingredients of the meal and the recipes. The cooking was fun and the meal tasted great. She also told us a lot about Japan and the japanese table manners.If you are interested in cooking and / or would like to get insights about Japan from a native I highly recommend to book one of her courses.

Best Sushi in Little Kitchen. I did a Sushi cooking course at Mayuko's little kitchen and I am very happy I chose her place. There are several other places, but when I saw this place on Tripadvisor I contacted Mayuko and immediately received feedback from her. It is a small and familiar place, exactly what I was looking for. Mayuko was a great host and a great teacher, and the food was very delicious. I can highly recommend this place and would like to do another course next time I'm in Tokyo.

A Gem near Shibuya. We like to cook, but never had the chance to learn how to make Japanese food (we have been waiting 10 years). So, we found this entry on TripAdvisor and truly had a GREAT experience. Mayuko's Little Kitchen is such a gem in Tokyo--a truly delightful experience to learn something while on holiday. Mayuko met us at the train station and then 10 minutes later we were learning and chopping. We agreed with her before to make sushi rolls and gyoza, and we also made some of the best miso soup we have ever eaten.  Mayuko is such a nice person, was a great teacher for our two boys (7 and 10) --encouraging, teaching, and guiding us every step of the way. The food was delicious, only exceeded by her hospitality.  Thank you Mayuko for offering such a great experience -- this was a highlight of our vacation. We look forward to our next visit and cooking class.

Our favorite Tokyo experience!. This was the best thing my family did while in Tokyo! Mayuko is so lovely and welcoming. We learned so much! I have a seven year old son, and Mayuko could not have been more patient or kind to him. I would say this class is great for older children! The food that we made was so delicious, I really couldn't believe we made it ourselves. It was an afternoon that we will remember forever. Thank you to Mayuko!!
Japanese Cuisine. I had so much fun during my cooking class! Mayuko is a really nice host! I will come back to try the Japanese Dumplings! I can highly recommend this class!

Like dinner with close friends. Our dumpling dinner at Mayuko's Little Kitchen was my favorite part of our trip to Tokyo. Mayuko is so kind and an excellent cook. Her energy is just infectious and cooking with her was very hands on yet also really relaxing. Almost immediately it felt like cooking with an old friend. Our dumplings, salad, soup, and pumpkin were delicious! We had such a great time!

Definitely recommended. I attended cooking school with 3 other people (4 total). The small class size and traditional Japanese kitchen made for an intimate lesson. The food was excellent, Mayuko is a great instructor, and it was nice to have a family style meal after cooking everything. Highly recommend.
Delicious food and a great time!. A wonderful cultural experience! Mayuko is a great teacher! The food was delicious and I can't wait to make more! Thank you Mayuko!!

A wonderful home-cooked meal in Tokyo!. My husband and I took this cooking class while in Tokyo for our honeymoon. It was a perfect way to see day to day cooking and living in Japan. Mayuko is knowledgeable, worldly and very sweet! We also joined another pair that were travelling in Japan and it was great sharing stories and tips. Also, we cooked gyozas and the recipes were delicious and easy enough that we can definitely repeat them at home! We had a great time with Mayuko and highly recommend this class!!!

Amazing experience!. My experience with Mayuko's cooking class was one of the best I had during my stay in Japan. She's a great teacher, and gives the class in the most enjoyable way! It was so much fun meeting her, and I'll definitely use those simple and delicious recipes when I get back home!!

Must do.. I'm so happy to say, that you need to visit Mayuko's Little Kitchen!! You don't even have to be a great chef, she is a very good teacher and makes you feel comfortable, and what's even more important, she gives you a good understanding towards food and culture in Japan. She has so much heart and information that she wants to share. So don't miss this opportunity to learn!!

Mayuko's Little Kitchen. We really enjoyed our lunch with Mayuko - the cooking lesson was informative and fun. Mayuko was lovely and she was happy to chat with us about Japan and food so we came away with a much better understanding of Japanese culture/food.

An absolute pleasure!. With only a couple of days in Tokyo, my friend and I decided at the last minute to book a class, and emailed Mayuko in the morning. By 7pm, we were sitting at her table, learning to make sushi and home style Japanese dishes. She's a great teacher who clearly puts a lot of love into her work, and has a wide knowledge of what Tokyo and Japan have to offer. She gave us great tips on what to do around the city. My advice: make Mayuko's Little Kitchen the first stop on your itinerary. It's a solid gateway into an amazing country!

Mayuko is AWESOME!. My husband and I were visiting Tokyo for 4 days and after poking around on Trip Advisor and reading the reviews for Mayuko's Little Kitchen, we decided to see if she had any classes available - and lucky for us, she did! We LOVED every minute of the experience - from being in her little kitchen and being able to not only learn about what we were cooking, but also to ask questions about Tokyo, the neighborhood we were in, Japan, etc. - we learned so much! Hands down, meeting Mayuko and taking her cooking class was the highlight of our trip - and we did a lot of wonderful things! There's something so valuable about being with a local, and learning to cook something new. We walked in as guests in her kitchen and we left as friends.

Just like at home. Me and my friend learned how to make some home style japanese dishes. All was very clear and the atmosphere great, I will definetely cook what I learned for my family, very tasty. Thanks Mayuko, you made us feel at home :)

Mayuko gives you a lot of special tips about Tokyo & Japan.. You can get not only the key point of "real" Japanese dishes but also a lot of vivid information about sightseeing of Tokyo, which you never get from the Internet or guide books. I took the lesson with my friends from Chile who had never cooked Japanese dishes but we were able to cook all without feeling stress. That was really fun.Moreover, Mayuko gave some latest information about boutiques, museums and restaurants to my friends. I believe that it made my friends' trip more exciting.
Is a must!. Very good ambient and very good teacher. I really love Japanese kitchen but this experience will be a memory for life.

An Experience to Cherish Forever. My wife and I have always wanted to learn how to cook Japanese food so we thought where best to do that than in Japan! We found Mayuko on Trip Advisor earlier this year and she was kind enough to accommodate my wife's seafood allergy. On the day, Mayuko picked us up from the nearby train station and escorted us to her home. We were taught how to prepare and cook miso shiru, gunskan zushi, makizushi and kabochano nimono. Mayuko is an exceptional teacher. She is very well-organised and takes her time to explain the origins of each of the ingredients we use. Mayuko is incredibly warm, kind and funny. Not only did we gain invaluable cooking skills and techniques, we also made a friend, whom we are sure we will meet again soon! We cannot recommend this enough - a must do for anyone visiting Tokyo!

Everyone visiting Tokyo MUST try!. I really encourage you to try "Mayuko's Little Kitchen". Why?Well, for starters, Tokyo is such a huge, bustling city, with so many people, that it can be hard for foreigners to communicate with the locals. I think food and talking are the best ways to truly understand Japanese culture. Furthermore, Mayuko speaks perfect English, so it's easy to talk to her.Under Mayuko's gentle, patient guidance - and I'm an absolute beginner when it comes to cooking Japanese food - I learnt how to make "maki-zushi" and, "Japanese-style steamed pumpkin". Wow, when we sat to down eat, I could hardly believe I'd made it myself!Not only is Mayuko a great teacher, but she is a cheerful, enthusiastic person, too. You will definitely enjoy talking to her, and eating yummy, homemade food. Mayuko's kitchen may be little, but she has a big heart!

Excellent experience!. I'm British and the two children that I took to the class were Thai and French. We all thoroughly enjoyed the experience! Communication before hand was good and we were met at the train station without difficulties. She was lovely, warm and kind and could not have been more patient and informative. We made a few dishes and the children and I assisted and we got to eat them at the end. We were so full! The children continue to ask about 'the nice lady'. Would definitely recommend! X

Good food and good company!. Mayuko is an excellent teacher. She was well prepared to teach us the basics of cooking with miso and prepare four dishes together, but also adapted to our questions about cooking techniques and other dishes. The class drew an interesting group of Japanese native and expatriates, so you're likely to have an interesting conversation while you cook. Like cooking together in the house of a friend, if you happened to be friends with a seasoned chef. Highly recommend.
Perfect organization. i enjoyed very much and learned a lot of things about japanese cuisine. Strongly recommend

NO DASHI,NO LIFE. We learned “Dashi”,and we made Japanese dishes with it.”Dashi” is secret spice in Japan. we really love it.If you are interested in Japanese food,You must study “Dashi”;)I think Mayuko is very friendly,and an experience-rich teacher. Furthermore she has sence of humor.You can go to “Mayuko’s little kitchen” without worrying about anything.You will study “Dashi” at Mayuko's studio, and I hope you love Japan more!

Fun and resourceful class. In our class we had a dashi (Japanese stock) focused menu. Mayuko explained dashi and the ingredients in the beginning of the class so that we all had a basic idea.We made 3 different kinds of dashi and I was surprised how little did i know about it even as a Japanese person.It was a class of 3 people and we just did not stop laughing. Now I am very inspired to cook more after leaning such beauties of Japanese dishes. I highly recommend this class if you are looking for a fun but resourceful activity in Shibuya-Shinjuku area.

An Excellent Time!. Mayuko's Little Kitchen was a truly amazing experience! Mayuko is very knowledgable, entertaining and personable. Her instructions are very thorough and easy to follow. The food is fantastic and the conversation is most enjoyable. I highly recommend this as a 'must do' during your stay in Tokyo! Thank You Mayuko!!!

Great experience!. I visited Oyakodon( Japanese egg bowl), and Japanese noodle class. That was my request, and I was luckly the first person to book. So my request became the menu of the class. Mayuko's explanation was very clear and interesting! And I love the taste which is beyond average, and warm atmosphere. I highly reccomend this cooking class!

'Mayuko's Little Kitchen' a warm, yummy, wonderful experience.. In Australia the most we know about Japanese cooking is sushi. Mayuko's Little Kitchen let me experience what a Japanese family would cook and serve at home. I loved the warm and friendly atmosphere and especially Mayuko's sense of humour. There was plenty of laughter and fun in her class.Not only is the food delicious but also beautiful. I especially enjoyed learning to make Golden Curry and my sushi favourite 'Inari'. The lesson is easy to follow and you feel you are welcomed into Japanese home life.A great experience I highly recommend.Mayuko's Little Kitchen will make you smile. I did :)
